text:
Bomb dinner last night before rock in rio:) and the hospital :(. Yellow tail sashimi!!!!!
spicy tuna rolls! you wont be dissapoint.
The food is awesome.  Went on a Monday during Happy Hour 4pm to 6pm.  Been here 3 times. Today the service was mediocre.  I usually go  during lunch.  I think the wait staff is much better at lunch.

Want to get some of the best sushi in Vegas without going to the strip? Soho is the place to go.

We stumbled upon this place thanks to Yelp and am in complete agreement with the 5 star rating.

Highly recommend the yellowtail yuzu soy.

To top off the good food and reasonable prices, the chef is someone that actually cares about his customers and stops by to greet every customer.

Little would you realize that the freshest Sushi to be found anywhere would be found in the middle of the Las Vegas desert. I have been coming here for years and it is always the greatest quality and most delicious cuts ever. Highly recommend it to anyone who wants delicious food and reasonable prices.

Nothing compares to the service, reasonable pricing and high quality of Soho. This is the BEST sushi bar in Las Vegas, Nevada. They have high quality white fish, tuna, yellowtail, uni, giant clam and more... I've been eating here for years and will continue to do so. This owner also owns a few sushi burrito spot around town that are equally fantastic.

LOVE: Food! Everything soooho good! 
LIKE: staff is soho amazing! I've had the pleasure of being served by I think Louie twice, he's so awesome. But the whole staff helps out as a team to make the experience top notch! 
DISLIKE: nothing!

I don't review nearly as many restaurants as I should, but this is one that I can't not review.  Based on the Yelp reviews, I was expecting it to be good, but I was blown away by how incredible it was.  We sat at the sushi counter, so we were able to watch the chefs prepare everything we ate.  They truly are artists.  The sashimi platter was stunning, and they charge only $35 for it.  It would be at least $75 at Nobu.  We had the yellowtail appetizer, the roast chicken, the A5 Japanese steak, Nigerian prawns, Toro, pork belly, and a couple of their speciality rolls.  It was all phenomenal.  The fish is all Nobu quality and a fraction of the cost.  I understand that the chefs all came from high end placed, but the rent is much lower on Jones, so they pass the savings onto the customers.  If you like Japanese food, go.  It doesn't get any better.
We had lunch here and it was delicious. The mushroom soup had great taste, the seaweed salat was good, and the sashimi was very fresh. Furthermore, service was very very good and friendly.

went to this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews. Yes it's a 15 mins taxi ride from the strip, yes it doesn't look like much but man.. what a food!

the extensive Sake list is great, the food is the best we've had in the states and I can only say: try for yourself! very highly recommended.

My new favorite restaurant.. Authentic japanese cuisine, Las Vegas strip quality at off the strip prices. 

Where to start?

Food
Decently price for the portions and quality. Short rib off the bone is amazing, green tea tiramisu is awesome. Lunch special is a bargain at $9 which comes with a small entree presented with rice, miso soup, and side salad. Haven't tried everything yet but everything I've got didn't dissapoint

Staff
Service was amazing. All servers worked together and made sure out dining experience was top notch. The owner/executive chef walked around and greeted every table and made sure we were enjoying our meals.

Not much more to say, but to go out for yourselves and try this hidden gem off the strip

Friends and I were in Vegas for a couple days, craved some Japanese Food, looked it up on Yelp and this one had 5 stars.  Mind you, I was the only person familiar with Japanese cuisine. My 3 dining partners were clueless.  We ordered Beef Teriyaki (That was familiar to Nick) Cucumber Salad, Shishito Peppers, Popcorn Shrimp (Came with 3 dipping sauces), Crispy Tuna Roll, Twin Dragon Roll.  All pretty good tasting. Presentation on the dishes was appealing, taste was on key.  I tried the Uni and it has been awhile since I've tasted good quality Uni..Delicious!
My friends were amazed on the flavors as the experience good Japanese food as oppose to the ones they've tried before.
Service was excellent.  The owner/chef came to our table and follow up on our meal and having a conversation with us.  Even offered to try a new appetizer.  Yuzu Steelhead trout.  It was a unique dish with thinly slices of trout, yuzu wasabi drizzled, topped with pop rocks.  It was divine.
I definitely will go back the next time I am in Vegas.  I suggest that you do too.

Soho Japanese Restaurant is amazing! Went there for their grand opening and had an amazing lunch. Strip quality food at local prices. If you go there for lunch try one of their awesome lunch specials for only $8.95! Each bento box comes with Miso soup with negi and tofu, green salad with a tangy and satisfying vinaigrette, choice of entree, and a side of steamed white rice. As for the sushi rolls, unbeatable quality! Fish is so fresh you can taste the difference. Another positive note is service. Our waitress Rachel was so attentive and helpful with tons of suggestions on what to try. When it came time for dessert, we were blown away by the Green Tea Tiramisu and Creme Brulee! So creamy and full of rich flavors. Soho is definitely worth all five stars.

Soho is my favorite sushi joint in Las Vegas. The food is amazing, the staff is always friendly.  This is the only sushi restaurant in town that I've never had anything to complain about. 

My favorites, in no particular order:
- Yellow tail yuzu (incredible)
- Salmon wasabi
- White fish ponzu
- Steak (his steaks are amazing!)

It's not an AYCE place, but the quality is simply outstanding.

Visiting Vegas for the week, we turned to Yelp to find a good sushi spot. Soho isn't a good spot. It's an amazing spot!! Nothing we tried disappointed us in any way, and our only regret was that we live in Montana and can't come here more often!! The staff was very attentive, and knew the menu so they could explain to us any ingredients we weren't familiar with. We were honored to meet Chef John, and his passion for the products he presents his patrons with is very obvious. 

We visited Soho's twice while we were in town, and I think we went through the whole list of sashimi specialties. The husband doesn't like salmon, but the Wasabi Cream Salmon won him over. Next trip I really have to try the oysters and the miso cod, among other things. 

There is truly a reason Soho has a 5-star Yelp rating, and you will not be disappointed with a visit here!

Cute little restaurant with great food. The last couple of times that I've come here there was a bit of a wait... but that's always a good sign. They have a great happy hour... baked mussels, some sushi rolls all around $4-$5 each. A few dishes I recommend are king crab tempura (my favorite), yellowtail yuzu jalapeno, soft shell crab and beef tataki. All of the workers are extremely nice and friendly. Fast and great service. If you haven't tried this place out yet, I recommend you do, soon!

After finding this place on yelp and saw the 5 star rating I thought I had to try it, I can now see why it has this rating. This is one of the best Asian meals of my life, no wait, one of the best meals I've probably ever had! No joke every dish is like a party in my mouth and the quality is really high and I'm a really picky eater. I'm not a big sashimi fan but I've been converted after the chef sent us one of his melt in your mouth signature sashimi dish. We ordered 4 types of tostadas, 3 types of sushi, jalapeno poppers and the baked mussels. My husband loved the sauce the mussels came with he started dipping everything in it, everything was delicious I have no complaints whatsoever. Service was great everyone was so friendly and topped up. My water constantly and removed empty dishes quickly to make room for more. We also had their famous green tea tiramisu which was to die for. We came during happy hour so our entire bill came to be just $37! I don't like vegas but I'd come back just for this place!

With all the 5 star buzz, we just had to check this place out. Thusly, we found out the secret is the chef used to work for Nobu and now serving up the quality at his own restaurant now. Just like Nobu at a fraction of the cost, yet still incredibly delicious with fantastic service to boot~  Let them know you're a yelper and the red carpet is rolled out. That's right folks, the power of yelp has definitely arrived~

SOHO Sushi is by far the most creative and amazing sushi spot I have ever experienced. Chef John has a team of chefs who create magic with protein, sauce & hocus pocus. Let Sheila take control of the menu and you will be amazed and surprised with every plate she brings you. This is a true gem in the gastro world. 

I hear they are opening a new restaurant on Sahara named Sushi Burrito. Must try this one next.  

Came back as I was in Las Vegas for a convention. This is a must stop for me. 

Oscar & Charlie guided us through the menu. The Escolar Carpaccio, firecracker roll, bronze broccoli & bakes mussels are excellent and available on the happy hour menu. 

As I said before the best way to experience this restaurant is to tell the server how much you want to spend and let them take control. This lets them cut loose and be creative. You will be truly amazed by what Tai', Oscar and the team will create for you. 

All I can say is let go and let them amaze you.

This is, by far, the best sushi restaurant I've ever been to. 

+1 The staff is courteous, friendly, and attentive. Our server was very friendly, and the head chef personally spoke with each table dining. We needed transportation back to our hotel, and our server helped us arrange for it after our first cab bailed on us.

+1 Prices are excellent, and portions are large. Unlike strip restaurants, you'll receive 8 maki-rolls per order, and two pieces of nigiri per order. All of the fish we ordered was extremely fresh and tasted excellent. 

+1 Location is off-strip, and in a quiet section of Las Vegas. Restaurant is also very clean inside, and well maintained. 

+1 As I previously mentioned, the head chef meets with every table to ask how your food was. He is one of the nicest restaurant owners I have had the pleasure of meeting, and even provided our party with free samples of the restaurant speciality, a yellowfin tuna sashimi with jalapeños. The chef politely asked us to sample his newly received "uni" sea urchin from Japan against his current California urchin. 

+1 To top our experience, our server gave my party free sushi pens and a free sushi keychain. 

If I can summarize my experience at Soho, I would say that it was perfect, and definitely worth the trip from any strip hotel, and definitely the best sushi around.
Loved this place far from the strip but worth the trip!

We can't get enough of this place! The food and the service is always the best. This is the only place I will eat sushi in this town! Our absolute favorite is the firecracker roll, which unfortunately isn't on the menu, however they are still able to make it since the replacement roll is extremely similar. 

We were last here on a Friday night, and even though the restaurant was busy, we never waited for food and the service from our server (and busser, and food runner, and everyone who works there really) was as if we were one of only a few tables - as usual.

Some of our favorites that we have to get:  Firecracker Roll, Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, Ocean Trout sashimi (with pop rocks!), King Crab Tempura, Rock Shrimp Tempura, and we ALWAYS ask about new/temporary items (order it, and always enjoy that too!). You wouldn't necessarily think to order short ribs from a sushi restaurant, but theirs are to die for!

This is our go-to place when we want an all-around great meal and great dining experience. All of our out-of-town friends ask to be taken here, too, when they come to Vegas.

Service and food was great.  Fish was fresh and the ingredients used complimented every dish.  Yellowtail yuzu,
Todas, black cod, ocean trout, and matcha tiramisu is a must.

I was traveling in Las Vegas for business and due to the fact I was up so early I decided to have an early lunch. What a fantastic idea, in that the food was spectacular. When asked which I liked better the Tuna sashimi or the Yellowtail sashimi? it was impossible to decide, as every bite was perfect. I must add the way a little crunch was added by the tempura jalapeños was over the top. Although not a "local" I am out here all the time and can't wait until I can come back.
Love this place!!! We always go here when we can. Service is great and food is fabulous!!! They even have happy hour where everything is discounted! Food is delicious!!!!

Our server Julie was the best. She really knew the menu and we could tell that she was excited about all of the food here. She even provided us samples of food we weren't too sure about. All of her suggestions were the BOMB!!! 
We had the hamachi for starters and it completely melted in our mouths. Next we had the uni trio which included uni from Santa Barbara, Catalina islands and Hokkaido. My favorite was the Catalina. Sooo sweet. The beef short rib was to die for. Fall of the bone goodness!  The twin dragon roll was perfect topped with deep fried ama ebi. Ahh, dessert.....grenen tea tiramisu and lemon cheese cake.  Chef john came out to greet us to make sure everything was to our liking.  I need a bed. 
The food and ambience is awesome and I am definitely coming back!!!

This place was great.  Beautiful and delicious rolls,  the sushi and sashimi was fresh.  Service was great and friendly.  Price was reasonable.  Drinks were delish!  You should definitely check this place out!!!

Hands down! This is the best Yelp decision I have ever made. Ever since I yelped Sushi places in Las Vegas and came across this gem, it has been nothing but amazing! The staff is super friendly and recognizes you after have eaten there a couple handfuls of times. 

The Happy Hour menu is small but everything is AMAZINGLY prices and I love the Sake choices! (Lychee Cold Sake is my favorite). 

My boyfriend and I even came here for a Non-Happy Hour dinner and everything was delicious. The chef gave us some Cajun Albacore on the house and that blew my mind. The next visit, we are letting him take control on what we eat because it was that delicious! 

Soho, you have customers for life!

Don't judge a book by it's cover!

The outside and inside looks kind of shabby. Also the location doesn't look that good... but the food totally makes up for that. I could not believe that I could eat Japanese food this good outside of Japan! It was just amazing. Every dish was spot on... Also the speed of the service and the freshness of the food was excellent.

If you like Japanese cuisine, I would visit this place.
You will never be disappointed with any of the food here, even the specials are amazing. Chef John is really making this a local favorite.

This place is awesome. I went there for dinner and was greatly impressed. I mostly had sashimi ordered from the chef specialty part of the menu. The food was high quality and amazing. Worth every penny, however, it is reasonably priced. The atmosphere is great and the place is kept clean. Overall this is one of the better sushi places I've been to in awhile.

Soho is the best sushi restaurant hands down.  Been to many sushi joints all over town, but the quality of the fish is stellar!  Here is what I tried so far:

hamachi Kama (the special of the day):  the hamachi Kama was awesome - Tender and with the sauce I was in heaven!  

yellowtail yuzu: the flavors of the yellowtail and sauce matched so well and the textures of the deep fried jalapenos and yellowtail are lovely together.

Seared tuna special: it was well seared, not too much and not too little. Excellent and delicious!!

The yellowtail and tuna were complimentary by the chef/owner!  What really impressed me was that he comes out and talks to his guest (each table) and makes you feel at home.  Relaxed and comfortable atmosphere with top quality food and service without the ridiculous strip prices. 

This is my new favorite sushi joint!!  Loves it!!!

We've been here twice so far and loved the restaurant and service so far.  The best part of the meal was definitely the mixed sashimi plates for $25, which included salmon, tuna, ocean trout, yellow tail, scallop, and a few others I didn't recognize/remember.  Our second favorite was the tadas which we had every flavor of, except for kimchi, and all of them were amazing.  Lastly we ordered rolls as well, and they were good, but unfortunately don't have my favorite roll on the menu - Caterpillar (eel, eel sauce, avocado). 

Both times we ate there, the chef (and possible owner?) came out to greet us during our meal and ask how everything was as well.

Awesome restaurant, awesome service, awesome location in the southwest area - we'll be back!

One of the best dining experiences I've ever had! Tae is one of the chefs at Soho and I have nothing but great things to say about him! It was our first time dining there and Tae walked us through the menu and even made us a complimentary dish! The uni was so fresh, the toro melt in your mouth amazing and the short ribs so decadent! Can't wait to eat here again, thank you to the staff of Soho and especially Tae!

Came here for dinner seeing reviews and after finishing a drive in from OC. Definitely off the strip, a dark drive west on Warm Springs. Not very crowded yet, which was good because we were famished, but not ready to just gorge. Looking for a delectable satisfaction vs. gluttony, which Vegas food seems to focus on. Greeted warmly and seated quickly. Received h20 quickly and given time to review menu, ask about specials, take a breath, and soak in ambience. Ordered spring roll, poke, spicy albacore, twin dragon roll and firecracker. All came out timely, without rush, fresh as can be. Owner/Chef John came over to greet us and thank us for coming. He sent over complimentary uni which was perfect.  No pressure to order alcohol, I just wasn't in the mood after a long drive, but will next time because prices were reasonable. Overall, great place to eat, perfect size, great mood, one flat screen on mute to check out the college fb game if you wanted to. I'll be back.

There are few places and even fewer items that cater to gluten free diets, especially when it comes to Asian eateries. I'm happy to say Soho is the exception to the rule and the example for others! They go above and beyond with their gluten free tempura (FINALLY!!) and are able to manipulate their dishes to make a close (and sometimes identical) gf variation. The food alone can make your experience, however, they also have an extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff who exceed my expectations each visit. I recommend their Yellowtail Yuzo, Beef Tataki, Volcano Roll, and Twin Dragon Roll. Soho, is hands down my favorite Japanese restaurant and I can't wait to try their Wagyu next date night!
This place is amazingly good. Besides the delicious food we had a great service from our server Sheila.
Good food, excellent service - very accommodating! Ordered muso soup, Spicy tuna roll, spider roll and Coconut shrimp yumm!

My husband and I absolutely LOVE this place! The service is amazing and the sushi is top notch!!! Chef Jon and his team have created a neighborhood hotspot. If you are looking for top quality sushi with great service, this restaurant is a must try!!

Very impressed with the quality of the sushi. The yellowtail sashimi was delicious!! The chef made a special roll for my daughter. The owner was very friendly and came around to check on us. Service was good.

We special ordered a roll, chef made it perfectly.  The staff is very friendly and attentive. Every piece of fish was delicious. Chef stopped by the table to check on everything. Highly recommend this place.

This place is Awesome! Food was so fresh and delicious, Customer service from all the servers were on point, Great Ambiance and everything we Ate were So satisfying!!

This place is Definitely a must try. The Chef even comes out to greet you personally and introduces himself. Not a Uni fan, but am now. The Uni is so fresh!! Can't say much more you just gotta try it for yourself!

I'm ashamed to say that this was my first time here, but going back tomorrow!! 

Thanks SoHo!

My only regret is that there aren't more stars to give...

A friend and I were in Las Vegas for a convention and decided and we VERY much wanted sushi. So, we took to yelp and (as per usual) we weren't disappointed. From the minute you walk in, the quality of the establishment oozes from every corner. 

The prices were incredible for the quality you get, and the selection was broad - encompassing more than just sushi, but also several styles of Japanese cuisine. I will admit, we ordered Gyazo but were unsuccessful as they were currently out. We instead ordered the Edimame as an appetizer and before we could come close to finishing it, were presented with our first 2 rolls. We continued to pack in as much of the delectable assortment as we could and threw in the towel after 5 rolls. This is a testament to the value itself as we're both avid sushi eaters.

We settled up the check and called for a cab. However, as there were 2 conventions running, we were told it could take up to 2 hours! Feeling defeated we walked back in and asked the staff if there was a better cab company to call -- they were met with the same response.

What happened next shocked me most. The owner actually allowed one of the staff to drive us back in to the strip! I was floored. The cab ride back was a 20 minute trip with the traffic and they were absolutely great about it! I couldn't ask for more in terms of customer service.

Thanks Soho for reminding me that some places still care!
Wow love this place! The fish taste super fresh. Happy hour is between 4 and 6pm and they have a couple of dishes and rolls for $5 each.

Came here reading the other Yelp reviews and Chef John met my highest expectation! 
1) Chef Mixed Nigiri: 5
2) Chef Trout & Scallop Roll: 5
3) Chef Mixed Nigiri (2): 5
4) Scraped Toro/ Toro Roll: 5
5) Tempura: a touch too much oil on the batter but fantastic flavor and perfect texture: 4.5

Overall a great find! Super happy! Price spot on.

Staff US superb and I find it hard to imagine a restaurant cleaner than this one - not talking of appearance but actual cleanliness!

Will most definitely return.
X

I dont know why but yelp seems to have deleted my original review. Anyways the food here for the price to me was good. Its not Raku quality sushi and no sturgeon, blue fin etc.; so fine dining this is not. Also the decor and atmosphere is Ultra casual... like Mickie Ds style and doesnt match the price. The service was good but not great at the price point. It is not cheap we dropped $100 for two people lunch. What they do right is the non sashimi happy hour stuff. Like fusion sushi tacos etc. I think for an American style fast sushi (think sushi panda express) this is good, but I have had sashimi in LA and Vegas that puts it to shame for not much more $. Just my .02 as I have been eating at sushi joints every week for about 10 years.

This is by far the best Japanese, actually the BEST restaurant in Las Vegas!! It doesn't have the atmosphere of Joël Robuchon but the foods makes up for it 100 times over!! The freshest sushi and friendly service! I've been there 5 times and can't wait to go back! The owner/chef is so gracious!!!

Today for the first time I had sushi here and let me tell you it was AWESOME!!! 

Chef John goes above and beyond to make sure your happy with your meal. He came out to our table and greeted us, which to me it says a lot, asked what we liked and were then surprised with his signature Yellow Tail sashimi which was absolutely wonderful! It was so good we had to re-order it.

We also had the tuna poke which again was amazing! Hadn't had this quality of sushi and sashimi since San Francisco so to find this place closer to home is so nice.

Oh and the TOSTADAS! I really can't stop raving about these! They are small but so full of flavor and addicting that you won't be able to just have one! I recommend the Hamachi, tuna, and the salmon one.

Overall a great restaurant with great service but above all AMAZING QUALITY of FOOD! Will definitely drive 4hrs just to come eat here!

Very reasonable price for lunch! It's only 8.5 for a bento! I ordered a grilled salmon bento which included salad and soup! It's tasty! I also ordered a uni sashimi and it is fresh! Will definitely go back again!

AMAZING!! AMAZING!! AMAZING!!.....Simply put.. Service-5..Atmosphere-5..Price-5..Food-5+.... Must try... Our server Charles was perfect..Ordered all of our dishes and was point on all the way! John the head chef/owner came to our table upon leaving to see how everything was. Very nice guy! Will be back over and over again!!
Can't say enough great things about SOHO!  The food was amazing.  The service was perfect!  You will not be disappointed.

My friends & I came here for their happy hour (looks like they added an extra day.. before it was Monday through Saturday, now it's everyday: 4PM-6PM) & got a decent amount of food. 

We had the white peach & lychee sake. You can easily share this.. each glass of sake filled 4-6 of the shot glasses. I recommend the white peach sake - it was infused really well! The lychee sake was good too.. but I didn't like that you could taste the sake more than the lychee.

During happy hour, we also had ika geso (fried squid tentacles), cajun albacore sashimi, avacado & salmon roll, firecracker roll (didnt try this one.. I can't do spicy :(), shrimp tempura roll & the tostadas!

Oh man, the tostadas were delicious!! There are four options: 
- Salmon with pico de gallo 
- Tuna with poke sauce
- Hamachi with salsa verde 
- Tako with kimchee 
We tried all but the tako. The tostadas are $1 each during HH.. we loved these! They are very light, refreshing & we kept ordering them!! Haha.. eat these right away! Otherwise the chip will get soggy..

Halfway through our visit, the owner came by our table and asked us how we were doing & just chatted with us. He told us he was going to send us a plate of yellowtail sashimi which will show us what they're all about: fresh, high quality sushi! & they nailed it! The yellowtail sashimi was a great example of that: fresh + high quality = delicious!!

Throughout our time at Soho, the wait staff was really attentive.. refilled our glasses, asked how the sake & sushi were & the waitress came by before happy hour ended to see if we wanted to put in more orders. We had to pass on dessert because we were all full, but we still got something sweet! Our waiter brought this cute tray of sushi keychains & we could take our pick! It may seem like a small gesture, but it was SO nice!

This was one of the best experiences I have had in awhile from beginning to end! My friends & I left with big smiles on our faces.. I can't wait to go back & try more food!
Favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. The fish is extraordinary. The staff is wonderful. If I could give this place 10 stars I would. Always get the oysters!

If you feel like eating raw fish in the middle of the desert, this is the place.  Although you can get herpes in Vegas, you won't get salmonella here.  Food and service was excellent and they played some Taylor Swift in the background... Bonus points.  I recommend the sashimi and octopus salad.

Great experience and good service. Everything was delicious.  Only reason it got 4 star was because tempura was heavily battered and oil tasted old. Not light and delicately crispy.  Otw I would return
This place is amazing! I had the best sushi there and the place was very clean. The service was very good and fast.

This place is by far the best place for sushi in Las Vegas!  Quick and helpful service during weekday lunch hour. I'd recommend trying more than just the rolls - some beautiful and delicious food awaits!

The most amazing sashimi I've  ever had! The owner puts so much  finesse and passion into his craft. I felt like I was a guest in his home, he took great care of us! The fish was great quality and the pricing was beyond fair. Give them a try!

We drove by SOHO for over a year before deciding to give it a try. Dang it!!! we wasted that time. Their happy hour is awesome with many of their best sellers featured. They always hook us up with some chef's choice sashimi (here, try this) It just appears at the table, or gets handed over the bar for free. Who doesn't like free? Very fresh, always tasty. SOHO is our new preferred Sushi place.
Fresh fish, excellent menu, great service and overall very good value.  This chef really wants to please his customers. You can't go wrong here.

I randomly stopped in here with my family for lunch while in Vegas for a few days and have to say it was excellent. The lunch specials were all really beautiful with plenty of food that tasted great (we ordered teriyaki beef, teriyaki chicken, Katsu chicken, tempura rock shrimp and sushi).  

We had a fantastic time thanks in a large part to our awesome server Louie, so we came back again a couple of days later.  All in all a very pleasant unexpected surprise and now one of our favorite non-Teppanyaki Japanese restaurants.
Omakase sashimi was worth the trip from the stripe.  The variety of fish options was incredible.   Will definitely come back again.

Excellent service! Chef Lee's personable approach made the evening an exceptional experience, due to his hospitality and generosity. The fresh yellow tail, scallops, and uni were one of my favorites. The dressing on the Seafood Salad was perfect. The nontraditional Eggrolls served in glassware is an out of the box concept - great idea & good appetizer. Thanks Darrell & team for your friendly service and Chef Lee for the Asian fusion experience!

Love it, love it, love it!  Soho is indeed a hidden gem located beside Chevron gas station along S. Jones cor Warm Springs.  My hubby and I are sushi fanatics who continuously search for a good sushi place.  Based on reviews from fellow yelpers, we tried Soho Japanese Restaurant for lunch and we were not disappointed.  Sometimes, yelp reviewers miss the mark, but this time they were spot on. 

We ordered the salmon and tuna tostada for appetizers.  The freshness of the fish which was perfectly seasoned (excellent blend of citrus, salt and oil) got me hooked at first bite.  The wasabi cream was smeared on the crunchy, flaky tostada, the salmon and tuna were topped with fresh herb that had a similar taste to cilantro/parsley which gave the concoction a refreshing twist.  

At this point, the chef/owner, John approached our table to introduce himself.  He was a very likeable guy who obviously wanted his customer/guest to be happy with the food selection.  He offered us a delicate dish of Hamachi layered on top of a mixture of garlic infused grape seed oil with hint of shoyu and topped with mild sliced jalapeno.  Again, perfection!  This was only topped by the fact that it was complimentary!  John surely knows how to woo his customers, and it definitely worked.

I had the rainbow roll which was equally good.  The sushi rice was cooked and seasoned just right and of course, the fish, shrimp and crab eggs were quite fresh.  Hubby wanted a chirashi bowl, but it was not on the menu.  They had a sashimi item on the lunch special menu but no chirashi.  However, because John was so gracious and accommodating, he made it happen for my hubby who was very happy and satisfied with his choice.  The service at Soho was fast and friendly, a worthy companion to the exceptional sushi creations.  

We will definitely be back for happy hour (4-6pm, Mon-Sat) with friends who would definitely love this place as well. Thank you chef John and Louie, our attentive  server.  We will see you soon.
Awesome place with great lunch deals and a full sushi menu specializing more in sashimi and unique dishes. The head chef takes time to talk with customers and offer recommendations.

They don't have noodles or rice, but they have awesome sashimi and sushi! We tried the scallop, salmon and sea urchin sashimi, all of them were fresh and good. I would definitely recommend the baked mussels. The seasoning is incredible, my personal favorite.

This rating is strictly for management and service ONLY !!!(the food is good) Walk ins are NOT welcome and management has obviously never had maître d experience. Turning away walk-ins because they have reservations an hour later! Sheila told us they can't seat us because they were saving a table for a reservation an hour later... even after my father in law told them we would be done in an hour they still turned us down. We were told to come back in two hours.. mind you they only had 4-5 tables seated!  I've worked on the strip in restaurants for many years and you don't turn business away when you have open tables and no one else waiting! This to me is bad business. We dined here the week before and the food was good. We would've become regular customers but instead they have lost our business and referrals. We went up the street to another sushi place and we were done eating in less than an hour.

This is the best sushi I have had. I have had sushi from Vancouver BC to  LA. The freshest of everything. The staff took care of you. The deserts are to be tried. Try and save room, step out of your comfort zone. Try new pieces you will be amazed

Found this place on yelp and convinced my better half to leave the world of buffets & cigarette smoke to come gorge on sushi. A good 15 min drive from our hotel (Aria) but definitely worth it.  The menu is limited until Jan 8th but the servers are very accommodating so if you have something in mind just ask. By far the most amazing salmon I ever had is the Salmon wasabi creme. I devoured 2 orders myself! The ambience is casual but the food itself is like your in a 5 star restaurant without the 5 star price. MUST TRY-

* of course the salmon wasabi creme
* SoHo Maki, basically long thin spring rolls but believe me ur taste buds will thank u.
* yellow tail sashimi BOMB
* DONT LEAVE WITHOUT ORDERING THE creme brûlée IT IS OUT OF THIS WORLD. The flavor the texture it is the high light of our meal.

Everything we ordered I enjoyed but those are the top 4 must try dishes. Only bummer was because of the holiday special menu I didn't get to order oysters and the kani. But next time I'm back in Vegas I'll be heading over again. And let's not forget the service! Attentive staff, friendly, and owner makes it a point to go to every table and ask how we like our dishes and even sent over a sashimi plate on the house. I'm predicting this place will soon have lines out the door.

Good japanese food, great service! I can't speak well enough of the team at Soho. Went for a late lunch, we had 3 well-priced bento sets. Chef chien came out to talk to us as well, this never happens in a place when meals are priced under $10! This is the healthiest meal I had in my trip so far!

I spent five weeks working in Vegas and this was by far the BEST locals recommendation. The staff was courteous and attentive. The sushi was amazing! I wish I had written down all of the spectacular times we ordered but alas I am left with only their lovely memory. The sushi was fresh, tasty and promptly made. I loved eating at a restaurant that didn't scream, "You're in Vegas!".

My wife and I checked this place out due to the almost 5 Star reviews across the board, and we were not disappointed! 

Amazing sushi rolls, and the portions are very generous. Also, the presentation is extremely creative, and the sushi chefs are masters of their craft!

Highly recommend SOHO!
Used to love this place, year ago had really good happy hour, service and food. Not so much now
Edamame and California roll.  Simple lunch, prepared and served well.  Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.
Best New Sushi restaurant in town by far!  The White fish soup and specialty rolls were all creative and delicious.  Must try the tostadas!

I loved the whole set up this place , loud music , food are awsome and little side dishes they serve before the big meal incridebly amazing.. I highly recommend for people who are craving good Korean food and they are open until 2am..

Noce sushi place, fish is so fresh.
I found alcohol pretty expensive but we are in vegas.
They have all you can eat menu too with large choice

Best Sushi in Las Vegas. I could not wait to have lunch there sometimes twice a week. I am very disappointed they stopped serving lunch. What a blow. I sure can't make it there a dinner time due to my schedule.  I hope they reconsider and start serving lunch again.
Truly one of the BEST sushi places I've ever been to and I've been to many. Everything we have tried is delicious. Portions are relatively generous. Definitely recommended!
Good good good prices. Happy hour was good and customer service was extraordinary. Candice was a lovely waitress and went above and beyond. In my top 5 for favorite restaurant.
This sushi place is much MUCH MUCH better than expected in terms of variety of flavors that is refreshing. Highly recommended and is now my top sushi spot.

I don't even know what to tell you is their best dish, because every one we've had has been incredible, and we've tried a lot.
I live near a Nobu and honestly, I can't go back there.  Soho is just so much better.  Don't miss this restaurant.  The quality of the fish is sublime and the owner/chef is an artist and the staff are wonderful.
This is always my first stop when I come to Vegas. I've eaten almost every item on the menu, and I'm never disappointed. The staff is lovely and I've never had a bad experience
We r a regular at Soho, at least 10 times.  But to night the so call fresh soft shell crab was terrible.  I am very disappointed.

Sashimi platter and yellow tail yazu are delicious! The sashimi was fresh and fatty,
like butter! And the platter is very reasonable. Friendly and fast service. Would definitely come back!

The 7 of us came to Soho Japanese Restaurant after reading the many great reviews on Yelp, and it was one of the most authentic Japanese food we have had in a while. If you are also tourists like us, and want to look for something away from the Strip but of equal standard with affordable prices, this is it!

As we walked in we saw a very plain and quiet interior, immediately lowering our expectations for the food. However we were quickly proven wrong.

The highlights of the menu were the Yellowtail fish sashimi; the presentation was superb, while the fish itself was extremely fresh and tasty. The Cajun Albacore Sashimi was a complimentary dish from the head chef; the sashimi was seared around the edges, layered above a bed of radish, and soaked in a flavorsome cream-based sauce. The Beef Ribs were stewed for 8 hours, the texture was so tender and juicy that it detached from the bone effortlessly, and literally melted in our mouths.

After what seemed like 10 dishes, we could not resist to the tempting dessert menu created by French chef Leonard Phay. We ordered the Matcha Tiramisu and the assorted Mochi Ice Cream. IT WAS AMAZING. See photos below; words does not do it justice.

Apart from the food, the customer service was brilliant. The staff were very friendly, cracking jokes with us and asking about our visit. The head chef even came to our table to specifically thank us for visiting, which was a very heartwarming and welcoming gesture. We thoroughly enjoyed this dining experience away from the rowdy culture of Vegas, and would encourage those of you who love a good taste of Japanese cuisine not to miss out.

Went here for lunch for the first time and all I can say is AMAZING!  the food here is what you would expect from a restaurant on the strip top notch!  Real crab in the sushi rolls and CHEAP!  I will be back!

Found this place through yelp and was not disappointed. The sashimi are very fresh and love the variety chosen by the chef. The restaurant's specialty yellowtail with yuzu is pretty good, got to love the fried garlic on top! (wish there was more). The house salad was tasty and i would recommend it as a break from all the heavy usual US salad. As for the tempura, the frying dough could have been puffier and lighter, but other than that this place is the bomb.com. PS The staffs are extremely welcoming and they're the main reason why sushi soho is a great place to eat at :)

This is the first time we've eaten at this sushi restaurant  our old favorite closed after being open for over 20yrs. Our first experience was good and we will return. I didn't give it 5stars because the chairs are s little worn and my plate that was given was chipped but the server was good polite and fast so very good experience. Not our new favorite yet but we will see...

One of my favorite Japanese restaurants here in Las Vegas. The food is so good and the service is top notch. The staff are so friendly and very attentive. Would recommend this place to all my friends.
I was wondering what all the hype on yelp was all about. This place definitely delivered. A must-try again and again. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great quality fish.

This is probably the best happy hour place I've eaten at! My first time here and we sat at the bar. They really took care of us and were fast with our every order. The food is absolutely delicious and all the fish tastes fresh and perfectly prepared! They even gave us an amazing sashimi dish on the house! There are so many food options during happy hour as well as drink options. I highly recommend this place and I plan on going back there soon.

AMAZING!! Best sushi in all of Vegas..chef Jon creates the most decadent food. Since coming here and getting great service and awesome food I have not even tried another sushi home. Chef Jon is amazing to loyal custies. I've been completely satisfied since coming here. Thank you chef Jon for always taking care of me when I come in.

Just came from lunch at this wonderful new restaurant. Delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced! At the end of our meal the owner John came out to ask us how we liked it. We had a lovely conversation, and when he found out we liked uni, he ordered complimentary uni for all six of us. My husband and I are pretty fussy about uni, and it was fantastic. Go now while you can still get a seat !
Bottom line: great food, great value, great service. Chef-driven Japanese food for 25-33% more than your typical strip mall sushi joint. The difference is remarkable. Foodie destination for sure.
The BEST sushi I EVER had!!! If you are in vegas, don't go to those over priced sushi places in the strip and go to this place instead! Definitely worth a drive. Chef Tae was the best!!!

I came here for happy hour (4-6pm). The staff was kind even though we came in 5 minutes to 6pm and let us order even after 6. I don't usually like sashimi. Sometimes the texture grosses me out and I don't like the flavor of most fish. However this place had rave reviews so I dipped my toe in once more.

My favorite dish, the Cajun albacore sashimi has really nice flavor, smooth and tender texture, and pop from the jalapeño. The firecracker was my second favorite as it's creamy spicy tangy and sweet and has crunchy and soft textures. Tapas were my least favorite. The kimchi taco was the best one. Lastly, the potstickers came with a vinegar soy sauce which I didn't like.

What a excellent surprise! We were in Vegas for the weekend and heard that this new sushi restaurant will be a hidden local gem as many kitchen staffs are from famous restaurants.  Went there at the grand opening day out of curiosity. 

So glad that we were adventurous. Excellent food in affordable prices.  Top quality sashimi,  great presentation.  The lunch set is less than $9.  we ordered Salmon and loco Moco and both were awesome.  The miso cod fish is definitely the best miso fish I've ever had. 

Yes. SOHO deserves 5 stars !

The ambiance and calm attitude of the staff and place sets the tone. Very chill and relaxing. 

The green tea is superb. We had the twin dragon, spicy tuna, crunchy tuna and volcano rolls. 

The volcano roll was amazing. 

The edamame came with a sweet chili sauce that was absolutely the best. Very smooth and the heat is just right. 

Service was great!

Super good food & great service!  Tuna tad as, twin dragon roll (one of the best rolls we've had, even a good old fashioned California roll was amazing! Beautiful presentation & attention to detail - real crab is always a great thing. We're definitely coming back!

price adjusted, the best restaurant in vegas andl a top contender overall.  owner/chef lee came out to talk to people; he is an extremely nice guy who clearly cares about your experience.  fresh, large sashimi cuts, lunch specials, happy hours.

the bestest sushi place i have eaten at. oh, and this place introduced me to hamachi kama! i may not know the names of the dishes i have eaten here, but there is nothing that i've had here that i did not enjoy. if i could give you six stars, i would!

My husband and I looked this restaurant up on yelp and with the great reviews decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did. The sushi is awesome! Fun atmosphere and great staff. Everyone pitches in and makes you feel well taken care of. Mica was our server. She was knowledgable, sweet and made our first time experience a great one. Thank you chefs and staff for giving my husband an A + experience. We will return again.

We've been here twice and both visits exceeded our expectations. This is the place to go if you love sashimi. If you're looking for a place for fresh fish and generous cuts of sashimi then this is the place to check out. 

As we walked in the staff was very tentative and were seated right away. As we sat we received our drink order and our waitress Julie ran us through the menu and listed out her favorites as she emphasized on the sashimi. We heard a lot of good things about Chef Lee and his attention to sashimi, so the wifie and I decided on the 15 piece sashimi plate along with some house favorites which were the ocean trout with pop rocks (pop rocks went well with the trout as it acted more as a texture touch rather than adding taste) and the yellow tail with ponzu sauce (clean fresh taste, ponzu paired perfect with the yellow tail).  

As the sashimi plate came out the first thing that caught my eye were the generous cuts of fish. Our plate consisted of three pieces of tuna, three pieces of scallop (light and sweet as this was the wifies favorite); three pieces of saba; two pieces of red snapper; two pieces of salmon; and two pieces of Hamachi kama (my favorite as it was so so buttery it left a silky feeling in your mouth). As we were close to finishing to our surprise Chef Lee greeted us at our table and ask how we were doing. He also brought out one of his special dishes on the house, sea bass with olive oil and truffle salt (very simple clean tasting in which every element went well together). 

Soho is one of my favorites. Personable chef and friendly staff with one of the best sashimi in town.

What a wonderful taste explosion! Local restaurant price with strip quality! Big Eye Tuna and SOHO Tostadas ( what I have is Tuna ) are my biggest surprise that night. I don't usually eat Sashimi, but what I had in SOHO is 100% satisfied my tongue. Fish was so fresh that it melt in your mouth with a sweet taste. Even the basic edamame is different from local restaurant, the souse I had with edamame is calamondin. I can taste the insistence on food of the chef. SOHO would be my favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas!!

Can't understand why this place got five stars. Food was fine but price was not worthy than the taste I had. Server was kind but took so long from ordering to get foods on the table. Last, server said that they don't accept the debit card so we gave another card and again and again. Finally I ask to try my debit card and then it was working and it was fourth card we gave to her. What a nice place have a server who does not know how to swap card haha no more word to say

Went to your new place yesterday John, it's going to be as popular as this place.  We love your restaurants, employees, service, food; we always get that extra special feeling when we are there.  Thank you for opening these restaurants, we will never quit coming.

Awesome food, service, music and the house sake is very tasty. I really recommend if your in Vegas and love sushi you have to check this place out. The lunch special prices are very affordable. Service was very attentive water glass was never empty.  One of my favorite places now and will be back.

Got to try this place out.   Came here on numerous occasions.  Only thing with this place is that you need to fight off the people for seating, which is a good thing to have.  
Chef John is excellent, spoke to him  on numerous occasions.   Everything on the menu are fabulous,  you can not go wrong.  We love this place.....

Love this place!  My boyfriend and I visited today, for my birthday, for the very first time.  Every member of their staff was super friendly from the moment we walked into the moment we walked out.  They have a great happy hour menu (for drinks and for food) and the sushi was delicious.  Service was also super quick despite it being fully packed.  Our waiter was super nice and when he realized it was my birthday, totally hooked me up with some J Pop and a great plate of delicious, fresh tuna.  I really can't say enough good things about this place.  Incredible service, food, and value.  We'll be back soon!

FRESH. FISH! Well, I'm going to have to find a new job to support my sushi habit: SOHO is only 2 blocks away from me - YIKES!

I have to be open and honest here: I know the owner and some of the staff, yet had NO idea this place was even opening, as well as opening so close to where I live in SW Vegas...

From first hand working experience on the strip, I can say Soho has derived itself from the benchmarks of service and food quality set by elite Vegas fine dining, but at a third of the price. Real king crab in your California roll, big-chunk big-eye tuna in your spicy tuna rolls, countless specialty rolls, lunch specials, Locomoco holy sh*t... 

This is the best sushi off the strip hands down. I need to mention  the ONLY reason I got into eating sushi as much as I have in the past few years is because I got to try SOHO owner John Lee's sushi years ago, from a popular Vegas restaurant on the strip. Now I can walk there in 5 min, get the same food, and at a great price. DONE.

I was here last month. Haven't been back in awhile because of traveling, but none the less, the food was still great. All the Nigri and sushi rolls tasted heavenly and not heavy on the rice, which is a plus. Scallops with Foie gras is the best dish to me. Chef John Lee still there and cooks great food. My server was Charlie and she gave great service. You must try everything especially the desert, creme brulee and green tea tiramisu. I don't even like green tea anything, but that desert was delicious.

You must try this place!!!  The interior is ok, I hope they upgrade the exhaust system since it smelled a little like a stinky-fried-food Chinese restaurant.  The first server we had was terrible, but it turns out it was his first day.  All the other servers are super knowledgeable and awesome. 

The prices are super reasonable for the quality of food.  The Chef used to be the Executive Chef of Social House on the strip so he knows all the vendors and gets top notch ingredients.  The hubby is super sensitive to uni and if it's just a smidge not fresh he will pick up on it and claim it to be "fishy" or "too slimy".  He RAVED about the uni here and even ordered himself seconds!  Trust, this has never happened before (not even at Raku or Kabuto or Yonaka).  The chef is dedicated to making sure his food is extremely fresh and clean tasting. 

We tried the yellowtail, the tostadas, beef tataki, angus gyoza, butter lettuce cod, and crispy rice tuna roll.  All were amazing, especially the yellowtail, tuna poke tostada, and cod (as well as some other nigiri and sashimi we had).  I would pass on the gyoza and crispy rice.  Gyoza was limp (and I guess I still prefer traditional pork) and a tad too greasy.  Crispy rice roll is a great concept, just didn't care for the actual crispy rice.  It was kind of stale and not crisp.  

Can't wait to go back and try some of the other items on the menu - they also have HH.  The toastadas are only $1 each.  I might just have to go and get like 10 of the ahi poke toastadas.

Incredible. We had a large party of 11 and the server asked if he could just "blow our mind". We agreed and he proceeded to bring plate after plate of delights. Incredibly fresh fish, inspired rolls, sauces and spirited service. The best sushi experience ever.

I love Japanese cuisine among many other national favorites, such as German, Russian, Greek, French, Italian, Spanish, Mexican, Indian, Chinese, Thai, etc.
Just about every nation has some special dish to offer for different taste buds !
When I lived in Chicago for many years, I used to shop at Mitsuwa, a large Japanese grocery chain store.They sell fresh imported fish for sushi and sashami along with a variety of Asian groceries. Yummy !Southern California has several Mitsuwa stores, but none in Vegas. I had lunch at SoHo today! I must admit that it was a very pleasant experience!First, when you enter, it is the ambience of this cute restaurant will make you smile, immediately followed by the greetings of  wait staff as well as the Chef/Owner himself.This place is immaculately clean, which is a must for all restaurants, especially a sushi bar ! I orderd sashami lunch which was probably the best in as many years that I have been eating fresh fish !
The  fish was literally melting in my mouth ! Unlike mundane iceberg lettuce served in many fine sushi restaurants, the chef here serves my favorite colorful leaf lettuce salad, which itself deserves seven stars! But YELP allows a maximum of five stars. So what ? I will give my cute  little lettuce what I want!
It is my third visit in five days ! I was here for lunch last Saturday, then again on Monday for Happy Hour!Tuna and salmon tostadas were so tasty that you might want to savor a dozen of them, while sipping Kirin!What makes this sushi bar stands out among zillion restaurants in this food paradise called Las Vegas ?
Besides serving fresh seafood at a very reasonable price, it is the friendly staff that will treat you so well,as if they all have known you for a few years ! Ten Stars !
Like all chefs will say, if you had to stand outside and wait for an hour for sushi during rush hour, then it must be damn good ! Kudos to SoHo, the fish and the staff 
Ambience *****
Greetings    *****
Cleanliness *****
Meal            *****
Value          *****
*********************************************************************************************

Came here for lunch and dinner.... Food was spectacular!!! Had the server surprise us and also added a few dishes we wanted to try ourselves... Everything was delicious!!! Uni was super fresh and sweet and they don't use seaweed on it.. Hmmmmm!!! Sashimi was thick and fresh.. Short ribs was so tender it falls off the bone and don't need a knife to cut it.. High quality food was low price!!! Would recommend all my friends to come try it!!
The best sushi place in town! My favorites are the yellowtail yuzu soy sashimi, golden ocean trout sashimi and crispy tuna roll but, honestly, you can't really go wrong.

Came to celebrate my future SIL 30th/Bach and Soho did not disappoint. They were super accommodating to our schedule and went above and beyond to make our evening fantastic. 

We were running late and every time I called to check in, they told us not to worry and never once made us feel bad. Last thing you need in Vegas is dinner to be canceled. Upon arrival, they surprised us with complimentary sake to start off the night - best tasting ever. Having a large group, we decided to do omakase. Due to our late arrival, we had to hustle thru dinner to make an event. Dinner did not feel rush, dishes were timed perfectly, and we were getting full before our last dishes so we stop. They provided candles for our cupcakes which they were able to store as it was delivered earlier. 

TLTR: The food was amazing and the staff was stellar. If any of us are visiting, we are going to make a stop here!
Loved Soho Sushi! We found this restaurant on Yelp. The seaweed salad was perfect, and the sushi was fresh and so good. We will definitely return when we're back in Vegas!

1st time trying out this place after reading reviews on yelp.

It's more like 4.5 stars. Service was prompt and got seated right away (with reservations) if not, there is definitely a wait. Waitresses were attentive (6 waitresses in a smaller sized restaurant)

Sashimi was good, rolls were good, SOFT SHELL CRAB was excellent.
1/2 lost was due to the AMA EBI, have had better (more fresh elsewhere)

5 adults and 1 kid for 300.00 including tip. Expect good food = bigger tab = not completely full but satisfying. 

WILL RETURN next time I'm in Vegas! Thanks Guys!
This place is awesome.  Fresh fish.  Excellent service.  I promise you will not be disappointed.  I will definitely go back next time I am in Las Vegas.

Go go go! This is place is amazing - the sushi (choose the twin dragon!!) and service is unforgettable. The owner/chef had time to give us advise on what to choose and gave us special tastings. Next time I visit Vegas I will go again!

Perfect lunch portions, great selection. From Seattle and was sceptical if I could find great sushi, but this place definitely delivers! Can't wait to return and try more of the menu! Fun atmosphere and friendly service with competitive prices. Lovely little spot, definitely don't hesitate to try!!

Don't understand how their reservation and seating process takes place. Obviously it's who you know there that gets you a table. Expect to wait at least 30 minutes longer than you are told. Numerous people walked in as we were waiting and were seated before us, after we were told they don't take reservations before 7:30 p.m. If you make a policy, stick to it.

We were craving for good sushi and a friend who lives in Vegas recommended this.

Ambience- very nice, warm colors, soft music (not loud); hostess asked if we had a reservation but since we didn't, she said 'sorry, I don't have any table for you' (and it was half full!) She paused for a second and enjoyed our stunned faces, then smiled saying she was kidding. Hmm, you got us, girl.

Service- Hostess had a good sense of humor.  All the staff, I mean, the waiters/ chef/ sous chef, etc would yell 'Soho something' every few minutes in unison and said 'bye and thank you' to almost every person when they leave. A little over the top maybe? But we enjoyed it.

Food-
Twin dragon roll- excellent, large bite sizes. Reeeeeaaaally yummy (might add a little more e's and a's there)

Soft shell crab roll- good but not spectacular. Gobbled it up quickly. Still enjoyed it.

High roller roll- has Wagyu beef in it. Is it just me or did it taste ... hmm, weird? Never tried wagyu beef before. You know when your mind expects sushi taste but your taste buds give you something else? It was good- just wasn't expecting that taste. Wagyu has a little after taste. May have to try it again. I always give food a second chance. (Yeah baby. )

Mochi- can't go wrong with Mochi. It's always good. Liked the chocolate ice cream and the chewy outer layer (don't know how to describe). Trust me, it's good. 

Will definitely recommend and come back on our next trip to Vegas.

Super bummed about this place. I called in an order to go and when I showed up there was a ton of people standing around. Only 2 staff members acting as bussers, hostesses, food runners, and servers. I found a server after two minutes at her station and asked where to pick up to go orders. She was polite and said she could assist in just a moment. 10mins later she was still bussing tables and seating people. I ended up leaving. Was really bummed out especially since I had wanted to try this place for forever. We had planned on coming again that weekend but after that experience we decided not to

My favorite Sushi Place in town.  I visit this place at least once every 2 weeks.  The quality is just like expensive sushi on the strip but more affordable and a better location (its close to my house).  his is my go to sushi place. It's where I take family and friends when they visit.

So, we been here a couple times the past 3 years. Coming from out of town, we tend to stay away from the strip when it comes to dinner. Each time has been wonderful. This particular time was a bit of a quasi disappointment. No knock on the food as the food was good but not worth the wait. We ordered from their omakase menu which had set items. We entered at 830 thinking their Yelp reservation confirmation at 845 was set. Come to find out it was not but they gladly seated us without delay anyway.

After ordering from their omakase menu (set menu) with additional items, the food came out at an average 18.75 minutes per dish. 8 omakase dishes totaling 2.5 hours. Normally this would not been an issue if it were our first time (no expectation) but unfortunately we been here before. To their defense the restaurant was at full capacity till 10 pm but half full at 10:15pm. We were the last to leave at 1130. We have done omakase at many places and this was very long. You tend to lose your appetite after awhile. Fortunately they broke their rule for providing us pitchers of beer. The beer had to make due for hungry patrons waiting 18.75 minutes per dish.
Fabulous good, great customer service and to top it off the price is fantastic.. You all must try everything.... Desserts are flipping yummy

My boyfriend and I went to Soho for the first time, as all of the reviews seemed really impressive.  We are from San Diego and have had a lot of really good sushi, so we were excited to try Soho.

Upon arriving, we were surprised at how busy the place was.  Every table was full.  That seemed like a good sign.  Luckily, we didn't have to wait as we came in just before the crowd.  The restaurant was decorated nicely, and seemed very clean.  

We ordered the Cajun Albacore, Mixed Tempura, Crispy Tuna Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Garlic Tuna, and the Chef threw in the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy.  Pricing was decent as the entire bill came to $57.  We thought that the sashimi plates were delicious and the Yellowtail was AMAZING!  I thought it was very nice for the chef to do this and I would have given Soho a 5 star rating, had it not been for the fact that they didn't have any rolls with Eel or they didn't have the regular crispy tempura topping on the rolls that most places have.  The crispy tuna roll was good and different.  It had fried the rice on the bottom instead of being rolling in the other crispy stuff.  The tempura veggies was by far the BEST tempura we have ever had.  If we are in the mood for tempura and yellowtail sashimi, we will make Soho the place we go.  Because there are no rolls with Eel, we will have to try other places next time.  

Overall though, Soho is a great place to have sushi.

My new favorite sushi place-the staff is amazing and the owner is top notch! :)

Went seeking an all-you-can eat sushi place and learned that a 'buffet-style' approach to sushi is not always the best value-Freshness is the key! Everything I had was amazing (yellowtail, spicy tuna, soft-shell crab and sake)!

Thank you so much for being awesome and affordable...and must importantly FRESH!!!! 

Highly-recommended! This place is the Jam!

Soho you were totally unexpected, I came here solely to try your neighbor ice cream shop. And then I saw you!! No regrets!! Your servers are nice, and HH specials are great! All on a whim!! I loved everything here! Our server Julie was pleasant and professional. The sushi was delicious! I will be back to try regular dinner items in the future for sure!!!

This place has the best sashimi and it's very fresh! The yellowtail yuzu is my favorite and a must try! If they aren't out of the very demanded hamachi Kama order it! Happy hour is from 4-6 which has really great items as well. Their lunch specials are very affordable and large portioned.

BEST FISH AND SERVICE YOU CAN POSSIBLY ASK FOR
Being a fish connoisseur, I know good fish when I see it. And let me tell you, THIS IS GOOD FISH. Unless you plan on getting a boat, catching the fish yourself and chopping it up on the boat, this is as fresh as you can get it PERIOD. The quality of the fish is so amazing it taste like it came straight out of the ocean. 

Even better than the fish quality this place is packing, the main chef and his brother are amazing. It was customer service at its finest. The main sushi chef and his brother are sure to give you the best experience possible. What more could you ask for from a sushi restaurant?
this hands down one of the best sushi places in vegas, I highly recommend the twin dragon roll.
Whenever I go to this place the service is amazing and so is the food. I've never been disappointed, except when they're closed :) !!

Among the best omakase I have ever had.

John and his staff are passionate about their work and it shows. Their imagination during my omakase dinner rivals time spent in Tokyo for presentation and quality. 

As the saying goes; 'come early, come often'

I went there for its happy hours. Got there just before the crowd filled in. And there were good reasons why people go there. There's a wide selection of happy hours items at great prices. I tried 5 of them. They were all good though I'd prefer some of them being less seasoned. When it comes to fresh seafood I subscribe to the mantra of simple is best. In spite of that I enjoyed my meal quite a bit. The service was prompt and the waiter's recommendation was good. The space was nicely decorated. Noise level was high but that's what you would expect with a crowded place. I'd go back and try some simple nigiri and sashimi next time.
Good food. Casual environment with low lighting and hip music. Dark tables and chairs. Its a good casual local spot to chat and chill.

BEST VALUED sushi place I have been to in Vegas!!!
I have been to many top rated Japanese restaurants in 5-star hotels in the Strip
in the past, and they were amazing but not the best value for the $$$$. I can definitely say that some were rather overpriced.
This place, on the other hand, provide the best quality sushi, better than the most I had in the strip hotel restaurants, for much less $$.
I am very picky when it comes to sushi, so we decided to seat by the head chef for the chef special, and every plate and every piece of sushi made us speechless. They were perfect!
If I am in Vegas, I will ALWAYS choose this place over the restaurants in the Strip hotels even though I almost always stay in the strip area.      
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!

I thought San Francisco seafood is fresh but somehow in the Las Vegas area the SoHo chef owner brings in slap ya momma fresh fish! Simply awesome. Start with Happy hour then do the daily specials. Mmmm good

It's been a while since I've written a review as dieting has kicked in for me.  Hard to foodie it up while cutting the calories.  :)

Still, decided one random Thursday that sushi was going to be for dinner, as it had been a bit since I've had japanese.

Yelped a bit, since I decided our usual stomping grounds wasn't going to cut it, and found SOHO by accident.  Just so happens to be right around the corner from my place, so...off we go!

5:30pm on a Thursday and the place was PACKED.  I guess there's happy hour that runs here from 4-6 or something, so we got there just in time to pick a few things from that menu.  In particular, the mini-tostada things -- pretty dang tasty.  I only had the tuna one as I wanted to save calorie room for the rest of the meal.  But wife said they were all really good (at $1/ea, we ordered 2 of each for everyone in the family to share).

Before I go into the food, service here is excellent.  Server came by about 10 different times to refill our teas and waters.  Also gave some good recommendations on the dishes.  The place is very Yonaka-like in that the dishes are fusion and modern, but less saucy and faster plating (Hi chefs.  It doesn't take 30 minutes to slice 8 pieces of fish).

Couple of really outstanding dishes.  GET THE YELLOWTAIL JALAPENO SASHIMI - it is one of the the best yellowtail dishes I've had to date.  There's something about jalapeno, yuzu, and fatty yellowtail that just makes you go tingly all over.  The slight tangy acidity of the yuzu mixed with the creaminess of the fish fat, topped off with a twinge of heat from the fried jalapeno slices.  Ka-pow!  Order another!

Hydro bibb black cod - comes with a little piece of lettuce to wrap the finger sized appetizer in.  What's a hydro bibb?  Simply, it's hydroponically grown bibb (european butter) lettuce.  We originally thought it was some sort of science experiment, but went ahead and ordered anyway.  Glad we did!  One of the more savory dishes we had all night.  Tastes like eel, but without the bones, and all the protein of fish!  Tasty.

A few other dishes to touch on that stand out in my mind: 

-soho maki - basically a thinly rolled eggroll with chicken and spring veggies; the sweet chili sauce makes this dish worth while.  We saw another table order 4 of these things...

-king crab tempura - this was on the specials board that night.  Came with some sort of aioli dip that was to-die for.  Was probably some sort of mayo based sauce that killed my diet, but dang it was good.  Had to do doubles during the workout just to burn that sucker off!

-ika geso - this is on the happy hour menu.  Basically, little tiny fried squids.  For those of you on a dietary challenge, squid is high protein, low fat.  Little high on the cholesterol, but a few tentacles won't kill you.

I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by this little spot in a strip mall (next to a subway and family practice.  We will definitely be coming back for fresh fish another time!

Fantastic.  If you are looking for all you can eat or 50 different rolls and nigiri then this place is not for you. if you are looking for a great atmosphere, fantastic service, and unbelievable flavor, then Soho is for you. the menu is awesome. they had a nice selection of a variety of things. Some cold apps, including sashimi are a good way to start. they have these $2 cold fish on chips which were really good. they had a nice variety of hot apps which we did not partake in. One of the best cucumber salads I have ever had. 

we had several rolls. I would highly recommend the crispy tuna. it isn't quite as good as Katsuya's but it was outstanding. also had a twin dragon which we really liked. 

total for 4 was $100. we wanted to try a lot of things and we ate it all. this place is so good. our kids (ages 4 to 14) love sushi restaurants. they are well behaved but I probably wouldn't bring them here. maybe one or two but not all five. Soho could certainly accommodate all of us, I just think it was a great friends or date place. 

well done Soho.  well done.
Best Japanese restaurant in Vegas, the beef tataki is worth the visit in itself. Throw in chef John's hospitality and you have an excellent dining expierence!

Let me break down the five stars. Service was excellent. Incredibly attentive without being in the way. They seemed genuinely interested and excited to give recommendations and menu ideas. 
The food - 
part one - sushi and traditional rolls. We ordered several types of sushi (mostly standards plus the chef gave us blue fin tuna). All were fresh, well presented, large portions. The excellent quality of the fish was confirmed as we ate our way through the platter. If I had to nitpick, the rice could have been more firmly packed under the fish, but that really is splitting hairs. 
 I also ordered (a few) salmon skin rolls. I try to order this particular dish whenever I go to a new sushi house. I think it's a very difficult item to make well. In short, they did just that. The salmon skin was perfectly crisped, the roll was compact and filled with fresh garnish, including avocado and a light sauce that, though I can't put my finger on the exact flavor, moved the roll from good to fantastic. 
Part two - The specialty rolls. We ordered several specialty rolls. One, the twin dragon was as delicious as it was big. It was the last thing we ate and capped the meal with a perfect sweetness.  We also ordered the crispy rice spicy tuna roll. In truth, that was the only downer of the meal. The spicy tuna topping was perfectly blended and flavorful, but the rice was severely overcooked. 
That, however, was the sole flaw in our dinner. 
When we received the bill, we were more than pleasantly surprised that our sushi extravaganza had cost about 40% of what we'd typically spend at sushi Roku and a quarter of nobu. 
Whether our meal was as good as at either Roku or nobu is debatable, it probably wasn't. However, the meal was excellent, the sushi was fresh and well presented, and the staff were wonderful. Given that, it will be hard to justify going to either of the aforementioned restaurants instead of soho. The price for marginally better food  simply does not seem worth it.

Great Service, Great Atmosphere. 
I'm in Vegas from So. Cal for work. Very Impressed with Soho Sushi

This place is outstanding.  The fish was fresh and presentation was amazing.  Chef John introduced himself and made sure our experience was exceptional. 
We will definitely be regulars!

We were recommended by a friend that Soho is one of the best Sushi restaurants in Vegas and boy was he right! This place by far is the best Sushi we have ever had! It is completely fresh and melts in your mouth! The service was amazing as well! This is a must go!
Yellow take sashimi was fabulous! Great specialty rolls and truffle tempura too. On top of all the delicious food and wonderful sake as well, the atmosphere and service were perfect!

We were looking for a good sushi restaurant off the strip driving through Vegas from St George to Palm Springs. We sat at the sushi bar being the first customers right at their opening time. We picked this place based on the ratings and they actually exceeded our expectations! Chef made us a yummy sashimi plate. Everything tasted fresh and interesting. We would definitely be back.

I've been to this restaurant twice now, and I love it. I've been to Soho twice, and only during Happy Hour. I love the happy hour items. There's nothing I can say about this menu that has not been said before. 

The fish is so fresh and so amazing.  I love the salmon avocado roll. The The avocado is always so fresh and melts in your mouth. I have three different tadas which are crispy wontons with avocado and fish on top. I've tried the salmon, tuna, and tako (octopus). Normally I love salmon, but in the tada version, I love the tuna. The tako tastes kind of like shrimp ceviche. That might be because of the pico de gallo that is on that tada. 

We also ordered the Cajun Albacore Sashimi which tasted awesome! The fish was just so fresh and so amazing. Everything melted in my mouth. My friend ordered the Hydro Bibb Black Cod. That was 2 really small pieces on a bed of lettuce. It was not that great tasting. It also tasted a bit sweeter. 

The one thing I would not recommend is the soho maki. It's like a really long egg roll. For egg roll fans, it'd be great. However, it's not something I would want at a sushi restaurant. It did taste great, and came with sweet and sour sauce, but I thought it be more fishy. The description mention shrimp and other things, so I thought it would contain more shrimp. 

The servers were very friendly, and they took our order quickly. They cleared all our plates once we were done. They didn't even rush us out when we finished eating.

Not your traditional Japanese restaurant.   Mainly sushi which is very fresh and some creatively delicious variety rolls. Must haves: Twin dragon roll, king crab tempura, yellowtail sashimi with yuzu soy sauce, and the crispy tuna roll. We'll be back, next week!!

This place is unbelievable. Soho, please
don't change and we will be back again and again. Food, drinks, service, prices (especially Happy Hour menu)...all exceptional. And a table side visit
from the chef/owner to boot! Soho is a 5 star restaurant in every way. Did we mention the location?!?! How nice to get gourmet, fresh, innovative Japanese without having to go to Spring Mountain or The Strip. These SW locals are huge fans after just one visit!

This place is great! Service and food are both great! The servers have a sense of humor and recommend the best items. Even the owner came to check up on our food, which made us feel important.
Food wise we ordered plenty of food. We started off with the tostados. We ordered hamachi, salmon, and white fish tostado. All great! We also ordered the black cod appetizer, which had a rich taste in the fish. The tuna pizza came out next. All parts of the pizza were great; the crust was sweet and the tuna had much taste. The last, but definitely not the least, the short rib. The meat pulled right out of the bone, and the sauce is very rich, which made it filling. This place has amazing food and I recommend this place!

Do not drive past this one place! It's very unassuming from the outside but the quality & freshness of the sushi is comparable, if not better than anything on the strip. At a fraction of the price. 

Sat at the sushi bar & was served by Chef Oscar. The care and expertise he used to slice & create was awesome to watch. The pride he has of his craft was obvious. Check out the sashimi platter picture. That's Golden Eye Snapper adorning that platter. 

Besides eating with your eyes, the taste did not disappoint! Totally fresh, great cuts of fish. Chef Oscar added a bit of roe here, a little uni there to completely elevate the nigiri. Didn't skimp on the thickness of the sashimi, either. 

Great meal, fantastic value, fun experience. What more do you want?

We found this place on Yelp and decided to try it because of the good reviews. And that was an awesome decision! Away from the Strip, which we appreciated because their lunch menu was reasonably priced and the food was delicious! I got the salmon teriyaki, which was excellent! The sushi was delicious too. The servers were excellent and the atmosphere was great for any occasion.

No reservation, walk-in on a Friday night. Waited to be greeted for a few minutes as there is no hostess. We are told 45 minute wait. There are only two other couples waiting & we already see an empty table so we think great, we will wait. Several large and small parties walk right in and are seated. Another couple complains & is told that they were waiting at a nearby bar & she calls them by cell when their tables are ready. So she says can we just sit here & order? And is told yes!!! If that was an option, we would've done that too at the beginning. We left & went to a nearby competitor with 4.5 stars & we're very pleased.
