This place is awesome! Fresh fish and great service. Definitely my go to sushi restaurant.

Was actually craving for some Soba and found this 5-star place, had to make a little detour going home but this place was a very pleasant surprise. Tried the happy hour menu and they were deliciously fresh with great presentation. Could have gotten more but 8 items from the menu was almost like dinner-)). To top it all, the owner himself welcomed us, a very gracious man and let us try their/his specialty: yellow tail yuzu soy. The verdict... I would give this place a 6-star review if allowed. Am so excited there is a place like this that I can frequent.

Went to Soho Japanese Restaurant due to the yelp reviews and have to say that Soho did -not- disappoint! Great cold dishes such as salmon sashimi, rolls and Chef John is absolutely awesome! He came over to our desk (actually he went over to every desk and personally said hi and introduced himself), asked us (and other customers) how we like the food and recommended a cold dish to us on the house. I end up ordering a few more because the tuna and samlon was amazing.

Thank you John! Your food is amazing, you and your staff are just extraordinary. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!!!

We have been wanting to try this place for a while because of all the great reviews on Yelp. We live on the other side of town but we finally made it in today! 
It did not disappoint! The staff was really friendly (Charles was GREAT!) and the sushi bar chairs were really comfy.
We started with edamame which was delicious because it comes out hot and flaked in big chunks of sea salt with a sweet chili dipping sauce.
We ordered the Salmon Sashimi with Wasbi Creme next and it was delicious. While we were still trying to decide what to get next, the owner and head chef John overheard us telling our server that it was our first time. He asked what kind of fish we liked and we said Yellowtail Tuna. He immediately sent out a complimentary Jalepeno Yellowtail Sashimi appetizer. It was AMAZING! The fish was really fresh and melt in your mouth. 
We ordered the King Crab roll which has all of our favorites; crab, avocado, cucumber, spicy tuna and FRESH HOT shrimp tempura on top. It was probably the best roll we have had in Vegas. Again, really fresh. I usually smother my rolls in sauces and jalepenos but this roll didn't need anything else! 
We also ordered the Spicy Soft Shell Crab roll and it was good, not as good as the first but definitely really fresh and delicious. 
They have small plates on happy hour too that are really good and really great priced.
Overall it was a great experience and we will definitely be back, even though it is a drive for us!

This place is definitely one of my favorites. For a sit down semi-fancy lunch or dinner it really hits the spot. I've been here twice now and both times were amazing. The staff is knowledgeable, the fish tastes fresh and delicious, all of their dishes did not disappoint. The owner came out to see that our order went well and we were more than happy to say yes!  We ordered almost everything off the happy hour menu, plus some of the sashimi options. It's on the other side of town for me but I'm most definitely willing to make the drive for their fish! 

If you're in the mood for fresh fish you definitely have to check is place out.
I don't write reviews. But I'm writing a review. No brainer if you're in the neighborhood. Do it. Stat.

Best Japanese restaurant in Vegas!!!
I come here a lot
Amazing launch special extremely cheap extremely fresh 
Great crew the food comes within minutes. 

Must try the salmon tadas!!!

Omg it's amazing. 

Thank u guys for doing a great job!!!

Food was so good, def high quality.  The service was amazing, I forgot our waitress name but she was so nice and helpful.  She gave us a free sparkling sake bottle, one roll and dessert for our anniversary.  They are all very welcoming.  We will def be back when we are in town.  Next time hopefully we can make it to happy hour.

5 star sushi in middle of no where in the outskirts of Vegas ??

Just had to experience that for myself on the recent trip out there.

On a Fri night, the place was packed, but after 30 mins of waiting, we got a table. 

The waiter was a friendly kid from Hawaii, who was able to recommend some of the favorites and specials. We ended up ordering prob more that necessary for two of us.. but we wanted to try various dishes. Plus the prices were oh-so reasonable. lol

Yeah, those 5 stars are well-deserved !

Everything from oysters to sushi was super-fresh and delicious.

The food comes out pretty quick, but in orderly and timely manner so your table is not full of dishes uneaten.

We also got to talk to John (owner and chef) who is a very nice guy and definitely knows his sushi. We wish him and the staff the best.
Awesome Japanese food. Great happy hour. Must try the firecracker roll.
Unbelievable experience.  The food is amazing and the happy hour tapas for $1 are great!  You can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu!
Food was awesome Yellow tail salmon pico de Gallo . Best sushi in southwest . Oysters Kumamoto. Service was great and Chef was awesome .Hot Chef

This is definitely a 5 star place.  The food is delicious and fresh.  The servers are very helpful and know the different dishes well in order to help you choose according to your likes.  If you like sushi and live or visiting in the area, I highly recommend trying the food here.
Best food on the southwest HANDS DOWN. Best service In town friendly staff that never forgets a face. My family loves this spot.
Can't beat SOHO!!! Presentation, flavor and price!!!!! Do yourself a favor and enjoy this incredible Japanese restaurant.

I am a tough critic when it comes to sushi. 
Before I visited this place last year, I thought sushi was just okay. Now, sushi is a regular meal for my boyfriend and I. However, NO other sushi restaurant compares to this place. 

Service is excellent. We were never ignored and the drinks were always full. They checked up on us regularly and anticipated when we were ready to order perfectly. 

Rolls are spot on, along with the tadas. We happened to come during happy hour. We enjoyed 5 rolls, 6 tadas, and rock shimp  for under 50$. 

Honestly, if you visit Vegas, you really should give this place a try!

11/17/14 Sashimi  were good.Sushi  a little bite small bite to me.But when I order beef Tartar I expected steak Tartar like (Raw) but what I got was cook ground hamburger meat on taco shells.That was ruin my early dinner.Service was good I think they have about 15 people working per shift So how could it be bad.

I use Yelp when I travel for work all around the country.  I even try--and hope--that it works when I travel internationally, but to no avail.

In any event,  this is my first review that I've written on Yelp.  

I've been to SOHO 3 times and I live right down the road.  Every time is better!

I'd tell you what I had, but I almost order the whole menu.  Just go.  It's the best seafood I've had in years, and I'm from Boston!

I came here with my family and friend who was visiting us from out of town. I ordered two orders of snow crab California rolls and grilled salmon. I was wondering what all the hype was so here's my final verdict. 

Customer service was ok. We had people coming by non stop offering my friend more hot tea that he had ordered. It was in fact, quiet annoying because I think in the less than hour ish visit, servers came by around 8 times to check on us and offered green tea refills... for ummm, just for my friend. I didn't need any water so I never asked for a refill. They came by to refill water once, so kudos for remembering us water drinkers. Then they probably come by 3 additional times to check to see if we were OK again. Gee, I didn't need to be checked on us every 3 minutes. 

It's 4am in the morning and I can't sleep. I'm thirsty and my tongue feels really nasty. I also had to apply ChapStick. Why? I think what I ate had a TON of msg!!! 

I live in Vegas and I frequent a lot of AYCE sushi buffets but knowing that I didn't have AYCE at Soho, why do I feel so thirsty right now like I had eaten at a buffet? It's not fair cuz I only had two snow crab California rolls and a grilled salmon mini plate. 

I just wanted to warn anyone who only eat cooked meat to be careful. You're going to feel thirsty. I'm just glad my 22 months old daughter refused to eat any of the food here because it wouldn't have been nice if she wants the one up right now lol. And if you're planning to bring your children to eat here, think twice. Your kids might wake-up at night crying for water.

I'm an out of towner here for a convention and decided to step out for some good food and found this place on Yelp.   True to form it did not disappoint. Awesome staff.  Extremely kind, patient and friendly.   The food was great.  Extremely affordable and worth the trip.   Dont be afraid to step off the reservation for some good food!

Amazing sushi and service. I was more than satisfied with every roll. Sashima was awesome as well as the toro I'd definitely recommend for people to come here. 

Staff gave us free sashimi as well!

Props to chef John ! He really has created a masterpiece !!! Bringing fresh and creative quality food to locals.


Everything from the California roll, that contains REAL fresh crab, to the braised short rib blew my mind.   

I have the pleasure of dining at Soho often, and not once have I been disappointed! The food is unbelievable and for a amazing price

Staff is super friendly- I can't wait to see the menu, and this place grow.  Amazing !

This place is overrated. We waited over 40 minutes. NOT TODDLER FRIENDLY! I brought my 2.5 years old twin girls. Asked if they have kids menu. Waiter said flat "NO". I asked what kids eat here, he said "just like adults, california roll, tempra" etc. I had never been here before and I was ordering menu. As I was trying to find something for my girls, the waiter said that the more i take longer to order, the more i have to wait for the food to come. He said why not ordering some now and after we eat and we can keep adding the order later. So that's what i did. The food was good, but over priced. I asked two spoon for my kids, and they brought the big adult spoons that my girls coundn't even put them in mouth because it was so big. We finished all we ordered initially, so i ordered one more roll. It never came, but was surely on my bill. The waiter never apologized for not completing my order. I will never come back to this place again, at least for dinner or with family. maybe ok place for adults only.

Me and my Fiancé came here while we were visiting Las Vegas. We were looking for an alternative to the Strip as we wanted something light and affordable. We came here during HH--AMAZING! 

We ordered a lot of different things from the HH menu and crispy rice Tuna (this was SO good). Everything had the right amount of flavor and was not overly salty or rich. Also, the servers were incredibly attentive and helpful.

We popped into SoHo for their advertised happy hour (we came for the sushi!); and we were served good sushi at great prices.  We definitely got a lot of bang for our buck. We will be back here soon; can't beat $5 rolls!

We were craving sushi and find this place on yelp based on the reviews. The people do not lie. The food was excellent. The staff was friendly and efficient. Service was great. We would definitely return when we are in town.
So. Good. Worth driving 20 min off the strip for excellent sushi at a reasonable price. We ate more than we should have, and will be stopping here any time we happen to be in Vegas!

I brought my daughter here for her birthday dinner. The food here is fresh and delicious, food servers are all super nice. They also have an awesome happy hour menu. Sitting is a bit limited so make a reservation if possible.

I went to soho to try out their lunch special that include sushi..It was the best deal ever!!!..It is a Japanese Vento box style!! I chose Sashimi Lunch Seto that came with bowl of rice, Soho house special salad,  miso soup, and the 7pc assorted sashimi are 2pc Salmon,  2pc yellow tail, Japanese snapper ,  and 2 pc big eye tuna..All that food for only $ 8.50..That is Kick Ass...The food are delicious and the sashimi are in big chunk what are fresh and very flavorful. ..Yum yum yum..my tummy is happy and my craving for sushi at lunch is satisfied. ..definitely come back more often for this lunch special!!!..
Best sushi place in Vegas! The staff is incredible and so nice. They have amazing service and the food is great! Absolutely love this place!!
Nearly perfection in this awesome off-strip sushi house. Trust me when I say you will love it. An off shoot of the original Social House rumor has it...do not miss.

This is a very good place to go if you like sushi, but you want to try some new dishes, they have some unique ones on their happy hour menu (which is mostly $5 per item). My favorite part about this was it allowed to eat something in my comfort zone, but try something different as well knowing I wasn't breaking the bank for food I wouldn't enjoy! Their happy hour is Mon-Sat at 5-7pm, and they have the following dishes on the happy hour menu: 

Escolar Carpaccio
Cajun Albacore Sashimi
Angus Slider
Truffle Tempura
Baked Mussels
Crispy Brussel Sprouts
Bronze Broccoli
Salmon Avocado Roll
Shrimp Tempura Roll
Spicy Tuna Roll
Ceviche

They also have some drinks, and I would recommend trying some sake while you are there. Jelly sake was not on the happy hour menu, but I would recommend it because it's just really cool and tastes great (like a jello shot, but much less messy)!

My partner and I ended up getting the spicy tuna roll, salmon avocado roll, and cajun albacore sashimi. I would recommend all 3!

The atmosphere is wonderful, service is great (even though the place was packed when we were there), and much more bang for buck than eating on the strip.

Update! 
We returned with two of our friends and it seems as if they expanded the happy hour menu (no complaints here) and 4 of us were able to eat and drink for $70. Additionally at this visit, our waitress was amazing making recommendations on what to try (we all typically stick to sushi rolls instead of sashimi) and everything we tried was indeed delicious. This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!

So, we decided on SoHo for all of the good Yelp reviews. The good things: the freshness of sushi & the service. Our waiters and waitresses were extremely friendly. And the sushi was good. Was it the most amazing sushi we've ever had? No, but it was good. The factors that left more to be desired: the decor of the restaurant and number of sushi options. If you want a restaurant with a cool atmosphere and ambient lighting, this is definitely not the place. I would definitely revisit this restaurant, but for lunch. When I want to go out on a Friday or Saturday night, this wouldn't be top on my list. It reminded me more of a cafeteria, and hence why I have it three stars. If rating solely on freshness and quality of rolls, I'd give it a 4.

This is the BEST sushi spot in all of Vegas! Forget the high priced strip sushi restaurants... if you want the highest quality of fish for the overall best price with the best service please visit this place! I can't rave enough about it or the people who work there. After trying it once it has become a weekly ritual. 

You MUST go during the week to experience the full potential of this spot by sitting at the bar and having your taste buds jump out your mouth from the not only eye popping displays of fish he creates but the best hands down sushi chef Aaron. He will create you dishes you couldn't dream of. He always goes above and beyond to make sure your dining experience is spectacular. If you are a sushi snob like I am please do me a favor and see chef Aaron at the bar... he will cut the fish and dress it to perfection. Five stars all the way around. LOVE THIS SPOT!!!

The quality of the food and service is mind blowing.  Best sushi I've ever had in my life! 
If your an uni fan, try the trio. WOW!!!
Also great place for date night
Tadas Bites for $2. I wish I could do happy hour here. Go to Sushi place off the strip!

This was our first stop in Las Vegas after flying in and picking up our rental car, and I'm so glad it was! We had water, hot tea, and edamame right away which was great and just what we needed! We split three rolls-the Crispy Tuna, Volcano, and Twin Dragon. They were all interesting, fresh fish, and a good blend of flavors. We tried to pick a favorite but really couldn't. In spite of being quite full of sushi, we were convinced to try the dessert. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the green tea tiramisu was wonderful--nicely flavored, not overly sweet, and the perfect end to a delicious meal.
Superb hidden Gem!! I would give it a 10 Star if Yelp would allow me to:-) The Service and Food was Fantastic. Thank you for the wonderful experience.
Great service! Great Food! Love this place.  I will come here again when I visit Vegas. Forget the strip this is a main attraction.

Seriously!! The food and service is so great!! I'm so thankful they this place came to my side of town!  I absolutely love there lunch specials! The salmon!! Yum!! And it's always fast and friendly service here!! Thanks for the sashimi chef!!

I went here for the first time last night.  Only ordered a couple of items (tuna tostada and twin dragon roll) but enjoyed them very much.  Excellent service as well! Will be coming here every time I'm in town.

Soho is an amazing restaurant! The minute we walked in we exchanged laughs immediately. This is how every restaurant should run. Everyone from the chefs to servers were constantly staying busy and smiling! We went during happy hour and I was blown away by the food! Cajun albacore sashimi was so good and the poke tostadas! Everything was fresh. Servers knew what they were talking about and I saw the passion each individual had! Overall great atmosphere and service and most importantly food! It's our new sushi spot!

This place not only lives up to its reviews, it surpasses it!  The sauces are amazing, and the food is so fresh,  everything is fantastic here!  We arrived during the happy hour which featured several of the main dishes in smaller portions, so we decided to order several dishes.. We tried the Cajun albacore, the hydro black cod, the firecracker roll, the shrimp tempura, the baked mussels, the beef tadas and the salmon avocado roll...  Yum yum yum!   We will definitely be returning here regularly!  Well done Chef Lee!

This place is absolutely killer. I frequent Japanese restaurants often and this is hands down my favorite location. The food is excellent and the price point is even better. Just look at all the five star reviews for this place! Awesome.
The quality of the fish is outstanding!  Some of the freshest that I have had even much  closer to the coast.  The service is attentive without being intrusive.

We love this place.  This is our first stop when coming to Vegas.  The staff is extremely friendly and the sushi is so creative and fresh.  If you're within 500 miles of Soho, I suggest to stop in and enjoy some of the best sushi you've ever had.

This place is definitely a five star. My man and I went here 05/12/14 and ordered mostly sushi and a yellowtail main dish. They also for FREE gave us a sample (4 pieces of a new salmon dish) for us to try! I've never ever gotten free fish at any sushi place. And excellent fish at that! Absolutely amazing. Also, the main chef walked around and asked us how everything was. BEST SUSHI QUALITY AND SERVICE I've had in a very long time. The fish must have been out of Norway. That's how pure and good it tasted....finally found a wonderful sushi joint.

A local gem that I am soooo sad I didn't find sooner.  I literally went three times in one week.

Chef John Chien Lee, owner and former Social House chef, is a master at his craft even after sharing a large sake (Orka ginju $60 very tasty) he didn't miss a beat.  Watching the staff behind the sushi bar was like watching a well oiled machine.  Nunu was to John's left (one time JJ gave Nunu the day off) and was the perfect team.

Ordered their Triple S Roll ($15 - shrimp, scallops, spicy tuna, tempura white fish and asparagus)  I also ordered nigiri - octopus, spicy scallops, akodai snapper and halibut.  Very fresh and not a puny cut.  They also have specials not on the menu.  I had their Monk Fish (yuuummmm) with ponzu sauce and taro root chips.  Everything served was fresh, great portion size and reasonably priced.

The have a special dessert chef bake specifically for them  My party had the Matcha Tiramisu ($7) which is a green tea soaked sponge cake (I took a picture and already posted it).  The menu described a "Matcha sabayon" which when I asked John what that was - he sweetly giggled and said he didn't know.  Cute.  Another catch was an item on the menu described as a "field octopus."  An obvious typo but also too cute.

I will be back!

Must say the fish was awesome and fresh. They didn't hesitate to customize my rainbow roll and it came out awesome. Their pickled wasabi was great too! Chef John and the staff provided outstanding service. Great first experience will definately come back again.

Finally found a quality sushi place that is off the strip. None of that mushy fish and rice blended concoctions like those low quality All you can eat joints. Quality sashimi, delicious sauces. Not one of those places that serves 50 million made-up rolls mostly consisting of spicy mayo and other filler ingredients. The focus here is more on bringing out the taste of the quality fish, not overdoing it with the sauces. For instance, their California roll is made with 100% real crab meat!!! I never liked California rolls because most use imitation meat. I love crab so I will eat them here!!
 The owner and staff were very attentive and nice. The owner even gave me a free dish of sea bass sushi to try for free...and it was delicious. They had a green tea creme brulee that they are still deciding if they will put on the menu.....its a keeper...YUM!
The peach lychee sake is awesome and made in-house! Prices are good for the quality you get. Happy Hour menu has great selections and awesome is an awesome deal.
I will be a REGULAR here!!

We came in for dinner tonight for a friend's  Orth day dinner, just a small get together. They were very accommodating and friendly. The food was excellent. The staff was excellent. The chef was incredibly humble and generous and offered us 2 complimentary sashimi plates. For the second plate, he came over to our table and introduced himself and thanked us for coming in and that he wanted us to try his fish because he makes sure it's very fresh so we got to choose which fish we wanted as a sampler! And it did not disappoint. It was delicious with a lot of flavor. Just that generous act of kindness alone should tell you how great of a place this is. Thank you again!!

This place is awesome! Food is great and they have amazing sushi rolls on happy hour at great prices! The owner came by our table to introduce himself since it was our first time visiting and let us try a plate on the house!!!! Very personable and friendly!!!!! Next time we come to Vegas we will definitely come back!!!!

ok so this place is great and was really fun to have dinner at.  its like Japanese tapas exploding in your mouth.  at one point the owner/chef came to our table to say hello, he was very nice, and offered to make something special that turned out to be yummy.  would definitely come back over and over again.  thanks for the good time... a new fave!!!
Love this place! Sushi is fresh and inventive. The red snapper with uni is a personal favorite. As is the Santa Barbara Uni. Great lunch special too.
Very nice place not too far from the strip. Loved the seared garlic tuna and miso sea bass. The staff is super nice and friendly. Will return the next time we're in Vegas.

When I looked this restaurant up on Yelp, I could not BELIEVE its reviews. At the time it had 5 stars and over 300 reviews. I don't think I've ever seen a rating this good. With my adoration for sushi and impending trip to Vegas, I was dead-set on visiting Soho and thank god I did.

The restaurant was in a strip mall and the decor was fine... it looked like about 30 other sushi restaurants I've been to. I've learned that great things in humble packaging, but I was a bit underwhelmed at first. Silly me! As soon as we sat down, we were treated like absolute royalty. Not only was our waitress very helpful and nice, she was also relaxed and casual with us in a way that my boyfriend and I always really appreciate. We love to crack jokes while interacting with wait staff, and this girl was on top of it, joking right along with us! She was excellent. She then proceeded to give us the BEST recommendations for our meal. Everything we ordered was SO FRESH and just bursting with flavor. No fishy smell or after taste... this fish was fresher than fish I've eaten on both coasts. After we were done, we were so impressed that we ordered another round! I wish that I could recall exactly what we had ordered, but that's kind of irrelevant to my review because literally everything we tried was amazing. I feel like you seriously can't go wrong at this place unless you have a food allergy and purposefully order something that will make you swell up and die. So don't do that.

Dessert was excellent. We had the green tea tiramisu. I feel like if I gush anymore, this review might not sound legitimate, so I'll just leave it at that.

The real clincher was when our check was brought, the waitress brought us out an adorable little sushi keychain and a pen that looked like chopsticks holding a little rubber piece of sushi. I was in love. I wanted to wrap this restaurant up in my arms and fly it back to Colorado with me.

If you're a sushi fan in Vegas, do NOT miss the opportunity to visit this place. Don't let the fact that it's a tiny cab ride away from the strip keep you away, either... the prices and quality of your meal will more than make up for that $20 cab ride.
The hostess was really cute and nice... Oh and the food was da bomb !! #entertainment720approved
Phenomenal food, friendly service.  Love the sopas,  get 2 of each!  Also really good shellfish.
Super delicious fresh sushi...melted like butter.  Staff = A+...Chef = A+++.   I highly recommend checking this place out.  Will go back to this restaurant again.  Total hidden gem!!!!

I have never tasted such fresh quality of fish except on Las Vegas Blvd in one of the casinos, but the prices in this place is so much less expensive than what I usually pay at the casinos.  

This food in this place is definitely strip quality with local pricing.   I will definitely tell all my friends and family to try this place out.

One of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas (including the strip)! I've tried many different sushi rolls here and they were all delicious. They use real crab instead of imitation crab so even their California Rolls are super good. Last time I was there they had this Tako Salad on the specials and it was SO GOOD! Definitely try it if you are an octopus fan. The Miso Black Cod is delicious, one of the best places to get it if you don't want to pay $40 for it at Nobu! 

The most memorable dish for me here is the uni! Not sure where the uni was from, but it was literally the sweetest and most buttery thing ever! Better than the ones I've had at Nobu and other expensive sushi restaurants! I'll be back for more uni very soon!

What a great place!

We had dinner here.  Happened to be during happy hour.  Waited a bit for a table but food was well worth the wait.

Lots of really good dishes like baked mussels.  During happy hour they serve small dishes at $5 each.
We had about 5 dishes per person and they were all great.

Highly recommend this place.
One of the best sushiplaces I've been to around the world. Costs about a quarter of top restaurants and honestly has the same quality of food, service and dedication.
Best Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  Staff friendly. Food is delicious. Great prices happy hour or regular menu.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars. Such a great find - excellent food. You must have the sashimi, it was so fresh and had the right texture. Also try their rolls, we had the spicy crab roll and it had the right amount of spice and the crab was just so fresh and melting in your mouth. 

Next would give additional stars for their service. The staff was so attentive - made great recommendations and made sure we enjoyed every dish. This is a must visit every time you are in Vegas.
All if the sushi places we have had in a lifetime, this place is hands-down the best ever. From Vegas to Los Angeles.

My company came into town for an industry event. We came here after a long day to unwind over amazing sushi. For the price, it's a great value especially in quality. I definitely would recommend this spot. It's a bit of a drive since it's off strip, but I'm telling you....it's worth it! Candice (our server) was super patient and informative in what dishes to get! I can't leave out the hostess either. Even tho members of my group were grumpy and impatient in getting seated...she was always smiling and reassured us. The service alone is 5 stars!!
Amazing sushi, great ambiance and incredible customer service... highly recommend in every aspect!

First time there and won't be my last. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Our waitress Sheila was exceptional and was very helpful with suggesting great options. The food was amazing and big portions of fresh sushi. High quality at it's finest!! Definitely my new favorite spot. I suggest the Twin Dragon Roll, it was amazing!!

Run, sprint, fly: whatever it takes to get you in this place!

Soho serves serious QUALITY food at strip-mall prices. Residents in the SW are lucky to have this restaurant in proximity. Chef/owner John Lee and his crew execute fresh, creative and sophisticated fare. The room is casual; the service is attentive and earnest. The food will make you feel like royalty. This is not one of those drab AYCE places, so don't expect heavy sauces, gummy sushi rolls or chewy fish.

There is amazing talent in the kitchen that has access to the finest ingredients often reserved for restaurants on The Strip. A lot of care is taken in their preparation to highlight the ideal characteristic of the fish. The flavors clean, refreshing, silky, complex and complementary. That fish cradles your palate and melts in your mouth.

Order what everyone else says:
Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, Tuna Pizza, any of the Tostadas to your liking, Uni, Black Cod, Oysters, Snapper, Tuna Poke, Salmon Poke, Short Ribs. Take it all in. Ask what's good that day and just let them work their magic. You won't be disappointed (unless you're into heavy sauces, gummy rolls or chewy fish).

Once you've completed your indulging, you'll be equally delighted by your bill. C'mon, $2.00 tostadas! I don't need to go to the other sushi restaurant in the SW anymore. This is it.

My husband and I was thinking the same thing everyone reads on here how can this sushi restaurant have 5 stars? We were so curious, we needed to try it, We also thought its almost 7 pm and this is a 5 star restaurant then there is going to be a wait. We got there and parked and there was no line outside.  I told my husband it must be closed.  Nope it was open- of course it would be its Saturday! There were a few tables opened and we got seated right away! Charles was our server! He was great explaining the menu and making his recommendations.  He was right, everything on the menu is good! This is our new favorite place! Fish is fresh- its so fresh it just melts in your mouth! You forget what fresh fish tastes like when you eat at AYCE restaurants! No more AYCE for us! 

Salmon Wasabi Creme-hmm! So good! My favorite! Salmon is cut sashimi style, the roe gives it a salty taste, the creme gives a creamy taste! I'm addicted! 

Tadas- only $2 each! We enjoyed the octopus, hamachi and tuna.  All 3 were mixed with their sauce and placed on a wonton wrapper.  Good portion considering it was $2 each! 

Bone in Short Rib- if you are looking for a heavy dish then this was a good one to enjoy. The runner was right when she delivered the food as I was eating with my chopstick, do you need a fork and knife?, I said hmm. Then she said it falls right off when you eat it with your chopstick.  She was right no knife needed. It was so soft! The crispy onions made it more flavorful

Whole Aji- like sashimi style raw fish? This is a winner! I don't normally eat aji but I will here! It was another one of my favorite (surprisingly).  I don't even eat this at other sushi restaurants, but here, hmm, SO GOOD! 

Triple uni- it was a special on the board! I don't eat this but I will tell you what he said best uni ever! Be prepares there is no rice! 

There is so much more we need to try! We are so happy we found this place! This is hands down one of the best on the southwest side! We are definitely coming back! Thank you everyone for helping us find a good restaurant to celebrate my husbands birthday! Everyone's review was spot on!

My favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas on or off the strip! The food is outstanding, there isn't a thing I haven't liked. Chef John Lee and his wife Michelle own the place and they are the nicest people you will ever meet! They really make you feel like family here and go above and beyond to make you feel at home and welcomed. The atmosphere is cozy and if you get Charles as a server you are definitely winning here! Charles is a people pleaser, fun, and is very knowledgable with the menu. Ask for Charles! Great job John Lee, I wish you many years of success!!
Loved it! Really good food no matter what you order. There's something for everyone. Awesome quality for a great price.

First let's talk about the service. Charlie was our waitress and she is awesome. She was very attentive and helpful with selections and request we had with our food. It's was like we went a friends restaurant. We enjoyed the sushi, shishito peppers, miso soup, beef teriyaki and tempura; All very good. Soho came highly recommend and will be by me also. Thanks to the friendly staff for making our dinner very enjoyable.

The food here is great but the customer service is terrible..... 

Was at Soho finishing dinner when they close the restaurant. The wait and cook staff were cleaning up without regards that customers were still present in the dining room. A girl (Asian, medium height and build) was singing/squealing at the top of her lungs and cursing  left and right. It was obviously a cry for attention from the sushi chefs. I'm pretty patient but after it continued for about 30 minutes I could not handle it any more. Casey, our server at the time, was great. He was polite and mild mannered. His energy did its best to offset that crazy lady. We tipped him 100% of the tab for saving our sanity. 

Basically, it's hard for local restaurants to succeed when they are competing against big named chefs on the strip. Soho definitely has the food handled, but they could really invest in hiring a restaurant manager to ensure that the ambience is maintained (especially when a customer called to ensure that it is not too late to get proper service).

Well just called for a simple togo and I asked," Can I still place a to go?" I ask because I work in a kitchen and it is close to closing time , so if they are already shutting down , I understand. Guy on phone answers back with, " if you want". Why would I ask? Wth. He says hold on one sec and five minutes into my phone wait, still holding but my grip has weakened  and so has my love for this place. I go here 3-4 times a month and than I get this. All I wanted was rice, shishitos, tuna tataki,  and cajun albacore. In restaurants you have to be consistent,  it's not about being escoffier one day and a burger king line cook the next. If your consistent , eventually that consistency will turn into greatness. Unfortunately this place obviously has workers in here who do not meet the consistency accord and do not want to be great. Huge disappointment,  one that I will share with all my restaurant comrades .

Hands down the best sushi place in Vegas. We hail from SoCal and it is the only place that has the same type of quality sushi but what even takes Soho above is the staff and service.

We prefer eating sushi in Vegas because of Soho.

Amazing experience! Both the sushi and the service were "5 star"! We appreciated Charles' personable service and he had knowledge of the best items to order - in fact, he did all the work! We just sat back and enjoyed every dish that was served.

Loved the Lychee saki, the Yellowtail app, the Tostadas, the Hydro Bib Lettuce wraps! 

I will definitely be returning to Soho Japanese!

Got shrimp tempura roll. Was pretty good. Got a fire cracker roll it was yummy because I tasted the spice. Got tempura shrimp with tempura veggies. Pretty good price because happy hour. Whole bill was about 25.
Thank you Soho!!!  My favorite on everything.  Food + Ambiance + Service!!!  I loved everything.  The best UNI in town!  The peach sake was fantastic and fruuuuuity!

This place is amazing. Had to wait 20 min due to the limited amount of seats but it was worth every second of my time. Once your seated the staff is really friendly and knowledgeable about food recommendations. Everything we tried was really good but the best dish has to be the cod fish. I'm a sushi lover and by far this is the best place.

I havent left a review for this place yet?

AMAZING.

$8 bucks for THE BEST UNI EVER I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE? YES
SABA THAT JUST FLEW OUT FROM JAPAN WHICH WAS CAUGHT YESTERDAY YES?

their maki rolls were okay, but who eats maki roll stuff at a japanese restaurant if you want something authentic or trying to eat real fresh fish??

It was funny because my group looked surprised that I picked this place out ( looks so whatever, not fancy at all), but after few bites, they all agreeed that this was the best japanese place ( one of them eats the best places in NYC, and all over the USA due to her job)... quality of their sushi is just TOPTOPTOP notch.

You won't regret it.

We picked this restaurant based on the good reviews. We were not disappointed. There were three of us and we shared 3 rolls, a tostada and an appetizer. 

First, we started with the grilled octopus. It was perfectly prepared and delicious. Next came the flying fish roll and high roller roll Both were excellent. Then came the mixed seafood tostada and soft shell crab roll. These were good also but not as good as the first three items we ordered.  

We were very happy with the choices but we look forward to trying other options in the menu next time we are in town.
Super fresh sashimi.  We'll worth the short drive off the strip.  Chef Chien Lee was great and very friendly.  All 5 stars ratings from Yelpers can't be wrong!  Love the uni and the yellowtail.

our waitress were very attentive, we are very used to the LA scene sushi bar, and this place is not very far off.  we spot the owner working seamlessly with chefs at the back ground, we really admire they strive to provide a good food and service to the customer.  Would really consider to come back when we are in town

Don't think this place needs another stellar review so I'll cut to the chase.

Sashimi plate (larger one) always fresh and the variety of sashimi is great (e.g. ahi, salmon, scallops, uni). Presentation is always cool (see shrimp stuffed in mouth of fish carcass). They'll fry the fish head for you too after you're done with the sashimi so you can pick off the meat or eat the eyeballs.

 Japanese A5 wagyu is awesome rare. Gold flakes may be a little over the top but whatever, it's A5 wagyu! Meat like butter! The ponzu sauces that came with it overpowers the flavor of the meat. Bypass sauces; a little salt and pepper is all you need.

We picked off the menu board and got the prime Angus filet with uni butter. Tasted great, but we made the mistake of ordering this after the A5 so prime filet was almost like eating a gristly piece of pot roast. If we didn't make this mistake, it would've been much more awesome in my mind.

Scallops with foie gras was cooked perfect. Best part was that the foie gras on top was not some flimsy piece; it was about half the thickness of the scallop. A little rich, but cutting the servings in half did the trick.  Hate over-cooked scallops but SoHo always cooks it to melt-in-your-mouth perfection.

Sushi rolls were tasty but as long as the fish is fresh, rolls taste decent just about everywhere. Presentation is always spot on here, though.

This place never disappoints.

Had to try it when i saw Ada, the Vegas sushi diva called it the best sushi in town.  Tay was my chef,  surprised me with a yellowtail spring mix and deep fried jalapeno and what looked like ponzu but had a twang that made the whole dish awesome.  The fish could have been mediocre and still a good dish,  but it was all aces.  Classic spider roll,  a tuna lovers roll that could have been the whole meal,  and generous nigiri. The fish is fresh,  the flavors almost futuristic,  these guys have a terrific sushi experience.  I recommend them,  high energy competent staff, attractive clientele,  get in here.

The food is always so fresh tasting.  We only had to wait a minute to be seated while they handled a large party, but the chef sent out an extra dish saying he was sorry for the wait.  Such nice service and the prices are so reasonable for the great quality.  I love the tempura rock shrimp and the rainbow roll was fantastic (say yes to real crab meat at sushi restaurants).  We had several other small bites, but the bill only came to around $25 per person.

It's not like John and Soho Sushi need another great review.  He's already created the BEST sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.  However, there's one part of John's creative genius that is not on the menu.  If you have an opportunity to spend $30-$40 per person on Sushi ask for the Omakase.  John will treat you to a Japanese feast like no other sushi restaurant.   Every time my wife and I go to Vegas, we have a meal at Soho Sushi.  And each time the Omakase is a feast.  On this day, my wife, sister and I were treated to the following 8-course meal:

1. Yellowtail with Yuzu sauce (Just the best way to open a meal)
2. Hirame with Uni
3. Ocean Trout with Ikura
4. Garlic seared White Fish
5. Hamachi Kama (The absolute largest I've ever had)
6. Bone in Short Rib (not Sushi, but succulent and tender)
7. Maguri Negi Toro with Black Caviar and Gold Leaf (Yes, you read that right...gold leaf!!!)
8. Green Tea Creme Brule with Mango Mochi Ice Cream

It's not enough that each course was an extraordinary surprise, but the best tasting food we had during this trip.

The cost was $30/person.  If you're ever in Las Vegas, this has to be a required visit.  The only other seafood restaurant we go to during our trips to Vegas is Aquaknox at the Venetian, but at that point it's $100/person.  I've eaten at Kabuto in Las Vegas Chinatown, Sushi Den in Denver, Morimoto's in New York and Hawaii, Katsu-ya in LA, and numerous other Sushi restaurants throughout the U.S.  Soho Sushi is number one in my list of Sushi Restaurants. 

You also can ask for special orders.  If John has it, he will serve it with great flair and quality.  The fish is fresh and tastes excellent.

Great find! We found this recommended on Yelp. I'm so glad we went.

We had the Yellowfin Yuzu Soy which was great. The Dragon Roll was different from other a I've had elsewhere, and good.

The chef prepared for us his Golden Ocean Trout. Fantastic. This was different than any thing I've had before, and would definitely order again. The Spicy Albacore Roll was to die for.

It's 20 minutes off the strip if your not local, but good food, reasonably priced, and glad we went.
Delicious food at good prices. The servers are always terrific and the atmosphere is relaxing. Happy hour is also totally worth your time.

Yellow tail is AMAZING. Also loved the Big Eye Tuna Poke. Every time we go there, we try something new. But, these two items remain favorites. My husband isn't really crazy about sushi, like I am. However, he loves the sushi here. It's super fresh, and the chef clearly puts a lot of love and attention into his work. The owner/exec. chef is usually present, at least at dinner time. He's been there every time we've gone in. He comes out and talks to the patrons, and shows that he cares about everyone's experience.

Great place for dinner or happy hour!  The Cajun Albacore Sashimi is amazing and a must try! They have a large happy hour offering and the sake list has something for everyone.  Friendly staff and good service overall.
Twin dragon and Soho moco! That is all! Went for my husbands birfday and they gave us a small bottle of cucumber sake amazing!!!! Will be back#)

We came here because of the great reviews and it definitely lived up to the hype.  I have been to all of the top sushi places in vegas and this one is fantastic. Not only is the food great but we were greeted by the owner who is also the head chef. He made us one of his favorite dishes on the house. Absolutely perfect little gem. Strip quality at a third of the price. Servers were wonderful and picked out great items for us. Must try!
We found a hidden gem off the strip for Japanese good. It's not the typical eat all you can but the food is exceptional. Fast and friendly service. A must have is their match tiramisu.

Our first time at cozy restaurant not too far from the Las Vegas Strip.  Loved the whole atmosphere of the place.  Every person was greeted as they entered with a hearty welcome from the chefs.  The rolls we tried were fresh and tasted absolutely amazing.  The best was the rainbow roll.  That was so good, I will definitely have to order that when I am back in Vegas.  Service was crisp until we had to leave, for some reason it took a while to get our check.  However, that did not affect our opinion of this restaurant.  Overall, I highly recommend this place.
Loved it! The Bronze Broccoli and crispy Brussel sprouts were so delicious! Our server Sheila was extra awesome too!

The staff is very attentive and polite. The sushi was fabulous, it literally looked fabulous.  The taste itself was delicious. We had the shrimp tempura roll, the firecracker roll, and the volcano roll. The volcano was our favorite! We ordered it twice. All three rolls were great. We did not have to wait to be seated which was suoer nice. Thanks.

I love this place! I've been here twice and both times the service was amazing, and the food was amazing.. everything was amazing! I always feel a little bit guilty going to other sushi places as I feel like I'm betraying this joint LOL I also put off writing this review for the longest time, because my experience here was more than perfect and I just didn't know how to put it all into words. Did I mention the service here is amazing? I can honestly say that I have never received better service anywhere than I have here -- they really go above and beyond. 

The first time I came here, we had ordered uni (among other things).. just as I was saying how amazing it was, the chef came out with two more orders of uni for us because he didn't think the first order was good enough quality! The second time I came here and ordered Uni, the chef brought out more Uni from Japan so that I could compare it to the original from California! I am no uni connoisseur, but there was a noticeable (not in a bad way) difference! This was a very nice gesture, and I really liked that the chef takes time to get your opinion on the food. 

I never order California rolls because they are normally at the bottom of the sushi chain for me with that gross imitation crab meat & whatnot.. but OH leT me tellll ya .. it's SO DELICIOUS here! Huge lumps of real crab with avocado.. I can't help but crave their California roll sometimes being the crab lover I am. MMMmmm MMMMMM MMMMMMMM.

I also ordered the miso glazed black cod, and yuzu soy yellowtail along with some others that I forget. Everything was so fresh and delicious that you really can't go wrong with any item on this menu. My boyfriend has gotten so sick of sushi/japanese food since I always drag him with me on my adventures, but this is one place he WILL come with me to.. so that says a lot!

Everyone here is very friendly, which makes the entire experience that much more enjoyable. It really makes a difference when I go to restaurants because it sets the mood.. no one wants to start their meal with a debbie downer as it makes it hard to even enjoy your food!

Just as I thought my amazing experience was over, they came out with these sushi keychains for me! How cute!

By far the BEST sushi restaurant I have been to on Las Vegas!

5 stars for their super friendly SERVICE,  super FRESH fish, super clean ambiance, and super affordable prices!

$8.95 lunch special that includes 7 pcs of sashimi= 2 thumbs up

$2 mini fish tostadas= faves: salmon, tuna, and yellow tail.

Went here on a Saturday for lunch.  The place is simple, yet clean and inviting.  I was seated promptly and given the menu.  On first glance, prices seems a bit high.  For example, a california roll was listed for $7.  However upon closer inspection, I think I understand why the seemingly high price.  The roll comes with real crab, not the usual immitation stuff.  I guess Soho was going for food quality more than price.  I ordered the sashimi lunch seto for $8.50.  Again, the price was reasonable considering the quality of what I got - awesome!  I need to go back here with a group of people to sample more items on the menu.  Based on my single lunch experience so far, this place is a winner.
what can I say about this place best of the best ! must go early on weekends or the wait is about an hour or so , yeah get there during happy hour !

Just had dinner last night at Yonaka.  Cannot compare to SOHO. SOHO is still so much better fresher and you get your moneys worth. The atmosphere and ambience at SOHO is more of a relaxed and freindly place.

We arrived at around 12:30pm and the wait was about 15mins. There Lunch Specials are pretty cheap, $8.95 for an entree which came with salad and miso soup. We also had the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, the Ume Scallop and the Sunny Salmon Roll. Everything was really good.
Staffs are super friendly. Fish are very fresh. Nice atmosphere. Lunch menu price is good. Highly recommended!

Food and service were great. Cajun albacore sashimi was awesome. And the sashimi with the pop rocks was cool. Oysters on the half shell were excellent and the sushi roll with the king crab was really good. The green tea tiramisu was also great. Awesome place. Will be back soon!

Normally I'd give this place 5 stars; however after waiting for my free range chicken for half an hour I got something COMPLETELY different than other times.  They brought down the quality of the chicken.  Their "free range" chicken is now a few warmed up chicken strips with fake grill marks on them.  Even the sauce is different!  And it comes with no broccoli.  It's cheaper but I don't order food because it's cheap, I order food because of the quality and the taste.  I was very disappointed and couldn't even send it back since I ordered take out.  Time to find a different Japanese restaurant.

I love this place! The sauces are so creative. The fish is so fresh. The lead chef knows their stuff and they did a good job at training the staff it's always good. Jen was great! She was cool. I have everyone try the pop rocks sushi, the applejack sushi is great. Mainly I look forward to the Uni. Yum! The Yuzu cappuccino is amazing!

Love this place. Great specials every day and the happy hour is a great deal! Fish is fresh and the chef is always there. He is nice and welcoming and comes out to greet you when he isnt too busy. Staff has always been nice as well. Been there over 5 times!

Okay, so many positive Yelp reviews can't be wrong. And they would not be.

I am a sushi fanatic. But I won't spend crazy money on sushi and this place was perfect. Everything was well priced and fantastic tasting. Grant it, it was my birthday (I didn't realize so many people celebrated my birthday by wearing green, weird) anyhow... 

Our guy, Oscar, was super friendly and made amazing dishes so we had to be those types that just snap chatted, social media'd the bejesus out of his arrangements. We took a lot of photos. Ask Oscar what you like and he will whip a roll or dish that fits perfectly
And OMG the salmon avocado crime dish... yum yumdilliumcious. Everything was so good I didn't care I spent my birthday in the friend zone with my date. Had a great time thank you!

Really poor service! Will not patronize this place again.

Came in on a Saturday afternoon around one with a party of six. Despite having about 20 percent of their tables empty, they seated multiple parties of four and two ahead of us. After a half hour wait, no one could figure out the concept of putting a smaller and larger table together.

I've been here before and the food is decent for a Chinese owned Japanese restaurant, but I won't put up with rude service and stupid staff.

I started with the tuna tada and Cajun albacore sashimi from the happy hour menu! Wow! Backed up a second tada order just for kicks, could have eaten bakers dozen!  On to the twin dragon for the main dish. It was more than expected and lived up to the reviews. Long live SH!  Vegas needs you

Delicious sushi that is not AYCE.  The service and food at this restaurant is on point.   Usually i prefer to go to AYCE because that option serves my appetite better, but hearing about this place and reading reviews I had to try it out.
Lunch special is tasty, and affordable.  I also went once for dinner.

I forgot what I got for lunch, but for dinner, two of use shared: angus beef tataki, 4 Sushi Tadas; sushi on top of a wonton crisp with a corresponding sauce (2salmon, 2 yellowtail), and a Fire Dragon roll, and a Salmon Avocado Roll.  50 bucks for the total bill.  I am definitely going back

Went there with friends to have lunch. Food was  great. Strongly recommend salmon sashimi and sunny salmon roll. Because of the busy lunch hour, we had a bit wait there. Very nice restaurant overall!!

New restaurant in the neighborhood, thought we would check it out.  Outstanding!  We couldn't stop ourselves from ordering more and more.  Everything we tried was fresh and absolutely delicious.  The presentation was just as good as the food and the prices were very reasonable.  We will definitely be regulars from now on.  Thanks for bringing high end, strip worthy food to the neighborhood and keeping your prices great.  See you again soon.

I really don't know how these guys have 5 stars on yelp.   I went expecting this place to be amazing but was pretty dissapointed. The portions were small for the price, the food came very slowly even though there were only 3-4 parties there. To be fair the servers were all very nice and friendly.  But I wouldnt go here if you're in a rush to be anywhere since I can't imagine how slow it would be on a busy night.

This is the best Japanese in Las Vegas. 

Hamachi Kama
White fish ponzu 
Yellowtail yuzu soy 
Appetizer Tadas 
Sea urchin 
Rock shrimp tempura 
Wagyu 

Get lit. Dive in

Actually I am not a big fan of uni. However after tasting the sample of the Japanese uni, I have to say I love it?It is so creamy and a littler bit sweet. Chef John is so nice. I even get "sushi to go"? the keychain is cute. Thank you: )

I use to love, love, love this place.  Service was so bad last night.   The slices of fish were so much thinner than what I remember. They sent as a comp sushi dish which was extra fishy.  The salmon, tuna and Hamachi  was also on the mushy side (maybe Monday is not the day to eat sashimi.  Also, what's the deal with serving hamachi with the blood line?  It's just soooo wrong.  I have no idea what happened to this restaurant.  It's my go to place whenever I am in LV (which is 5X per year).  So sad. :(

My sister and I came here for dinner tonight. It was one of my bookmarked places to try. We were going to do ramen but didnt want to drive that far. We are both glad we decided to finally try this spot. Not only is it close to home, they had quality food that was delicious and fresh. Our waiter gave us excellent service and even helped us with recommendations. The staff was very prompt and friendly, they made sure we never went thirsty. We had the tuna tadas which were very good. And 2 sushi rolls which I can't remember the names  they were delicious. The green tea crem brulee was excellent, very creamy and not overly sweet. Will definitely come for happy hour next time!

You ever eat at a place and a day later, two days later, you're still thinking about that meal?  You can't wait to go back and you're plotting your next opportunity to get back there?  This is one of those places.  We had lunch here and ordered scallop sashimi, yellowtail sashimi, salmon and avocado handroll, King Crab rolls with the crunchiest shrimp tempura on top.  It was all delicious.  Amazingly fresh, beautifully plated and just yum.  Service was incredibly friendly and they accommodate gluten free diets  with GF tempura batter and wheat free soy sauce.  You can't get better than this little place and I can't wait to come back and try their other plates.

Impeccable service and food!! It's no wonder soho has been featured in all of the major Las Vegas publications! First, the food is so fresh and amazing. You can actually taste the different types of fish, which, for a local spot with a decent price point is practically unheard of.  And the service!! The teamwork among staff is on point and you can tell that the morale here is great. I live about 10-15 minutes away (taking the 215) and it's totally worth the drive.

Is still good, but not as good my past visits.  The order at the table was obviously made by two different chefs, since the same sushi came prepared differently on the two plates.  I hope they continue to do better as I know they always have tried to do.

The food is usually good.  The imitation crab meat was a huge disappointment.  The service is always too slow at lunch time.  The staff needs to understand that when people are coming for lunch during work that they should promptly bring their food, drinks, and check.  Many times the staff is congregated in the back talking while people are staring them down waiting for service.  It's a shame.
WOW! High quality at a great price. The presentations are definitely 5 star/ 5 diamond. Strip quality restaurant for locals!

We came on the recommendation of some friends and yelp reviews. I must say that Soho did not disappoint. We arrived just after opening and were seated immediately. (For future reference, you can reserve seats at the sushi bar!) Pedro was very attentive and constantly, but not overbearingly, checking on our satisfaction with the food. It was obvious that every chef genuinely cared about our enjoying the food. Service from the wait staff was also quick and smooth, bringing our drinks quickly and clearing dishes as soon as we finished. Thank you, Soho, and another shoutout to Pedro! We found our new favorite local sushi spot and will be back.

After a few failed spots I am taking the time now to write how great my experience was eating here...the sushi is exceptional and the service was great...the uni was the best I've had..the decor on their platters were amazing and the sushi was so delicious...your money is well spent here will be returning soon..

I have been here around ten times and the experience is always either great or incredible. Lots of great dishes. Some more traditional than others and quite a few with fun little twists! Honestly my favorite spot for sushi and Japanese food.

THIS HAPPY HOUR MENU IS LEGIT. Really, really great time with the parents sampling their happy hour tapas and drinks. $3 house sake and other cheap drinks! But the dishes are what's fun and truly "fusiony". Loved the brussel sprouts with a hint of sweetness paired with savory flavors. Sushi rolls were fresh. Soba noodle was refreshing. Everything was inventive and well-presented. I have seen other happy hour menus and I appreciate not just the variety of choices here but also that they are one flat price of $5. Deservedly, it does seem to get busy pretty quickly as dinnertime approaches. It made my parents, who are traditionalists when it comes to Japanese cuisine, surprised and even a little impressed with the food and that you can actually go to a Japanese restaurant and not always have to order the same sushi/sashimi combo. Great place for family or dates. Will return as long as I'm in the area, for sure!

Soho sushi is one of my favorite places to get sushi, the rolls are a little on the pricey side in comparison to most average sushi places, but they deliver! I really prefer simple sushi and nigiri that doesn't have a whole bunch of stuff piled in or on top, this place definitely caters to a simple sushi palate which is the main reason why I come here. Another great feature is that they have amazing portions a $15 sushi roll will have 10-12 pieces on the plate. I do wish they had an all you can eat but I don't think the menu is large enough for that. If you do stop by you should try the salmon belly nigiri it's so fresh and they bring a good sized sliver of it. It's a really cute place too very clean the staff is nice and attentive they remember you if you've been in before which I like.

Coming from Hawaii and having enjoyed the food in Tokyo, my husband and I are pretty picky when it comes to this type of food. Everything was excellent! We ordered 4 different tadas, the hamachi sashimi, the ahi roll on crispy rice, the shrimp tempura roll, the hamachi kama, and the beef tataki. The beef tataki was our favorite dish. Everything was so fresh.  The service was impeccable and the chef/owner came out to talk with us. Highly recommend!
Love the omakase here with Chef John! I used to slum it with all you can eat sushi places, but he converted me from quantity to quality.

I really like this place nice staff. And they really like to make sure you are happy with your food. Customers have a good vibe as well. All round NICE!!! JK KUHL approved... Return visits ? OH YES!  Oysters coming soon!!!
Probably the best sushi I've ever had! The plates are unique and innovative. SO good. Not ayce which would be the only downfall.

Yum and yum! This place does not disappoint. Came here about 3 years ago and could not forget it. Three years later, visiting Vegas and my husband and I headed out of town for dinner and, again, Soho did not disappoint. If you are visiting Vegas I recommend checking this place out rather than some of the overrated places in Vegas. The sushi is delicious and fresh! I dislike Vegas but looking forward to my next time connecting through so I can eat some of the best sushi around!

I've read people saying the list of rolls is short... Chef John encourages you to try different fish, different rolls, different combinations. Let's get creative with the chef!! That's what makes this place what it is.. Awesome!! Freshest fish EVERY time. Best service every time. 

Step outside of your comfort zone.. Ask for the chef to make you something unique and different.. Will be the best choice ever. 

Ps. High Maintenance Roll... Not on the menu yet... It's in my belly every time!!!

Eat on folks!!! This place needs 10 stars

Wow. By far the best sushi I've ever ever had. The customer service in this place is genuine and you feel comfortable around the staff. Chef John Lee did a phenomenal job and he even gave us complimentary dishes! I've been to plenty of sushi restaurants in Vegas and this is my new go to sushi place it's across town from me but I do not care how far away it is, that's how amazing this place is!
Amazing place!! Good Food all fresh.. the staff is super nice.. worth the time and money :)

We keep coming back for more. We bring all our visitors from out of town to experience SOHO.
My mom and dad have to stop by every time their in town from CA.

I can't get enough of their hamachi kama. It's the best! I'll call in advance to save 3 hamachi kama ti make sure they don't run out.

The happy hour menu is awesome. A good variety for under $6-7.

The staff are just too nice here. They gave us these cute sushi pens with our check.

I used to love the Social House & to find out that the chef from there opened this restaurant it's no wonder it's so fabulous!  

I can't wait to go to order more off the happy hour menu also cause it looks reasonable and really good.  

Ambience nice, sat at sushi bar, quick service and friendly.  Looking forward to next time.

This is my absolute favorite sushi restaurant and bar in Vegas. The quality is just like expensive sushi on the strip but more affordable and a better location. There isn't anything on the menu I didn't enjoy and I've tried almost everything. 

Must try items:
Yellowtail Yuzu soy
Salmon
All tostadas
The roll that has macadamia nuts 
Soft shell crab salad
The broccoli is amazing


Not sure what these items are really called on the menu but I'm sure the servers will know!  Also extremely great service.

The reason I came here the first time was because it was across the street from me. That is all it took to get me hooked. Everything here is so fresh and good. The chef is super nice and always comes by and says hello. 

Fast forward to today. I met Chef Nunu. I think that's his name. Him and the other guys in the back were all cool. I have to say A+++++ for great customer service. Even the ladies are super nice and they remember everyone. Well maybe cause I'm there all the time LOL 

Today I decided to do something different and not order from the happy hour menu. I got the deluxe sashimi, ikura, chef special and green tea brûlée.

The deluxe sashimi had salmon, sea trout, tuna, scallops, and some other fishes. They have different types of fish every week. Well that's what the chef said. I'll sit at the bar next week and see what they have. Everything on my plate was delicious. Portions are huge too. I was full after I ate all my sashimi but still had a little bit of room LOL

The next thing I got was ikura aka salmon roe. It was like eating Nemo's brothers and sisters LOL the ikura is so good here. It has a sweet taste to it.

The last fish was salmon. I think they said it was Scotland salmon. It tasted buttery and super good. They topped it with ponzu sauce, avocado and hibiscus sugar. I thought combo was weird but it melted in my mouth. It was HELLA good. It's supposed to be on the new menu.

The green tea brûlée was better than the vanilla. You have to try it to believe it.

I love coming here and I will be back for more FOSHO

What a nice sushi restaurant. The fish tasted so good and the service was great. We ordered a spicy tuna and it was spicy unlike other sushi restaurants where I have to ask for siracha to make it spicy. They made it perfect. We also ordered the sashimi plate and it was beautifully presented and very tasty. I highly recommend this place

Wow. What great place!  I have to admit, my expectations weren't high when we drove in the strip mall. When we walked in we were greeted promptly by a smiling gal who became our waitress. The service Ada gave was great, and she engaged us during our entire meal, even though she was pretty busy. On to the food - Sushi was super fresh, tasty and well prepared. The Twin Dragon roll was great, a little too much sauce for me, but not enough for me to mark this place down. Wonderful lunch! When you go in, ask for Ada.
food is good, I like the sunny salmon maki. The palace is nice and not far away from the strip or airport.
I'm from Los Angeles where there's a large selection of sushi places. This place is really only 4 stars. Great customer service though!!

This place is fantastic - great sushi great staff = great experience.  I dined with all people that were visiting and it was my first time as well, we were all greatly impressed.  Our server Mika was so helpful and since we were a party of 7 she suggested letting us try the top selections versus going off the menu while staying in specified price point.  All the dishes were amazing and their fish is top notch.  I can't say that anything we has was bad- amazing ahi, yellow tail, cod, lobster etc - fresh and creatively prepared.  I could live on the ahi poke crisps alone but can't say there was anything I wouldn't order more of.  The chef stopped over to check on us, which I thought was a nice touch.  Julie the hostess was also very helpful - and we enjoyed her assistance.  I live with a 2 mile radius of 4 sushi places in Silverado Ranch yet I can't wait to drive the extra miles back to Soho!

If you haven't been to Soho you are sooo missing out. It is a hidden southwest Las Vegas gem, and I am lucky enough to have it right behind my house. 
Warning: this place gets BUSY! They will have an hour wait on a random weeknight. During happy hour you must make a reservation or good luck getting a table. My only complaint is they typically don't have a lot of servers working so service does get extremely slow during busy hours. I've often had to wait a while to even be greeted by a server or have my food delivered to me. Plan to spend some time at Soho. 
It looks like a hole in the wall but it's gorgeous inside and a good atmosphere. They have TVs playing sports. It's the only place we can catch Dodger games around here! Also, though the same company I believe, don't mix this up with the sushi burrito place. That's across the street, and this is much better and different, in my opinion. 
Otherwise, the experience is to die for. The food is absolutely amazing. They even have one of the best lunch specials...so much food for such a good price. But happy hour is definitely my guilty pleasure. A menu full of $5 bites and drinks. The portions are pretty big, shareable among two. I love the carpaccio, the ribs, the rolls, the Brussels sprouts, there's really nothing I don't like on the happy hour menu. But please try the ribs, you won't regret it. 
Also, my favorite treat is the green tea brulee. It is so good and unique.

Wanted to try something new around my neighborhood so I stopped by Soho to give it a try. Soho is not your typical AYCE spot, but more of a chill, date spot where you order tapas of sashimi and smaller entree portions. Don't go hungry! It is on the pricier side but you'd go there for quality, tasty fish. Each dish had wonderful presentation! I love love love sashimi so I ordered what my server recommended, which were the Yellowtail Yuzu and Ume Scallop. Each dish had the perfect flavor and texture, they were definitely served fresh. We also ordered the Miso Black Cod, which was very delicious. The cod was almost buttery and had the softest texture to the bite. The Bone-In Short Rib was yummy as well...the meat just fell off the bone, the knife they provided was of no use! Haha. Chef John came over to our table to check up on what we thought of our entrees and noticed we enjoyed our sashimi, so he offered to have us try some fresh Wild Saba that had just arrived for them. That was my first time trying Wild Saba and the chef was right about it being fresh! Received the check and was  so surprised the Wild Saba was on the house...thanks again, Chef John!

This place is a hidden gem. It's just as good as nobu without the strip, the pretentiousness or the price tag. Love the oysters, the rock shrimp tempura, miso black cod and sashimi specials. I've been here multiple times and every time I find myself wondering why more people don't know about it. I'm just happy I can get a table and enjoy this amazing food.

Never got to try the food ,
Very poor Coustemer service !!!
As we walk in there was no host and it took the waiter about good 5 minutes to say hi to us then she asked if we have reservation , I said no she ok and went away about 15 minutes after she comes to say sorry it's going to be an hour wait!!!
I would have understand if she would have come right away and said it will take that long.
but let us wait 20 minutes and then say it will take an hour really .
Just tried this place and it was awesome!!  The food was amazing and the staff was great!!  Everything we ordered from the appetizers to dessert was delicious!!

Outstanding sashimi and sushi! Definitely get the Premium Sashimi if you enjoy sushi at its best. I can't believe how well made and done the sashimi was over a beautiful presentation--it is fantastic and well priced! 

Thank you John and Team for the great sushi and dining experience! You've made regulars of us at our first visit.
Vegan magic roll is delicious!! They have the best happy hour 3-7 everyday . The prices, quality and most importantly customer service is incomparable to any other sushi joint!!

Been going here fora couple years. Fish is great for the price but the only thing is there service is sooo slow. Not really good at turning tables and the waiters sometimes make you feel uncomfortable if you require too much of them. Overall, operations is eh but food is great! Not a five or four due to poor handle on table operations.

Roommate and I stopped by here because we were on our way to the strip and looking for some grub before that crazy area.  It was a great decision especially after 3 hours on the road.

Friendly staff who were very attentive and polite.  The owner came over to chat and gave us a free sample of the yellowtail so that we would have tried the raw fish and got to see how fresh it was for ourselves.  Roommate and I both had some of the bento boxes on the lunch menu and can I say I was pleasantly surprised.  The beef terriyaki bento box was a good size, not too large or small, came with salad and miso soup and the beef wasn't over cooked.  In fact it was almost tataki style (very red in the center).  I loved it!   The sauce came on the side which was nice too because I don't like when the terriyaki is just slathered on, I find that lazy.

The yellowtail was in a yuzu sauce that was just divine, and since it was my first time trying yellowtail and I enjoyed it, I am now a fan of that fish.

I would highly recommend this place to locals and tourists alike.  And I will be taking my boyfriend/friends here on future trips to the area.

Thank you Soho for a wonderful experience.

When we saw all of the 5 star reviews, we couldn't help but come and check this place out.  Every time we go to Vegas we try to find a good sushi restaurant and never seem to get it quite right.  But this time we hit the Jackpot!

We went on a Thursday night and there wasn't a wait.  The owner introduced himself right away and asked if we had been there before and when we said no, he immediately sent our the house special, which was delicious!  From the first bite we were in for a great night. 

The sashimi platter was delicious, and the pieces were bigger than any place i've been before.  It was a steal at $25.  The salmon wasabi cream was my favorite.  

The owner asked if we wanted sea urchin and we declined as my BF had had a terrible experience with it before but the chef insisted on making it in a way we would like it and sure enough, it was delicious!     

I'm not much of a reviewer but I left there feeling like I'd had such a great experience I had to share!  In fact, we loved it so much we brought our friends back with us on Saturday. :)  Same excellent friendly service, amazing food and a great time. Definitely worth the trip off the strip!

I ate here about 3 days ago for the first time.. Only because its very close to my house AND because of Yelp. This place got 5 out of 5 stars!! I had a dinner date with two of my girlfriends and I chose this place for us. I was sure that we wouldn't be disappointed bc of all the positive reviews... But I was wrong! Kind of... Service was very slow. We still hadn't gotten our main dishes after thirty minutes... And we asked our server twice about our food.. She told us twice that she'd check... and then nothing. We did get our appetizers.. Slowly. Staff seems kind of all over the place..well anyway, after waiting... And we were starving, my friends got upset and wanted to leave.  So we asked for our check and told the server to cancel our orders. Then as we were getting up to leave the table, suddenly the server appears with all our food in her arms!! My friends asked me if I still wanted to stay and since the food was already made, I said yes of course. I just don't understand why our food took so long. We didn't order special rolls or anything. Just sashimi..AND the restaurant was not busy! Well we decided to stay..(although we were in a grumpy mood by then) and then the owner of the restaurant came out and apologized for the slow service! He asked us to please at least try the food and that it will all be comped. Everything we ordered was absolutely amazing. I actually came back today for a late lunch, this time bringing my sister.. The food here is so good that it actually makes up for the kind of slow service. Today when we walked in, nobody greeted us. This guy that was wiping up a table just said 'how many?' Without even making eye contact. When I asked if they had dessert, the server said he didn't know bc it's his first day. I get it. Maybe service is slow bc the employees are new??! I only came back here bc the food was so good... But I do think the staff needs a little work. The owner seems to care a lot about what his customers think, which I think is wonderful. He came out and greeted me, telling me thank you for coming back, also sending us free scallop sashimi dish. Our last order of beers were forgotten by another server, so we were given complimentary sake shots. Overall... I want to love this place as a whole. I love the food for sure.. This is why I will return... But I hope the service catches up too.

Update to Soho's review was definitely needed. My friend and I had been wanting to come here for a while as we haven't been here for years. I randomly decided to ask her to come with me to dinner one afternoon and here this experience went. Lol Unfortunately, it was a day it rains in Vegas (as we all know, that doesn't happen often). I had got off work from a far hospital at 530ish, but due to the rain, it took a while for both of us to arrive at the restaurant. It was pretty busy at the restaurant and a lot of people waiting. I had asked the hostess what would happen if our wait for a table exceeds the time limit of happy hour (which was the main reason we wanted to come, and had come many times in the past), she had assured us that we will still receive the happy hour pricing, even if it passes the time. Great news as we would have been sad lol. I am not sure when they changed the times, but the happy hour now goes from 0400P - 0700P. Supposedly they take reservations now. Had i known earlier, i would have called. But as stated, it worked out anyway. 

After waiting a while, we had finally got a table maybe at 0645P. After we were seated, we had the happy hour menus. They seemed to have added some stuff since my last visit. Aside from the food, they offer beers/sake/sangria as cheap as $3 and wines at $5.
