SOHO Wings includes choice of garlic Parmesan, yuzu miso, or nutty habenero. I had asked for yuzu miso. Not as what i expected. It is mildly sweet with a very light hint of miso. The batter seems a bit "thick", not in actual thickness but it not being that light in texture. I'm still on the hunt for the best fried chicken in town, that can match the korean fried chicken in LA or Seoul. XD 

We had also tried the Firecracker roll because i had remembered there was a happy hour item that had crispy rice. This definitely was not it. Lol The firecracker roll states it includes deep fried, spicy tuna, jalapeno, cream cheese, and sweet onions. Neither of us like cream cheese in our sushi, so we opt'ed out of that. This was literally a deep fried spicy tuna roll topped with sweet onions and jalapeno. Wonder what the crispy rice one which resembles the crispy rice you get from like a dolsot bibimbap or those clay pot rice. Mildly weird with the sweet pickled-like onions on top. 

Typically our favorites from the old happy hour menu are the tostadas for a dollar and salmon avocado roll. Very simple items but yummy. 

The tostadas as previously made, were individual tostada chips with a good amount of toppings (salmon, tuna, octopus, or yellowtail). Now, the "SOHO Tostada" is a choice of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, or mixed seafood. They used to be simply made, with simple seasoning and ingredients. Tuna was very similar to hawaiian poke. Now, instead of individual topped tostadas, the fish of choice is placed in a small bowl in the middle of a plate with 5 tostada chips surrounding. You do get about the same amount of topping as you used to, if not more, but i feel like they add a lot of things to "brighten" it up like pineapples, etc. Still tasty but would have preferred how it used to be. Soho was known to use fresh fish so unsure why all the "extra" is needed. 

Best and simplest item is still the salmon avocado rolls. 8 pieces per order. Simply delicious. Nothing to be said. Fresh fish

Overall, glad they extended the happy hour but unfortunately even if I can get off at 4pm, most dont get off till at least 6. But i think happy hour runs into the weekend too, which i dont think they offered before (dont quote me on this, call to confirm....)

I used to get this ghost pepper chili sauce the owner/chef used to make. Unsure if this is still available. A previous time i had tried to ask for it and they said they didn't have it or didn't make it anymore. 

Overall, love their happy hour. Good for dinner or just a snack. XD (piggy)

We found this place through yelp. Yelpers did not disappoint. My husband and I love sashimi so when we saw this place we didn't hesitate to give it a try. 

The lunch set  menu is VERY reasonable. It ranges from $8.95-$10.95. It includes Soup (2 to choose from), choice of salad, soup, and main dish. For $2.00 more you can have a dessert with you meal. You can choose from Green Tea cheesecake or mochi ice cream. 

We got the sashimi set and the teriyaki salmon set. The sashimi were appropriately cut, you taste the freshness and sweetness of the fish. The teriyaki salmon was moist. The teriyaki sauce is played on a ramekins so you can control the amount of teriyaki sauce on you salmon. 

The baked muscles and oyster were just a good. The baked muscles were very meaty. 

The chef also threw in complimentary trout sashimi on a bed of ponzu . It was fresh with interesting texture from the pop rock. It's with the try. 

Service was excellent. The staff was very knowledgeable of the menu. They were very friendly. 

The $3.00 sangria is delicious.

Their happy hour menu is a Real Deal! $5.00 sushi roll and drinks range from $3-$18.

I would definitely need to come back the next time I make my way back to Vegas. My friend and I came during lunch. It wasn't very crowded, we were seated right away, and the food came out in a timely manner. 

My friend ordered the bento box off the lunch menu. The bento box came with rice, meat, salad, sashimi, and pickled cucumbers. The meat was perfect! Especially dipped in their sauce. 

We ordered the yellowtail yuzu soy to share. It was topped with fried jalepeno. I would definitely order this again!

I ordered the spicy soft shell crab. The reason why I only give Soho a 4 star is because it wasn't spicy at all. The roll had soft shell crab, spicy tuna, cucumber, avocado, jalepeno, and spicy aioli. I had to order a side of jalepeno and that still wasn't enough spice for me.

I've been in love with this place since 2014. The freshest fish, and an excellent happy hour. A few other places in Vegas could use the hint, people love full happy hour menus  employees are super friendly, which leads to humorous encounters where some customers are overly familiar-they like you, not love you people. Try the unagi and the black truffle sashimi. You won't be disappointed.

This was my first 21st Bday dinner in Vegas and I had the best experience ever!! Props to our server Gabriel for making this dinner unforgettably amazing. 

We went in around 5pm on Friday and scored from happy hour. Everything was $5 each. We ordered the yellow tail tostada, the albacore, the escolar, the seafood dynamite roll, and the scallop pico de gallo. I can not describe in words how shocked I am. I loved every single dish!!! If I had to pick a favorite, it'd be the scallop pico de gallo. As for drinks, we got the jelly alcoholic drink (interestingly good) and a bottle of sake. It was quite the touch to the meal. 

Hopefully you'll get the same experience / server as I did!!

Little gem.  The chef is simply genius.  
Dishes not to miss: scallops sashimi, bib lettuce black cod, yellowtail sushimi, soft shell roll. Live uni the best I ever had.

I came in excited, left with an empty stomach and short $126. First of all, this place had 5 visible sushi chefs, behind the glass. Whether they're assistants or THE chef, it doesn't matter. It took over an hour for they to prepare Sashimi supreme or whatever they call it. $35 for 18 pieces of sashimi, is OK. But the fact that the Sashimi were cut paper thin pissed me off. It was me and four other people, so obviously I tad to order them a bunch of other things. The only thing I liked about this place, was the friendly staff. "But J, why not give them 2 stars since the wait staff was friendly?" Because, imaginary friend that didn't experience the fury I felt. There were 5 bozos standing there behind the glass, why didn't my damn sushi and sashimi come faster?

Breaking off from the AYCE adventures... This place has incredible ratings and reviews. So. DUH I'm gonna try it.

Golden Ocean Trout, which is made with POP ROCKS on it. AMAZING!!!

Shrimp, Octopus, and Tuna Tostadas. Sooooo good. All of their tostadas are made differently. Extra variety!

Baked Mussels, not the best overall taste I've had, but the mussels themselves were fantastic.

Octopus Nigiri and Spicy Scallop Handroll were delicious. The Firecracker Roll was good. However my most favorite... Was that damn Crispy Tuna Roll. Holy crap.

Cucumber Salad, Miso, and Toban Seafood Soup were nice little side dishes. The chef also provides a free sashimi dish... You'll just have to find out what ;)

But.

To top it off? Dessert.

Green Tea Tiramisu. And Green Tea CREME.BRULEE. Jesus.

No really. Just Jesus.

The service was awesome. Very nice waitresses and waiters. Didn't get personal with the chefs despite sitting at the bar, but the atmosphere is super friendly.

Verdict? YE!!!!!!!!

Coming again, soon.

Soho is one of those places that catches you off guard. You walk in and you see the venue and it's like "hm.. I might actually have to pay a bit of money here" and then you sit down and at the end of your meal they hand you the check and you're like.. "wow that's a decent price!"

Granted that decent price only comes during happy hour or lunch time, but still! It's a very welcome surprise.

I've eaten the sashimi lunch special practically every time that I've come here and let me tell you... This is definitely the place you want to come if you want fish quality that's above average for a price that won't leave you begging for OT at work. Keep in mind that this deal is only available during lunch, but when you're paying a little over $10 for 7 pieces of sashimi, rice, salad, miso soup, and a random side dish? I'd eat lunch here every day if I could.

On the days when I'm feeling like a million bucks, I sometimes go out of my way to order the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy dish. It is AWESOME. Aside from that.. I've visited during happy hour once and just kept shoveling these $1 tostadas into my stomach. Really, I just couldn't stop.

Five stars because there's just no other way...

I'll keep this short and simple.  

Koshihikari Echigo - Incredible!  
Yellowtail Yuzu Soy - Incredible!
Miso Soup (typically not a fave...) - Incredible!
Philadelphia Rolls - Incredible!
Yellowtail Maki - Incredible!
Fire Cracker Rolls - Incredible!
Matcha Tiramisu - Incredible!

I wasn't a 100% on board with ordering the Koshihikari Echigo.  Our server, Charles, overheard me talking about it and said "If you don't like it... it's on me!"  Sold!  However, you tricky tricky gent, you..   :-)

Some of the best sushi I've ever had in addition to fun and very attentive service!  My new fave place, I'll be back!

Sooooohooooo good! It's a really nice sushi place to dine at. I really love how the service is on top of everything and they go above and beyond to have the best customer service. Our waitress was so nice! She new it was our first time and she brought us a sashimi dish on the house! Highly recommend coming for the happy hour as well! Everyday 4-7pm it's always packed so definitely make a reservation before hand.
What a great place, very surprised how good and fresh all the ingredients are. This will definitely be the go to spot and I'll be a regular.

Fresh fish and great happy hour specials- worth the drive to check out, as it's across town from me so requires special planning. The firecracker roll is a favorite, but everything is executed very well.

TOSTADAS: Tako is slightly spicy, salmon is delicious, Hamachi was on the plain side, tuna poke was the best. $1 each HH, regularly $2/ea.
HYDROBIB BLACK COD: delicate but flavorful, loved the soft texture of the fish contrasting with the fresh crunch of the lettuce.
FIRECRACKER ROLL: a favorite roll! Packs a nice punch of heat with spicy tuna and jalapeno, cools it down with a minimal amount of cream cheese and great texture and flavor of sweet onion. Unique!
SALMON AVOCADO ROLL: simple and delicious
CAJUN ALBACORE SASHIMI: BF's favorite, good-sized portion with a lot of sauce, served on a bed of crunchy radish.
IKA GESO: Tasty surprise! A bar-food take on fried squid with a dust of spice, served with a curry mustard sauce. The sauce makes it!
BAKED MUSSELS: Large, tender, and saucy.

Added the server's recommendation, YELLOWTAIL SASHIMI, their "signature dish". It was good, with generous slices of fish and light but flavorful garlic-ponzu, but not something I haven't had elsewhere.

Ultimately, I came here due to the Yonaka comparisons and was pleased with the fish quality and the great flavors but feel the menu is mostly great quality versions of common sushi staples- would love to see them add some more unique or inventive dishes, like the ika gesso. Will be back for the Firecracker roll, would love to meet Chef John on my next visit!

Hands down, the best sushi I have had in Vegas. Extremely creative offerings coupled with a pleasant, open space and great service. I especially loved the Ocean Trout (Steelhead) Sashimi with pop rocks. We ordered it for the novelty of the menu description, but it was the stand out of our meal. Everything was wonderful. Chef Lee (formally of Social House) came by our table and spent some time with us, inquiring about our impressions of his restaurant and our preferences. He challenged us on Uni, probably the one sushi/sashimi component that I generally do not like. He generously introduced us to the EXTREMELY fresh Santa Catalina and other Uni that he selects. I have to say that even though I am not a Uni fan, I now think my hesitancy on Uni has been the fact that it is rarely presented as fresh and clean as what Soho offers. 

We explored the rest of this eclectic menu and every selection was outstanding. We finished up on a short ribs dish that put us over the top. Every minute of our meal was a favor fest. We can hardly wait until our next trip to Vegas to return to Soho.
Sooooooo good... And I am a sushi snob! This place is super friendly n so darn delicious... Plus, sushi plates with lights on them... Yes, please!!!!!

We looked for the best sushi in Las Vegas on Yelp and found this place.  We had three people from Seattle so our expectations of sushi are pretty high.  We were very impressed with excellent service, high quality fish, and the manager who provided a special sake for our celebration.  Oh yeah, and the price was a great value.  THANK YOU Soho!

Very good. Venue is reasonable, not exceptional. Food is very good. Excellent happy hour value.

-Yellowtail sashimi: very good. quality fish. good balance of herb/yuzu soy
-angus beef tataki: also very good. crishpy shallots are a great touch.
-tostadas are good, but def not worth $3. Excellent deal when they're $1 during happy hour, though.
-daily special had a trio of sea urchin. it was AWESOME. highly recommend if available again.
-there was some skinny deep fried stick thing...looks cool. tastes meh. kinda like sweet spring roll meets taiwanes sweet sausage taste. not unpleasant but def not ordering again.
-i think we ordered three specialty rolls. they were all...meh. Not too far from what you get at AYCE joints.

Overall, highly recommend for happy hour. Stick to the sushi/cold dishes.

First off, we were drawn to this restaurant because of the 5 stars review.  After having spent $100 between the two of us with mostly Sashimi dishes I'm baffle at the 5 stars and $$ rating.  It's good but definitely not 5 stars.

To be fair we did not order any sushi rolls so perhaps rolls taste better and more cost less.

3 - 3.5 stars. The tea cup came dirty with lipstick on it... I would say 4 stars is kinda a stretch...
Considering the fact that it is in Vegas and off Strip, this place is actually a good deal. About $50 per person after tax n tip - not THAT cheap but if you want to get similar quality Japanese food on the Strip it's probably going to be doubling the price. I don't know if I can conclude this is the best sushi place in town though...
Personal favorites were salmon, and oyster with uni & fish roe. But I expected the uni to be more fresh.

I've had a fair amount of sushi and this is by far my favorite place to get it! Not only is the food exceptional, the staff is amazing! The fact there is a huge party being extremely loud and having a Jolly O' Time makes the experience even more entertaining!  I highly recommend their signature dishes, they're both different and fun! It's an exciting place with amazing food! I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in town!

What in the world! One of the best sushi experiences I have ever had. Why? Of course amazing quality but also a server who worked wonders with us.

First of all, we wanted to sample a variety of fish so we ordered like 5 types of sashimi. I usually steer clear from the pre-selected plates since I want to have control. However, our server Sheila said there was a large plate for much cheaper and basically she would get us what we wanted. Vegas baby!

So, we got some salmon, scallop, albacore, yellowtail and regular tuna. All outstanding. FYI if you have never had sashimi scallop, it's a must try. If it sucks then it's not fresh enough. This one was pretty good. These are large pieces too, nothing wimpy. Soy sauce was good. Ginger was fresh. Wasabi packed a lot of heat.

Then we got a handful of rolls--spicy soft shell crab, spicy tuna, twin dragon ... and did we get the firecracker too? Anyway, again all excellent.

A bottle of sake later, we decided to hit the uni. My friend and I have had limited and bad experiences with uni, either bad quality or tried so long ago just bad memories. Our server convinced us their quality was outstanding so we got some Catalina ones and she had them throw in some Hokkaido ones as well since we had trouble making up our minds. Wow! Ridiculously good--buttery, silky, no fishy or slimy nastiness.

As if that wasn't enough, we kept talking about coming back during this trip and she said we would have to try the wagyu if we do. We ask if they just have it for dinner? Nope, lunch too. Since we could die before the next time out, we decide to go ahead and get it now. Vegas baby! And as if we were not winning enough, $25 for 2 oz of rare Kagoshima prefecture wagyu. Wuuuut? I mean this is a steal!!! Makes up for the money I lost gambling. In most restaurants you are talking about $25-35 per ounce of this delicacy. Needless to say, it was outstanding. It was served with some sauces and salt, etc on the side.

I tell ya. We probably ate $400 worth but it was way below that. The service was awesome, friendly and the ambience was nice for a little strip mall joint. We are definitely going back on the next trip out. My friend's high roller friend says it's the best in Vegas. If you are in the mood for sushi, you cannot miss this place.

Yaaaaas Brian and Joanna for telling us to head here. I can't believe the food we had at lunch for a total of $20. $5 rolls were huge and flavorful and oh-so-fresh. It's a little bit of a driver, but definitely worth it. This was a perfect pre-flight meal and such an amazing value.
Gave this place another try almost a year later and it's actually really good. The UNI flight is still bomb. Fish was fresher than last time and I'll definitely be back. Peace out!

Should probably update my review, considering the last one I wrote stated they no longer have Happy Hour, which brings me to the new developments at the restaurant: 
1. They have Happy Hour again, and 
2. They take reservations by call. 
Totally helpful since we probably would've waited an hour to get seated had my fiance not called ahead to make a reservation. Geez... There was at least 3 tables put together for a huge group! 
The food is still fresh and amazing. Like I can still order my favorite Golden Ocean Trout. It's great surprise to go back every couple months and realize that they switched the menu up too, which are mostly items on the Happy Hour menu. 
Gotta send good vibes to the staff for providing great customer service no matter the time of day. Plus, I like seeing the regular friendly faces.

Food: Quality of the food is great, for a japanese restaurant the sushi's/ Sashimi's that we tried were really tasty and fresh we had the Golden Ocean Trout and the Tuna Sashimi and they were definitely GREAT!!!

Ambiance: Homely atmosphere with great service from the staff. Great with kids.

Overall: Definitely try this place if your going for Sashimis and Sushi although they are not EAT ALL YOU CAN, the a la Carte food  is definitely worth the money.

Omg...fresh is not even the best way to describe the fish here! It is incredible. We found this because of Yelp! TY yelpers!!  We tried spicy  tuna roll , firecracker roll, salmon avocado with salmon & tuna tadas. We're planning our return already!

Fantastic experience! This was my first visit to Soho and I could not have enjoyed it more. They have a great selection of rolls and everything is incredibly fresh. The edamame comes with a really tasty dipping sauce which is a nice change and their specialty sashimi was all to die for. The chef and owner of Soho even came out and brought us a plate of amazing seared tuna on the house. Needless to say I'll definitely be going back soon!!

Yesterday was our 7th time we've dined here in about 3 years. The experience was like, it was just another sushi place. The temperature on the sashimi, oysters and the sushi rolls was not perfect. Also the taste was missing that extra ooomph flavor on the hamachi kama, soft crab and the grilled squid (not seasoned well). Not sure it could be that we didn't see the owner there yesterday or maybe just an off day. They were not even that full and the food took long. This was our go to and one of the best in the valley, but now I'm not so sure...

So happy to be sharing this. So happy to have found Soho. 

You could grill your own Shishito peppers, but you'll need Yuzu sauce as good or better than the house sauce. So order it here. 

Ocean trout sashimi - think Salmon and enjoy. 

Spicy soft shell crab roll - a bite of a twist to the typical favorite of mine. 

Sashimi & Shimaji with uni, a chef special round up our meal. 

For dessert, a Mochi trio of sesame green tea strawberry. Simple finish. 

Presentation, taste, texture, creative yet all worked. 

Service amazing. Kudos to John Lee.

First time here it was highly recommended by some friends , and it defiantly lived up to our expectations . Julie was our server and she just the sweetest waitress , her knowledge of the menu and all the items she recommended were terrific . It made our experience for sure ! The food itself was to die for we had a variety of items from apps to sushi rolls , and sashimi looks like we found our new sushi spot thank you soho !

Love this place and already been in twice in less then a month, the last being NYE.  Fish is fresher than almost all other local sushi joints, while prices are very reasonable.  They have a full desert menu, of which I've had the profiteroles that are amazing.  Doesn't hurt that the owner is always there making sure every thing is perfect and it is right around the corner from my place!!

Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Trout with pop rocks, Cajun albacore roll, salmon and avocado crime, yellowtail tostada bite, green tea creme brûlée.  All unreal. Service was friendly, food came fast. Great experience.

Great food, atmosphere and service! Chef Chien offers a great deal of passion in the food he serves here. 

We decided to try this place after so many great reviews and recommendations. 

They have one of the best happy hours I have knowledge of, like their amazing $1 sashimi tostadas!  These are not skimpy even if it is their HH portion.  I seriously can't believe they are only a $1.

We have tried (over several visits) the Soho Maki, Tostadas, Beef Tataki, Albacore Sashimi, Firecracker Roll, Ika Geso, Cod Lettuce Wraps, their bento box Soho Moco and, all were pretty good .

Pricing is very reasonable and the service is exceptional.  Also something memorable is their comfy seating.  This place definitely satisfies my cravings for both palate and pocket!

I finally decided to make a Yelp account so I figured that I would take the time to give 5 stars to one of my favorite spots in town. SoHo has some of the freshest fish here in Vegas and some creative starters and apps as well. The price is also half the price of any Strip location, so no complaints there. The staff is absolutely fantastic as well. My fiancé and I go at least once a month and they remember us each time and they constantly go above and beyond with service. Overall, if you want fresh sushi, friendly staff, and a good atmosphere, this is the place to go.

This place is incredible.  While sushi joints in this town are a dime a dozen, Soho stands apart.

The fish is so delicious, and the atmosphere is pretty neat.  It's not a large establishment, but they fill the space the best they can.  It's busy pretty much all the time - a plus when you're dealing with places that serve raw fish - but this can mean waiting a while during peak hours.  Be prepared, but just remember it's worth it.

For the quality you get, it's reasonably priced, as well.

We visited because of the Yelp list of top 100 eateries. We were not disappointed. Probably the most memorable moments were a Japenese Belgium beer, Kagua and the raw fish teased with a topping of pop rocks. Would not have thought it would have worked, but the sublte sparkle and pop actually added to the overall texture of the fish...go figure. Highly recommend

Alright, so I've finally gotten around to writing this review and.... this place DESERVES 5 FREAKING STARS!

Soho is opened by Chef John who was one of the executive chefs at Social House at Crystals.

I cannot stress enough how good the food is here. Especially the sashimi. I know it takes years to be able to master cutting sashimi. It's not as simple as just slicing a cut of fish. And Chef John is amazing. Plus he selects only premium quality fish.

First time we came here was just by chance. It was about 4pm and we were hungry. I had heard about Soho through some co-workers and so we decided to check it out. They were serving happy hour during that time and so we ordered some tostadas and a few rolls. We had noticed how good the tuna had been. Towards the end of that meal Chef John came out and was introducing himself to all of his customers. He came by and spoke with us for a little and then told us he was going to send over the house special Yellowtail Ponzu Soy.. pffft. BOMB. SO DAMN GOOD. It was melt in your mouth sashimi.

The service is not bad. It's not fine dining so don't expect them to be hoovering over you. Although they are still pretty attentive. The storefront is very misleading as it looks very generic and plain. But Chef John really puts effort into his restaurant. During one visit we came for lunch we got a small little sushi keychains when we got the check. 

YOU NEED TO TRY THIS PLACE. If you can appreciate great sushi and sashimi then this place is for you. The sashimi melts in your mouth and the uni is the BEST uni I've ever, EVER had.

**side note: being from an island and having been to Japan. The quality of fish/sushi here is definitely not taken lightly.

My girlfriend and I have been here for dinner with a group of friends, and we thoroughly enjoyed it.  We knew there was a $8.50 lunch special, so we finally made it back last Thursday for lunch.  I ordered the sashimi lunch, which came with 8 big pieces of fresh sashimi, a bowl of rice, a bowl of miso soup, a spring mix salad, and some cucumber salad.  We also ordered the terriyaki chicken lunch which was very well seasoned.

Selection of sushi is pretty short. The rolls they do have that I got to try are good though, and the guys behind the counter are cool to talk to.

The California roll was sweet, which while good was not my style.

So they have a platform change.  They no longer do lunches or happy hour. They are now open Monday- Saturday 5-? Pm.  Sorry I can't remember the exact closing time.  The menu is a bit different and the portions are a little smaller but the whole quality and commitment to excellence is still there.  The owner is splitting his time between the full service and their newer fast food restaurant platform.  But still people waiting to get in at 5pm so all good!! We had several things twice! We loved their scallop hand rolls. So much that we had two orders (each!) and 4 orders of Uni.  Delicious!!!! We also had the VERY BEST Salmon collar I think we have ever had I any restaurant.  It was cooked perfectly and so light. So well worth a try!! Yummy

This place is amazing. Came here 2 days in row, once for dinner and the following day for lunch. The prices are very fair for dinner and even better during lunch. I'm already planning on coming back for their happy hour. Everything ordered was so delicious. The Cajun albacore melts in your mouth and has so much flavor. Definitely one of my favorite things on the menu. This is definitely my husbands and I new sushi place. Will not be going anywhere else but SoHo sushi!

Would like to recognize Sushi Chef TAI @ SOHO Las Vegas for his creativity in brilliantly combining untraditional ingreedients tasts textures and his beutiful presentations. I have had the pleasure to enjoy sushi made by the best sushi chef's in the world including but not limited to, Nozawa, Nobu Matsuhisa, Masa Takayama, and Chef TAi's sushi is at this elevated world class level.

Needless to say try the Omakase with Chef TAI, trust him, he will pleasantly surprise you with a world class sushi experience.

I really hate that this restaurant puts "walk ins welcome" on its home page. Due to the uncertain work schedules of my friends, we weren't able to make a reservation anywhere on a Friday night in time for a celebration. However, stumbling on Soho's page with its boastful "walk ins welcome," we decided to swing by there instead of gamble our chances at one of the busier AYCE spots up the street. Arriving at Soho though, which was pretty quiet with a few folks sitting waiting, we were quickly informed it would be a 45 min-1 hour wait... Um, where exactly are walk ins welcome then? Do you even understand what that means? The kicker was that they were holding three huge tables for reservations that hadn't yet come through. 

Looking through reviews now, obviously I should've realized this claim was baseless - many state that you should make reservations ahead of time. No idea why they think "walk ins welcome" is something that accurately describes their restaurant! The rub of it all is that we did end up at an very popular AYCE place up the street since it had only a 30 min wait. Hopefully Yelp will remove the "walk ins welcome" on this restaurant's page.

It's so damn good. I'm pretty picky about where I eat sushi since I have allergies to seafood, but am completely addicted to veggie sushi. Charles was our server and he was incredible. The entire staff (even in the kitchen) was super friendly and didn't hesitate to offer up suggestive  as well as special off the menu options. The owner (chef) came out and spoke with us and offered amazing food!! Definitely a great spot/vibe will be back again

Great sushi in Vegas, especially when first opened owner was super nice and the fish is fresh. It caught on quick...so the place is always busy. Happy hour menu is great. They have amazing homemade sake, must try.

Yelp did me right with this place!  Great sushi, really chill atmosphere, fun service and it all came at a reasonable price, exactly the type of place I'd love to have in my neighborhood.  

All the fish we had was very fresh and a long list of traditional selections were supplemented with a nice list of seasonal seafood specials.

We brought our baby and the staff was very accommodative to making our daughter happy.  Next time I get a rental car on a visit to Vegas, this is my spot for off the strip dining.

Me and my boyfriend go into soho very often (more often than we should lol) because the fish is just so fresh. We always sit at the sushi bar and the staff is always on point and so friendly and greet us by first name. I've eaten a lot of sushi but soho knocks it out of the park every time. Their happy hour is phenomenal. Almost everything good on the menu is only $5 and happy hour is almost all day!!! We go in to see chef Aaron. Best sushi chef in town!!! He makes our experience so special for us every time like it's the first time we've been there. If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out.

What can I say about soho. It's the best this city has to offer and perhaps the best sushi I've ever had. 

Service is amazing. Happy hour menu is extensive, delicious, and cheap. The sushi rolls are flavorful. The nigiri is always perfect. They only use high quality ingredients and you can tell because the flavors are out of this world. 

I use to only eat all you can eat but I realized quantity doesn't satisfy me after having soho. I rarely go to all you can eat and I try to turn all my friends to this place. It's not difficult, once you go you won't go anywhere else.

Love this place! Good quality, good price and good service.

Happy hour prices, portion and quality were amazing. We had the:
- Hydro Bibb Black Cod (nice big chunk of cod), 
- shrimp tempura, 
- spicy tuna roll (good quality, not masked by a lot of hot sauce), 
- fire cracker roll (inside was kind of mushy and flavors weren't distinct), 
cajun albacore sashimi (awesome fish quality), 
- baked mussels (LOVED the flavor. LOVED, loved, LOVED the sauce; mussels had a good texture) and 
- jalapeno poppers (way bigger than I expected). 

We also got the matcha tiramisu. It was DELICIOUS!! LOTS OF FLAVOR. (Unfortunately they were out of the green tea creme brulee.) The iced green tea was a little watered down (tasted like sugar cane water, couldn't really taste the tea).

I love that the happy hour portions are full sized/order. The quality is good and fresh. They don't use a ton of rice either (huge 'plus' in my book). The food came out fast and hot.

Service was reeeeally good. Our server was very friendly, knowledgeable and tentative. I appreciate that she didn't treat us different or worse because we mainly ordered from the happy hour menu.

We will definitely be back and bring friends and family!!!

My wife and I were in town from NYC for a couple of days and we wanted to get off the strip and away from the crowds.  We are big sushi lovers, and have quite a few favorite places back home.  After looking at Yelp, we chose SOHO. 

Wow...what an incredible choice.  It's a small place...intimate...without a lot of the glitz of LV.  That's ok...we've gotten our fill of that on this trip.   What we wanted was some quiet so we could re-connect and just enjoy some really good sushi

We got all of that and more.  From the time we walked in, the staff was incredibly attentive and accommodating.  Our server Angelica made some great recommendations...the yellowtail, especially, being one of the freshest and most succulent sashimi dishes we've ever eaten.  

We made three choices, and after we were done, we ordered one additional roll. I wasn't even that hungry, but the food was so good I felt obligated!   When we were done with that our server brought another plate over. My wife said "oh, we didn't order that," and she said "this is from the chef."

It was ocean trout, which we'd never had before.  It was a deep red, like salmon, with a meatier taste.  Outstanding!  Later, John came to out table.  He's the chef and owner, and he explained that he thought we'd enjoy the ocean trout because he'd seen the other items we'd chosen.  Very thoughtful, and always a treat to meet the owner and the person who prepared our meal.

I think that's the true secret to SOHO...pride and passion.  Not only was John personally invested in us, but all of his employees clearly took steps to ensure we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.  John and his entire team went "the extra mile" to please us, and they succeeded with flying colors.  

We would highly recommend SOHO. It's a little out of the way, but that's the charm, and it is WELL WORTH the journey.  Oh, and a bonus?  It's probably about 30% less than you'd pay on the strip for less flavor and quality.  Sushi lover?  Don't miss this place!!

I've now come here 4 times and I must say it continues to get better and better each time. John, the owner, has been nothing but great each time I come and his staff are nothing short of fantastic. The food is icing on the cake and I've recommended this place to everyone I know. Thank you, John, for making my dining experiences so amazing each time and catering to my salmon sashimi fetish :-)

Best Sushi in Las Vegas! I've eaten there 2 out of my last 3 trips. Well worth any drive/uber/lift to get to this place! It can get busy around dinner time; I would recommend calling a head to make reservations or walk-in for a late lunch.

Total professionalism and quality by all standards.  Food highest quality, service exceptional.  This place has something special going on.  My wife and I were both very pleased with our experience.  To say we will be back often is an understatement.
This place is amazing. The service was awesome, the food was incredible, and we'll definitely be going back next time we're in town!

Yum!  Read Yelp reviews and headed there.  Wish we'd called & made a reservation it would have saved us a 1/2 hr wait but it was so worth it!  We ordered off the Happy Hour menu the Cajun albacore sashimi, salmon avocado creme, shrimp tempura roll, salmon tostadas & baked green mussels (a bit chewy won't order them again).  A couple of little carafes of 
their fruity guava sake.  And it was excellent!  We topped it off with their  tiramisu for dessert!  Great food and top service!  Will go back!

Not a bad place but much overprice considering quality of food and service... At least not qualified for more than 3 stars... / During this holiday season, I found Oyshi Sushi nearby is much better for my taste.

Very disappointed. Walked in the restaurant And i got excited coz they were packed. Meaning, food must be good. Waited for a host or server to give us a table or the least acknowledge our presence. Waited, waited, waited. Almost 10 minutes. Server looked at us so we thought, finally they noticed.  But we were wrong. Server just walked away. Poor customer service!!!!! So we just stepped out and find another Japanese Restaurant in Rainbow with absolute great service. Never will come here again. Service matters!

I wanted to give this 4 stars because I wish they had more rolls, but chances are Executive Chef and Owner John would create it, if I had asked. John was previously the Executive chef at Social House at Crystals Mall at the City Center. I normally do rolls and not sashimi but he brought out complimentary sashimi dishes that were amazing.  
The Fish is so fresh, thing I typically never eat were actually pretty good.  Happy hr from 4-6 is a must do we ordered about 7 items off of the menu that were filling.  The house White Peach Sake was delicious, Iced green tea was bomb Oh the deserts Green Tea creme brûlée and chocolate mouse great stuff.  
Soho Maki
Bacon Wrapped Kurubota Sausages
Stuffed Mushrooms - I don't even like mushrooms and they were delicious
Hydro Bib Black Cod
Shrimp Tempura Roll
Spicy Tuna Roll- My least favorite but still appetizing even for me who doesn't like    spicy tuna
Albacore Sashimi
Some Complimentary Fish with pop rocks
I think sashimi trout - second least fav but still good

The sauces are paired really well with each dish. Definitely a come back to place.

Ordered delivery.. got miso soup and the Firecracker and Crispy tuna rolls. The service was great over the phone and interaction with driver. Firecracker roll seemed a little small but otherwise it was great !

The best sushi I've had in my entire life. Their spicy soft shell crab is the best roll they have there. It deserves every star possible. I recommend this restaurant. They also have a killer sashimi salad which is a must-have. Oh my god I almost forgot their green tea tiramisu. Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!! The best tiramisu ever! You gotta try it, it has a soft cream on top with green tea flavoring and candy tiramisu. The service was also awesome. The waiters and waitreses were so kind. They always checked to see how we were doing. Every dish was introduced before it was served.

Molecular gastronomy + sashimi.  This was a fun and pleasant surprise.  We got the golden ocean trout, it's freeze dried miso, chives, lemon ponzu, and pop rocks!  They wanted us to try the yellow tail sashimi.  It had tempura jalapeno slices on top, micro greens, and some awesome sauce.  Then we go the SOHO tatas, white fish, salmon, and shrimp.  Garlic edamame, calamari with three sauces, short rib in a wasabi cream sauce and salad in this spicy dressing.  This was like home cooked comfort food.  Everything is presented beautifully, every bite melts in your mouth.  We ordered the green tea creme brulee but they brought out the matcha tiramisu, and when they realized it they brought out the creme brulee. lol  We liked the creme brulee more because we don't care for the soggy texture but the flavor was good.  

I came back another time with a friend after spending all day outside for a festival.  It was hot and we wanted cold food, so we came for iced green tea, sashimi, and a spicy tuna roll.  It was a nice refreshing post event meal before napping and getting ready for the night. I'm so glad this place is here.

Any place with this many reviews and 5 stars on yelp must be met with a certain level of skepticism. What with all the fake reviews and the like that go on, but damn was my skepticism completely unwarranted. 

Myself and my date got there at 7:30 on a Thursday night with a 15 minute wait. Not bad at all, the hostess was very polite and took my name down. We had a beer next door and had a table 12 minutes later. Then this place began to shine. 

I ordered the same thing I ordered at every new sushi place I try. The common every day sushi items that are either sub bar, usual or extraordinary. Salmon and Salmon roe nigiri and a spicy tuna roll. This place blew my mind. The Salmon tasted like an Alaskan stream ran through the restaurant. The roe had the perfect consistency. An 'al dente' texture to its bite and a pleasant fresh saltiness. The spicy tuna was perfect. 

I was almost about to start popping bottles and shaking hands and then something bad happened. My soft shell crab roll didn't appear for 10 minutes, then 15 and then 20. This was okay as I was having a nice conversation with my date and she was enjoying her monstrous chicken salad and just as I looked up to complain the very nice waiter supplied us with some complimentary hot house sake for the wait, and moments later a large order of spicy yellow-tail sashimi (6 pieces). 

This was outrageous good service. I hadn't even complained yet, but they knew. "From the chef" he said. And walked away politely, then my roll came out. 

Everything was perfect. They were busy, I can understand why the roll took a minute. I was walked out the door like I was a senator with a stripper on my arm. 

Definately coming back. 5 stars more than earned Soho! Good job.

Intro: My boyfriend and I love having a favorite sushi restaurant. After moving close-ish to the Vegas area, we weren't too impressed with what the strip had to offer because it all seemed overpriced and overhyped. We came here on a whim because we were hungry and this popped up on Yelp.

Pros:
-This place is absolutely amazing!!! The selection is completely unique!! What made our first visit to the restaurant a very memorable one was when the chef came out to say hi and recommend the ocean fish dish. It had an indescribable sauce (I think yuzu was in it?) and was topped with poprocks and I know that sounds strange but oh my god was it delicious!! Who would've thought? But I don't think we would've ventured beyond the happy hour menu if he hadn't suggested it.
-The happy hour is a REALLY good deal but only offers so much. Don't be afraid like we were to try other things on the menu!!
-There seems to be an army of people preparing sushi every time we go, which I feel reflects on how much priority they put on the creation of the dishes.
-Lychee or peach sake is so good! Again, we got it off the happy hour menu but I couldn't finish it by myself, they give you a decent amount. The glassware it comes in is utterly impressive too. I will have to take a picture and post it in the future....Looks like a bowl of ice water with a tulip bulb shaped vessel that sits in it. Guaranteed to make you feel fancy.
-The atmosphere is non-intimidating and feels cozy yet clean and modern. 

Cons:
-Getting overstuffed on so much awesome!!!
-It's not dirt cheap, be ready to shell out $25-$30 per person if you're really hungry. Maybe $20 per person if you're moderately hungry.

Conclusion:
This is a one-of-a-kind sushi establishment and the kind of restaurant everyone needs to try at least once. It feels like you're that person on food network trying that really amazing artfully compiled dish with the "MMMmmm" face.

SoHo made it to the top of my list of sushi places in Vegas.  The sashimi is fresh, perfectly paired with seasonings & sauces that only compliment the sashimi.  The presentation is colorful and clean.  The quality of fish was at best.

Another great off strip sushi place. Has incredible yelp reviews. The food is very good - and the prices are reasonable. It does not compare to NOBU and a couple of other high end sushi places - but it's a great meal for a great price. 
It's in a strip mall and seems to be busy all the time.

Officially my favorite sushi spot in town. Good service and prices are ok too. Portions are good size. I love the Cajun albacore roll. They have a good selection of spicy rolls which are my fave. They make is black cod appetizer served in a lettuce cup that is amazing!!! It's only 2 servings but worth every penny!

I've now been here 3 times and it's time for a review. When I think of sushi and don't want AYCE this restaurant does come to mind. I've been twice for happy hour. Both happy hour experiences were good in terms of service, no wait, and better price. Some happy hour items I could do without such as the sausage (too much sausage). Sounds funny but I can only take so much sausage and these are full kurobuta sausages. Ika geso is another one I could do without. 

For the good-the happy hour rolls, poke tostada, and the black cod lettuce wrap. 

Due to the good experiences the first 2 times we came back on a Friday night. It was packed and there was a long wait. They said 20 minutes but it ended up being about 35 minutes. The sashimi mixed plate was ordered and very good. I did not care for the scallop and I am usually a big scallop fan. It tasted fishy. The hamachi was very good.We got a soft shelled crab salad and I thought it was bland. This time they were busy and forgot my husband's beer and water refills. I know they were busy, but... 

I love their green tea tiramisu!

Read the yelp reviews and finally made it!

The place itself is nothing special with disappointing decor but it's all about the food and service so the good news is that both were great! We arrived a few mins after happy hour ended and our server told us the unfortunate news. Luckily the girl next to her saw me take out my yelp app and came right over to ask, is it your first time? We'll extend it for you...:) Woo hoo! We were thrilled because we wanted to try happy hour out first! 

Started with the tuna tostada, amazing! Sweet and fresh and the perfect way to start our meal! Also a very delicate & modern presentation. 

Next came the stuffed mushrooms, not a fan at all. The flavors were ok but the breading was dense and the bites were heavy. I didn't enjoy it.

Next came the Cajun albacore sashimi. My favorite dish of the evening. So fresh and delicate and very mild in flavor. Like butter...

Next the cod, my second favorite item. It was cooked perfectly, sweet & tender. 

Next the firecracker roll. Great combinations of flavors with sweet onions on top and over all a very well balanced roll. Crunchy, creamy, sweet & spicy.

Next the Ika Geso, octopus! It was tossed an a very addicting curry powder! 

And lastly a spicy tuna roll, filled with tuna! And a shrimp tempura roll. Both were great!

All this delicious food was only $40 for happy hour! An incredible value and over all a very good time! 

Hope someone comes in with some decorating skills or I'll do it on trade :)

Can't wait to go back & try the regular menu!

Wow this place deserves the five stars! Best sushi I've ever had in Vegas and the best part is its a great price for high quality food. I will definitely come eat here everytime I come to Vegas! Oh and did I mention our server Charles is super awesome! He took care of everything and brought out all the best dishes. We didn't even need to worry. Love u Soho Sushi!
My new favorite spot. The chef made so many special dishes for me.  I just love this place.  If you give the chef the freedom to create  you can have similar sushi as Masa

Mediocre food,  service "meh" , we didn't understand why this restaurant is so popular and busy.  Would give it a second chance because we had a party of 10 the first time we tried it.  Not really impressed at all and definitely disappointed after the hype.
You want a great fresh sushi or sashimi, this place is it. Come in before 7pm and you get a great happy hours pricing. The miso fish was great. The Hokaido uni was amazing.
With out a doubt the best sushi place I have ever eaten at. Local and it's off the strip. Outstanding food.

Absolutely amazing sushi!!! I've been eating sushi for aboit 10 years, this place has the tastyest Baked Mussles, love the ginger which is fairly mild but with a perfect aftertaste that does not overpower and of course the ocean trout sashimi is absolutely to die for, best sashimi I've ever had!!!

So we were going to eat sushi at a nearby place, but due to the wait time we looked on yelp for something else with s decent rating. SO glad we did. In comes Soho - awesome $5 happy hour till 7 ( including Saturday). There was a bit of a wait - but well worth it. Try the Fuji roll and the salmon carpaccio. Outstanding quality, attentive service without being intrusive, and overall great dining experience at a very reasonable price. Not fancy yet FAR from a hole in the wall. Well worth stopping in.

#1 sign that this place would not disappoint? We walk in at around 1:30pm and this place is PACKED. I was pleasantly surprised by this find on Yelp. This place is so awesome, we had to come twice on our short Vegas NYE trip. This will forever be my first stop whenever in Vegas!

This beats any sushi restaurant or buffet on the Vegas strip, so if you've stumbled across this restaurant like me, consider yourself lucky. The quality of sashimi is amazing! Everything melts in your mouth, and the prices are really decent. They offer amazing bento lunch specials, too. I love my sashimi so I got the sashimi bento both times I was here. They also have appetizers called "Tadas" which are little sashimi appetizers on top of crispy gyoza wrappers. Definitely worth a try! Or like me, order one (or a few) of everything.

Lastly, Green Tea tiramisu is not to be missed...that is if you still have room in your stomach. Can't wait to come back next time.
Awesome sushi. Love the nutterpillar roll, and cucumber salad. Higher quality than most sushi restaurants I have tried. Yellowtail ponzu is also great!

Finding hidden gems like SoHo Japanese Restaurant is why I love yelp!  I was scanning through the typical Vegas tourist spots for dinner when I came across SoHo.  Seeing a restaurant with over 350 reviews and a perfect 5 star score is a rarity so I knew I had to investigate further.  The restaurant is located about 5 miles off the Las Vegas strip, I believe the cab ride cost around $17 coming from Mandalay Bay.  It was well worth the drive! 

When we arrived it happened to be happy hour and SoHo has some GREAT Happy Hour Specials.  Everything is absolutely fantastic and fantastically priced!!

Among some of the standouts and must orders if you visit: 

Black Cod Happy Hour Special is a must try, you might even order 2 
Ahi Poki Tostada Happy Hour Special: you will definitely order 2
Yellow Fin with jalapeño - Fantastically delicious  
Golden Trout with Pop rocks (yep, pop rocks!)
Angus Beef Tataki - tastes as good as it looks
Soft Shell Crab Special - breaded and fried, served with three amazing dipping sauces.  If it's available (seasonal) get it!  
Bone in Short Rib - fell right off the bone.  Moist, tender and totally delicious.

Green Tea Crème Brûlée to finish off the meal - no words left to describe this except a heavenly finish to an outstanding meal.  

So now that I've listed almost the entire menu as "must try" I hope you understand the level of enthusiasm I have for this restaurant and it's food.  To add to the experience Chef John, owner and executive chef, came by to visit our table.  It was instantly apparent his love for what he does and his appreciation for good food.  His message to us was he wanted to take the Vegas dining experience off the strip and bring it to where the locals can enjoy.  I hope he plans to expand to Washington, DC!!!

If you like to discover great "hole in the wall" restaurants this is definitely the place you have to eat at. What to expect is fresh fish, quality preparation and great customer service! If you have ever ate on the strip at the famous Social House then that is the type of service and quality food you will get (maybe even better!)-- and at HALF THE PRICE!! Support Las Vegas small businesses and eat here!! 

My favorites are: 
Miso Cod on top of butter lettuce cups
Salmon Wasabi Creme Sashimi
ALL of the tostadas--specifically the POKE
Yellowtail Sashimi with Jalapenos
Everything SASHIMI....you know its fresh when you try the UNI =)

Too much too mention!!

Lunch Specials are $8.50 can't go wrong with that!! 

LOVE this place and the STAFF!! =)

Came in based on all the positive reviews and we weren't disappointed.  Great food, well priced and excellent customer service from the entire staff. We ate only sushi and all of the fish was fresh with great flavor. I joked about driving back to Vegas just for lunch here.

Great place!  I looked up Sushi on yelp and this had 5 stars so I had to try it. I'm very glad I did!  Very good fresh food and fantastic service!  Do yourself a favor and skip the strip for a great meal.
Best sushi on the southwest side of town. Tostadas are AMAZING. Nice, friendly staff and clean restaurant. Highly recommend.

This place is amazing! Best happy hour in town. I celebrate every holiday here! It's so good I could come every day! If you like salmon the salmon avocado creme is amazing! 5 pieces for 5 bucks on happy hour. Staff is great too. Make a reservation even if it's just for 2. They are that busy because they are that good! They have sliders and fries for those that aren't into sushi so it's really good for everyone!

Parking (3/5):
I went to Soho for a Yelp - UYE event. Its located on Jones; couple blocks south of  215. Location is easy to find, but parking might be an issue on busy night. 

Atmosphere (4/5):
Average noise levels, very comparable to other sushi or AYCE restaurants. Good for a large gathering, etc.

Service (3/5):
This place was very accommodating with 15-20 people. All though it could be because they knew that we were with Yelp. It seemed like that their staff was not the most attentive or trained. One of the waitress actually managed to pour left over sauce over  one the my friend's dress. Which was an accident, but that just shows that they need to improve their Service.

Food (3/5):
Food was way better than their service. Restaurant actually made a tasting menu for everyone at the table. Here is what we had.

Seared Tuna with Tempura Jalapenos: It will be spicy. Seared Tuna was fresh, but I am not sure if Jalapenos go well with it. Also, there was lot of ponzu sauce.

Pot-stickers Meh... I would say avoid it, you do not go to restaurant like this for their pot-stickers. They didn't seem fresh and it seemed like they were adding them to our tasting menus cause they had bunch sitting around in the freezer.

Seared Yellow-tail: The fish was fresh and it was seared to perfect amount. Unlike the Tuna, they didn't over do it with sauce. Presentation was good to.

Oysters: They were not good. I do not like oysters drenched with sauce. Specially when its  sweet and sour. Oysters are enjoyed with light lemon juice. That's it. 

Short-Rib: Pièce de résistance of the meal. You will see lot of reviews mentioning this and that is with the best reason. It's the main highlight of this restaurant and they know it (~$20 for a rib). The meat falls of the bone and it practically dissolves in your mouth. The taste is exquisite. Some short ribs did have a lot of fat on it, but its up to personal preference. Some people prefer the flavors that fat adds to a meal. I personally don't enjoy it because it will add another mile of running to my daily cardio. 

Over all this restaurant is not bad for the location it's in, but if you have a choice of going to other place then I would highly recommend picking something else. The short-rib is the main attraction, but its not fully worth the price when you get a short-rib full of fat and less meat. Also, service needs a bit of a work.

Average: 3.5/5 - Being a man of science I round it down to (3/5), so other or I strive for more perfection. :D

Wow, really good. Came late for happy hour but they hooked us up anyway. The happy hour menu is amazing and cheap, wonder how they make any money. Soho tostada, fire cracker roll, baked mussels along with everything else was really good. Waitress was super friendly and even bought the first round of drinks. Highly recommend

I've given a lot of restaurants 5 stars, but if I could give Soho more, I would a thousand times over. It's not every day that I walk out of a restaurant touched by the service. I am definitely coming back here (for happy hour.....because I am a poor poor grad student). Their fish is fresh; and the price is amazing.

I went with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday early. We went around 4:30PM for happy hour, and I was surprised that there was a pretty big crowd already. It seems that you can make reservations during happy hour, so I will definitely place a reservation next time. They asked us if it'd be okay to seat us at the sushi bar, and we said okay. AND THAT WAS THE BEST DECISION EVER. Thank you Soho for my memorable birthday dinner!

I wish I got the chef's name, but my bad. He handed us our wasabi/ginger right after we sat down. We also ordered directly with him; for the drinks, we ordered with the waitress. Since every dish on the happy hour menu was 5 bucks, we kind of went crazy with ordering. I don't usually like talking to the chefs because I'm awkward, but he stroke up a convo with us, and I'm glad I responded. He found out it was our first time there/we were there celebrating for my birthday.

Halfway through our meal, he gave us a yuzu yellowtail dish on the house just because it was our first time there. It was such a nice gesture. When we asked for the check, it took them longer than usual because they were prepping a complimentary dessert for my birthday. The whole staff sang to me as they placed the dish in front of me. I think I'm especially touched because even though I was just ordering off the happy hour menu, Soho did not skimp on the customer service. 

Food wise, at least on the happy hour menu, the fusion foods are where it's at. The best things we had definitely were the tostadas. They're kind of like a poke/ceviche mix that you eat with fried wonton chips. It was awesome. My boyfriend also loved all of the sashimi with sauces. (He has a thing for ponzu though) The JPOP alcoholic drink was sooooo good; it was just like drinking a soda, and I like sweet/fruity drinks. The karage was just okay--but for 5 bucks, I'm not complaining.

TL;DR Go for happy hour. Sit at the sushi bar. Leave happy.

i'm on vacation from the bay area (tells u the quality of food i'm used to) place is super friendly and basically some of the freshest sushi around. just ask you lr server what's good. can't go wrong!!!

Had reservations Wed. @7:00 pm. Still had to wait for table !! Yet walk-in are welcome ?
Celebrating a birthday. Very disappointing. Still waiting on food.
This is by far the best I have ever had. The chef came out and was very personable and sent out a dish for us to try. The sushi and the steak dishes were fantastic. We will be back very soon.

Super friendly servers (and owner).  Prices were very reasonable (especially for Vegas standards).  Fish is decent (not the best I have had).  For the two of us.  Our bill came to $160 without tax and tips (about $200 all in).  We came here on a Wednesday night, so the fish wasn't as fresh as I was expecting (since this place was highly recommended).  However, would I come back again.  Absolutely.  It is still a very affordable place.  The table seating are comfortable and spacious.  Not many sushi counter seating though.


Nigiri orders:
Mirugai
Hamachi
Maguro
Tai
Ama Ebi

Rolls:
Spicy Tuna
California hand roll

Plates:
Hamachi Yuzo
Tai with Uni (ponzu)
Uni Duo (Santa Barbara and Catalina)
Kumamoto oysters
Mixed Sashimi 

Hot plates:
Mixed Tempura
Baked Mussels
This review is long overdue. Best happy hour in town. Food is very good. Even though they can get busy, service is still wonderul. Truly a hidden gem!
I don't write reviews often, but I felt these guys deserved one. Excellent and friendly service and the fish is top notch. Very generous servings of fish for their nigiri sushi -a true rarity!
This place rocks!  Best sushi in town.  Great happy hour, lots of food to choose from. Highly recommend.

AMAZING food and fantastic service!! The chef/owner was incredibly friendly and sent over a complimentary white fish that was exquisite  this is definitly my new sushi spot. I used to love social house like no other but I found out the owner was the executive chef there!  Bye bye social house...hello near my home, more affordable, friendlier SOHO

First time eating a sushi burrito and it was  staff was nice and attentive and it looked like a Japanese version of chipotle ! 

I had the twin dragon 5/5 it came with spicy tuna and something crunchy the flavors went really well together 

My mom had the 3amigos 5/5 it had three different types of fish in it so it's good for the fish lovers .

So wonderful we came here two nights in a row on vacation. Escolar carpaccio is awesome , they can accommodate gluten free and have gf soy sauce.  Happy hour from 5-7.  Everything we tried was delicious.

Great Sushi and Service!! Me and a couple of buddies came to vegas last month tried out this place and was amazed. Came back a month later with more people to visit a second time and I wasnt let down! The sushi was served fast considering the place was almost at max capacity. And the owner came out and greeted us. He was very nice. If u come to vegas gotta eat here at least once. Its off the strip so plan wisely. I love sushi!!!

Cajun Albacore was amazing. Always something new. Wish they were in New Jersey!


Always have Ama Ebi, one of my favorites.
Awesome food! Not one dish disappointed! Fish was fresh, flavors on point! Can't wait to return to try more!
The food was amazing. Sashimi with pop rocks especially. I'll be back so much to choose from.

A/C, A/C, A/C, I would love to give this place a 5 star, because the food is very good. However every time I have gone here it is very Hot. I have asked the staff more than once, if they could turn down the Air Condition and they tell me the A/C in on but the heat is coming from the kitchen and that is why it is so hot. However no matter where I sit in the Restaurant I never feel any breeze from any A/C vent. They also have 4 or 5 fans going so I know other people must have complained about the heat also. I have a real problem spending a $100.00 on dinner and sweating through it. I would for sure refer this place in the winter months.

Soho is as good as these reviews show. It definitely deserves its very high Yelp rating. Each part of our meal (with BF) last night was fantastic. Total bill was $72+ tip. We had tuna tatas to start. Wow how yummy they were can not be described in words. We also had a bottle is saki that was recommended by the server $12 special silver Tyku.  Then we had the 12 pieces sashimi platter. Each platter is different and ours was spectacular and had 16 pieces of sashimi that was a visual feast, including two types of fish eggs. Then tempura, and two sushi rolls, spicy tuna roll and firecracker roll. This came out with a complimentary 4 piece plate of tuna sashimi with ponzu sauce. We finished with vanilla creme brûlée and mochi (supposed to get 3 but I was served one of each of the 4 flavors!).  The service was spot on and the flow of the meal excellent.  We loved our meal and the entire place.
Nicely remodeled and friendly staff. Clean and service was excellent! Chef came over to check in with us and sent back a complimentary tuna sashimi which was excellent.

Sushi burritos were DELICIOUS!!!  I had the 3 Amigos wrapped in seaweed and I got a side of wasabi just to add a little kick. My boyfriend had the Triple "S" and he devoured it! 
It was our first visit but we will most definitely return to keep trying their other burritos.  service was also helpful and friendly!
Finally! Quality over quantity. SOHO rocks... flavors are amazing and fresh. My new sushi spot for sure! Unmatched in southwest las vegas.
Great food, service, atmosphere and green tea creme brulee! Very reasonably priced too!
Hands down best sushi off the strip. Try the dishes! They are easily as good if not better than Nobu. The rolls are good and fine but this is a fantastic place to veer off and try EVERYTHING.

I'm writing this review as I'm getting the check.i LOVE  this place not just for the quality of the fish ..the PEOPLE that work here ..amazing !!!!! JJ,Tay  vong..are incredible !!! Thanks for the amazing service!!!
Very fresh and delicious. The twin dragon was very good.. but so was the simple spicy tuna. The staff was also very friendly.

This is our second time eating here and we will be back when in town. Food is some of the best sushi we have ever had. Staff is super friendly and helpful. They have great sashimi and yellowtail Yuka soy. I wish they would move closer to where we live.

Great spot for small dishes and rolls. $5 Happy Hour menu. Great rolls, loved the volcano and nutter pillar. Also enjoyed the yellowtail yuzu soy apps and the premium sashimi platter. Definitely a spot I'll come back to.

No date? No friends? No problem!  The food and service is so good that it's worth going, even for just a table for one.

I decided to check out this restaurant because it had such a high rating, and being the skeptic I am, I was looking for stuff to critique.  However, the worst I can say is that their popularity has outgrown their dining space.  Even so, the wait was still less than half an hour for a table, and it was well worth the wait.

I arrived at 5:50 pm on a Saturday night, hoping I might catch a happy hour special, but the dining room was packed, and there was a wait list, so I didn't get a seat until 6:17.

The servers were surprisingly quick considering how busy they were, and they were definitely on top of the drinks and meal orders.  I ordered the Garlic Shishito Peppers appetizer, and it was quite tasty.  It had a spiciness that sneaks up on you, so the first several didn't taste hot at all, but eventually it kicks you in the face if you keep going.  After researching these peppers, I found that one expert claimed 1 in 12 is actually spicy whereas the rest are generally sweet.  I think my experience was about 1 in 5...  Even when I got a spicy one though, I'd still put them below jalapenos in heat, so if you have no problems eating jalapenos, these won't challenge you.  Also, for only $4, it's a must-order for those who enjoy spicy appetizers.

For my second appetizer, I tried the Hydro Bibb Black Cod (a good deal at just $7), which was possibly the most delicious appetizer I've ever had, and I'm not even exaggerating when I say that.  The fish melts in your mouth, and the lettuce and garnish perfectly complemented the flavor that was cooked into the cod.  I just wish I had taken a photo before I devoured this dish.  If you only try one thing, make it this appetizer!

Next, I thoroughly enjoyed the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy Sashimi.  Like all their food, it was noticeably fresh, with perfectly flavored sauce, and as their signature dish is well worth the trip just on its own.  The only downside on this dish is that being sashimi, it is not going to fill you up, so you'll have plenty of room to order more.

I enjoyed an order of the edamame with my main entrees, and it was good, but nothing spectacular: standard boiled and salted soy beans (or squeezy beans as my 7-year-old niece calls them), and it came with a side dish of a sweet sauce although I prefer to eat them as is.

Finally, I ordered their signature roll, the Twin Dragon, which is definitely more of a filling main course (I couldn't finish all of mine, so I took it in a to-go box).  Its description is what you'd expect in a dragon roll: shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, avocado, and crab meat, but it's definitely one of the better dragon rolls I've had, and the double shrimp on top with their delectable sauce made it clear why this is one of their most popular rolls.
Came for happy hour and was disappointed that it is no longer happening. The food and service were great as always-But It cost about 40%more than our usual dinner here:(

Very good service here and the owner stopped by our table to speak to us since it was our first time.  I thought that was a very classy gesture.  The sushi is fresh and good, but I wouldn't say it's the best I've had.  But for the price and considering it's Las Vegas and you don't have as much to choose from like LA or OC, it's a great spot.  I'll surely visit again when I'm in town.

I went to Soho after reading the great Yelp reviews.  The sushi was innovative and fresh.  I can't say Soho will make me go to my favorite sushi bars less but I may come back here on occasion.  We sat at the sushi bar which was awkward because you can't fit your legs under the bar. There is a slanted piece of wood that runs the whole length of the bar that prevents you from sliding your legs under.  The chairs are very big and comfy so that makes up for it.  It was also very cold at the sushi bar so bring a jacket or dress warm if you plan to sit there.  We were both dressed warm but we were freezing.   Our favorite was probably the lettuce wrapped cod-I forgot to take a pic.

Service was exceptional and attentive.  5/5
  
The prices 5/5 very reasonable for great quality and super fresh fish. 

Not a 5 star rating because I am not dying to go back.  Usually when I eat somewhere exceptional I want to rush back within the next day or two.  I will return someday though to try more menu items and I especially want to sample the desserts.

Located next to the Chevron Station, behind Lucky's.

Fresh ingredients in all of their dishes.   Best kept secret is lunch. When not busy they certainly will accommodate all requests to make sushi from the dinner menu. The Brussels sprouts are the best with pine nuts. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere very laid back. Not even in a hurry to get the customers in and out. Enjoy the food and the time that goes along with it.

Went there tonight for dinner after reading all the reviews. . . The food was delicious and very well seasoned.  The reviews were dead on.  The food was fantastic,  the ambiance was nice and the service was what u would get on the strip.  And the prices were decent as well. 

The cool thing. .. the chef came by the table and introduced himself.  How many times have u gone to a restaurant to have the chef come out and say hi?!?! Freaking awesome!  :-)

Definitely coming back!  Loved everything here!!!!

Came here for birthday dinner while in Vegas. The sushi was wonderful: very fresh, great texture and beautifully presented. Service was also far above average: friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating of dietary restrictions. Good selection of sake and Japanese beer. Will definitely be back!

Such a great sushi place and I love that it is so close to home. The salmon sashimi and salmon hand rolls were so fresh!  The service was excellent, especially since the chef even came to our table to introduce himself. He even made us a sample of the Hawaiian Poke which was delicious! My mom even told him that it was the best poke she ever had.  They  had a great  happy  hour menu and I cant wait to go back to try more dishes :)

All of the 5 star reviews for this place are right on!! The food is excellent, very reasonably priced and the staff is usually very attentive.

We are from out of town and make it a point to visit on EVERY trip to Vegas.

Out favorite sushi in town, no contest. When we have time to kill we love sitting at the bar and letting the chef take the reigns. The happy hour menu is great, with generous hours. We bring our out-of-town guests here and have never been let down. My faves are the White Peach Sake, Yellowtail Yuzu (sashimi) and the Sunny Salmon (roll), but I haven't met a SoHo dish I didn't like.

Phenomenal restaurant. High quality sushi similar to what you expect on the strip with the "this is my sushi spot" atmosphere. Service was great made you feel very welcome and the owner/chef john lee came out to see how everything was.....goes a long way.  Will be back. This is my new sushi place.

Best SUSHI EVER!
Staff very knowledgeable about gluten. Very friendly. Happy hour specials, big portions!
Everything so incredibly fresh and presentation awesome!

My top two Japanese restaurants in Las Vegas. The kindest owner, staff, and kitchen I have found anywhere!

Ingredients are always incredibly fresh, and dishes range from traditional to inventive and creative twists on traditional items.

If it's your first time you should try a few tostadas, the black cod in butter lettuce, anything they have with uni if you enjoy it (they pride themselves on their selection and freshness).

Their sashimi combinations always executed expectations. Front their traditional assortments to their contemporary interpretations.

Have fun when you go here, definitely try some of their specials of the day, but not matter what, given their superior quality and friendly and inviting ambiance and service, you're bound to have a great time!

Five stars all around.   Service is fantastic, everyone is friendly and helpful.  Started with the lychee infused sake, so good!  

Sashimi was to die for.  Got the yellowtail and a fresh Alaskan salmon order.  Yellowtail ponzu sauce was amazing, went to my happy place.   Salmon special came with greens and kelp noodles, my favorite.  

Twin Dragon roll - beyond good.  I don't know which part of it I enjoyed the most.  

Finished with the short rib, one of the best I've ever had, anywhere. Fall off the bone, perfectly seasoned.  Side salad was even good, had a nice kick to it. Delicious.  

Best sushi experience I've had in years.  Highly recommend. .

Fantastic sushi and service to match. This is very fresh and generous servings of sushi. Also tried the chicken here and it is all top notch. Happy hour has some wonderful choices of "Tadas" plates of different sushi apps. Five star period!!!

This place was so clean and felt really open when you walk in. Right when I walked in the staff was so warm and welcoming. Great service and our server came by frequently.  Oh and the food was excellent.  Great lunch specials at reasonable prices!!

This is by far the top best sushi place I have been to. Sashimi's selections are of high quality, cut in perfection, extremely fresh, and delicious.  The sushi roll are made with less rice, offering generous amount of the sashimi/meat portion. This place beats Oyishi by Price, service, creativity,  and deliciousness.  My new fave sushi place & first time, yr 2015!!! Also their California roll are made with "real" crab!! Which I thought was non existent. My only regret is that I wish I had stumbled on this place a while ago..

after eating at a bunch of overrated, overpriced places on the strip, soho was our last stop before heading to the airport. BEST DECISION EVER. 

soho's salmon wasabi creme is tied for 1st place in my experience as far as the fattiest, most buttery, melt-in-your-mouth salmon sashimi i've ever had. i am not a wasabi fan at all but the flavors balanced and blended beautifully. and extra points for presentation! my friend's fiance said this dish was so good he almost cried haha. 

next up was the yellowtail yuzu soy, which was also incredible. i'm a bit biased though bc my love for salmon trumps all else, but this was honestly the best yellowtail i've had. flavors were light and citrusy and the flavor of the fish still shined through. 

the twin dragon roll (alaskan king crab, spicy tuna, tempura shrimp, avocado) was huge for the price we paid. local supermarkets where i live have dinky, terrible rolls for $8-12 and this was just a few bucks more and so so much more legit! this was my favorite roll at soho. 

the triple s roll (scallops, shrimp, and something else? i can't remember) was good but not too memorable. the twin dragon was definitely better! 

my black miso cod lettuce wraps came out after we had finished eating all the sushi and at that point i was pretty stuffed. i had an absolutely delectable miso cod dish at izakaya den in denver and was hoping for something similar but this was nothing close. the sweet sauce was too thick and heavy for the delicate fish and the hot fish on lettuce was just weird. 

trout sashimi with pop rocks (compliments of the chef) arrived at the end of our meal. it was perfect because we had been so curious about it when we were looking at the menu... i didn't know if it would just be an insult to the fish or somehow epic. mm it was more the first than the second. i'm glad i didn't pay $$ for it and it was definitely generous of the chef to give us the opportunity to try such a unique dish! (seems like they do that a lot-- so nice.) 

unfortunately, they were out of the supposedly amazing green tea tiramisu. next time!

and i'm serious. i am pretty much sick of the strip but i will come back to vegas just to visit soho! sushi that's hard to beat + super reasonable prices = one of the best of the best! :) :) :)

A friend of mine recommended this place when I came to Vegas. It did not disappoint it was actually the best sushi I've ever had. I went to happy hour and tried many of the items.  everything was fantastic. All of the fish was really fresh. The staff was very nice and checked on me many times through my visit. My only problem with this place was I got so full I didn't get to try more of the items. I will never again go to Vegas without going to Soho.  This is how all restaurants should be.

Update: tried the pan fried broccoli tonight. Normally, broccoli isn't something I'd get too excited about, but this was by far the best broccoli I've ever had! Highly recommend :). It comes with the NY steak but you can also order it ala carte.
Best local sushi place yet!  Room is bright and clean, staff is attentive and awesome, and the food was spot on! Super fresh, perfectly prepared, and so much flavor.  We will be back!!!

Food was delicious and the waiters were really great. Take advantage of the happy hour (4-6pm). I would highly recommend the twin dragon roll. It's kind of intense but so so good. The "tadas" were whatever but if you get them on happy hour they're only a dollar. Garlic soft shell crab was great too. Definitely coming back here if I'm ever in town.

Please note that this review is just for the lunch special. 

Vegas folks can be pretty damn snobby when it comes to sushi (and food in general) because let's be honest -- this is one of the food capitals of the world and we have endless choices. 

I've been here twice for lunch and the service has always been great and the food phenomenal. Their special is $8.95 for the "typical" dishes you'd find for lunch specials -- sushi, chicken teriyaki, salmon, etc -- HOWEVER, everything is just upgraded several notches. 

The sushi is the freshest I've ever seen for the price and everything from the pickled salad to the green salad side dishes are just more tastier and fresh. And the price -- it's really a steal that I am super happy with. 

Definitely a restaurant on my list to come back to.

O.M.G. everything was amazing!!!!!
