Best UNI I ever had. The ocean's very own butter. Melts in your mouth, salty, creamy, cold, firm, slightly sweet and so so fresh! oh my I want more!!! 

The Hawaiian Poke Ahi tostadas... I just love it with the combination with the avocado cream. I have tried the shrimp, hamachi and tako ones too but I think the ahi is the best

And you cannot forget the hydro bib black cod is just amazing!! Best lettuce cup you'll ever have! Trust! 

Some of the other things I've tried that were very good too are the yellowtail yuzu soy, seared tuna special, crispy tuna roll, fire cracker roll, gyoza, soho maki and angus bone in short rib. Desserts are delish!

This place is reasonable and way better than most sushi restaurants. Fresh and better quality!! 

Staff is awesome, owner is amazing! He's goes around to every table to make sure every is going well. Super nice guy too!!

I'm always thinking of coming back here every time I wanna eat Japanese or just some bomb ass raw fish! I'll be back for sure! And you should try this place out!

This is by far the best sushi I've ever had in Vegas. I ate there 3 times in one week. I've only ordered off of the happy hour (4 to 6), but everything has been delicious especially the Salmon Avocado roll. It's a simple roll, but very flavorful and only $4! The staff is always friendly, and was very helpful the first time I ate there. They went over every item on the HH menu and gave their suggestions. All three times have been a pleasant experience!

What an amazing experience from start to finish! Locals are in for a treat and I have no doubt that word is about to get out. I'm considering myself lucky to be amongst the first set of patrons. 

I have found myself a new favorite sushi spot in Vegas! Got my megaphone out and I'm spreading the good word, starting now. I'm making a prediction that I'm about to become the Duchess of Soho Japanese Restaurant. I'm ready to duke it out for that crown so bring it! ;)

Unreal! These prices are too good to be true... especially for the quality you get! The sushi quality is comparable to high-end restaurants on The Strip. I highly suggest running, not walking, to check Soho Japanese Restaurant out now.  

Took some friends here and every single thing we tried was excellent. The chef hit the ball way out of the park! 

Some things that I recommend trying are:

Ty Ku Coconut Nigori Sake... only $21 for 720 ml (WOW! I'm moving in!)

SOHO Tostadas - Tuna - Hawaiian Poke Sauce (pictured)

Beef Tataki (probably my favorite dish but I'd be hardpressed to choose a favorite, pictured.)

Rock Shrimp Tempura with 3 different sauces (faves were jalapeño aioli and the sweet banana sesame)

Spicy Tuna with Crispy Rice (pictured)

Soft Shell Crab Roll (second favorite, pictured)

Crème Brûlée (pictured... all of the desserts were really good though so don't mean to leave them out. Just ask my stunt double, she knows all about it! *wink*)

If there's something you usually order that is not on the menu, ask and you might receive. I get the impression that they are still gauging what people would like to see on their menu and/or they're willing to make it if they have the ingredients and it's not. 

I would have taken more pics but everything looked so good it was hard to get everyone to wait before going to town on the food. Our guests were extremely impressed with Soho and it didn't break the bank to take them here. I cannot believe all that we ordered and what we ended up paying. It was especially cool when the owner himself, Mr. John Lee, came out to welcome us. He made us feel like true VIPs and he was really personable and funny. He told us about his plans and I like what he is trying to do with his place. I wish him nothing but the best. 

I have no doubt that Soho Japanese Restaurant is going to do well. The news is going to start spreading like wildfire, mark my words! 

I'm eating there again tonight. Yep, it is THAT good!

Update: As you can tell by my checkins I go here quite regularly. Recently, one of my dining companions needed to eat gluten free because she has celiac disease. Chef John Lee hooked up many options for her. My guests were so impressed! Thanks Soho Japanese Restaurant and John Lee for all the extra special things that you do.
Whitefish special delicious! As always the chef/owner came out to check on us-super nice and talented guy. Great food and service!
Great food and service. Very disappointed they stopped lunch service. That place was packed during lunch. Should we start crowd funding to get lunch times back.

Omikase is the way to go. A bundle of delightful surprises in your mouth. One after the next. Their Yuzu is like something I've never had before. Delightful. Delectable. Everything from the carpaccio to the oysters to the whatever we had in between has been amazing. Perfection. Will come again!

The service here is amazing.! Louie is so friendly and nice, and the chef and owner was so nice and came over to our table to welcome us. The food has tremendous flavor, and freshness. I will look forward to my next dining experience here.

My wife and I went here on a lunch date. We ordered the salmon seto, loco moco seto, 15 piece mix sashimi platter, yellowtail yuzu soy and matcha tiramisu for dessert.
The lunch set was good. My wife loved her salmon. We both enjoyed the sashimi platter for the freshness of the fish. The only disappointment was the dessert. The tiramisu was a little dry but the overall the meal was excellent. We will come back for the sashimi and try some other items. I hope they don't let their standards fall like so many other restaurants. It truly is a gem here in Las Vegas.

The service was awesome and the sushi was DELICIOUS! The sushi was brought out so quickly too. The fish was fresh and the rolls didn't have too much rice. The price was reasonable. We liked the sushi so much, that we returned two days later. Yum! Definitely worth the ride or drive.

The quality went down a lot the last 2 times I went. I used to love this place but now it's just another run of the mill sushi joint, nothing great, mediocre quality fish, I have a few items on the menu that are ok, but I can't even remember what they were. It's really a 2.5 but I gave them a three since they are better than a 2 and I'm sure regular people would like it.
Been here a dozen times.. And it's so good all the time.. It's on a different level than just about every other local spot with similar food..
this place is amazing! they offer so many vegan options compared to some other japanese restaurants! i recommend the vegan lover if you're plant-based, vegan, or looking to shake up your diet.

I love this unassuming place.  Everything I've eaten here (which is quite a bit) has been fresh and flavorful.  The happy hour is an inexpensive way to sample a few dishes, and I enjoy their standard bento box lunch.  That being said get their sashimi dishes.. .all of them!
We had the $68 tasting menu. All sashimi were fresh tasting. The salmon was excellent and buttery, yet balanced with citric flavor from the sauce. Good service. Will recommend anyone to go!
Saw the good reviews and decided to try it out. Quality of the food and service wasn't that great... I guess I'm just use to the savory flavors of California sushi. Not my cup of tea.

Quality fish. Quality service. Holy yum batman!

We were visiting from out of town, and a friend (LV Local) suggested trying this place out. We were not disappointed!! We came during the evening of 5-15-14...

When I walked in, I was surprised at the casual / non traditional setting. Don't let it fool you! The fish was exceptional. We sat at the bar & asked the chef to surprise us. He quickly provided us with carefully paired pieces of fish; we had salmon, yellowtail, butterfish... Each one was delicious. For "dessert" I like to finish with either Toro or Uni; we tried 3 different types of Uni. The chef was super friendly and very kind. The Uni was fantastic (of the 3 options, the Japanese was our favorite).

Service is good but I would recommend sitting at the bar to enjoy the good company of the chefs! Next time we're in Vegas, we will definitely be back. Don't bother with the restaurants on the strip.... This is a quality sushi restaurant with great value. Our bill was under 100$ and we were drinking and had lots of food. Totally worth it. Oh and we got pens with little sushi-s on the end! I'll treasure them forever while I dream of the Hoakkido Uni........

Wow what an amazing night ! The sushi was Ffrreeessshhhhhh the sashimi was so tender it melted in our mouths ! The rolls where very flavorful generous with the right amount of fish and well balanced great flavors and sauces. Full bar and great Saki choices I tried 2 different ones both amazing . The service was exceptional !!!
Great smiley knowledgable staff The Cheff is super friendly .

Great deal and delicious food! Came here on a night during CES, enjoyed the yellowtail yuzu, softshell crab spicy roll, the uni (we didn't spring for the "uni trio" which looked pretty cool but we passed on this), and a few other items. The miso cod was excellent as well. Really well-priced for what you get, highly recommend if you are in Vegas. It's a bit of a drive away from the strip but totally worth it.

Food was really good. Eel roll was our favorite. We went for my wife's birthday and they gave us Mochi (chewy ice cream) which was very good.

Staff were great. Everyone was very nice and our waitress even brought us some sashimi for free even though we didn't order it because that's what they are known for.

Service was a little slow. Getting refills and our check was a little slow. Nothing that would keep us from going back. 

We were extremely pleased with this place!

Tried this place for the 1st time with the family.  It's not AYCE but they have Happy hour 5-7p.   Not much selection on the Happy hour menu.  Tried a few but the ones we really liked was the oysters, tuna ceviche and yellowtail.  We tried the otoro but it didn't taste the way I've normally have them at Naked Fish. Service is good, very friendly staff.

Heard Soho is open for lunch again.  Came over as soon as I can. First person I saw was Chef Chen behind the glass.  I knew things are okay here now because the presentation and quality of the dinners had slipped a little while he was away. And I was right, lunch was great.  12 pieces of fish with the lunch special.  Choice of greens or seaweed salad, white or brown rice, miso or mushroom soup.  Add dessert for 2 bucks.  Fish were fresh tasting, chicken katsu is still the best in town.
I miss the lunch bento tray.  It made feel like I was eating a lot more food.  It was the same amount of food as previous lunches but in the round plates, but I was still feeling hungry. 
Baked mussels have a citrus flavor to it, the rock shrimp are good as ever.
Overall, I am glad to have Soho back on my lunch rotation.

I can see why this place has 5 stars. Customer service - top notch. Starting from the apps, everything in between,  to desert was awesome. Instead of me explaining it all, why don't you just come and try yourself, you won't be disappointed.

I'm going against my own rules here (writing a review not only before I've tried it twice, but before I've finished the first meal!!), but this place is... Not just ONE word to describe it! This place caught me by surprise. Here's why:

When I pulled up to the front, I thought, it's nothing special to look at, basic strip mall sushi place. I walked in and the setup is modest, almost unsure of itself. I looked at the menu and saw that there weren't MANY options, but I stayed positive. I was meeting a friend there who had been there the night before and asked me to go with her tonight again so there must be something about this place...

She arrived and we began ordering our basic favorites. For me, it's just a simple Philly roll. She warned me that if I didn't like smoked salmon, to ask for fresh. When I try somewhere new, I like to try new things but I gauge how far I'm willing to go by the predictable. "If I don't like the smoked salmon, I'll stick to the beginner rolls" is what went through my mind. After the first bite of "beginner" Philly roll, I realized, this is the big league. Beyond fresh. Strip quality. Local pricing. I. WANT. MORE.

I ordered a Firecracker roll, which sounds like it may be spicy, but Sushi Chef John Lee (the owner and head sushi chef of Soho, previously known as executive chef of Social House at Crystals CityCenter, whom I also had the honor to meet and speak with at length) knows his fish pairings. The Firecracker roll was the perfect amount of spicy, sweet, crunchy, and smooth. It found itself somewhere between amazing and incredible on my scale of taste. Best of all, though, it was $9. I immediately had doubt that I would find anything better on the menu. BOOOYYYYYYY was I in for a ride!!!

My friend ordered a Spicy Soft Shell Crab roll because she only got one piece the day prior due to her party eating it all. Ha! Needless to say, I only got one piece of that one too! So I ordered my own as well. WOW. Normally I'm hesitant about soft shell. I've had a few questionable experiences with it and I feel like I'd rather just not take the chance again but this make... "Speechless" is what comes to mind. Trust me on this if nothing else, TRY IT. Take one bite and you'll understand.

Aside from the sushi rolls, we also ordered Angus Beef Tataki. I've had it before at another Japanese restaurant in Vegas and LOVED it. Sushi Chef John Lee creates all his own sauces, many which use citrus as an ingredient. He paired the beef with a mild but savory sauce that can only be described as succulent. Presented beautifully like all his plates, I almost feel bad that I destroyed it. :D

We ordered several more dishes (WAYYY too many to describe right now) and they're all borderline orgasmic. I toughed it through to manage a dessert as well due to a picture I saw on yelp of a Green Tea Tiramisu. Being part Italian and having lived in Italy for 4 years, I can judge harshly on any food claiming to be "Italian" or using "Italian ingredients or methods"... I'll say it fast... Italy should take note... This dessert was shocking. Green Tea.... Tiramisu.... It's a combination that could rival the tastebud tickling that José Andrés has done at China Poblano at The Cosmopolitan. Not bashing him at all, I find him to be an incredible magician of food, but this sole dessert is something else. Something intriguing. Now only to avoid the mafia from here on out...

Just prior to leaving (we had stayed a measly 2.5 hours... NBD...), Sushi Chef John Lee asked how everything had been for us, to which we applauded and both agreed to write 5 star reviews. Then he said, "Thank you, but all I want is for you to leave happy, having enjoyed the food that I can make for you." So I replied, "Well, I'm leaving sad.... But it's only because I have to leave." He laughed and thanked us again and we departed.

Lastly, thank you Bobbi for taking me here! And if you'd like to "duke" it out for that crown, I'm all yours baby! ;)

The raving 5 star reviews baffle me. I live in the area, Kobe and oyshi down the street are similar. The food and service are good, I'd go go back.  The restaurant decor is very simple. Its really good, nothing bad to say, but definitely not super impressive.

Honestly, I never write reviews esp when I am on vacation cause I'm
Afraid that the restaurant is a one trick pony but I reassure you that this is the most amazing restaurant I had the pleasure of dining at! The food was amazing but what really made the experience amazing is the service! From the moment we stepped in the door to the moment we left it was the most welcoming experience! Words cannot express what an great experience! So much so we tried to go back during our 4 day vacation! 

Must go! Happy hour is a STEAL!

A hidden gem near the strip. Went there on a Saturday night in an unassuming strip mall.
I've eaten at dozens of sushi restaurants through out the U.S. and this is one of the better ones in Las Vegas. The quality of the fish was superb, the presentation, chefs and sushi was simply excellent. Check out their happy hour specials. Now here are some of my favorites:  
Salmon collar
Soft shell crab
Salmon Roll
Black Cod Butter Lettuce Wraps 
Hamachi
Spicy Tuna Roll
Dragon rolls
If you are in Las Vegas, resist the temptation to eat Japanese food in a hotel and venture out to check out this favorite. I agree with other Yelpers that this is one of the better Japanese restaurants in this city.

Truly fresh seafood. In a desert city where every bit of food is delivered frozen then thawed and cooked, this place gives you the impression fish was caught the same day! I don't know how they do it. Yes, it's pricey. But so worth it. Staff has rather quirky humor, "swaggery" caught me off-guard at first, but you get used to them. They're fun, definitely worth a 5 star service.
Amazing food and service!  The black cod lettuce cups and the yellowtail sashimi were awesome.  And, at the end of our meal, the chef came out to see how we liked it.  I highly recommend it.

I love this place! They're yellowtail capriccio is to die for. They're sushi is also very fresh and not fishy at all. We also tried they're roast they had and it was great. The chef even comes out and talks to the customer and asks what we loved. At the end of
The dinner the chef himself made us a sashimi platter of yellowtail! Totally recommend this Japanese restaurant.

I think 4.5 stars overall for this place totally makes sense. The fish was really fresh and the service was awesome. We were lucky that it wasn't super busy when we were there still great .. busy enough for Thursday night though. We came hungry and started with the Oysters first. I loved that they have options to add Uni and the Ikura on top of the Oysters. We did that and it was delicious. 

I personally loved the Duo Tuna that you can choose the kind ( fat or lean). The Duo was yummy!
The Shishito peppers was good but I expected to get some spicy one but got none. Hamachi Kama was very tasty. The skin was crispy outside and the fish meat was soft and tasty inside. We had it with the Ponzu sauce. 

For the price range compared to what we got, it was very good. We satisfied what we expected and felt it was worth the trip to swing by. The look from the outside of the restaurant could be misleading as it was in a general looking shopping complex. I think this was so much better deal than many places in the strip. 

The food came out so fast too. Highly recommend!
This is the first time Ive seen a 5 star rating and it lived up to it. Amazing quality and freshness. Job well done. dont fix it if it aint broke.
Stopped in from out of town and was amazed of the great tasting food.  In addition, the atmosphere and ambiance was sensational. I will definitely return when I come back.
Tae was our chef and he is the man!!! Made all of our dishes quick and made sure the presentation was on point. They have a great happy hour as well. Definitely will be coming back!
This is my favorite Sushi restaurant in the valley. If you can sit at the bar and hopefully you will get Gino he's very nice and serves you surprises.

Every last bite was amazing! We ordered so much food! Let me try and remember.... 

Salmon skin salad 
Brussel sprouts 
Korean BBQ shortribs 
Porkbelly 
Sashimi tower 
Uni 
Baked mussels 
Spicy tuna rolls 
Spider rolls 

There may be more but just trust me, everything was good! Prices blew me away! So worth venturing off the strip for!

This is definitely on the top of my list of local sushi restaurants that I enjoy. This is now my 2nd time that I've visited and both times have been great. Walking in I am always quickly sat and they luckily have wifi and a place to plug in. It's becoming one of my go to spots to grab lunch while doing some work. 

Service - Both times the service has been exceptional but this time the service is above par. The male server that I have the pleasure of serving me is not only friendly, but super funny, personable, and knowledgable. 

Food - Fresh is definitely the name of the game. I typically eat sashimi so I always know if a place isn't getting in in regular. I even tried the Miso Black Cod and all I can say is Yummy! 

Drinks - They only have beer/wine/sake but they have a fantastic bottle of Sparkling Sake for only $18 so it's perfect for me. 

My overall view is that this is definitely an awesome place with fresh fish, great service, and a nice atmosphere. You can't go wrong here. Of course if you want 600 lame deep fried rolls then you might want to go down the road. If you want great food and great service, stop by SOHO for a great meal.

Just 15 min off the strip- and wayyyy worth it! But also note that there will probably be a 30 min-1 hour wait. 

If you're looking for a legit sushi joint in LV that won't break the bank, Soho is the way to go.

Went here last week at about 8 p.m. and had to wait 30 min for a table for a party of 2. My sister & I were starrrrving and our table couldn't have come any sooner.

Ordered:
1. salmon tostada & yellowtail tostada ($2 each). I love yellowtail but actually preferred the salmon one. They were still both delicious! I loved the avocado and chip thing the fish came on. The only thing I would change about this dish is I would make it at least two times bigger! So friggin tiny, especially if you're friggin starving and ready to eat a horse!!!

2. Spicy tuna on crispy rice. This was my first time ordering this and now I order it everywhere I go, hoping to get the same taste! The rice is crispy on the outside but perfectly chewy on the inside. I would definitely order this again when I go back. 

Tbh, I don't remember anything else I ordered. But it was delicious and prices were reasonable. In Vegas? Jackpot!

Everybody (especially Chef John) is very friendly. I love to eat here- especially during their lunch special and happy hour! They have plethora of delicious options, and you can never go wrong. 
Their whole menu is on point. C'mon Vegas, we need more restaurants like Soho! Woo!

This restaurant is amazing. During happy hour, the menu lists a variety of meals for $5. I cannot believe the quality of this food for $5!! It is delicious and well-presented. Definitely try the tartar! My boyfriend and I come here often, and are never disappointed. Sometimes there is a relatively long wait, but it's worth it for what you get.

Good poke bowl. The fish seems fresh and good quality, the sauces I chose were delicious. My favorite sauce was the creamy cilantro. A bit on the pricey side as they charge extra for several of the toppings, and I like to pile 'em on.

Went here twice in three days. It's THAT GOOD. Happy hour items were delicious. The fish is so sweet and fresh. Definitely recommend the Ahi poke. Any of the sashimi and most definitely recommend the seaweed salad. Try this place. It's top notch no frills sushi/sashimi.

Wow . We are still learning the area and haven't had sushi in a while so I checked the places near here , I agree with every good review on here , this place is awesome !! Vegas is very saturated in Asian cuisine if it's ramen, sushi , or Chinese , as far as sushi goes this place takes the cake we had a few waiters I didn't get all there names but asu (probably misspelled) was very nice , everyone was in fact , I had the twin drgaon roll and a couple tapas which are like Japanese nachos and everything was awesome , will def come back !

The best service!Best food! Highly recommend this restaurant to any sushi lover!  And if you'd like to get away from the strip and eat sushi the locals love this is the place for you. You will not be disappointed!

This place is amazing...I come to Vegas for CES every year and this is now my goto place.... chief John is a master at getting flavor to your table..nothing is bland about this place.... I eat  sushi very often and I must say that the taste and value of this place is right on point...You might have th wait a little bit but it's worth it....

Came here because several people raved about it and so I made sure to make reservations. When we got there the hostess admitted that she overlooked our reservation and assured us that a table was leaving. She crammed us in the far back corner where nobody really cared to check on us, left our dirty dishes on the table until the bill came and we felt pretty much neglected the entire meal. I made sure to get our server's name Charles, he was awful and kept saying rude comments. I was asking about the specials and he basically made us feel stupid by telling us it's basically the same stuff on the menu. He asked us if it was our first time and then his reply was "it figures." He made the whole experience much worse and although the food was fairly good the service made it not worth coming back. Very disappointed.

Best sushi in Vegas.  5/5.  I could just end there, but they were so good, I have to write more.   
One drawback, no reservations.  Wait was over an hr on a Monday night.  But well worth it.  Staff is just absolutely wonderful.  Food is like I said the best.  Due to the wait we were showered within gifts from the chef. Awesome.  Just fantastic.
Hidden gem ! We Love Soho: from the chefs creations, quality of the food, and the friendly servers. A must try. Ty Soho.

I am not a big sushi fan so when I say this is the best sushi that I've ever had, it really means something. And the prices, totally reasonable.  The staff messed up on our reservation so we had to wait for a table. The manager apologized and offered us some free appetizers while we waited. Thumbs up to the food and the staff.

Worth the drive! We've eaten at some of the finest Japanese restaurants, this rivals the best....The pairing of flavors and presentation was exceptional....Our server, Mika (sp?) was knowledgeable and guided us through the menu with great suggestions.... Don't expect the strips high-end decor & frills...This place is casual....

This is the best place in ALL of vegas for sushi. If you want strip quality without the crowds and crazy prizes this place will knock your socks off. I lived in San Diego for 7 years and went out of my way to try all the great places. Vegas sushi does not compare in general. SOHO has the quality, freshness and the type of service rockstars get. Sit at the bar, introduce yourself to John and try it for yourself. Indulge in their appetizers AND their desserts. My new favorite will be on the menu soon (lemon cheesecake). This is a hidden gem. I would love to see it stay a neighborhood secret but this place deserves the recognition.

Soho is my favorite sushi spot in town! I come here regularly and usually reserve a spot at the sushi bar. I've received nothing but amazing service and delicious food! They offer an awesome happy hour menu!! Chef Aaron is our go to sushi chef, and I have enjoyed everything he's made me. Sheila always hooks it up with fast and friendly service!

I've lived in Vegas for three years now and have tried many sushi places and been disappointed by almost all of them.  I saw great reviews for this place on Yelp and thought I would give it a try tonight.  I've never had fresh sushi that tasted this amazing.  The sushi chef / owner is passionate about what he does and you can taste that with every dish.  The chef's attention to detail, dedication to craft and passion for his food are unparalleled in this town.  I will DEFINITELY be coming back here.  Prices are the best I've seen for fresh sushi and the quality blew me away.

We are a huge sushi loving family. We have tried many Japanese restaurants on the strip & all over Las Vegas and this restaurant is a great local surprise. The food was really great, tasted fresh & definitely hit the spot. My 8 year old loves sushi and he has definitely told us when he doesn't like a place...he loved this place. Definitely recommend the yellow tail and whitefish ponzu, as well as the cute bite sized sashimi tostados. The staff was incredibly friendly and our server offered up some great "must try" suggestions.

Amazing sushi and unique menu items.  I've been to Nobu and in my opinion this place ranks right up there with it, possibly higher since the prices are so much more reasonable.  The service is fantastic.  We even met the owner who greeted us with a complimentary menu item.  

Black cod, poke tostadas, hamachi--everything is amazing.  

Don't let the small, unassuming location deter you from an amazing meal at a reasonable price!!

Delicious place. Everyone is very friendly and everyone has a smile which makes this place enjoyable. This place is off the strip so you won't deal with parking. Chef is fun. I haven't tried dessert yet but believe that I won't leave without a taste. Omg!!!dessert!!! Unbelievable!!!

Who would have thought one could find what might just be one of the best Las Vegas dining experiences sandwiched between a gas station and a Subway? This small, yet very homey eatery, captures the feel of higher end locations, and actually kicks their butt in the menu department. 

The service was great, I almost felt like a VIP. Starting with the lady who greeted us, to our very knowledgeable waiter Darrell, and the sweet lady assisting him, we got the royal treatment, and were quite impressed with the fabulous selections they recommended. Talk to Darrell and let him tell you what's up, we did and were quite happy.

 When one considers where this really is, it is even more amazing; not on the strip or in some high end casino, but in a small strip mall out in the desert. The values are here, but you can also step things up a notch or two if that is your party's desire. Nice place!
Recommend for both lunch and dinner. The lunch bento sashimi is awesome. Asahi on draft is great. All of the rolls are great. Love the crispy tuna and firecracker roll.

I had dinner at this quaint restaurant the other day & I enjoyed the food. It's small and personal so I was surprised they even had a television right in the center of the place. Other than that the servers were very attentive and are write there to refill your drink, which i loved. I would recommend this place its more of a locals spot. I had 3 different sushi rolls and the seaweed salad and everything was on par!

Not enough fresh sashimi options. Poor quality of fish - not fresh enough, not shocking considering we're in the desert. I do like their rolls. If you ever come here just order their rolls and forget the sashimis. They did not even know how to make a proper hand roll.
We are longtime loyal customers of Soho. The service and food quality is always impeccable! After hearing we just got married, they treated us to a wonderful green tea cake. Love these guys!!

We're a fan of this place specifically for their happy hour.  Good sushi and mini tuna tacos at some decent prices.

Our first time there, we were greeted by the chef which was really nice and he brought us out one of his signature dishes to try which again was really nice and generous of him.  So overall a good experience and good service.  We have gone twice so far, one for regular dinner and once for happy hour. 

Love that it's just around the corner from us, so we will be going more often.  Great when chef's from the strip decide to open up their own restaurants here for us locals :)

Went here for lunch with my sister, mom, and son. I have to say, one of the best sushi spots in Las Vegas! The lunch crowd died down, so there was availability right away. We were greeted upon arrival, I love that! And since it was me and my sister's first time - our server Julie went down on the basics of Soho's food and menu. I have to say Julie gave us great customer service, right from the start!! Everything we order was not a disappointment.
Absolutely love this place! Fresh sushi, spectacular taste, friendly and helpful staff and nice ambience!

Came across this place because of the high rating on yelp and because we were tired of all the subpar AYCE sushi that we always go to every time in Vegas.  Some times you just gotta go for quality over quantity.

First off, we were greeted very warmly and it was very evident from the get go that service is a priority at this restaurant.  She explained what the most popular dishes and specials of the day were.  We ended up going with a few of them and were not disappointed.

The highlight of the evening was the Hamachi with yuzu, shoyu and fried serrano chili ($12).  So good.  Hamachi was super tender, the yuzu, ponzu sauce was awesome and the thinly sliced serrano chili added a nice kick of heat, it's mild because it's so thinly sliced and also fried so it takes some of the heat out.  Everyone agreed it was the favorite dish.  Thanks for our waitresses recommendations!  I can see why its their most popular dish.

Big eye poke ($15) was excellent quality of fish but i thought there was too much sesame oil, i ended up dipping each piece in shoyu to cut thru it, so good.

Garlic Tuna tataki ($12) very fresh fish and tasty.

Tadas ($2 each) Their take on tostadas, nice little bites of raw fish on mini deep-fried wontons.  We tried the salmon and hamachi.  Wish i had tried them all, but theres always next time.

We also ordered 2 rolls ($15 each), the Twin Dragon and Triple S, mostly for filler since most of our items didn't include rice.  The Triple S  (scallop, shrimp and spicy tuna) was kind of forgettable.  The Twin Dragon however, was delicious!  King crab, spicy tuna, avocado, and shrimp tempura on top.  It had a very strong shell fish flavor and a nice crunch from the 2 shrimp tempura on top.

After eating that we ordered the mixed tempura ($7), nice and crunchy and a nice selection, shrimp, broccoi, kabocha, shishito pepper, cant remember the other stuff.  We also ordered King Crab tempura too, which was nice, but pricy. a few pieces of crab leg lightly battered, Yum!

Garlic shishito peppers - it had a sweetness to it that i didn't care for, but one of my friends though it was the best dish of the evening.

The decor is a bit confusing, it looks a bit thrown together but the food is very good and very fresh, but what most stands out is the service!

I wish I could give them more stars! The best quality in town. Hands down. We had a beautiful sashimi platter and with a boyfriend who is from Japan it's pretty hard to impress him with any Japanese restaurant. He even said it's the best sushi he's had since moving to the states 10 years ago!

All the 5 star reviews was what got my boyfriend and I to troop all the way here.

Service: 0/5
Food: 1.5/5
Organization: -10/10

There is no flow here. Workers are too busy dancing/playing or on their phones.

When we came in, we waited for a table. At least 7 tables were open, all 4 high tops were open. We were told to wait. Eventually girl 1 came to us and told us only tables available were the high tops and bar seats. We said the high tops were fine, they told us to seat ourselves. We sat ourselves and a different girl (girl 2) gave us our menus and walked away. After waiting a bit, guy 1 gave us water and walked away. We looked at the menu and waited for the server/guy 1 to come back. Waited a while but Guy 1 was busy bussing tables. We waited about 10 minutes. I was staring at the back but everyone was huddled up talking and joking around. Then Guy 1 went to the back. Eventually Guy 2 got the hint and came up to us and asked if we were ready to order. We ordered everything in one go. Sodas came. Food took awhile to come out as in it came out one by one. We tried to get our servers attention. Eventually girl 2 asked if i needed a refill... told her yes and my boyfriend needed a refill too. Waited for her to come back for 5 minutes but saw her come back to the front and just stand there. Eventually girl 3 came with my drink but my boyfriend's drink was forgotten. We were ready to leave by now. 

No one has a specific role here. It seems like they believe it is teamwork but there is a lack of  organization and consideration. Everything and everyone was all over the place. The food was nothing amazing or memorable. 

In my opinion, they need to figure out how to organize and work everything out. Everyone should have a specific role or everyone should learn how to balance everything. I worked as a hostess for almost 2 years. I understand there are difficulties and issues might come up but this was just terrible.

Best. Sushi. Ever.
I'm already planning how I will drive the five hours to Vegas just to eat here!!
Exquisite cuisine, reasonably priced. 
Wow.

This place is better and better every time.  I usually order my favorite thing at every restaurant.  I go for the sure thing.  However at Soho, you need to be adventurous.   You don't want to miss out on something amazing.  Everything that comes out of this kitchen is delicious.  I haven't eaten a single thing I didn't like.  Every visit I seem to have a new favorite.   Right now I love the Brussel sprouts and the flying fish roll.  Also the new passion mango sake is yummy especially to pair during lunch time!

wow! what a great surprise this was... such pleasant employees that answered all my "new-bee" questions and they made excellent suggestions about the great food on their menu. So many wonderful entrees to choose from. Your food is prepared in front of you with speed and accuracy. 
I've already suggested Soho Sushi Burrito to my friends and I just ate there yesterday! 
I know they will impress you as well!
Enjoy

The Wife and are in town for a long weekend and as usual I did my Yelp research prior to landing.  First night in decided to head to SoHo and I'm very glad we did.  From the house salad to the white peach infused sake I had no negative feedback from a culinary perspective.  Now you should prepare yourself to wait even if tables seem open...I know it sounds odd but this is a small place with a small kitchen so from what I can tell they seat based on the kitchens bandwidth.  This happened to us as the counter seating was open but they would not seat us primarily because they had a huge party (for this place).  With that said take the drive to SoHo, chill out with a refreshing beverage and prepare to eat some damn fine grub!

This is probably my favorite place to wait for happy hour in all the valley! The wait for three people was only 2 hours without anyone in line and a bunch of open tables! Fantastic, comfortable chairs to wait in except for the fact that you can't really see the TV screen as it's angled away from the waiting area. The only thing to do while sitting down is deeply question your dining choices, and questioning the rationality behind waiting hours for seats which are already empty. I decided to dine elsewhere to save my sanity and that is one of the better choices I've made so far for the new year. The food is decent nothing that you cannot get at any other sushi bar. It's only worth it for happy hour which is from 4-7 and still quite pricey for a average meal. Honest review of food/service/ambiance would be 2/5.

Probably my favorite place to stop at when I visit my friends and family in Vegas. 

Food is delicious and reasonably priced, excellent service and great atmosphere!

I always order the premium sashimi which is about $45 and definitely worth the price. Waitress asked if I wanted sweet shrimp or uni? I said bring me the UNI! The presentation and quality was aesthetic and super fresh!
Amazing happy hour, great food, and great service. We had the pleasure of having another cool islander from Hawaii serve us. Will definitely be back when I return to Vegas.

My husband and I had an amazing time dining at Soho! We ordered a wide selection of sashimi plates, sushi, and rolls, and everything was fresh and delicious. The service was great and rounded off a perfect night. The ambiance and atmosphere was obviously no where near as fancy as some of the places on the strip. But they more than made up for it with the prices. We got to try a number of unique and delicious dishes without breaking the bank and without any pretentiousness. We'll be back next time we visit Vegas!

WoW !!!! 
 If you haven't gone yet you should.  The Rock Shrimp with three different sauces were awesome. Hamachi with ponzu and deep fried Serrano chili and the Ika ( Calamari ) was great too. That was just starters.
 Miso Butterfish had great flavor flakey and moist. Filet was sooooo tender also had three unreal dipping sauces. Short rib was melt in your mouth Super Rich flavor. Salmon moist tender with great steamed veggies.
Last but not least Hamachi collar with the cheek meat as well.... Perfectly cooked with a great dipping sauce and grilled lemon.
Whew.... Now for dessert, Green Tea Tiramisu was was the best I've ever had. And you can't go wrong Mochi ice cream .... The Sesame, Green Tea, and Strawberry, were the picks of the evening. 
 Overall Great experience !!! A Great find !!!! Go an enjoy !!!!
Aloha

I rarely go to the same restaurant twice a month, and going to one twice a week is unheard of, but I loved SoHo Japanese Restaurant so much that I went two consecutive days in a row - I would have gone for three, but we were already on our way back to LA!  

During both visits we took advantage of their happy hour offerings and were blown away by the taste, generous portion, and inexpensive how bill ended up being. Honestly, it doesn't get any better than this. Below were the items we sampled. 

**Note*** Items listed were from two separate dinning experiences, but some items ordered did overlap
       

HAPPY HOUR MENU (4pm-6pm)
-Cajun Albacore Sashimi ($5): Thin sashimi slices with a mayo based sauce is a great way to start your meal.    

-Ika Geso ($4): Calamari accompanied with a flavorful yellow curry sauce. It was cooked perfectly unlike many restaurants that tend to over-fry theirs. Definitely a worthy order. 

-Salmon Avocado Roll ($4): Chef John was incredibly generous with the amount of salmon he stuffed into these rolls and get this... you get 8 pieces. Seriously? That's like $.50 per piece. And no it's not anything like gas station sushi, this is high quality fatty salmon that just melts in your mouth. Excellent - we actually ordered two servings (on both visits), and we'll definitely order this again and again in the future 

-Hydro Bibb Black Cod ($4): I'd like to think of this as a Japanese Fish Taco with the Bibb Lettuce acting as the tortilla and the grilled black cod as the protein. The fish just melts in your mouth, it's soooo good. Two thumbs up!   

-Tada Salmon ($1): Guacomole, salsa, and salmon over a flat chip. It was good, but I think you'd be better off ordering the Salmon Avocado Roll.  

-Baked Mussels ($5): Also good, but to be honest I can't remember much about it.    


REGULAR MENU 
-Golden Ocean Trout with Pop Rocks($11): It's like a full blown party in your mouth. So if you're fearless this is your ticket to super stardom and the salmon was so fatty and delicious. Love!    

-Flying Fish Roll ($15) - This was a simple tuna and salmon over sushi. The presentation was modern and taste was solid.  

-Uni Duo w/ Santa Barbara and Catalina ($20): To be honest, I am a novice when it comes to uni. I really liked the Santa Barbara, but I couldn't say the same for the Catalina. The Catalina is a bit more gritty, whereas the Santa Barbara was much smoother. Nevertheless, both were very fresh. 

-Kumoto Oyster wiyh uni ($6): Hands down the best dish of the night. The oysters were so incredibly juicy without tasting fishy and combined with the roe and uni - it was magical. I'm at a loss for words. Just order it!  


SUMMARY
Food execution was spot on, service was great, and prices- OMG, I still can't believe the bill. About $50 (not including tip on each visit) for two patrons at a nice Japanese joint with high quality fish. Completely Un-heard-off...  

Soho has now become my favorite place to dine in Sin City and on every trip from this point on, it'll always be on the Vegas itinerary. Thanks Chef John for the wonderful memories and delicious food.

Amazing amazing amazing!!!!!   Great value, service and unmatched quality.

We eat Sushi all over the U.s. And this was the best quality and value.

Had Premium Sashimi, several orders of wonderful sushi, uni sampler, eel and more.

Sake offerings are fantastic!


Don't walk.....run to this pace.   

Excited to come back again.

There is no hiding the fact that I am a fan of Soho Japanese Restaurant. Is the food good? Yes the food is good. Is the staff awesome? Yes Chef John Chien Lee and the staff are pretty awesome.  I could easily give Soho a 4-5 star rating.  Everytime I've been here I've been impressed more than the last. I'm sure if I was to go tomorrow I would also be impressed. 

When coming here you need to know that their dinner menu is a lot better than their lunch mainly because a lot of the must have items are served during dinner.  If you do come here for lunch they have this Lunch Seto for under $10 and it includes one from eight items which includes Salmon Teriyaki, Loco Moco, and Sashimi and it's served with yummy salad, rice, and miso soup.  It wasn't that bad. Here's my Sashimi Lunch Seto http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=7DpWBN02wkQ1TrtPkHVt0A#7DpWBN02wkQ1TrtPkHVt0A They also have a few sushi rolls, salads, and appetizers served during lunch.  One thing you should do is ask if they can serve any of the dinner items. I've asked twice and both times they were willing to make an item off the dinner menu. Just ask, the worst you'll get is a no and you order something else.

I have many favorites one is probably the bone-in short rib, it is a must. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=j8BK5DiHa-eVduVUKJFmXA#1xEgn9UQF6V3E9rtMvs2-w It is so tender that you can cut it with a chop stick and so delicious that you'll probably want more after eating your entire order. It is a little fatty and just melts in your mouth. I'd order some rice with it but you can eat it on its own or with a sushi roll.

For apps one of my favorites are the Garlic Shishito Peppers http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=j8BK5DiHa-eVduVUKJFmXA#lKya5IUtF4FBqA7I2wr0gQ they are good and I have to have them each time I'm here. They're like candy.  Another of my favorites apps are the edamame http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?select=j8BK5DiHa-eVduVUKJFmXA#VtxviC2KrM4-pOYMYGdz9A it's the first time I've had it with large salt crystals and really made a different for me.  Another is the Hydro Bibb Black Cod, it is basically a marinated miso cod topped with wonton crisps in a lettuce cup. It's light and delicious.

I only had one of their sushi rolls which was ok but have had majority of their non-sushi roll items, this is clearly where they excel in.  The chef is very creative, if you order ahead he'll make a very nice platter of various sushi and sashimi pieces. 

They have a nice big screen TV and very comfortable chairs. Sitting at the bar is a bit awkward, I kept banging my knees on the underneath parts of the counters. Spacious but does occasionally fill up. This is not All You Can Eat unless you have lots of money.

Been there a couple of times so far and I love the food there soooooooooo good!! I am really picky with my seafood, and I pretty much never try anything outside my comfort box when it comes to seafood or sushi yet in this place I decided to give it a shot and what can I say I AM NOT DISAPPOINTED the fish there is soooo fresh and "non fishy" my biggest peeves with seafood sushi places. I love this place and the owner John is great the staff is friendly and the food is good!! It is on the pricier side if you like to try lots of things and well.... we usually do but soooooo worth it!! 
I do not recommend this place if all you're after are sushi rolls,but I would go there if you are willing to be open minded and try some appetizers and creative items!

This place reminded me of restaurants in Hawaii everyone seemed to be in a cheery mood and wore a huge smile. The mahalo, relaxed island vibe was palpable. I also appreciated the low lunch prices that were to be had. Our group of five enjoyed a variety of dishes mostly off of the $8.95 bento box lunch specials. Steak, salmon and sushi samplers were all around us, there was so much food it could only with the uttermost care fit on our table. We also got two rolls, the double dragon and albacore. I felt these were well made because they had a thinner rice covering than is usual but other than that they were the usual sushi roles I have come to expect at regular joints. Sometimes I am wowed by sushi places with bold flavors or unique presentations such as sushi samba this was more of a regular but solid feel.

Awesome!! Great food. Amazing service staff was very friendly. Stopped here on my way into las vegas .I was amazed at how fresh the fish was and how fast the food arrived too our table.  SoHo will definetly be my go too resturant when i go too las  vegas from now on.

I am all about this place. It's slightly further from my house but worth the drive. 
Sushi burritos! I've never gotten sick from here and for some reason their rice is the best. Super quick service and very reasonable pricing. 
One of my favourite stops. 

Employees are always welcoming and helpful, and the food is good.
This is one of the best Sushi places in Vegas, fresh,  and great service. The Sushi chefs are accommodating and make great recommendations. I would definitely go back there again

My daughter has tried to take me here before and it was too busy so we ended up somewhere else.  I wish I would have waited the last time because this place is soooo good! It's clean and they have nice servers, but most of all the food was awesome!  We had lunch so we thought we were limited to the lunch menu, but our server brought the dinner menu out and we were able to order from there.  The lunch menu is pretty good, but the dinner menu has so much more to select from.  They had great lunch specials like the salmon avocado roll for only $6. We ordered the seabass lettuce buttercups from dinner menu $12, super delish!  My husband ordered the sashimi lunch special for $10.95 and it came with soup, salad & good portion of sashimi.  I ordered the Teriyaki chicken lunch special for $8.95.  The chicken is white meat and the sauce is served on the side which I liked.  The chef owner brought us the seared Garlic Tuna on the house.  We ordered so much stuff, you really can't go wrong with the sushi here.
we just ordered several things off the happy hour menu that we could share and nobody left that table unhappy. We all plan on coming back again.
The worst 5 star rated restaurant that I have ever been to. The sushi is not fresh at all...I just dont get how people rated this place as 5 stars...

Dammmmmmmmmmmmm Good?The rolls and the sashimi , you should try it.
Oh, wait, and the dessert is good, too! Do not forget the dessert!

I had dinner here with my friends last night and WOW was it good. From the service to the to the food, I was extremely impressed. We had sushi, sashimi, oysters and mussels and it was all delicious. The sushi was some of the freshest fish I've had. I was so amazed that they can have that quality of fish in Las Vegas. This restaurant is my friend's favorite sushi spot and I can't wait to visit them again so that we can go once more. Two major thumbs up!!

Could this be one of the easiest 5 star reviews I've ever had to write? Hands down, YES!! I came here for happy hour and my friend and I tried about everything on the list. 

While everything we tried was fantastic, my overall favorites were the Cajun Albacore Sashimi, Tadas with Yellowtail, and the Shrimp-Avacado roll. 

The tadas were the most "fusion" like thing we tried. A mixture of "ceviche like" spice accompanied with tostadas and touch of lime, I ordered two plates to myself!

The cajun albacore sashimi....can I drool any longer? I loved the light cajun seasoning idea. This dish, along the with others at Soho, doesn't take away from the idea that I'm eating sashimi. Some places fuse dishes together to make something completely new altogether, which usually turns into a sad "miss" from me. 

We received a recommendation from our server Boris to try the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy off the regular menu. Oh boy oh boy oh boy!!! I've gravitated toward yellowtail and albacore of late, and this recommendation was right on the money. Our servers, Boris and Candice, were extremely attentive and spot on on their recommendations based on questions of what our palettes gravitated to. 

I'm very happy to have found this gem. When I come back in town in a few weeks with friends, I know exactly where I'm taking them to.
Good, fresh sushi at a reasonable price.  Only 4 stars due to the limited wine list.

Food was okay wasn't really to our taste. One waiter was also okay. But other than that service was completely non existent. Waited until 4 for Happy Hours still not worth it. Most of the workers here are too busy talking than actually doing something. Even if they are, they completely ignore you and it's also someone new that does something . There is absolutely no flow to it. Most likely not coming back here again.

This place had 5 full stars when I looked it up last night and it should always remain that way. I am always a skeptic when I see 5 stars, but after my experience at SOHO last night, I can state in all confidence that this is by far the best place for Japanese food in Las Vegas, Service was top notch and the food, well, you'll see!

Soho has one of the freshest sushi in town, and their sashimi lunch special is perfect if you wanna get some fresh fish without breaking your bank. It's only 10 bucks but includes 7 pieces of sashimi, a bowl of rice, miso soup, house salad, and a small dish of cucumber salad. The interior to the place isn't anything overly fancy or special but it's the food that counts right? Service was also pretty good and friendly. Outside of their lunch special I would say their entrees and specialty rolls are a bit overpriced though compared to other sushi places. Specialty rolls are about 12-15$. But consider that you are paying for freshness quality over quantity. I'll definitely come back here next time I have more cash to blow.

I've been here for dinner once with Hunnie Bunnie and another time for lunch. 
Both times the food has been ON POINT. Delicious and fresh! 
For lunch I had the sashimi bento which comes with salad, miso and white rice. 
Friend had the teriyaki salmon bento and the teriyaki came on the side. Definite plus for that in itself because although she loves her sauces I am not a fan, especially of teriyaki! And only like $8.95 for the bento! Good deal. 
We also shared an a Sashimi salad which comes on a pretty large portion of greens and a decent amount of fish. However the Sashimi Bento is just a mini version of the Sashimi salad + the other things that come with the bento so it was kind of a double order. 
We also tried the lettuce cups and the fish was tastey on that as well. 
AND if you have never been there before, the chef sends out their specialty yellowtail dish which was nomtastic especially with the little fried jalapeños on to of it. 
Service was good and food came out in a timely manner. 
We left stuffed!
Yummy foods and great service! I would highly recommend this spot to satisfy your sush cravings!
My review, very fresh, awesome sashimi. Crap for rolls & sauce is weak and shitty shitty appetizer. I don't know what the hype is all about.

SoHo has become a highlight of our Vegas trips.   No matter what we're doing, we always find a way to go during happy hours (5-7 pm) at least once.

Whatever you do - you have to try the salmon sushi and  the white peach sake.  But you can't really go wrong with any other dish as well.  During happy hours you get the best sushi in Vegas for 1/3 of the price - you gotta try it!
Excellent food and service. This our new favorite Sushi spot. Owner came by to day hello.

Wow, where do I begin? I came here the other night with my girlfriend to try something new. The food here is amazing! Great flavor and high quality!

This place is located off the strip in a small little strip mall. Nice decor on the inside. Open kitchen with dim lighting. Place is pretty small, so call ahead.

The waiters and waitresses were on point throughout the night. No complaints here.


Now onto the good stuff. The food!

We happened to get here early before Happy Hour ended, so we figured why not check that out as well.

The happy hour here is amazing! $5 entrees on really good items. You definitely can't go wrong with that!

From the Happy Hour list we ordered:

Baked Mussels - So good 

Truffle Broccoli - Fire

Tempura beans - really good!

Escolar Carpaccio - Sooo good!

Yellowtail tadas - Good

Salmon tadas - Fire

Tuna Tadas - so good

Seared Albacore - Amazing 


Off the regular Menu:

Grilled Octopus - So good!

Rock Shrimp - Love the sauces

Short Ribs - Bomb

Scallops - Amazing


Sushi Rolls:

Volcano (Fried, no cream cheese, no jalepaneo) - Fire

Flying Fish - Bomb

Nutter pillar Roll - bomb

Twin dragons - ok

High roller - ok


Definitely go here! So good! 

Only critic - They should add a couple more specialty Sushi Rolls. They do such a great job with sauces and flavors - they have the potential to make even more unique rolls.
Great food.  Unexpected work visit in Vegas but certainly a great surprise here.  Both food and service get 5 stars.

A standout in the Southwest, Soho truly is a great option in Vegas for sushi & Japanese small plates.

Soho is a clear-cut 5 Star location for Happy Hour!  Just skim the reviews for HH and you'll see tons of rave reviews.  The value is incredible for the quality they are putting out!  This is seen again in their Lunch Specials.  Even void of the HH/Lunch pricing, they are still creating some wonderfully balanced and fairly inspired dishes though.  

I always check out the specials board when entering Soho as some of my favorite dishes have come from there.  Their signature dish is a Yellowtail Sashimi that comes with  a slice of Tempura Jalapeno, some Micro Cilantro, and is finished with Garlic Oil & Yuzu Soy.  It has quickly become a Soho classic and elevates the Yellowtail without distracting from the fish.  In fact their have been multiple moments that my tongue has longed...yearned...I don't know...maybe lusted for a little tempura jalapeno slice.  This can sometimes be awkward when it happens during the day and excessive amounts of salivation is accompanied.  It can be easily avoided with fairly regular visits however.

I am also a fan of their Tostadas...they make for a well composed bite (or two) and come in multiple offerings.  Their are plenty of other tasty options including Hydro Bibb Black Cod, Blue Fin Tuna Specials, and Ocean Trout Specials.  The later two of which also work well simply as Nigiri.
This place is awesome!  A must visit if you are in Vegas. The best sushi I've ever had. Wait staff was top notch. My only complaint is that our table was wobbly.

Best HH spot for sushi. The $1 sushi tostadas-octopus, yellowtail, tuna poke, and salmon are a steal! Also, love the fried baby octopus with what tasted like a curry aioli (guessing the dip). The miso black cod in lettuce wraps were good but it was a tease with the small piece of fish. All compliment well with the $3 Asahi draft beer.

Being the fat asses we are when it comes to sushi, we had ordered the non HH items too - ivory salmon, yellowtail yuzu, scallop sashimi, and uni duo which comes with two different types of uni. The sashimi didn't disappoint! The Santa Barbara uni is incredible! The best I've had so far in Vegas. The Catalina uni was OK but that's just a matter of personal preference. Pretty much all of the dishes I've had there were excellent and fresh.

The servers there are also nice and welcoming which makes this place rock even more!
This is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. The quality is incredible. Chef Tae is the best!

I can't describe how much I love the restaurant. if you have never been here, I feel sorry for you! I think their dishes is just amazing. Even bite is a pleasure! The waitress are very nice and sweet, making me feel like friends! I want to try all their dishes, they never let me down! The oyster is really good! The uni duo is really good, my mouth watering all the time when I thinking about it! Try the restaurant and you just can't stop coming back!
The sashimi lunch special is a great deal. The sashimi quality were very good. The hamachi kama was of high quality too. This place rock. Will definitely be back for other dishes...
Delicious food, great service and a nice gift of yellowtail sashimi from the chef that was awesome! Definitely will come back next time we're in the area

Not like any other place where they would treat you horribly when it come's to happy hour, they take time for garnishing, the chef is actually there to prepare your food, big slice sashimi, rice is not falling apart, nori is crisp to the bite, miso soup is tasty!

Awesome happy hour! Reservations are key! Great food at great prices! Service is outstanding and fast too! They actually have enough staff who work like a team and always clearing the table or asking if we needed anything. Favorites were the Ikura sashimi and salmon yuzu! Highly recommended!

They have an amazing drinks and hot foods Happy Hour menu!!  
HH is Monday-Saturday from 4pm-6pm. 

We ordered the following from the HH menu:
-Bacon wrapped Kurobuta Sausages ($5)
-Hydro Bibb Black Cod ($4)
-Salmon Avocado Roll ($4)
-Ika Geso (fried squid) ($4)
-Jalapeno poppers ($5)

We enjoyed everything but my favorite was the Ika Geso (fried squid)!  It was warm and crispy when it arrived and the aioli dip was a great compliment to the dish. What an amazing price too!

Another dish we enjoyed very much was the yellowtail sashimi drizzled with yuzu soy.  The fish was fresh and the sauce was refreshing. It was $12 for 6 pieces - a great value!

Since we saved so much on the other items, we decided to splurge on the Hokkaido uni sushi ($16 for two pieces).  It was delicious!  The uni was creamy and very fresh!

Reservations are highly recommended!

They have flat screen tvs and they were showing football when we were there. 

The service is 5 STARS!!

Plenty of parking in the shared lot.

This is the best Japanese restaurant I have ever visited and I have been to plenty.  Everything we have ever ordered is always delicious and never lacking in flavor.  The service is impeccable!  Even the head chef came over and provided us with one of his amazing creations.  I can't say enough good things about this place.  Come and you won't regret it.
Reasonable price for Japanese. I ordered the hamachi, did not do the magic for me. But everything else is good. Will come back for other dishes.

The miso cod makes me realize so much why I don't like cooking fish at home.  I can never time the cooking so perfectly, and this is a great example of the perfect fish.  Not a second overdone, best dish on the menu.  It's a little pricier than the $2 tostadas, but so darn good!!!

The second stand out for me was the cajun albacore plate.  

Great addition to the southwest. All the staff is very attentive.

Outstanding freshness and a non typical selection of rolls and flavors. They also have a tasty saki selection and excellent edimami.  The staff was friendly and efficient. Holds up well to the finest competition out there. All in all, we look forward to our next visit as we are avid sushi eaters and it's so nice to have a variety of choices.
We absolutely loved this place, delicious sushi, very inexpensive for happy hour,  lots of stuff on the menu, we will definitely go back, it's our new favorite happy hour place.

The server recommendations are amazing and the hospitality is incomparable! The yellowtail is definitely a must try! The ambience is well polished with a clean atmosphere, appropriate music levels and unrivaled presentation!

We've been here a few times. My favorite thing to order here is the Hamachi Kama. Cooked to perfection paired with some white rice. Their happy hour menu has some of my favorite things. Poki Tostadas and Baked mussels. The baked mussels here taste so fresh compared to other Japanese restaurants I've been to in town. 

It's true what they say, where there is no AYCE sushi, it's gotta be GOOD! 

There are so many other things we've had here that all taste amazing, as there are many more we'd love to try in the future.

Their sushi burritos are the perfect size and always hit the spot every time. Quick service. Helpful. Always great food. It would be awesome if the Sahara location was much bigger so more people could stay and eat but it's still great food.

YELP nailed the recommendation on Soho.  I'd never sought out Yelp's Top100 list but experiencing Soho is going to help lift this ignorance.  Soho lovingly shares some of the best sashimi and other japanese treats I've enjoyed anywhere in the world.  In a strip mall.  Even our cabbie who's been in Las Vegas for ten years didn't know about it.  

I'm going to tell everyone I know about Soho to and beyond the point of being obnoxious, it's that good.  I don't like Las Vegas, but I'm going to make sure my whole family comes here just to go to Soho.  It's that good.

The service was fantastic - thanks Sheila!  You can tell the whole team is having a good time with this project.  It's that good. 

The signature hamachi with a light ponzu sauce is a must-have.  As is the garlic softshell crab.  As was the crispy spicy tuna roll.  And don't forget to ask if they have Wagyu when you go.  It's not on the menu, but they did have it and it was heavenly.  I could go on and show what piggly gourmands my business friend Tom and I were, but something should be left to imagingation.  I doubt there is anything less than wonderful on the menu.  It's that good.


There are plenty of excellent dining establishments on the strip, with much fancier decor.  But they don't deliver the quality and the heart and soul like Soho.  Help a cabbie make a fare and go to Soho!    I hope Lake Mead doesn't run dry, just so Soho can stay in business and prosper.  It's that good!  YES IT'S THAT GOOD!!!

I can certainly see why this place is # 3 in Yelps top 100 for 2015.

Service was exceptional, at the same par you'd see at a place costing 5X as much. The staff was quick, helpful, friendly and didn't make us feel rush.

I asked for garlic edamame but instead received some variation of edamame with a really good tangy sauce, definitely wasn't garlic but was really good and the edamame coding was a nice treat.

Was hoping for a fried lobster roll, sadly they didn't serve lobster but instead the waiter recommended a jalapeno roll with crab and cream cheese. Was definitely good and different.

The spicy mayo was a bit off but otherwise good.

If you go for lunch, would definitely recommend the lunch special, really amazing deal.

Overall, one of the better sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, will definitely go back.

Always so delicious. Talk about the freshest sushi in Las Vegas, for a great price too! One of my all time favorite restaurants! 
Service is always impeccable, everyone is so friendly even the sushi chefs and owner!

This is my main sushi spot. I love that this place is not an 'all you can eat place', since I believe that 'all you can eat' places brings the quality of the restaurant and the food down. My custom veggie roll I get every time I go there is always a delightful surprise. I've never had the same veggie roll twice since the chef makes it different each time. The service is also fabulous. My water is constantly being filled (I drink a ton of water) and Sheila (waitress) is very nice and super attentive no matter how busy she is. The only complaint I have about this place is that they are not open on Sundays but other than that, their food is superb.

By far, one of the best sushi restaurants I've been to in my life, which is almost surprising to me as it is no where close to the ocean. The food, decor, and the people make this restaurant very deserving of 5 perfect stars. 

I ordered the soft shell crab roll, but the chef complimentary upgraded it to the spicy version. AMAZING. 

... BUT THE TOSTADA CHIPS. I literally craved it for days after having it. I only had the ahi tuna but I could have had about twenty of those things and it be the only thing I had all day, and I would be completely happy. SO. GOOD.  

It's a little far from the strip, but honestly so worth the visit.

Loved this place. Not like your average Japanese sushi restaurant, dining area is clean dark yet vibrant. Staff are friendly... Food came out fast. Everything we ordered was made with perfection and the plating is beautiful and unique. Sashimi was melt in your mouth buttery goodness yum! I will return for sure

First time here, and so glad we came.  We had a number of different plates, and enjoyed all of them.  Our MOST favorite was the steelhead trout with pop rocks, but other favorites were the sashimi platter, oysters with salmon roe, and the green tea tiramisu.  My wife made me take a bunch of pictures for yelp, since the presentation was so amazing.  Price was about what I expected for a nice sushi restaurant.  Definitely a place to check out.

went to try this restaurant out , ,staff was very friendly and ask how we hear about it .. i said by using yelp.. after a few suggestion  we found the food to be very tasty and great presentation .. in the middle of the meal the owner came over to introduce himself and thank us for coming in.. He then also noticed we ordered mostly tuna so he said how about we try tuna but cooked a different way.. he then made us a small plate to try out. on the house..  found this to be very welcoming and could see the true appreciation of the owner.. will be visiting this place often and telling all my friends to try it out.. also the white peach cold saki was tasty ..

Sushi soho is our new favorite Japanese spots. The service is fabulous. Attentive but not overly so. The owner recognizes you when you walk in. The fish is some of the freshest around to. Love the seared tuna appetizer. They also have soy wrappers for the nori haters among us.
Hands down the best sushi in town! The freshest and tastiest sushi! The SOHO specials cold dishes are to die for! From the yellowtail Yuzu, the seared tuna special to the amazing Cajun albacore!

I love sushi and have traveled all over the country so I've experienced some excellent dishes. However, Soho tops everything. The combination of great tasting food, service and price makes it better than anything I've ever had before.

We visited here for our anniversary. We made a reservation for 8pm as the reviews mentioned that happy hour is always packed. When we arrived we were seated immediately. Our waiter Sheila made a few recommendations and based on the reviews we ordered some of their sashimi speciality dishes. The Golden Ocean Trout and Yellowtail Zuzu Soy were absolutely amazing. We also had some oysters that melted in our mouths like butter. Sheila made our night feel very special and treated us like we were in a five star restaurant.
Soho is definitely going to be on our must-do Vegas list from now on.

This restaurant is outstanding!  The price is unbelievable for the quality!  You will not regret giving this place a visit!  The sushi is fresh...and we've tried most sushi restaurants in there area and the service is fantastic!  I cannot recommend this place enough.

Recommend...try the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy...it's fantastic!

Enjoy!

The quality of the food was fantastic.  We had a few of the specials; the sashimi was a plate of various types of fish.  The tuna was superb.  There were mini crabs (actually Japanese River Crabs) that we thought were decoration with the platter, but were edible.  

The "worst" thing we had was the Rock Shrimp Tempura.  They were quite good, but similar to popcorn shrimp you'd get at Applebees/TGIFridays/etc.  

I really enjoyed the Crispy Tuna Roll - literally crunchy/fried rice under the fish.  

The prices are closer to what you'd see on the Strip than locally, but the quality is at least as good as anywhere on the Strip, if not better.
Food was very fresh and tasty. The owner personally made a complimentary dish for us to try. Great experience overall.
The fish wasn't fresh, and the servers were a little too enthusiastic..... It isn't authentic Japanese cuisine

Great lunch place! For 9$ you can't beat the taste and quality. Def coming again 
Ordered the sashimi lunch. The lunch comes with 6 pieces of sashimi ( 2 pieces of tuna, 2 of salmon, 2 hamachi) bowl of miso soup, bowl of rice, side salad and this Korean style edamame!! For 5 more bucks you can add either salmon, tuna or hamachi poke. I got the salmon poke. It is sweet and buttery.

AYCE menu was pretty extensive and tasty. The deep eel roll was good. Gyoza was quite salty. The servers were very attentive and always checking to see if we needed more sushi or to refill our drinks. The rolls were really big and filling. The ambiance was beautiful and unexpected for the area. I would recommend this place.

This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant ever and I have been to dozens and dozens!!  Let me tell you all the things I love about them!

1. Their happy hour menu is amazing -- you get all the best things are discounted prices which mean you can order twice as much for the same price!!! Yes!

2. Cajun albacore -- I don't usually eat raw fish but when I do it's only here and it's only Cajun albacore. This comes with this amazing sauce, jalapeños, and is out of this world. Oh and you can order it at happy hour so...score!!!

3. Cucumber sake -- this is the most smooth sake I have ever had and we drank 2 bottles the first time and 2 again ever subsequent time...so try it!!! 

4. Their waitstaff -- they work as a team so you're never waiting or wanting for anything! Someone will be there to refill your water or add to your order without saying "oh let me get your server" I like when people work together. 

5. Sheila's recommendations -- if you aren't sure what to order, ask a server!!! Sheila is my favorite but as I mentioned above, they work together so no one will steer you wrong!!! And if you go often enough they bring you speciality items at no additional cost just because they want you to try something!!!

Quality fresh sashimi!  Ordered the sashimi plate and all cuts were incredibly fresh and delicious. The uni (there are 3 options) was the best I had ever had. This is not a cheap sushi place but you get what you pay for. I also ordered the hamachi Kama which is a limited item. It was huge and also the best I ever had. Best part of the meal was the friendly service. Our waitress made great recommendations and I'm glad I asked her what to order. Louie even offered to give us a ride to our next destination. I can't wait to come back again!

I love this place, amazing Japanese fusion food.
The service is some of the best as well.
My favorite are "beef tataki" and "plum scallop" must try it!

I would go back again!
Excellent food and service! Worth the drive off the strip. Accommodated our party that included 3 toddlers easily. The wait staff had excellent team work, everyone took care of us!

Vegas has so many world renowned chefs with outposts on the Strip that surprisingly, the best sushi in the city might be found off it. Pretty hard for me to believe myself. 

As my friends were spending their money on $35 drinks at a pool/day club on a Saturday afternoon after paying $40 for their ticket to see Alesso, I opted to find a good place to eat by myself. I polled friends on Facebook and got great recommendations like Raku, Sweets Raku, Piero's, L'Atelier by Robuchon, Taste of Siam (I had already been there before), but some of them weren't open for lunch.  I found Soho Restaurant on Yelp, then found that it was also listed as #3 in Yelp blog's top 100 places in the US for 2015.  

I took a seat at the sushi bar. A server and one of the sushi chefs asked what I liked eating. I started with a couple of sashimi plates, added a roll, then finished with live sweet shrimp.

This nerd was really enjoying watching them at work then I spotted that they had uni. The chef asked if I liked sea urchin and explained that they always tried to carry two varieties. I'm savoring my sashimi and a couple of minutes later, the chef places a small plate before me. "Since you like uni, here's some uni with snapper for you to try!" 

As I was finishing up my sashimi plates and about to start on my roll, the chef places another small plate in front of me.

Chef: Do you like beef? Do you eat meat?

Me: Yes, of course, I love beef!

Chef: Ok, good! This is just a little bit of our Wagyu.

I didn't realize what I was eating until I bit in. WAGYU A5! Who gives away Wagyu A5? It was so tender, so fat, so juicy with just a magic dust sprinkle of sea salt. He had just finished prepping some beef dishes and there was an ounce or two left over so I benefited. 

Eventually I finished my roll. I was about full, but was able to squeeze in live sweet shrimp for my last dish, a perfect way to finish it off. 

Yellowtail Yuzu Soy (w/ Tempura Serrano, Micro Cilantro, Garlic Oil, Ponzu, Garlic Dust) - You can't go wrong with any of their sashimi dishes here, but the Yellowtail Yuzu made my mouth feel like a kid at Disneyland. Happy, alive, and full of wonderment. Fresh fish with a citrusy, yuzu ponzu, topped with a deep fried serrano pepper slice. Very tender, crisp, and clean. The tempura serrano made this next level. This was my favorite of the dishes I tried. 

Golden Ocean Trout (w/ Freeze Dried Miso, Chives, Lemon Ponzu, Pop Rocks) - Barely a half-step behind the Yellowtail Yuzu is the Ocean Trout. A bright orange trout (almost looks like salmon), it was an evenly marbled cut that made it slightly buttery. The lemon ponzu and sweet crackling pop rocks was a contrast that complimented everything well. Based on personal preference, you might like this better than the yellowtail. Both are phenomenal.

Santa Barbara Uni with Snapper - My sample plate of this was the same as the regular sashimi dish. The snapper is subtle with allows the fresh, rich uni to shine.

Twin Dragon Dragon Roll (Alaskan King Crab, Spicy Tuna, Avocado, Tempura Shrimp) -  Yes, real Alaskan King Crab. Avocado chunks. All of this good stuff, topped with roe and drizzled with sauce. Loved it.  

Wagyu A5 - Best way to describe this dish is to say... Wagyu A5. If you don't know what that means, well, that means baby soft well marbled beef that just melts in your mouth. The way they cooked it was perfect... A simple preparation, medium rare with just a touch of sea salt, allowing nothing to distract me from a gorgeous piece of meat. 

Live Sweet Shrimp (Amaebi) - For my shrimp they used a large, live shrimp, so I'm not sure that it's true amaebi. Smaller amebi that I've had in the past have been sweeter. The single shrimp was prepped three ways for me. They removed the head shell, then cut the head from the body, and then plated the body and while the head was split, half deep fried while the other half was cooked in a miso soup. There is something very pure and primitive about eating something raw minutes after it was alive. Yes, we are a sick peoples, but it's so good.
