Have you ever been to a restaurant for the first time and they give you uni and Wagyu on the house? I'm still in awe. Thanks to John, the sushi chef who helped point me in the right direction and created phenomenal dishes. He was the one that noticed that I was really enjoying my food and gave me more just for the heck of it. I didn't know he was the owner! If you see a guy behind the sushi bar cutting jokes with his staff while making sure the fish aren't alive, that's John. 

Only $48 (before tax and tip) for all of this? If I didn't order the last shrimp, it would have only been $38. This same meal would easily cost you double on the Strip. And they have Happy Hour deals too. Only ten minutes/five miles from the Strip, Soho Restaurant is worth the small detour to have some of the best sushi in the city!

We went here because of the Yelp reviews, and were not disappointed. This place lives up to its 5 star reviews, and then some. Also, very affordable. Sure beats paying 2-3 times that on the strip. Our server, Candice was nothing short of awesome. Smiley, bubbly and friendly, and so very helpful. She knew the menu front to back, and could answer any question with ease. There were four of us, and we ordered a variety of rolls etc. Awesome presentation and everything was oh so good. If you order oysters, the come on a bed of ice backlit with color changing lights buried in the ice. A very cool presentation. When I get back to Vegas, this place is a sure go to place.
Omg amazing. The yellowtail dish is to die for. The service is amazing. I love it here. I could literally live here.

Glad I tried their Twin Dragon Roll. This one is hella awesome, I'm a fan of cream cheese so they put it in with the other stuff. Big portion and never thought I will be full already with just the 3rd or 4th roll. Try it and it's really pretty good, especially when you're really into tempura and avocado!

We were very satisfied with the service everyone I mean everyone was extremely friendly. 

We had called in to make a reservation for our party but only takes reservation for 6 and more we were only 5. We arrived and a young lady had recognized our voice over the phone came over to us and assisted us. 

We asked for recommendations And absolutely every choice was delicious. We can honestly say that it is the best sushi we ever had. 

As we continued to order and order rolls the owner/chef greeted us with the most genuine voice. That meant allot to us.

Amazing fresh sashimi and creative rolls. All the staff and sushi chefs are friendly and will make you something special at request. They have a variety of home made spicy sauces, which can have quite a kick! Prices are very modest for the quality and serving sizes. Overall it's one of the best I've had in quite a while, and I eat sushi all over the world.

We are forever spoiled after being introduced to this place. Our friends brought us here and all other sushi restaurants are a pale comparison. We live in Henderson but will travel just to enjoy the personable chefs, staff and of course the food! If I could give it more stars, I would!

Eureka! I can honestly say that this is one of my top sushi experiences. I am hesitant to rave due to skeptical readers, but while in Las Vegas for work I found this on Yelp and Lord, were we thrilled! We had the Yellowtail appetizer and it was every bit as good as Nobu. The soft shell crab app was outstanding. The fish in general insanely fresh. We probably ordered half of the menu and not only was everything perfect, it was also crazy affordable. It does not get better than this. Go. Now.

Don't be deceived by the strip mall look as you approach this place. The service and quality of food here is MONEY!

I took my typical overly critical Asian mom who has worked in the restaurant business for years and she loved it! 

Any of the cold dishes were amazing my favorite were the white fish and scallops. The black cod and the any of the tostadas are to die for! 

My favorite part of the experience is when the chef brought out the freshest uni I have tasted by far. He was very genuine and his passionate energy is infectious. I will most definitely be back here soon!

A 5-star rated restaurant on Yelp is very hard to come by but leave it to the tourists, or wait, better yet, the locals, to lead you in the right direction when it comes to good food in Vegas. 

Owned by Chef John Lee with his wife who also runs the dining area of the restaurant, the place seems to have something note-worthy going on. The quality of the ingredients they use are phenomenal, not to mention the exceptional freshness and grade of their fish. Like many, I value service that's genuine and efficient as well as a price tag that doesn't break the bank. This place has it all.

ROCK SHRIMP TEMPURA ($9) started off our meal with 3 dipping sauces that accompanied it: wasabi aioli, sweet banana sesame, and garlic ponzu. If there was one dip we fought over who gets to lick the last bit of it, that'll be the sweet banana sesame. 

SNAPPER w/ UNI ($13) initiated our cold sashimi orders. The presentation was so beautiful that all we wanted to do was stare at it. The inevitable was bound to happen and gladly we savored each bite appreciating how the uni did not overpower the snapper. Delicious!

SALMON WASABI CREME ($11) was highly recommended by our server and we took heed since we are big salmon fans. Clean flavors with a climax on the wasabi creme that sang melodiously altogether, this was easily my favorite out of all the sashimi dishes.

YELLOWTAIL YUZU SOY ($12) was served with "compliments of the chef" says our dear server. It was after all one of his most popular dishes and I completely understand why. The tempura serrano, cilantro, garlic oil, ponzu, and garlic dust all worked harmoniously for the benefit of the fish. 

BIG EYE TUNA POKI ($15) which was a special of the evening had a lusciously melt-in-your-mouth texture that only proves how fresh the tuna is. A much bigger portion compared to the sashimi dishes was a plus.

MISO MARINATED BLACK COD ($18) was cooked to perfection and was probably the best thing I ate here. So much for sharing but I'm getting an entree all to myself next time. Buttery yet flaky, black cod to me is the version of a grade-A Wagyu steak in fish.

TUNA TADA ($2) would be poki tuna on a tostada shell topped with avocado and cilantro. The contrasting textures of the crunchy shell to the tenderness of the fish and creaminess of the avocado was superb. For $2 each, can I have one more please? 

SOFT SHELL CRAB ROLL ($9) seemed to be popular but this did not wow me in presentation, however, looks can be deceiving and I'll say it was very good. My daughter will vouch for it, too but I'm sure the spicy version of this is much better.

FIRE CRACKER ROLL ($9) was my least favorite as it had cream cheese in it. Not their fault, just my preference. This had spicy tuna, jalapeno, cream cheese, sweet onion, then deep fried. Everyone else enjoyed it.   

TWIN DRAGON ROLL ($15) won me over despite how stuffed I already was at this point. All the dishes we shared between 4 people but we all can't deny this roll was truly something with Alaskan King crab, spicy tuna, avocado, and tempura shrimp. Without a doubt this was the best out of the three rolls we had.

MATCHA TIRAMISU ($7) ended our meal with a sweet note. Green tea soaked sponge cake and matcha sabayon topped with whipped cream were all there was to it but let your imagination run wild as to how heavenly scrumptious this really was. 

Leaving us with a lasting impression, this entire meal kicked-off our weekend in Vegas with a bang!

We went to dinner during happy hour (4-7!), on Tuesday & liked it so much we went back again Wednesday!
First evening I had the Angus sliders off the $5.00 happy hour and with an order of fries I was quite full. 
The waitress gave us a side order of salmon sashimi that was wonderful, so sure enough, we wound up getting 2 orders the next night.
I thought the fries, egg, and oxtail was especially different and well done.
The prices are very good, service is very good considering they were packed on a Wednesday evening, and all the servers are wonderful!
I would definitely bring out of town guests here. They turned me into a sushi lover - in part because you know the fish will be fresh and because the staff is so knowledgeable.

O man, this is an amazing find when I'm visiting Vegas. I came in during a lunch rush, about 10 minutes after they had opened. The place was already filled with people but they seated us right away. No waiting :-). The hostess was quick with bringing us water and the waiter came to ask what we wanted. I told my sister about their awesome lunch special so we didn't take long deciding what we wanted. I ordered the lunch sashimi and she ordered the lunch sushi. Its a nice spacious restaurant and can fit a good deal of people. There's no fancy decoration but it was simple and all about the fish. Next time we might sit by the bar to meet the owner! 

Sushi special: You definitely get your moneys worth!!! Cucumber, salad, miso, and fish for $8.50?! The quality of fish was really good, though I didn't care for the tuna. Miso soup was better than expected, full of flavor and.... TOFU! Most places skimp out on this and it's quite disappointing. The salad dressing was decent and the cucumber I ate in between to cleanse my palette. Out of all the fishes that they plated for the special I didn't care for tuna it the rest just melted in my mouth. Weird to say about fish. 

I ordered a beef appetizer the one with pineapple (forgot it's name) since I remembered I enjoyed it a great deal during my first dining experience here. 10 minutes later our waiter Charles told us there wasn't enough to make a plate and I was extremely disappointed. He definitely made it up to us and made my experience a happier one :-)

Yellow tail... O my. It's just as I remembered the first time refreshingly tangy! Of course delicious! This is an absolute must when coming here, the fried jalapeño gives its an amazing crunchy texture.

Considering how busy it was with two waiters the service was excellent. Charles was great and sweet! As we were leaving he opened the door for us :-) we definitely felt pampered during this visit. 

Probably won't stay a secret for long so go give it a try.

I was so excited to try Soho but like all things approached with high expectations, there is room for let downs.  First let me say that I enjoyed everything - from the comfy chairs to the friendly service to the quality of food.  It's great all around.  The kitchen is even willing to cater to your specific needs, even if it is off menu.  I love this kind of accommodation.  As for the food, there were some hits and misses.  Sorry I forgot to take a photo of my chicken katsu lunch seto box and shrimp tempura, but these were the items I was quite disappointed with.  The breading on the tempura wasn't great, as well as the chicken katsu.  It was dry and the coating didn't stick very well.  The miso soup had great flavor but was extremely salty (and I have a salty palette).  

The exceptional items were the green tea tiramisu (although I wish it was served more chilled) and the sushi which had good quality fish and great ratio of fish to the rice.  The Cajun albacore sashimi was also of good quality, but the sauce I didn't enjoy very much.  I think it would appeal to folks who love fusion ingredients and sauces in their sushi.  I prefer more traditional flavors.  If you love fusion sushi, you will adore this place.  And if you are more of a sushi conservative, I'm pretty sure you can still get what you want if you ask them to make it.

I'm being honest here, don't hurt me, okay?  The food here has been consistently good the couple of times I've dined here with my wife but in terms of value for the money, it's not there.   When I leave similar Japanese restaurants and paying similar prices, other places have me going, "Wow.  That was really good... AND I got my money's worth."   Not really the case here.  

In addition, there has not been any 'stand out' dish for me.  The sake (salmon) and the hamachi were pretty good but they won't make you go "DAMN!" like Yonaka's sake orenji or Sakana's hamachi sashimi might make you involuntarily do.  Their oyster selection is pretty limited and more pricey than Other Mama's superior selection in both taste and price.  

The free-range boneless grilled sliced chicken we had for dinner this time around was nowhere near as good as the short rib we've had in the past.  The chicken and the dipping sauce was fine and came with just a side of broccoli drizzled in ponzu sauce.  Strikingly a plain dish for such a well-rated restaurant.

I will give it to them that their service was quick and the food came almost as soon as we ordered.  With similar establishments doing what they do and better though, I think Soho needs to revisit their menu and step it up or else fall behind to some rising establishments.
Great food & great service. Happy hour can get (understandably) busy. Creative and fun menu, and everything we tried was delicious.

A-ma-zing!!! I was a part of a group of people shipped in to help open a certain big blue box furniture store. We were constantly on the hunt for a good happy hour that had good food, good drinks, and strong prices. One day, we stumbled upon this place. We actually ended up visiting three times during the three weeks we were in town! 
The first time was just for happy hour. The food and drinks were great! Favorites were the carpaccio and the bronze broccoli. 
The second time we went for someone's birthday. They recognized us from the first time and the birthday boy got a free dessert! The service was just as good as the first time, if not better!
The third time however took the cake. There for another birthday, we were immediately welcomed with appetizers when we sat down. After we had ordered, they brought out a complimentary bottle of sake. The waiter explained the flavor and we cheersed for the birthday boy. When our food came out, the house actually gave us two plates of their specialty - yellowtail with ponzu and other garnishes. Amazing! The birthday boy also got a free dessert. 
Yes the goodies were nice, but it really was the true prices, incredible hospitality, and quality of the food that made this place so special. 
If you go here expecting special treatment and freebies, don't. We had really connected with the team since we ended up having repeat visits multiple times within a week and a half. If you go here expecting good food, good prices, and great service, then you won't be disappointed.

Fresh, friendly, affordable, amazing place.  Everything I tried was different and tasty.  They have really large $8.50 lunch specials until 4 and an amazing happy hour from 4-6.  Big sake selection, new creations, definatley no the typical cookie-cutter Vegas all-you-can-eat place that we have so many of.  Desserts were also homemade, fresh, and better than anything I've had on the strip.  I can't wait to go back and try some more.

Always an awesome experience at Soho! The quality of the Sushi is very obvious and the service is always friendly and helpful. John the owner is a great host and fantastic chef! This is my daughters and mine favorite place when she visits from college.

Great food, great service!  If you do not like raw fish, you might want to go somewhere else.  This has got to be some of the freshest fish I have ever tasted.  Everything was so good.  We ordered a sashimi special and it was amazing.  The owner came over and asked how everything was and then offered a sample of a dish he recommended.  I can't remember what it was, but it was delicious as well.  Although it wasn't on the menu, I ordered an eel roll.  If you don't see something on the menu, just ask, they may have it!  The eel was so awesome!  Usually when I order eel, it is tough and has tiny little bones.  Well, this eel practically melted in my mouth, no joke!  I summoned the owner over and he asked how everything was and I asked him how his eel was so good, while others were not.  Apparently they only use a certain part of the eel if I remember correctly.  A tad pricey, but this is not your standard cheap sushi, IMO. If you want quality you can taste, come here!

I love soho! I have  tried most of the menu and everything is delicious! Also their entire staff is super sweet! 
Soho has a great happy hour!
Best Sushi ever!!! And everyone makes you feel welcome! Want good sushi? Come here! Trust me you wont regret it and I dont even like fish, but I like sushi now!

Best happy hour in town! We came here to visit family and man was the food and atmosphere great! The menu for happy hour was amazing! Kalbi, sushi, and more for $5! The food was fresh and delicious and we will absolutely be returning on a recurring basis!
We tried the Chef's sampling in our group. Chef John Lee WOW us with his favorites in presentation and taste. Five star from our group. Highly recommend this fusion Japanese restaurant.
Really fresh, incredible fish and great service for a very reasonable price. By far my favorite sushi joint in Vegas.

After picking up my Bay Area friends, one of them recommended we try this place out. It was the best way to start off an epic Vegas weekend. There is plenty of parking in the plaza, although some of it wasn't shaded. The dining area and restrooms were clean and well maintained. 

We decided to start things off with a couple of appetizers. I highly recommend the Ahi tuna tostada ($1 during happy hour). The fish tasted very fresh and overall the crunchiness of it topped it off. All of the rolls and sashimi were all fresh and presented in a beautiful fashion. I highly recommend the yellow tail! 

The service here was great. Our waitress was very kind and conversed with us about our upcoming weekend. We also got to meet the owner of the place and gave us a free bottle of sake! It was the best way to start off and epic weekend! Although it is a bit far from the strip, I will definitely go back to this place everytime I go to Vegas!

Overall very good place and highly recommended.

Very good service, very reasonable price and high quality food with great presentation. We ordered the tempera shrimp roll, fire cracker roll, seaweed salad, dumpling, yellow tail sashimi, miso cod and vanilla bean creme brulee. The creme brulee is excellent, aromatic, creamy and well balanced sweet. The cod has good texture, tender, juicy and flaky. But I may want it to be less salty though. My friend had the rolls and the salad. I like the salad tastes very fresh probably enlightened from the vinegar. I am not big fan of sushi or sashimi. But my friend liked them a lot as well.

The manager is very friendly and attentive. He stopped by our table to make sure we are satisfied with our food and send us complimentary fish items for both times we visited. It seems he stops by every table at appropriate times. He waved to us from inside the open kitchen when we left as well.

Such a quality experience for the price. It's incredible. The food is delicious and fresh, it tastes as good as it looks! We had crispy tuna, beef tataki, a special screaming orgasm (not on the menu) and edamame. They split a chicken dish for our children and the plates were presented beautifully. Their hot tea is to die for, the staff was very attentive and they made my family feel very welcome. Overall one of the better dining experiences we have had in some time. This is a hidden gem.

It honestly is very good fresh Japanese food but overpriced I feel for the items.  Pictures show the type of quality that it has. I was quite impressed being that I am not much of fan for a raw food. The urchin was a little bit grainy but other than that I don't really have much complaints with any of the selections. 

The green tea cream Brulé and  green tea tiramisu were interesting. I probably would not order tiramisu again because it tasted just like a sponge cake. 

The total for all the items easily came to $125. And that's really to feed only three adults and oh a Bento box for the kids. I was very impressed with the salmon. Very soft n moist.

Definitely the best sushi spot in Las Vegas. The variety of fish is fantastic, the cuts and rolls are great and the prices are amazing as well! the sushi chefs and staff are ready to have a good time with you as well... they were pouring sake like there was no tomorrow! :) 
Definitely will return here again and again.
Hands down the best Sushi Restaurant I've been to in the last couple years.  Food, perfect.  Staff amazing.  I'm not sure that anything else I say will improve this review.  Outstanding.

Recently came here for happy hour early dinner from a trip to Vegas.  This located outside the city and is in suburban area.  This I believe was one of the highest yelp rated restaurant in vegas.  

It wasn't that busy and there were no wait.  There's little bit of wait after happy hour.  During happy hour most item there are round $5 and has alcohol drink as well.  I don't think this place is japanese owned but korean.  Food quality is good in most part.  My favorite thing was the baked mussels, those are fresly cook and very delicious.  The salmon avocado sushi roll was pretty good as well.  Other item I try was just mediocre, the sashimi one wasn't that good.  Overall is pretty good but just little bit you can get ayce all over vegas...
Love sushi and visited a lot of sushi restaurants. So far Soho is the best! My favorite is Sunny Salmon Rolls. Really like the service too. Servers are awesome!

Another five star review for this place! Service is amazing. Food is amazing. Happy Hour prices are amazing. There is usually a wait so be prepared if you are coming during peak dinner hours. We got there about 30 minutes before happy hour ended and had to wait 20 minutes for a table. They said they would honor happy hour for all waiting. That was awesome!

Forget the sushi on the strip. Come here instead. Seriously. 

Met some friends here for lunch. Delicious. Great service too. They even gave us a complimentary dish for no reason. Sweet!

This place is far from the strip but if you have a vehicle, go here and eat. It is reasonably priced compared to anything you can find in the tourist zone. It is in an unassuming strip mall, but your gps will find it for you. What are you waiting for? Go.

We celebrated my birthday here last week and I think I found a new sushi place that I love.  The server was very informative and explained how the menu worked and recommended some good choices.  He even had us try some Uni which I'm not a fan because I've had a bad experience and what he gave us was actually good. I think I'll be coming here from now just to have their Uni.  LOL.  The owner was very nice and came to introduce himself to us and even got me a free dessert.  I'm in love with their Green tea creme brulee.  I had a great experience trying what they had to offer.  Will definitely be back.  I love sushi and sashimi and I usually crave it every week.   They offered more of sashimi like dishes which is great since I usually order only nigiri and prefer sashimi since I don't really care for sushi rice.  I'll be back soon.
I love this place.  They have the best lunch specials.  If you are looking for a place with fresh sushi you wont be disappointed.
This is the best restaurant! Everything thing is amazing. Even the chicken bento box for lunch, the best chicken I have had. Amazing sushi and atmosphere. We go once a week

Delicious fresh fish! A must in Vegas!!!  Best sushi and sashimi in Vegas hands down! Yellowtail  is amazing! Sheila was wonderful! She even got my hubby to try sashimi and he loved it! The staff here works so cooperatively together  and that makes it such a pleasant  atmosphere!

Great lunch spot. Not your typical "we look like a Japanese restaurant". From the outside, you would not know its a great place.  Food is fresh, service is good and the rolls are tasty. Nothing super special, pretty standard fair with a large menu.
Been back a couple more times and im spoiled, we always compare eating places to soho and really there is no comparison!

I came here twice, both for the happy hour. The happy hour menu was extensive! 

-Salmon Avocado Roll: delicious, classic roll!
-Chicken Karage: tasty, crispy and sauce was good
-Salmon Carpaccio: fresh and tasty
-FireCracker Roll: deep fried, spicy, and tasty

I enjoyed both times! Will definitely be back here again!

If you're a fan of modern Japanese -- the kind that Nobu made popular and places like Social House reimagined -- you'll love the food at Soho. The chef owner is the former executive chef at Social House and has brought his fusion-style of cooking to the 'burbs. That means Strip-quality food at off-Strip prices.

The strip mall location is nothing special and the interior is quaint and understated. But, it's the food that shines at this restaurant. You can't go wrong with the yellowtail yuzu soy ($10), tuna or hamachi tostadas ($2 ea.), or the angus gyoza ($5). The miso marinated black cod ($18) is as good as any I've had on or around the Strip (including the one at Nobu).

The variety of rolls may be limited, but the quality and execution is solid. This is not an all you can eat place, so expect to spend a little more for a higher end product.

The subtle sweetness and silky creaminess of the vanilla creme brulee ($5) was a great way to end the meal. If chocolate is your thing, try the chocolate mousse ($7). It's the perfect balance of sweet and bitter chocolate with cocoa crumbles and cookie pieces to add variety in texture.

The chef/owner stopped by to chat, which is always a nice touch to show that he cares about the diner's experience. With beautifully presented and well crafted food, Soho is a welcome addition to the local scene. For people on a budget, like myself, it's just another reason to dine in the 'burbs instead of the Strip.

Can I just say what a fabulous little hidden gem. I felt like I almost ate everything off the menu. Next time I'll have to get dessert, just too stuffed this time.
We started with the yellowtail, salmon and scallop sashimi. All were wonderfully seasoned, but my absolute favorite was the melt in your mouth yellowtail and salmon.
Sushi that we chose were the Spicy soft shell crab and the Twin Dragon, both delicious.
The main entrées we ordered were the jidori chicken, miso cod and the short rib. I have to say all were fantastic as well, but the short rib... OMG!!
The service was superb and we were able to meet Chef and owner who was the executive chef at Social House in Crystals. We were also surprised with the beef tataki compliments of the Chef. Simply amazing dinner and restaurant. On top of that, the live music was very entertaining. We'll definitely be back and what's great is it's just down the street from where we live :)

If you haven't tried this place yet... what are you waiting for?!? Seriously the food is amazing. The fish is super fresh and the service is incredible. Great for a casual date. Great for lunch. Good portion size. Worth the money. Seriously you need to try this place.

Today I had their California roll BOMB!
their rainbow roll DELISH! !
And their salmon sashimi was the bomb. The fish melts in your mouth. Its just incredible. You have to go here. So recommended!

Second time coming to SoHo and this place is amazing!

Service is awesome the team really works well together and the chefs are awesome.

Very very knowledgable staff.

Food is delicious. My favorite sushi spot in Vegas hands down! If you want sushi and or Japanese food don't settle for anywhere else. Make the drive no matter where you are you will not regret it.

The Yellow tail yuzu sashimi is the best I've had.

The lunch specials and happy hour are AWESOME!

Just met the chef and owner and you can see the passion he has for his restaurant. 

I don't think I'd go anywhere else.
Awesome service. Best sushi ever, especially the sashimi. Fresh and scrumptious. Dessert was heavenly. Can't wait to come back.
You guys are SO good!! SO yummy! And SO nice!! Lol first time ever having a sushi burrito and now I am HOOKED! I will be back at least once a month!! Plus your boba teas are BOMB!!

If you're looking for fresh and delicious sushi in the area, this place is a must-try. The service is great from the servers to the chefs. Happy hour is the best time to go, they have great full sized rolls for half price. I personally really loved the firecracker roll!

Great food and prices! This places wasn't much to look at from the outside, but the food and service was wonderful. 

I visited Soho for lunch with some locals, and was impressed by the quality of the food. The prices were amazing too. You can get a fantastic lunch for under $9, and that comes with salad, soup, and rice - on top of the main course. 

I had the miso black cod on lettuce, and it was buttery and delicious. My friend had tuna tartare on wonton chips, and she loved it. They also gave us generous pours of wine, so that's a plus.

I would definitely recommend this place, especially if you are visiting from out of town. It's a nice break from the craziness and high prices of the Strip. This'll be on my to-do list if I visit Vegas again.
I went to this location a while back. I honestly enjoyed the food service and walked out. Very happy customer

I felt like I crossed the desert to get here, (ok, so it was only nine miles) but it was totally worth it. Best red snapper sushi ever! I asked for it to be drizzled with the magical juice of the yuzu fruit which is produced by unicorns.

I had lunch at Soho Japanese Restaurant and i was impressed! It's a GEM in southwest !! go go southwest businesses!!!

Location is Warm Springs and Jones right next to the Chevron. Parking lot was full! (chinese, bar, subway in same lot)
Service was excellent, dishes beautifully decorated, very tasty!
My favorite was the Salmon Carpaccio and the Black Truffle seared tuna! The presentation of each dish was very elegant, topped with petals of flowers or young sprouts : art work!
The restaurant was full (lunch time)
I highly recommend this Japanese :-) You won't like it you will LOVE IT

Let me start off by saying from now on, this is one of my top 5 Japanese restaurants in Vegas. My gf and I have been planning to try this place out for awhile now and we're glad we finally did. If you go here, you definitely have to order: the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, King Crab Tempura, and Snapper with Uni. The king crab tempura is hella legit, and it comes with this delicious sauce. The snapper with Uni is definitely A MUST, probably the best thing on the menu for me. I've had bad experiences with uni before, but after hearing people tell me fresh uni is actually "sweet", I just had to give it a try. THAT UNI WAS SWEET AF. The service was amazing as well, our server Candice was on top of it. She explained the menu thoroughly and was really helpful since it was our first time. Basically, you should go here if you haven't already (:

One of the best Happy Hours in town! I say that when I refer to the quality of the food. This place is no where close to me but the drive there was well worth it!

Happy Hour is from Mon-Sat 4pm-6pm. The HH menu is pretty damn impressive. Prices range from $1-$5. Regular menu prices aren't too bad either. Today I only experienced the HH menu and I couldn't get enough of it.

Infused Cold Sake ($4)- you can choose from Lycee or White Peach Flavored. I went with the Lycee. It was sweet and comes with about 4 shots. When the workers would see your shot glass empty they would fill it for you, which I thought was pretty cool.

Tostadas ($1)- you can choose from Salmon, Tako, Tuna, and Hamachi. These are probably my favorite thing on the menu. I had to order more than one. I couldn't choose which one was my favorite. They're all my favorite! 

Spicy Tuna Roll ($4)- Only item that didn't really stand out. Very plain.

Fire cracker roll ($5)- has spicy tuna with jalapeños, cream cheese, sweet onion & is deep fried! MUST HAVE! It's literally heaven in your mouth. 

Salmon Avocado Roll ($4)- the amount of fish and avocado overpowers the rice which is appreciates. I love when the rice/fish ratio favors the fish! 

Cajun Albacore Sashimi ($5)- the beau's favorite! Had to order more than one. The aioli sauce that it's swimming in is so delicious and the fish is so fresh.

Jalapeño Poppers ($3)- BOMB! 

The owner of the restaurant was kind enough to come say hello to us and see how we liked the food. He even gave us complementary Yellowtail Sashimi which is one of their specialities. Our server, Sheila, was the greatest. Very helpful with the menu and extremely nice. She told us that they just opened 6 months ago and have been extremely busy due to the Yelp community. How amazing is yelp!

We definitely will be returning!

Sad thing is this place actually has decent food,  but the service is what makes them deserve such a low rating.  We arrived at 4:50 with a party of 9, and were told to wait for our table.  Roughly 10 minutes later, when there were at least 5 tables open and only a few with guests we were told "sorry, we have reservations at 6:00, but you can come back in 2 hours at 7:00".  The hostess and Manager poorly dealt with this situation and easily could have sat our party.  They were rude and due to their level of service we will not return.  We left and went to Oyshi sushi, we were promptly sat and funny thing is we were out of there before 6:00.  If I was the owner of this establishment, I would take a deep look into how operations are run and re-evaluate management.  This is a service city, and in the 13 years of living here this was the worst service I have ever seen.  Their current staff is going to run what could be a good local spot into the ground. Best wishes.

Ambiance: Local vibe,...if you live here, you know.
Food: Some of the best sushi I've had yet. I haven't been to Japan FYI...
Cleanliness: VERY CLEAN!!
Service: Was greeted like family and as a frequent traveler, this is important.
Server: Darrell is the type of server every server should hope to be. He is attentive, smart, funny and all about customer service!!

How can you beat a $5 Happy Hour menu, with delicious food and drinks, PLUS a friendly staff!? I come here WAY too much, but I am not ashamed! Keep up what you guys are doing because it is working! I love this place!!
Happy this is my home base sushi spot.  Always friendly staff, good service and quality product without the strip prices.  Don't go anywhere else if you live on the southwest side of town.

What is everyone raving about this place for!? We called on a Saturday evening at 7:30pm and the lady said they didn't have a waiting list nor would reserve a table for us.  They said there "are tables available for walk-in." We drove from east Henderson (with toddler in tote) and arrived 20mins later and were told it's a 45mins wait with 5 people waiting to be seated. Ridiculous. With so many sushi restaurants we picked the one with poor customer service and experience. No plans to return or recommend to anyone!

Incredible! Try the Pop Rock trout - sounds insane but is fantastic,

The Yellow tail sashimi with deep fried Jalapenos also super fresh and delicious.

I had the Shrimp tempura - with three dipping sauces to great.

But the highlight for me were the amazing little tostadas - I had a white fish one with Shiso pesto INCREDIBLE

And the shrimp and mango - also perfectly balanced and you just want to order ten more! 

If you're in Vegas check this place out - no ambiance in a shitty little strip mall but SO worth it!

They have a large variety of Sashimi at a really good price.  $25 for a Sashimi platter is definitely a steal, and it comes with 5 kinds of fish, 4 large pieces each.  The Uni trio was good, and my favorite Uni was the Santa Barbara.  I've tried the off the menu Hokaido Uni because my friend knows the owner; but it wasn't that special.

As for the cooked dishes, the Black Cod I ordered was too sweet and not anywhere flakey like Nobu's.

Restaurants like this don't come by very often and don't let the close proximity to the gas station deter you, Soho's owner and chef used to be the executive chef at Social House on the Strip. The restaurant is pretty modest but clean and casual. The menu is imaginative with specials rotating around the freshest seafood. Tried the fresh uni, Hydro Bibb black cod, salmon wasabi cream and green tea tiramisu. Everything was good if not stellar. On one occasion, I ordered an octopus salad, one of their specials of the evening. The server claimed that the octopus was from Spain and that they were testing the dish to see if it should be a mainstay. They were asking for their customer's opinions. The octopus was tender and the vinaigrette was sweet and spicy. In other words, I hope that octopus salad becomes a regular dish.

They also serve affordable lunch specials even during the weekends. At under $9, the sashimi box set is a steal. The restaurant is Strip quality but strip mall affordable. Besides the great food, what really separates Soho from others is the staff who seem genuine and eager to please their customers.

Impossible you say to have 5 stars with so many reviewer and I will tell you this place is the real deal.  It is absolutely that good.  The service, the prices, the FOOD.  We particularly like the yellowtail with yuzu and dragon roll.  The black cod was good but pricey for the amount they gave.  I would recommend the Hamachi Kama.  It was huge and much more worth it.  It is usually very crowded but we got a table at 8:30 p.m with no problem on a Weds night.  Have to try this and definitely get off the strip.  There is so much more to Vegas, baby, yeah!

This was my favorite sushi spot when I ate meat and after yesterday, it's back to being my favorite sushi restaurant as a vegan.  The service was excellent and the crew made sure the rolls they served were vegan.  They really aim to please here.  They try their best to accommodate any type of lifestyle.  The food is great and the people here take the experience to the next level.  

I had two variations of the vegetable rolls.  One had a sweet chili teriyaki with spinach, avocado, and asparagus.  It was pure joy I tell you!  The second had carrot avocado etc with salsa and more spice.  I would definitely get that one again as well.  It reminded me of their pico de gallo tostadas.  

Just typing this review is tempting me to go again today, but I gotta stay strong!  Or do I?

The first time we came here we were starving, and they were full! We didn't have a reservation, and there was 6 of us, so instead of leaving we decided to wait. They were very accommodating. I can't remember our waiters name, but he brought us menus and suggested we order small appetizers while we wait. Since it was our fist time we let him pick everything for us and let me say nothing was disappointing!!!! We started with the chip things (don't remember what it's called) they were amazing! Then we did the cod with lettuce which was also great. The seared tuna special is also really good. My favorite roll was the twin dragon roll! Overall everything he picked for us was so satisfying. You can taste how fresh the fish is which is a huge plus !

Wow! Vegas is just full of wonderful Japanese restaurants! I would have posted a few photos but others have already captured the greatness of this place. Not only is the quality of the sashimi out of this world but the owner is wonderful. We've been here twice and each time he has given us something special from the house to show his gratitude. :) You can't go wrong with anything you order here!

This review for my personal favorite Las Vegas restaurant is long overdue. 

Chef John and staff are doing everything right - fresh fish, amazing sauces that are so thoughtfully executed, all at moderate prices with attentive service. You can find us here at all times of the day. Their lunch menu is affordable and my husband loves their take on hamburger steak + gravy. I love coming in during Happy Hour (4-6pm) and getting a sample of everything. The usual suspects being the tostadas (hamachi being my favorite), shrimp tempura roll, cajun albacore sashimi and the miso cod lettuce wraps. If we're here during dinner, we're getting the short ribs with a side of rice, although the potatoes that come with it are really tasty too. The lobster tempura and  the rock shrimp tempura are not oily and come with really tasty dipping sauces. If you ever want extra of any sauce, don't be shy, the staff is happy to oblige.  

I've never really been too big on raw fish, but Chef John does it right. We've sampled a lot of the other sashimi and fresh fish offerings here, and have yet to be disappointed. Flavors are always complex and we love that Chef John sends us new dishes to try. Even our friends from out of town ventured out to eat here and were really impressed. This place is getting more and more popular, so I would recommend making reservations. 

We also recently dined at Sen of Japan and were very disappointed with the food and experience (should have listened to Antonia R.'s review!). During that meal, all I could think of was how much better the food is at Soho, and how much better value you are getting for your money. Oh well, lesson learned!

Wins:
- Solid Happy Hour offerings
- Food is good
- Quick drive to the airport or rental car drop off
- Friendly staff

Opportunities:
- Decor 
- Table was wobbly 

BLUF: If you want a quick good sushi stop near the airport, Soho is your answer.

wanted something off the strip found this sushi spot. establishment in a plaza, interior is nice and clean. 

had lunch. food is great , fish is excellent quality for the price. service was prompt and quick as well. worth a vist!

Soho is the kind of restaurant we need to see more of.  It reminds me of an informal Yonaka.  Now, you don't have to take that with a grain of salt!  As far as my liking, I am more comfortable and relaxed in a less stuffy atmosphere.  So I mean that utmost positively.  The quality of the meal here itself deserves a 3 piece suit.  

The sashimi is 'to a T' exactly what the other reviewers have wrote about.  Sans repetition, I will agree that the fish is top tier at Soho.  

Cajun Albacore had a mini taste of spice accompanied by a smooth cream and in the middle of it all was the tender melty meat.  Yes.  4/5

The Black Cod luttuce wraps' flavor and texture were delicate, umami & fap worthy. 5/5

[As a test of their standard fare, we ordered a traditional sushi joint roll.]  

The Temura Shrimp Roll came as a surprisingly delectable entree.  I can tell that all the rice I've ever had at all the AYCE sushi restaurants before were done wrong.  No sog and definitely not a bland choice.  Go ahead order one & see for yourself. 4/5

An Uni Tasting Platter of 3 different regions (30$) with 4 pieces of each was the knock out of this lunch!  Santa Barbara was the usual beige toned uni that you may be familiar with.  A bit more sea floor with this one.  Mmm.  The next was the more orange kind (I think it was from Catalina?) This was sweeter & creamier. Mmm.  Last was the real deal from Hokkaido Japan!  It was a darker reddish tone almost blood hue.  They were smaller and slighly undertone flavored.  I think there was some subtle nuances to it that I am not experienced enough to pick up on.  Mmm.  All three of us favored a different region uni.  Heh, different strokes. 500/5

Lastly I'll mention the Tadas.  Ahi & avacado or 3 other assorted chunks atop a light crispy rice flat. Serious twist and seriously good with a silly cheap price.  5/5

If cuisine were music, this Modern Japanese style would be my favorite genre!

Hands down! One of my favorite sushi places in the Las Vegas area besides the spots on the strip. The service is always excellence. I drive from anthem to go eat sushi here. Every friend I bring there, loves it too!

Wow! This place is friggin awesome and I'm not just referring to the prices but the fish grade, presentation and flavor are incredible. I had the 8 course meal: 
1. Snapper
2. Trout
3. Tuna
4. Sea bass lettuce wrap
5. Beef tataki like a short rib?
6. Tuna roll
7. ?
8. Green tea cheesecake + ice cream

Trout was out of this world! Seared tuna ridiculous! Shirt rib so damn good! Tuna roll was spicey and had fried rice (nice twist). Green tea cheesecake mild and surprisingly good.

Highly recommend this to all sushi/shishimi lovers (and I'm not a big sushi fan lol)

This restaurant brings high quality sushi you'd find on the strip to locals at better prices. They do NOT have all you can eat. I recommend coming during lunch time because that's when I feel like I'm getting the most bang for my buck. I get the sashimi lunch which comes with an assortment of sashimi, rice, salad, and miso soup. Anything you order here will be fresh and delicious.
Great sushi the quality here is great. Service is at a good pace. Come for happy hour it's a great deal.

We were in the area shopping and decided to stop by for happy hour. Prices were perfect for happy hour $1-$5 per plate. Great food great service! Sea food was very fresh! The owner was gracious and offered a complimentary sample of special sashimi...very nice and super delicious:) 
Very enjoyable

We're a regular customer here, literally once or twice a week.  The Chef is so friendly he ocassionally offer us "something new to try out for free"

All the stuff are friendly and attentive!

Food is so amazing! We always recommend this place to our friends.. you should try salmon wasabi creme, shrimp tempura roll, and mochi! 

Not to mention the 4 to 6pm happy hour! :)

We originally heard of the SOHO Sushi Burrito restaurant. I have eaten allot of different sushi burrito places but none of them tasted like eating sushi so I was somewhat disappointed. This all changed for me when I ate a sushi burrito at SOHO. The most amazing sushi burrito yet. We asked the workers what makes them different and why is it so good. They told us we have to check out the actual SOHO Sushi restaurant where they make all the sauces. My wife and I had to visit and we were blown away. Chef Aaron took care of us and was just an awesome cool white guy which is unusual for a sushi chef. Great personality and he recommend some sushi that we that had never tried before. I am not surprised very often but flavors and quality of fish were off the charts and different from anywhere we had eaten before. The next time we visited we got a chance to meet Chef John the founder of SOHO. Just a great guy that has really extended his passion and personality to his whole staff and company. Chef Tate also amazing showed us the freshest 40 pounds of tuna just flown in from Japan. We sampled it and so amazing. We are back for the 3rd time and chef Tate is just taking great care of us again. We love to sit at the bar it makes it just so much fun. Thanks guys for great sushi and and even better staff.

What to say? Delicious !! And no need to go to the big casinos overpriced Japanese restaurants! Here I found my sushi place!!!:-) happy!!
Moreover the Chef is a sweetheart : I sat at the bar not far from him and he made me try some extra plates!

We came here on a Saturday night and the service was beyond expectations. They were able to accommodate a party of 10 without any issues and were very kind and considerate. 

We ordered the 20 piece sashimi with a side of sushi rice. We also ordered the pop rock ocean trout, which was true to its name! With the 20 piece sashimi, you can also add in lobster sashimi and a lobster side dish for an additional cost. 

We will need to go back for their happy hour menu!

we tried Soho last week and now this is undoubtedly our favorite neighbourhood restaurant...live music,excellent food and friendly service are the highlights of this place..we tried lychee sake, shrimp and short rib and they were top class...the owner also gave as a free egg rolls which was yummy too...definitely 5 stars from me

The food and quality of the fish is outstanding...I have eaten there a dozen times and never had a bad dish....only negative marks are for the terrible decor...it's borderline unpleasant sitting there at times.

LOVE this place!

Service=5 star
Decor=5 star
Food=5 star

Such a hidden gem in the southwest valley. If you enjoy fresh Japanese food done right, do yourself a favor and check this place out. It's phenomenal.

Oh.  My.  Gosh!  We loved this place.  It's close to home and my bakery, and it's the freshest sushi I've had off-strip, possibly in Vegas period.  The food and rolls were so fresh and flavorful!  I am sad that I'm forgetting the names of the rolls we ordered.  Service is a bit slow, but I can deal with it when the food is this good.  What I LOVE about it is that the owner/chef care SO MUCH about the food!  He came to our table and asked how everything was.  As a small business owner myself, I really respect that...I care a LOT about my clients' opinions and I've been to too many places that don't.  I like that it's open late, as the hubby works nights and we can meet for a bite.
Long. Long waits for empty tables because everything is always "reserved."  Foods not bad,  but not worth the effort ... save yourself the wait and go elsewhere!

I dined here numerous times and every time I go I receive excellent quality food. I also highly recommend the cold white peach sake to try. The staff is very friendly and when I take my friends with me they are amazed by this hidden gem in the Southwest.

Reasonable Prices, Tasty Dishes

The executive chef used to work at social house and borrowed some of the recipes.  The fish tasted fresh and the combinations of flavors worked.  The prices were very reasonable, and the restaurant was causal.  It was a nice location for a first date, and I would go back again.

The food was not worth the wait.  Came here tonight at 5:30 for Happy hours by we did not get seated until after 6pm so we missed it.  Food was Kind of pricey for what you get.  Lunch prices look reasonable.....might come back to try it.
Skilled & friendly staff, amazing raw fish, this place is still a hidden GEM. We asked the chef to pick for us and had a very good dinner at a very good price. Definitely recommended.

Soho is one of the best options for sushi in Las Vegas, easy!!! I wish more people would venture off the strip to locations like this. Easy to access, right off the 215, Soho has never disappointed. If you're a tuna crispy rice (crispy tuna roll here) and yellowtail with ponzu regular at Nobu, Soho's is more than comparable. Also love their rock shrimp tempura and shishitos. 

The stand out here in my opinion is their cold dishes, the first listed on the menu. For Sen regulars, I think this is what puts Soho a step above, as well as the slightly smaller, more digestible menu with all the necessities. I sample several cold dishes (all sashimi style fish) every time I come, either by myself or as share plates with others. The chefs love to experiment and usually always hit the nail, so don't be cautious, I swear they won't disappoint. The yellowtail yuzu and seared garlic tuna are classics, but I'm a stickler for the golden ocean trout and cajun albacore. Last time I had a great dish with truffle too! Wouldn't order it every time, but it was a great change of pace. Ultimately, Soho is worth a trip for locals and tourists alike!

This place is so good. I will be back for sure. If you are looking for a legit Japanese place, it's right here. I wanted to try the sashimi but the platter was too big. So we ended up getting sushi rolls which are good. But our server offered us a sample plate of their sashimi and it was perfect!

This place NEVER disappoints many new items have been added to the menu. 
Chef John creates the best sushi/sashimi plates I have had in town. You must get here early or expect to wait.

Thank you fellow yelpers for leading us to Soho.  They do deserve their 5 stars from the quality of the food to the service.  Our party of four each ordered a lunch special plus some sushi and sashimi to share.  The quality of their food is topnotch.  The sashimi has a "melts-in-your-mouth freshness" I didn't expect in a Japanese restaurant... in the middle of the desert...un-freakin'-believable!

At some point in our meal, the owner/chef came over to introduce himself.  To me, it showed his pride in his restaurant and his concern for his customers.  There was an air of genuineness and sincerity in the gesture that I find admirable. 

We were so happy with the food and service that we thought it couldn't get better than that.  When the check came, we noticed that we weren't charged for the sodas we ordered.  We called it to their attention but were told it was on the house.  Maybe it was because we ordered a lot of food :) Nevertheless, wow!  What a pleasant surprise :)  Soho is really as good as it gets!

Very friendly nice customer service. Everyone welcomed us with a "soho!" We were able to come during the happy hour and ordered a lot off that menu. The fish was very fresh and flavorful.

I would recommend the sunny salmon roll and truffle tempura. Those were my two favorites. We ordered a lot of zesty items like the carpaccio and the mixed seafood tostada which was also tasty. 

Overall a very pleasant experience, deserving of 5/5 stars.
Recommended by my son. Had 8 happy hour dishes and all tasted great. Will definitely come back when we're back in Vegas.

Great time again this afternoon. Soho rocks ... Great sushi,  great prices..the staff is alway super nice and We live to try something new every time we go 
We keep coming back because .....
Soho is So Good!!!

Excellent sushi for a great deal. You can get omakase for any price. My friends and I chose to get $40 omakase and wow we probably got $80 worth. Each of our 8 dishes had at least 6-8 pieces of sashimi. I normally don't get full off sushi, but I did at this place. Everything is fresh, never frozen which was awesome! I definitely recommend this place.

Two favorite dishes were the trout and wasabi salmon. Service was spot on too.

This has been one of my favorite "Non-AYCE" spots for sushi.  They have an exceptional happy hour with food and drink specials.  My job planned my birthday soirée here and it exceeded my expectations. Between the delicious birthday dessert platter and the take home saki I couldn't have asked for a better night out.

Some of the best japanese cuisine on or off-strip. The kitchen staff has a deep and wide history, and I could taste this in the depth of flavor they bring to each dish.  Their lunch prices are ridiculously low, and they might offer the best bento box deal in town.  (Although I don't believe they call it a bento.)  The dinner offering is much more diverse than lunch.  The food is instantly familiar, and the quality of product and preparation is of top-quality.  I can easily see myself taking friends from out of town here instead of bringing them to the strip.

Very good sushi restaurant - 
1 thing I thought was something they need to improve on is - seafood food is tiny - little cups of broth - u have to pour it in a sake style cup and sip - would not repeat 

1 - love the sashimi style plates of fish - try them all , you cannot go wrong - casual atmosphere and something for everyone in case u bring a non Sushi eater - short rib dish is so good !
I'm from Georgia. When I come to Vegas, I get free meals and hotels. But still, I come to SoHo and pay the price because I love their food so much.

I loved the quality of the food. I brought my girlfriend so we can both experience it together for the first and it was just awesome. The staff was very sweet and friendly, they just had an amazing service. Candice was our waitress and she was just fantastic what she does. Thank you!

Service started off slow despite the numerous amount of servers working but once they got our order in, food came out quickly and they checked on us often... however, servers tended to not clear the table after we were done eating and only cleared the table when there was more food coming out. Other than that, no complaints about my dining experience here.

Happy hour here is legit! Rolls are 6-8 pieces and they offer sashimi and carpaccio for only $5. 

Baked mussels: mussels were on the bigger side and I thought they were average. At least they weren't over cooked and super chewy. 

Cajun albacore sashimi: one of my favorite dishes but it seems like they add daikon? on everything and the sauce was a bit too much. Nonetheless, still a good amount and I usually don't like albacore but I enjoyed this dish.

Kalbi ribs: would not order again. It was one rib cut into 4-5 pieces and was a little on the burnt side. Flavor was still good though, but I'd rather buy it at Greenland market and grill it myself.

Ika geso: 3 pieces of grilled squid which my friends enjoyed but I didn't have any. 

Spicy tuna roll: average roll but it was super spicy! My friends can usually handle spicy but they even commented on how it's on the spicier side. 

Crispy Brussels sprouts: would not order again. The Brussels sprout was practically falling apart so we got more leaves than the actual Brussels sprout. I wasn't a fan of the sauce because it was a bit on the sour side and I felt that the sprouts weren't crispy as we had hoped.

Mixed tempura : crispy tempura pieces which came with 2 shrimp tempera and 3 other veggie pieces. The sweet potato piece that I had was still undercooked so it was on the hard side. I probably wouldn't order it again.

Salmon carpaccio: another one of my favorites. 5 pieces of salmon with some toppings and arugula on top. Again, they overdid it with the sauce but luckily the sauce wasn't too overpowering or salty. 

Seafood dynamite roll (with no cream cheese): I think it's a deep fried roll with a ton of daikon and arugula on top. I wasn't a huge fan because I could hardly taste any fish.  Probably will not order again.

Salmon avocado roll: average roll. I think their rolls  are a little smaller than usual rolls but it's because they don't pack on a ton of rice. Salmon to rice ratio was perfect and they didn't skimp on the avocado! 

My friend also tried their uni, 2 big pieces ($10), he said it was one of the best he's had. 

Great place to come for some quality sushi, especially for happy hour!

This is hands down the best Japanese restaurant I have ever been to. We visit Vegas frequently and have been searching for a good spot and here it is. 1200 reviewers can't go wrong. This place is awesome. 

Came here for my birthday at 5pm on a Saturday. We were sat right away, there were a bunch of pre- reserved tables, so it was kind of empty. I'd recommend to make reservations at the bar. The hostess was friendly and fast. She quickly acknowledge everyone who came in. Our server, Gabriel was on it. He was quick to service us, on top of it, and even brought me treats for my birthday. He even had a shot with us. Happy our is bomb here. We tried J-pop cider, Sapporo tap, lychee sake, mango sake and some other yummy drinks I can't remember. Lol.

The happy hour food was amazing! It wasn't the typical roll sushi, it was quality appetizers and rolls. We enjoyed the brusselsprouts, spicy tuna dip, tostada dip, spider roll. 

For my birthday they surprised me with 3 Mochi ice cream flavors and yummy green tea cheese cake.

I highly recommend this place when you are in Vegas, very convenient if you are in South West area of Vegas. .

Thank you SoHo for making my birthday wonderful!!
Hands down my favorite sushi restaurant! Service is impeccable, fish is so fresh, great variety on happy hour menu, and fun environment. Recommend making reservations...they do get busy!

I've probably been here a dozen times and never disappoints. I've brought so many of my friends and colleagues and they've also returned. Quality of the food is amazing and you can't beat the price! Must order the "Tadas" during happy hour they're only $1 and man, do they pack on the fish!! I love this place and can't say one bad thing about it. Definitely a 5 star FORSURE!

3.5 stars. argh i wish i could give half stars. fine, i'll round up to avoid being burned at the stake by irate fellow yelpers. oh yelp. yet another sushi restaurant that is overrated. don't get me wrong, soho is decent. the service is very good, and very efficient. the fish is fresh, no doubt, so that's a huge plus. but there were definite missteps. also, they have raised their prices when compared to menu pictures on yelp from a year ago, so now it's only minimally less expensive than most sushi places in LA.

you know how shishito peppers are like a game of russian roulette? most of them are blanks, but approximately one out of every five is like someone snuck a ghost chili pepper in there to screw with you? these were all like ghost chili peppers. i nearly died.

4 glasses of water later, the golden ocean trout (pop rocks! love them!), kumamoto oyster with uni and salmon roe, and angus tataki were the highlights of the night. the tuna and salmon tadas were really tasty as well. 

the miso black cod was a huge disappointment. it was overly sweet and not at all flaky like at nobu. it was actually rubbery and kind of chewy. even my non-foodie bf was like, aw hell no this is wack. 

the rock shrimp tempura was ok, nothing special. i've definitely had better.

finally, the cajun albacore roll was my least favorite dish of the night. the combination of flavors was confusing and just not good.

overall cost was $114 for two including a couple drinks but not including tip. i think the sashimi platter here is probably a good deal since the fish is quite fresh, but unfortunately we didn't order that. there are definitely better places that cost less though (sugarfish! robata jinya! oh wait those are in another state). i guess if you're in vegas it doesn't hurt to try this place out.

The place was clean and service was pretty good.  They were busy on a Friday night.
The soft shell crab was great.  The Uni was sublime very fresh. The owner paid us a visit at our table at the end of the night and was very pleasant and upbeat and even gave us a free dish to try.  Fresh fish!! I will be back

I saw all the reviews on yelp and had to see what all the rave was about. Excellent customer service, great food, abs they even comped us a dish they wanted us to try. The chef came around and greeted us and made for an entertaining dinner. 

All the food we ordered was delicious. The short rib was nice and tender, as was the steak. Sashimi was fresh and perfectly cut, and the wasabi was also good too. The fried foods we ordered were also clean - not greasy at all.

I picked this restaurant because Yelp said it was wheelchair accessible and on that point-- it really isn't. My mom's wheelchair is the narrow kind as she is a petite lady and we had trouble getting to our table without having to ask every one to scoot in a bit. Plus the bathroom in the women's room-- well it's bigger and has safety bars, but accessible it ain't. I had to leave mom's wheelchair outside of the stall in order to her situated. I don't think the restaurant says they are wheelchair accessible-- yelp does, so no knock on Soho for that.

I really enjoyed my meal so I would come back-- just not with my mom unfortunately. The sushi pieces were huge, but not obscenely so (you know those places) and well priced. We went for the Uni Duo and wow, that was worth it. Other than sushi we got a beef tostada that was really delicious and had great texture (although a little heat would have been nice!), and my husband really enjoyed his yakitori. Service was friendly when we could get it. May go back for a date night with the hubs and just sit at the counter.

To summarize: not wheelchair friendly especially if you need to use the premises' bathroom, & sushi was fresh, well priced, and well portioned.

I would live in Vegas just to be a regular here!!! Came for my girlfriends birthday and was blown away dish after dish. We ordered a total of 10 items plus two desserts were free! 

Normally I take pictures of everything but around the third dish I completely forgot and was fixated on eating! This is a must try for sushi lovers!!! 

TIP: Make a reservation! This place is packed!

I waited till my second visit to rate Soho 5 stars after having dinner and their happy hour.

Chef John literally delivers a strip-like Social House experience for a fraction of the price in a neighborhood setting.  A well-known friend chef of mine not to be named told me they took almost the entire menu and brought it to Soho - he frowned a little upon this but I have no issues with it.  The locals benefit from it and they put out one of the best happy hours in town.

The dollar tostastas are so addicting.   I feel like a child ordering 6 and 12 pack taco's from Taco Bell but this is obv much more refined, elevated cuisine.  My favorite is the salmon tostata but they are all good.  We got one of each as they offer 4 selections.   The rest of the happy hour has a cajun albacore sashimi, black cod lettuce wraps (YUM), and several roll selections.   The rice on the rolls were a little under seasoned but overall everything was good.  The waiter recommended the bacon wrapped kurobata sausages.  They reminded me of little smokey's.   I wasn't a fan at first but it was greatt paired with the pickled cucumber.  The rest of the HH items are all priced between $3-5 per item.  

As for dinner, I came on another trip and i was really impressed with their beef tataki.  It's 100 times better than Tonkatsu Kiyoshi's version and a level or too better than Kyara's.   I love their ocean trout topped with rock salt - love the textures and freshness of the dish.   We also ordered the beef short ribs, a Yelp favorite, live uni, oysters, and on my most recent trip i sampled their king crab topped with a little butter and hint of garlic.

Everything here is great!  For dinner you won't find your yum yum roll here - This is more about the fish.  Chef John says that he gets his fish from the same supplier as most of the sushi spots on the strip so you literally are paying a fraction of what you would at Social House!

Soho was suggested to me by a coworker who loves sushi and I had drove by it a few times so I was curious to find out how good it would be. 

The food was amazing and the fish was of best quality and fresh. I would give the food 5 stars. I was expecting it be because the owner is Chef John Chien Lee, former executive chef of Social House at Aria. The service wasn't the best at least for me with the wait staff and I expand on why later on. 

First the food. We ordered baked mussels, seaweed salad, the spicy tuna roll, the salmon and avocado roll, and the salmon wasabi creme (the dish I was excited to try the most). The appetizers tasted the same as they would any other Japanese restaurant nothing special. I love salmon and it was definitely on point in both the wasabi creme and paired with avocado in a roll. The spicy wasabi creme had a nice hint of lemon tangy to compliment the fish, but the wasabi creme could of had a little more punch to it. In the roll, the avocado was nice and creamy and it looked like more of a mash than just a big chunk, which was very appreciated. Mid meal, the Chef and Owner, John Chien Lee, came out to check on everyone dining and when he can by our table he was friendly and welcoming. He saw that I had a thing for salmon and asked if I would mind to try something similar, but not salmon, compliments of the chef and I said sure! He brought us out the house special ocean trout and it was just what he said delicious! I never knew trout could taste as good as salmon and I enjoyed the surprise of the pop rocks that had top it off! 

The service would get a rating of 3 stars. It wasn't till the chef talked to us that the waiters had a bit more urgency to serve us, which was just two people. It wasn't too busy when we walked in, but it took longer than usually for them to sit us when there were plenty of tables available and the waiter also forgot we were there after he had told us to wait a moment. I think that the chef probably just got there a few minutes after we had sat because it seemed that every customer after us, they were on it and asking if it was there first time and giving them dishes of the house, which we did not receive. Though the chef made up for it with the complimentary dish of trout! 

The ambiance of the place was okay. It was like top 40 with house music playing, similar to places like ra sushi minus the loudness. Decoration was okay, could have been more, but will do. I did enjoy the menu and the way it was set up! 

All in all if your looking for fresh fish at a great price with a chef who has experience from working at a well known sushi spot on the strip, without the pricey cost, this is definitely a spot to try! Happy hour runs Mon-Sat. the days they are open from 4p-6pm. And even though the service was ehh, the food was delicious and I'll definitely go back for more.

I definitely feel like family every time I step into SoHo.  My husband and I always dine at the bar.  We have frequented this restaurant so often that Chef Tay, Chef John, and the entire SoHo staff know what our usual orders comprise of and cater our meal towards our likes.  The quality of the fish is always above our expectations.  The O-toro, yellowtail and salmon kama, and ikura with quail eggs are a must to try.  Since discovering SoHo, I never stepped foot in another sushi joint in town.

This place is one of the better off the strip Asian restaurants and is usually my go-to recommendation for anyone who is looking for a great a-la carte or happy hour sushi. On my last visit I had some rock shrimp tempura, yellowtail tostadas, Diablo Loca Roll and Sweet Red Roll. Shrimp tempura was a perfection of it's kind; yellowtail salsa was a little fishy for my taste. Friendly and fast service, free WiFi and happy hour 3-5 daily.

My new sushi spot! Just moved to the area and haven't had the chance to explore new sushi spots. This was my first place to try and I wasn't disappointed! The staff was very nice and took good care of us. The food had nice presentation and tasted awesome. The salmon in the philly roll was delicious! Definitely coming back!

It was nothing short of excellent. Every single dish was crafted to deliciousness. The chef came over, introduced himself and sent over a plate of their special, bass with truffle oil, salt, can't remember all of it but it was perfection. We have honestly not had such good sushi in a really long time. It's our new fav place.

I'm not local, I'm actually a tourist in Vegas.  I found this place from my friend's Facebook photo album.  They are foodie and highly recommend this place, thus we decided to pay a visit while we are in town during Thanksgiving weekend.

The first impression when we walked in- friendly staffs, nice & clean open kitchen, cozy atmosphere.  

We knew we were in for a good experience when we could tell that the place was filled with locals.  There were families, large groups and couples and all looked like they were having a wonderful time.

Now let's get to the main point of focus:  THE FOOD!  WOW!  Simply THE BEST!!!

Everything was FRESH and DELICIOUS.  You could taste the freshness and the quality of the ingredients with every bite.

On top of it, all the prices were very reasonable, especially for this area.  Hello~ we are in Veags, baby!  If you are willing to pay more $$$ on the strip, by all mean!  This is not a fancy restaurant with 3 servers standing next to you.  This place is cozy, family owned, with Michelin starred restaurant quality.   I sincerely think the quality I'm getting vs. what I paid for, it's totally under-priced.       
 
I found a local magazine quoted this newly opened restaurant "Nearly Perfect"!!!  wow~    

This place is a hidden gem in the neighborhood.   I want to keep this as special secret, yet I also want to shout from the rooftops.
  
I even came eat here twice in a row within 3 days.  That's rare for me to do!    I hope that next time when I visit, it won't be a long line... 

Thank you Soho & Chef John Lee for giving us such a memorable dining experience - we will definitely be back next time when we are in town!  Or...maybe we will come back shortly just to dine here again..

After seeing so many good reviews on yelp n since it's right by my house I decided to give them a try walked in n ready to eat but, wait was gonna be 30min for dine in so, I decided to take California roll to go for now cz I was so hungry n tried to pick something fast to make n I didn't wanna wait that long to be seated...I left my house @7p I left the restaurant @7:50p it took them about 40min to make California roll? That's the simplest roll in the world! I'm just so disappointed I didn't get to seat n try all those things I saw in pictures here only because she said it was gonna be 30min wait when my Togo food took 40min to make anyway I could've just waited to dine in if I knew both will take about same time...I used worked at a restaurant too myself n no matter how busy it is u must get those Togo orders get out first because ppl that r seating probably already have something to  eat n they can wait a couple minutes for their food to come out...if I had eaten here I could've easily spend around $100 (cz I can eat some good sushi!) so, it's their loss I won't be back here again even though it's right next to my house...

This is only the second five star review I have given since I started Yelp. Not being a huge fan of raw fish I was hesitant to come here because I know this is where the restaurant shines. But I came with an open mind and ordered a dish from every section of the menu.

I tried the yellowtail sashimi; shrimp tostada; hydro bibb black cod; rock shrimp tempura; cucumber salad; albacore; fire cracker roll; soft shell crab roll. The standouts for me were the yellowtail sashimi, shrimp tostada, shrimp tempura, and the fire cracker roll. A lot of the time I am not a fan of sushi because of all the soft elements but both the shrimp tempura roll and the fire cracker roll had a variety of textures. The shrimp tempura was lightly fried with the right amount of breading. Might have been the best shrimp tempura I have ever had. The yellowtail sashimi was also very good with the jalapeño tempura on top giving it the crunchy element I look for in dishes with raw fish. The two dishes I was not a big fan of were the hydro bib black cod and the cucumber salad. The black cod tasted fine but it was missing something and the piece given was extremely tiny so the lettuce took over. Cucumber salad had no flavor so I added a little extra soy sauce. Nothing I put in my mouth was bad but a few dishes needed a little refinement. 

Best Japanese I have had in Las Vegas and prices are ridiculously affordable for the quality of fish and ingredients being used. 

The chef/ owner is also nice and humble so I will be back time and time again.

Fresh fish... delicious dishes... friendly staff... affordable prices.... and I love how he caters to the locals... finally a sushi place to go to that has high quality fish without the high strip prices but fish quality if not better than the strip. This is not an AYCE restaurant but they do have amazing sushi rolls. I love the Fire Cracker Roll, the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, and let's not forget the Sashimi Mix plate of 15 pcs of fresh fish for just $25 (have you've seen how he cuts his sashimi pieces? It's much thicker than most places I go to). I normally wait to sit at the bar just to see Chef John in action. His friendly warm welcoming personality definitely brings more flavor to his dishes and there's never a quiet dull moment. We leave with a night filled with great food, great drinks and laughs with the chef/owner John 

Sheila is one of their many amazing servers...

If you don't like this place,  you don't have taste buds!

How can you now like this place? It should be 6 stars not 5. If you are not writing a 5 stars review for this place it means you know nothing about food.

People who gave it low ratings, which are not many by the way, are completely insane. They must likely are unhappy people that can't wait 10 minutes to be seated, or even another 10 to get your food in a Friday night when the place is obviously packed because it is so good!!!

Check the pictures, the sushi and sashimi are gourmet!  The owner and head chef is always there and the will make sure you get the best tasking and looking sushi you ever seen. 

The quality of their fish is simply the best you can get, and this is Vegas baby. The service is always outstanding and make sure you treat them well because they deserve it. Don't bother reading haters reviews, they are just unhappy people that are jealous and trolls.

This place deserves 999.999.999.999^(infinity) stars.

This is my second visit to Soho.. And when I walked in, the waiter ( Gabriel ) greeted us by name, and knew our drink order.. He remembered from our previous visit. Sheila was also awesome.

The sushi was on par with Nobu ! I cant offer any other accolade, this place is awesome.

We have found our new sushi restaurant go-to! We went based off of the Yelp reviews, and we are SO GLAD we did! The atmosphere is nice and the staff very friendly. Our waitress was extremely knowledgeable and had great suggestions - even a few items not on the menu! The sushi was top-grade and presentation was beautiful. 

Honestly, can't wait to go back. Wow.

I have eaten in at Soho 7 times, ordered to go 4 times and even had them cater a large event.  I really enjoyed their food.  Their sushi is very good as they do use fresh fish.   I have been to their happy hour on 5 occasions and even ordered everything on the Happy hour menu one time.  
    The Calamari, Salmon Roll, Albacore Sashimi, Black Cob Lettuce Wraps and Tadas  were the highlights from the Happy Hour menu.  The Maki, stuffed mushrooms and stuffed Jalapenos were not very good and we never ordered them again.   We have ordered several of the sushi rolls on numerous occasions and really have enjoyed them.  I do like that they use fresh fish and quality ingredients in their sushi.
   We had their Miso Black Cod, numerous sushi rolls and the Angus Bone is Rib for a dinner party.  The Miso Black Cod was truly the highlight of the night.  Everyone loved it along with the sushi.  
   I do love their Happy Hour!  They have lots of great items to choose from.  They don't skimp on the size of the dishes just because it is happy hour which is even better. Great place and just around the block from my house!

Im giving this 2 stars for their service. Came in alone on  a Friday afternoon and food was great but nothing special.  Was not greeted at the door upon entering as most sushi restaurants greet you upon entering.  Maybe because I was by myself although that shouldnt mean i shouldnt be treated the same way a party of 4 would is they walked in.  Anyway, no one came to ask for drink order until another server passed by to ask if anyone took my order already. NO ONE took my drink order yet but u are asking if someone took my food order already? ..waited 30 mins just for them to bring my check even though i had the plates stacked sugessting I was finished, no one asked if i was done or needed anything else. Well not returning for a while.  Good luck to your business.
