Very great happy hour prices and selection! Just went here for the first time yesterday. I was pleasantly surprised by how large the portions were for their $5 rolls and $3 house saki. The atmosphere and service were also good.

Great food, exceptional service and nice atmosphere. The only thing I didn't like was the tv was on while the radio was on. The host tried to seat me close to the tv and facing it and I asked for another table, as far away as possible. They obliged and sat me at a four top that had a reserved sign on it. Very nice staff, very accommodating. I ordered a lot of food b/c I was very hungry and I knew I could have half for breakfast. Food was very good but I will not order the hanger steak again.  It was the only three star item, he potatoes were overdone and cold and the steak was chewy. They offered to replace it and I declined. I'm glad I found this spot, I'll be back ! PS. Ordered the green tea creme brûlée for dessert. Worth trying if you like creme brûlée!!
The freshest fish I've had in town. Service is great. Everything on the happy hour menu is delicious. I highly recommend the salmon avocado roll.

Easily the best sushi spot in Vegas. Been to all the rest, beats Nobu etc easily. Hometown atmosphere, great place to eat insanely good sushi and chill with friends. 

The Ocean Trout is a must!! The Yellowtail Yuzu Soy was brought out compliments of the chef and made me moan out loud lol. Great rolls. 

Only issue would be the slightly sweet seaweed salad.

Read reviews and the reviews were accurate...very high quality, actually the best in Vegas. The presentation was great but this would be good even on  paper plate...  if you haven't been make a point to come here.

My initial experience at Soho when it first opened was not very pleasant. The food was good but the service was a total mess. 

I decided to come back and give it another shot last Saturday night.

The restaurant was busy but we were able to get a table right away. I noticed that the servers were more attentive and accurate this time around. The server took our beverage order immediately and followed up in a couple of minutes for the food order. 

We ordered the following dishes:

Hamachi Yuzu Soy (5/5) - I liked how he used a Serrano pepper rather than jalapeño. Also, the Serrano pepper was deep fried. Something different. The fish was very fresh. 

Mixed Tempura (3/5) - I have mixed feelings about this dish. The batter was not what I was expecting. It was not crispy and light. For me, one of the gauges for a good Japanese restaurant is the tempura since it's one of the least complicated dishes to make. One good thing they did with it was to add some salt after frying it. 

Toban Soup (3/5) - Basically it's a soup made out of dashi and mushrooms. Nothing special just the presentation. It was served to us in a tea pot with tiny tea cups. This soup needs a little revamp. 

Sunny Roll - seared salmon, spicy crab, lemon and tempura asparagus (4/5) the roll was good, fresh ingredients but for me it tasted ordinary. Nothing that made my palette jump for excitement. 

Hamachi Poke (4/5) - this was a new dish that the owner is trying out. It had onions in it but surprisingly, for you onion haters like me, you can hardly taste the onion. The fish was fresh and the flavor was good. 

Chocolate Mousse Cake (6/5) - this was the highlight dish of the night. So far, Soho is consistent with its desserts... Always the perfect ending to a meal. 

Let's go back to the service. I want to emphasize that the owner did a great job improving the service of the restaurant. I must say all the servers were very helpful and sober (compared to my last visit).  I had my drink refilled several times and the owner stopped by our table 3x to check on the food. 

I will definitely be back. Hopefully the owner has a new addition to his menu that will make my palette jump for joy that I can give this restaurant a 5-star rating.

My new favorite sushi restaurant in town. The sashimi is the best I've ever had. Chef/owner John came out to our table to explain his methodology and techniques; truly a unique experience. The staff was super knowledgable and friendly; a pleasure to interact with. I can't say enough about this restaurant. How's this: I actually like uni now. It was that good. Try the Catalina Island uni. You won't regret it. And it will  make up for all the terrible uni you've had in the past. :)

This place is deliciousness! Everything we got was amazing and we were lucky and showed up during happy hour! The Cajun albacore and the tuna tostadas were so good! Everything was great! Thank you Julie for being such an awesome server!
I absolutely love this place! The sushi is amazing and the staff is always friendly. They do get very busy at lunch, but that's a great sign!!

What a gem!!! We came to Vegas with the intent of making it a foodie trip and this was our first stop before even checking into our hotel. What a great decision. From the appetizers to the rolls, everything was excellent in both flavor and presentation. Not your run of the mill sushi. Everything has its own unique flair. Service was impeccable, overall an incredible experience. Skip Nobu and other popular places on the strip. Hop over to Soho, it's so worth it.

i very seldom write a review and right away at that but for soho i feel like i have to! i just stepped out of the restaurant and our experience can be described with just one word...AMAZING!!!
 
we ordered the beef teriyaki and sashimi lunch setto and everythig was spot on! the bee was perfectly cooked, the miso soup was not so salty (exactly the way i like it) salad was great! let's just say that it is very rare that my hubby empties out every single plate he has in front of him at a japanese restaurant but his looked like it was licked clean! the sashimi was very fresh and the serving size is perfect!

The green tea tiramisu has to be reviewed by itself...it's to die for!!!i would gladly go back just to eat this! 

The staff is super friendly and very very attentive from the moment we stepped in! 

To sum it all up, this is definitely in my top 3 fave japanese restaurant ! 

Did I mention that it's just around the corner from my house?? SCORE!!!!

By far the best!!!   The Golden Ocean Trout is amazing.  Lunch specials & Happy Hour specials are second to none!!!

Love this place!

This is my new favorite place:).
The good is amazing. Everything we ordered came out perfect and quick.

We came for happy hour and the Bibb cod lettuce is the winner for me. 
They serve the fish of the freshest quality as in unique ways. I would never have tried the trout sashimi but it make a shockingly light and delicious. 

Thank you for your great service and attention to detail.

We'll be back!:)

I have eaten at Soho for lunch and have had happy hour.  can't say enough good things about this place.  for lunch, they offer a few lunch special selections as well as the full dinner menu.  I've had the sashimi lunch special as well as the chicken katsu lunch special.  the sashimi lunch special portion is very good for the $10 price tag.  you get a couple pieces of salmon, tuna, and Hamachi.  pretty good value.  not to mention rice, miso soup, and a salad.  the katsu lunch also has salad, rice, and miso soup.  the portion for me was a bit small.  wish they gave a little more katsu.  but the flavor and crunch of the katsu was unbelievable.  i've honestly never had katsu this good before.  i don't know what it was, but every bite i took, I kept asking myself if this was the best katsu i've ever had.  and I'm thoroughly convinced it is.  

for happy hour, i can't say enough about the ahi tostadas.  i could eat 10 of these.  the hydro bibb miso black cod is so flavorful, delicate, and delicious.  one of my favorite menu items.  hamachi sashimi is wonderful as well.  the sauces and oils the chef adds totally enhances the Hamachi and the flavors dance in your mouth.  everything is so complimentary and the fish is always the star.  rock shrimp tempura was very good as well.  sweet and juicy shrimp in a pillowy tempura batter was quite delicious.  firecracker roll has a lot of fish in and on top of it.  the sauce was spicy without being over powering.  

one of my favorite japanese restaurants in las vegas.  strip quality food at local prices.  can't go wrong there.

THE best Japanese food in Vegas. Hands down! Soho has become one of the only places I will go for sushi because it sets the bar so high, it's hard to find anything as good. There servers are awesome as well. We usually sit at the bar and any server will happily help you if you need anything.

We stopped in for happy hour and ended up spending an absurd amount because we ordered absolutely everything on the menu. After sampling one item and being overwhelmed by the magic that is Soho, we lost all self control and needed to experience more. Absolutely everything was delicious. This was easily one of the best meals I had in Las Vegas and I will be returning one day.

I highly recommend the bites (only $1 during happy hour), the poppers, the sashimi platters, and the infused sake.
Good Sushi and they're have happy hour here too. All food is so good and faster. I been here so many time. When they're busy you wait just 15-20 min you'll got table.

I love love love SOHO!!!

It is one of my very favorite restaurants in Vegas! 

Every time I come the staff is so friendly, the food is fantastic, and even their seats are so comfortable. 

The fish is always fresh. Their cold sashimi plates are some of the best sashimi I've every had!

The salmon dinner is always fantastic. 

I haven't had one thing I didn't like from this place. 

Try their peach sake!! So delicious
We had four different rolls and they were all amazing. I can't wait till the next visit.

I think this place is more fusion style Japanese restaurant. I was there for happy hours and tried some happy hour specials! I liked spicy tuna and salmon avocado and most of them were okay!! 

I think I enjoy more authentic Japanese food than fusion style but it was good try!!
Awesome place. Chief is very nice. Food is so good. chief let me try one of their most delicious food there for free.

By far the best Japanese restaurant in Vegas. 
All of the dishes are tasty, fresh, sophisticated, delicious. Sashimi is as fresh as the one you found in excellent restaurants in Tokyo. Very creative and skillful chefs. Love every single dish here. 
Grilled Octopus (with the Octopus from Spain) is similar like the one I have in Madrid but 10 times tastier. Green tea creme brulee is just perfect. 

Happy hour menu is superb. Very inexpensive given the quality and generous food portion here. 

Good service, friendly nice staff

What else do I need say....I don't need to go to any other Japanese restaurants after I discovered this place. Yum yum!!!

i love their happy hour menu!!! it's such a steal with a lot of varieties. $5 for a dish? i am blown away by the price. i always come here when i'm in vegas. the orders come out in a reasonable amount of time considering it being such a good deal.

must orders : 
- soho tostada
- cajun albacore sashimi
- ika geso
- pork belly kushiyaki


good picks :
- baked corn cheese 
- angus beef tataki 
- baked mussels 
- truffle fries 
- salmon carpaccio 
- salmon avocado creme 
- hydro bib cod
- firecracker
- dynamite 

pretty much the whole happy hour menu is good. so try different items everytime you come (:

Soho is my go-to sushi spot in Vegas. The sushi quality for the price is an amazing deal. And the chef, the old executive chef at social house, is the nicest chef I've ever met. He always comes by the table to say hi and is always so friendly. I recommend this place to all my friends, and I never walk away disappointed. I usually get the sashimi platter for $25, and my boyfriend loves the happy hour tostada specials. Great lunch menu and happy hour menu. What's not to love?!

Amazing food!  Always come here for their fresh sashimi and very tasty food.  The owner is very hands on and actually remembers his loyal customers.  

A must have while in Vegas!

Decor: unremarkable. What was remarkable however, was the line of chefs with zero Asians. Ha.

Service: very good. Attentive, prompt, and I made a passing remark about a fish (escolar) I'd previously had a not so good experience with. The server, Boris, comped us their signature escolar sashimi to leave a better taste in our mouths and memories. 

Food: excellent. We had the tostadas of yellowtail, tuna and salmon. Sashimis of Cajun Albacore, yellowtail yuzu, salmon mascarpone and salmon avocado creme. The mascarpone pairing was interesting and unexpectedly delightful. Standout was definitely the Cajun albacore: bomb. 

We had the three mochi selections and green tea creme brûlée. The latter may be the most excellent creme brûlée I've ever had except for maybe the unparalleled delight of my first CB ever. This one was fragrant, creamy and the taste and texture was lick-spoon outstanding. 

Tried the coconut sake- pretty coconuty and smooth. The green tea had no aftertaste and was obviously brewed at perfect temp, fragrant, just lovely.
Absolutely the best sushi place in Vegas! Get the sashimi and short rib! Ask for Jon!!

Great sushi spot off the strip! Always leave full and happy! The location is great because this is a locals only spot!

Their menu has a lot of great things and then has some ehh things as well but overall delicious!

Any of their sushi is awesome! I love their albacore sushi, yellowtail jalapeño, salmon sushi, and their cucumber salad! 

I love a good miso black cod and saw it on the menu, so I ordered it. Unfortunately it was not up to my standards but that was the only thing that was up to par. It was very dry (I like it fall apart moist) and it came like in 3 tacos? Weird. But our waiter let us return it and get something else which was VERY sweet.

They also open at 11 and have a great lunch menu and "bento" lunch options so you get more bang for your buck!!!

So I came to see the hype for myself, with over 500 reviewers and FIVE stars. That's almost unheard of. 

Their service definitely deserves the five stars. They apparently have an excellent happy hour, for which I came about 30 minutes before it was ending. Our hostess said our table would be done in 20 minutes, which it didn't so she said that if it goes past the 6PM mark, she'd let the server know to still give us some time to order some happy hour dishes. 

Most of the food was pretty good. I had a whole variety of things. The stuff on their HH is pretty standard, nothing too special, like spicy tuna roll, salmon avocado roll, and this cajun seared ahi. Nothing too 5 star worthy, but still well made and pretty standard. Also ordered the mixed sashimi platter. Some of those cuts were pretty darn good. The scallop was sweet and fresh. Their salmon was nice and fatty. Their fish roe has a seaweed bite which made it taste great. I'm not a fan of some of the other cuts, like red snapper, but they were still enjoyable. Also had their warm octopus salad or something..that's not something I'd recommend to anybody. I like octopus but not only was it good, the flavors didn't match with anything else on that menu that we had ordered. It was very off.

I didn't get to try their Omakase, but what we ordered was pretty good, so I think I will come back and try that one day. Overall, general sashimi cuts were pretty good, but their other happy hour stuff--it's a good deal for HH, wouldn't order them normally. Service is great. I'd recommend this place, probably not for happy hour though.

This place is so good. Everything is fresh and the service is very friendly. Chef Gene prepared an amazing seafood salad and sashimi for my friend and I. The edamame and peppers were delicious, and something I would have never tried on my own, I definitely recommend! 

The lunch special is very reasonably priced and has several options to choose from. I can't wait to go back and try others.

Hands down the best place to eat sushi!!! I basically come here once a week! Everything is super fresh and I even love the uni which I never liked to eat but now this is the only place ill eat it. You can definitely taste the quality and how fresh it is. This is the only place im eating sushi from now on! Service is great here too!

not sure what the hype is about soho japanese restaurant.

yes, the portions are decent.  yes, the prices are dirt cheap.  but come on, there's more to rating a good sushi spot than just price.  the QUALITY of the food was average at best!  

i ordered the sashimi lunch combo, the yellowtail with yuzu sauce and a few pieces of hotate nigiri.  the miso soup was super bland(served us miso soup with a spoon), the sashimi was not very good quality.  you could tell it had been frozen for awhile because there wasn't the usual firm texture to fresh fish.  the hotate came out really brown and was super mushy.  definitely not fresh.  

soho japanese restaurant really caters to a more americanized pallet offering rolls with a ton of sauces and deep fried blah blah in it.  wasn't my thing.  for REAL authentic sushi, please drive a little further away from the strip and spend a little bit more at sen of japan or kabuto.  it is worth your time and money.

for a quick, fast and cheap meal...i would recommend Soho.  if you're looking for authentic, FRESH sushi, this is not the place for you.

Me and my buddies visited from the bay area. We checked out this place and fell in love. The food is great! The price is right. We had fun with the owners and the employees. Gino took care of us. The owner is awesome. The girls are awesome. They have other branches in Vegas and Reno. We had to visit again and saw them the second time. Thank you Gino, the owner and the crew for taking care of us. A place to remember whenever we visit Las Vegas.

Lived my entire life in Las Vegas.  Been to many sushi restaurants here, but this is by far my favorite!  Amazing experience.  Took my boyfriend here for Valentine's Day.  We had a fantastic dinner.  Every item we ordered was delicious, and fresh, fresh, fresh!  The food, atmosphere, presentation, and staff are all 5 stars.  One of the waitresses came over to talk to us while we were waiting to be seated and recommended several items on the menu.  The main chef came out after our meal was over to ask how we liked our food.  They even gave us souvenir sushi-style keychain charms on the way out, which was cute and a sweet gesture.  Will definitely be going back, we were very impressed all around.  The yellowtail sashimi was probably my favorite.  (Be aware this isn't an AYCE sushi restaurant, just order what you like, sit back and take your time to enjoy).
My first sushi restaurant visit since I moved to Las Vegas and this place is simply phenomenal! So happy I picked this place. I'm still eating and already forward to next time!

So Amazing!  The service is superb, the food is even better. We expected to pay so much more after we tasted the food. They introduced us to new things and each item was prepared to perfection. We have eaten a lot of sushi, it's kind of our thing and this is our new favorite!!!!

We  Love Sushi We  Love Soho Sushi!!!
Seriously the best Specialty Rolls and have an Amazing Happy Hour!! The owner greets his guests. Great service every time

This review is for 4.5 stars.

My only complaint was the wait.  Otherwise this place was perfect.  It's located pretty far off the beaten path but you walk in and you get a great jJpanese meal.  Every dish is great, the waitstaff is helpful, and the prices are surprisingly good considering the quality.  

We had the brussel sprouts, vegetable roll, tuna roll, egg roll, and mis soup.  We coupled that with the house saki.  The brussel sprouts were outstanding - one of the best dishes in Vegas.  The tuna roll was awesome as well.  The saki was great, too, especially for  $7 for a full serving (hot or cold).  The vegetable roll, miso soup, and egg roll were solid, but I will try something else next time.  

Come during Happy Hour (ends at 7) if you have the chance.  The dishes we ordered were mostly the classics and they go for $5 at Happy Hour rather than $8-9 off the real menu.  Our total bill was around $55 which is unbelievable in Vegas.  Soho is top notch.

I was craving sushi, so I popped into this place. Maybe it's just my taste, but I probably won't be coming back.

1. The food is really expensive. They don't have AYCE, so you'll easily be spending $30 on two rolls.
2. I wasn't expecting to see real crab in the California roll. I think that's great, but it was really dry and didn't have the texture I'm used to.
3. My soda tasted flat or watery.
4. There's only one soy sauce option, and be careful because it's salty AF.

I left rather unsatisfied and disappointed because I couldn't even finish my food.

**Update**
I have recently visited this location again because my friend raved about their happy hour menu. I really like their happy hour menu because select items are $5. 

We ordered the sliders, firecracker rolls, calamari and a few other rolls. 

I loved everything I ate and paid only $30 for like 6 items. The happy hour is the way to go! I go here more often now.

If I could give more stars, I would.  Yesterday was my first time at Soho Japanese Restaurant... so good that I went back today!  I had my friend order, as she had been to Soho many times, and claims this spot as one of her all time favorite spots.. and I dont blame her!

Their Ocean Trout, out of this world.  who makes sashimi with pop rock candy... chef john does!  Yes, it sounds a bit absurd... but pure genius!  It was literally poppin and rockin in my mouth! 

Four words... Hydro Bibb Black Cod.  Amazing!  Its marinated in a miso glaze, so it gives the fish a sweet finish!  They're serve in little cute butter lettuce cups. A definite new favorite!

Yellow tail sashimi was PERFECT! Its served with little tempura jalapeno , and set on the sashimi.  Each bite, pure heaven!

All of their sashimi is the freshest I've ever had in Vegas! Coming from Hawaii, I'm a bit picky when it comes to where I eat my sashimi, because I'm used to freshly caught fish in Hawaii. At Soho, its clear that their motto is QUALITY!

What draws me to this place, other than the fact that their food is AMAZING, is the customer service.  We were personally approached by the Chef/Owner himself.  He reiterated our order, and by that he was able to get a feel of what our taste buds were like.  He said that as a courtesy, he was going to bring out a complimentary sashimi dish, on the house.  It was a black sea bass w/ truffle and olive oil. OMG. it was soooooo delicious! First of all, he didn't have to do that... that was truly nice of him to do! 

The vibe, the food and location is perfect.  I will definitely be back!

This place gets a lot of hype because they do have good customer service. That staff is very nice, but because they are so popular they don't get your order right. They are overwhelmed because they are always busy. 

My friend and I went here and it was pretty busy. We asked for a few simple things but they forgot them. The food was only okay. I would try it again since I live across the street but it was nothing to write home about.

Surprising discovery WAY off the Strip.  Perfect fish, presentation, atmosphere.  I had salmon sashimi and it was every bit as good at what you'd get at famous sushi restaurants on the Strip, but the cost was $5.00, not $15.00.  If you have a car, it is worth the drive!

Awesome ! Price on the higher end but when you eat the raw fish you will know why. Chef offered us hamachi for the first time and we thoroughly enjoyed it !
Always a treat when we eat here !

This place is so good and so friendly.  It's about a 10-15 minute drive away from the strip but it's worth it.  I had the sashimi platter which couldn't have been fresher nor higher quality.  They have a large team of Japanese cooks and we saw many Japanese patrons which indicates that this is the real deal in terms of Japanese cuisine.  

Furthermore, I couldn't believe the price.  My daughter had two sushi rolls and miso soup.  I had a sashimi platter and tempura shrimp and veggies.  My wife had miso soup and a special veggie plate and our total bill was $59.  This place is such a winner.  I wish we had it in Scottsdale.

This place was AMAZING! Twin dragon rolls to die for and they even brought us a free sample of some amazing fish. Everything is so fresh they even have a guy in the back cracking Alaskan crab the whole time so you have fresh crab.

One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in the SW area. I've never left this place feeling disappointed. I love the premium sashimi here. All the fish/seafood are always fresh and the presentation is wonderful. I've also tried their omakase, which is a really good value and a good way to try their well-known dishes, such as the yellowtail yuzu, golden ocean trout, and braised short rib. The omakase ended with a matcha cheesecake and macaroons as desserts. I also go here a lot for happy hour, which is from 5-7 PM. Get there early as this place is always busy. $3 sapporo draft, $3 house sake, and a variety of food items for $5. Such good deals! Must get their cajun albacore, escobar carpaccio, baked mussels, and salmon carpaccio! Service is top notch! All the servers I've encountered are always so friendly and courteous. I also love sitting at the sushi bar because all the sushi chefs are awesome!
Very fresh sushi. Happy hour menu is a great deal (except avoid angus slider - it was dry meat on a cheap bun). Service was excellent. Overall very good sushi place.

They offer a good selection for lunch Bento box. Price is very reasonable. A lunch set comes also with soup, salad for 8.50. We ordered beef teriyaki bento, the beef was done perfectly. The teriyaki sauce was served on the side. Yay! Coz i dont like too much sauce on my meat. I totally will come back for lunch. 
I love their beef short ribs for dinner, it was tender, juicy and flavorful. The potatoes that came with it was yummy too. We also ordered a few sashimi plates. Love the freshness of the fish, the sauce was ok not too overwhelming BUT there was fried onions on almost every cold dishes. I love fried onions but not on my sashimi please?!

I'm visiting from LA, where we may have a good sushi place or two.  But I found this restaurant on Yelp, and off I went, thinking I'd look more toward meat items, as I'd eaten at another sushi restaurant the night before.  When I pulled up to the restaurant, admittedly I was a bit worried, because the signage made me think cookie cutter strip mall Japanese restaurant.  (Usually, when I think Japanese restaurant in a strip mall, I feel more comfortable if it looks like a dive.)  But generic outside appearance aside, this restaurant holds its own with some of the top restaurants of its kind in LA, and brought to mind restaurants like Wa and the original Katsu-ya.  I began with a house specialty, yellowtail sashimi with just enough tempura jalapeno in a garlic and yuzu-based sauce, before moving on to beef tataki, seared to a beautiful texture with a garlic chili oil.  Both were delicious and perfectly tender.  From there, the chef came out--it was wonderful to get such personal attention (and the restaurant was quite busy)--and we discussed what I might want next.  He suggested I try a white sea bass he had just gotten in, and then a trio of taro tostadas, each a combination of a different fish, spice (as in heat) and avocado cream.  They were fabulous small bites.  I finished my meal with the signature miso marinated black cod, perfectly cooked and amazingly flavorful, accompanied with a yuzu-based vinaigrette that complemented it perfectly.

My primary server was quite attentive and personable (as were all the others), the setting is unpretentious and comfortable, and I didn't know until the end that Chef had graciously given me the white sea bass and tostada tastings.  That was just the cherry on top of an exceptional meal.  It won't be the cheapest Japanese meal you've ever had (though the prices are very fair for what you get, and there are good deals to be had at happy hour and lunch), and if you're a quantity over quality person, there are probably better choices, but if you appreciate top quality, extremely fresh ingredients handled deftly by a talented chef, this is your restaurant.  Even if it were in LA, Soho would still be a standout.  Next time I'm in Vegas, this will be at the top of my list.

This is always my go to spot for al la carte sushi. I came during happy hour on a Friday night. I sometimes come for the lunch specials too

If I remember correctly it's Monday to Saturday from 5 to 7 for their happy hour menu. It was basically about 5 bucks a plate. Some varied but the stuff we ordered was in that range. 

Didn't take a photo of all our food. Since it's happy hour the portion is a tad smaller so we ordered about 5 plates to share. 

Mix tempura: red bell pepper, two shrimp tempura, onion, and I think a zucchini. This was good. I didn't notice an overly extended amount of batter. 

Baked muscles: these were good! They had Yuzu sauce or some ponzu sauce in it that made the flavors balance out and it didn't feel as heavy because of the sauce. 

Crispy brussel sprout: yummmm!! The mixture of textures, nice n crispy, they had some nuts in it for a bite. And the sauce in the middle, not even sure what it was but it was BOMB. 

Spider roll and spicy salmon roll. I like how they put these little crunchy balls on top of the rolls. I'm not sure how to describe the taste but added crunch. As always fish is fresh! 

Can't forget that Infused sake! Lychee is my favorite one. Mmmmm. Their lunch specials are pretty good too. Love the variety.

This place was excellent. The server we had was extremely attentive and friendly.  We ordered entirely off of the happy hour menu, which was robust and very reasonable. We had the cajun albacore, tempura truffles, salmon carpaccio, salmon avocado roll, and a lot more amazing food. Everything was well presented,  tasted amazing, and was fairly portioned. We would definitely come back here and need to since we were too full for dessert!

I can't say enough about this restaurant. I love everything I have tried there.  My two favorites are the Twin Dragon Roll and the King Crab Tempura. Chef John is always welcoming and the service is friendly, team oriented, and swift. As good as it gets!

Too good for words!  Amazing service and even better food! I  can't wait to come back and try more! Charles was our server and did an excellent job recommending dishes! The chef came over a few times to check on us and even sent out food for us to try!

Best sushi in Vegas! It's actually really good sushi. You can tell that's everyone loves working there. Amazing quality, fresh, mouth watering dishes. Habachi with yuzu, the salmon. We always sit at the bar next to Chef Tei  and he makes our Omakase. LOVE this place!
Absolutely a great place to try. Awesome vibe with some house music along with top notch sushi and great service. I will be back several times over.

My boyfriend and I have been here on several occasions. The staff is always pleasant and is always more than eager to accommodate any requests. The food is always fresh and the dishes are made to perfection. Happy hour is a plus!
Everything about this place is amazing. Every item on the menu is to die for. Can't say enough great things about this place! YUM! GO THERE NOW!!!

Fabulous birthday dinner at Soho last night! Great, super fresh fish. Beautifully presented. Well cut. Put yourself in Chef John's hands for Omakase, you can't go wrong. Staff are super friendly. Great experience. My new favorite sushi place in LV!

This is probably three and a half stars.  Staff was friendly and the place was cute and clean. Not a big menu selection. Management spent a lot of time on food presentation and not a lot on quality and variety. Rice on soshi rolls was slightly undercooked and sauce on our appetizer was a bit salty. Overall it was a nice experience but nothing memorable.

Recommended by another foodie friend and drawn by the curiosity of such high ratings, this restaurant did not disappoint. 

Yellowtail Yuzo Soy (fresh and covered with perfectly tasting citrus/soy sauce marinade),  Fire Dragon Roll (good, but would've personally liked milder spiciness) and Miso Marinated Cod lettuce wraps were the selection for my husband and I. While we ordered the Rock Shrimp Tempura with edamame for our sons. We were all pleased and satisfied with our meals. 

We initially requested for some dishes suggested by a friend, and was told they would make it even though it's no longer on the menu. So, don't hesitate to ask because they'll make it for you! And lastly something I learned from my husband today is to ask for fresh wasabi. They do charge $1 for it, but it does make a difference in taste. 

Definitely going back again and next time concluding the meal with some matcha tiramisu. They were sold out, so I'm thinking it must be one divine desert!
I've been here a few times .  Customer service is great and the sushi n sashimi is always fresh and delicious . Thanks Chef John

I've eaten here twice--once for takeout and another for happy hour. Their happy hour is great for those on a budget who still enjoy great sushi--they offer rolls like shrimp tempura, spicy tuna and others for around $5. They also have these great little sushi tostadas for $1 during HH, which are a fun snack.

I also tried the amaebi, or sweet raw shrimp (not on the HH menu). They told me that I could get *live* shrimp--so I went for it! It was the freshest tasting shrimp I've ever had.

I like the ambiance here--it's a true neighborhood joint. A lot of people came to the sushi counter to talk to the sushi chefs, and the waiters seemed familiar with regulars.

The only complaint I had was the rice. It's kind of like a brown rice? Doesn't seem too authentic. And rice is like 80% of good sushi.

All in all though, definitely worth a try!

I came here because of the yelp reviews and it lived up to their reviews. Their rolls were flavorful. I will definitely come back. 

This is what we had:
Brussels sprouts - very good
Cajun albacore - delicious
Spider roll - very good
Firecracker roll - I'm not a deep fried sushi person but i loved this roll. The onions put a nice flavorful touch.
Crispy tuna roll - delicious! Loved the crispy rice.
Twin dragon roll - very good
Hydro bibb sea bass - flavorful 
Tempura roll - ok.

Found this restaurant on our way through Vegas on a Zion trip. We just happened to be there for their Happy Hour and was really happy with everything we got. Some really interesting fusion-y combinations. 

Happy Hour prices were awesome. Servings were pretty small, but it was so cheap, we just ordered a lot of everything. It got crowded as the night went on. Luckily we were there right before the rush. Our waitress was really nice and helpful. I'd definitely stop here again the next time I'm looking for a place to eat in Vegas off the strip.

I finally had a chance to visit Soho this afternoon for lunch with a friend. Fortunately, we did not have to wait. The staff promptly greeted and sat us.

There was a pretty good selection for their lunch specials. I decided to try the salmon and my friend had their sashimi. The sashimi was a pretty good amount of fish and my friend said it was fresh. My salmon was cooked perfectly with some char but not over cooked. Even the little details where nice. The salad was not over dressed. 

I will be visiting this establishment on a more frequent basis. I'm excited to try their happy hour specials. And, I definitely have to try their Soho Moco. I'm a sucker for Hawaiian food. 

If you're undecided, reading the reviews, just go. You will not be disappointed.

Amazing server, chef/owner is super friendly....the food is phenomenal! Not your typical sushi spot. They don't use fake crab- 100% Alaskan kind crab in their sushi. The cold dishes are amazing. Overall, phenomenal.

This place is amazing!!!!!!! You don't need to search anymore, you HAVE to go to this place. I've been using Yelp for years and have never left a review until now, this place was just that damn good. Make sure you get a cup of their freshly made Miso soup, some of the best I've ever had, and try the Wagyu beef if you can, which was the for sure the best beef I've ever had. I also highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar, I talked to Chef Aaron and Chef Tae and they made my experience. Seriously, huge shoutout to them for incredible service and fantastic conversation.

This place absolutely lives up to its stars! Amazing food, amazing service, and adorable pens shaped like chopsticks holding nigiri :P The special with sea bass and truffle salt was my favorite, but the trout with pop rocks and the tadas were amazing too. Everything we has was fresh and delicious. But whatever you do, don't ask for Louis... He's mine!

I have nothing but great things to say about this place.

The important thing is that their food is just one of the best sushis I've ever had. They really have a punchy flavor and it never fails to satisfy. I do admit sometimes I am disappointed that they don't have more types of sushi rolls on the menu, but they make that up for how amazing their sushi tastes. At the same time, I like how simple their menu is because it is not overwhelming like other places. It makes ordering go by quicker. Service is good as well. Sometimes I like sitting at the sushi bar because I get my food wayyyyy faster.

The mochi here is also really great as well. When you order mochi, it comes in 3 and you can choose from mango, strawberry, green tea, and black sesame.

The interior of the place is really upgraded! I noticed that they changed their chairs to these fancy brown executive looking chairs (much comfier too). The ambiance of the place is very calming and romantic. They have fake candles on each table and some dim colored lights along the walls. I also like that they frosted the bottom windows so that if a car pulls up in front of the place with their lights on, it doesn't shine bright through the place. That way the customer doesn't get bright lights shined in their face while their eating. They pay attention to a lot of detail here. 

Food, cleanliness, and customer service is rated 10/10 in my books!

This place is always packed too since it's so good, so plan to go before rush hour/dinner time or be prepared to wait a little. The wait is very much worth it.
Really really good sushi. I'm so glad this is close to where I live because I will now eat here multiple times a week :)

This place is a must try.  Everything is delicious and the sushi is so fresh.

I love the Yellowtail Hamachi with yuzu.

The Firecracker roll that is deep fried is my favorite. 

Try the Poke Tada...you won't regret it.  I had three last time...just kept ordering them.

The Chef/Owner is great and always stops by your table.

This place is amazing! I must say that I have never had better sushi anywhere and I come from a place with great sushi selections. After having dinner here during my trip in Vegas, I wanted to eat here again the next day. Sadly, my friends decided to eat at other places. 

We ordered so many food while we were there. We just simply wanted to try everything because everything we ordered was very delicious. They are known for their sashimi so order from their specialty selection if you are there. You will not be disappointed. When I had the ocean trout (can't remember if that's the name or something else since we ordered so many dishes), my mouth was in heaven. The fish is topped with poprocks. Yes, POPROCKS!!! It definitely added a nice touch to the fish (and childhood memories of eating poprocks). 

The waitress that served us was very attentive. She recognized from our voices that we had tried to call in earlier to make reservations. All her recommendations were delicious and she provided great customer service. We ordered hot sake but were given cold sake instead. She returned and gave us a bottle of hot sake and told us the cold sake will be complimentary.

I also like that they are open to modifying our philadelphia roll with hamachi instead of salmon. Overall, I have experienced wonderful customer service and the best sushi quality here at Soho Japanese Restaurant. If the owner of Soho Japanese Restaurant is reading this review, can you please open a location in San Francisco, CA? I'm dying for your sushi. T_T

P.S. They have fresh wasabi. :)

Absolutely fantastic. We eat all over Vegas this is bar none the best Japanese restaurant we have visited. We shared 6 dishes everyone off them was delicious. Ask for the house made hot sauce out had habanero chili's.

My husband and I visited this place for the first time about 3 years ago. We were so discouraged and hesitant to return due to long wait times. However, we decided to try this place again tonight and we were so glad we did!! Every item we ordered was very tasty and delicious. The salmon carpaccio was to die for! The different kind of fish in our sashimi platter tasted really fresh. This is definitely a 5 star in spite of the wait (to be seated and bringing out the food).  Everything was worth the wait. We will be returning soon! Thank you Soho for serving great dishes.

This is probably the worst sushi I've ever had. The sushi broke apart and there was way too much sauce on the sushi, it drowned out the natural flavor of the sushi itself. This roll should have been called spicy mayo with a side of sushi. If you're looking for a sushi place, keep on scrolling and look elsewhere. The happy hour is a joke. 45 dollars for 3 rolls and 2 appetizers, might as well put it on the normally priced menu. THIS IS MY FIRST AND LAST TIME AT SOHO SUSHI.

Go. Just. Go.  Ask your server for suggestions.  They are known for the unusual cold sashimi dishes.  We tried several and all were amazing.  The tadas were fun too!  Well worth the drive.  Easy from the strip!

So, my husband and i have tried many sushi places and always resort back to sushi fever, but finally we have found another place. I was pleased with quality of fish and the way it was prepared. Service was great here!!! We went on a Friday night, not to bad of a wait. Worth going....

This place is amazing!  Freshest sushi in Las Vegas!! I live near the ocean in OC and this place is as fresh any place in So. Cal.  Gotta try the sashimi combo, sushi rolls are delicious, and for more exotic sashimi try the shimaji with uni!!

Came here for HH with some fabulous ladies and really enjoyed myself. Decent amount of choices for food and drinks on the HH menu. We sampled probably at least one of everything. The baked mussels were fantastic. I've tried them before and not really liked them and I really did enjoy them here. The shrimp tempura roll was good too. Portions are good. The tosta's were good, the shrimp mango was SO GOOD! Service was good, fast and friendly.
They've got decent happy hour deals as well. Cheap beer and sake along with quite a few food items.

Great atmosphere and everything in the restaurant were clean, including the soy sauce bottle. The fish were really fresh. The owner introduced himself to us as well and recommended some delicious ponyu sauce sashimi. 

The service was great, they were always there to refill your drinks and tea. Overall, I would really enjoy my visit and will come back again. Also, awesome hot sake!

I've been here a couple time but yesterday was my first in quiet some time! Greeted and seated right away without a reservation, very kind waiters and waitresses. Pretty welcoming vibe with a nice ambiance, we also hit the time frame of happy hour which was great! A lot of popular dishes and drinks only $5. First time we tried the crispy brussel sprouts and it was fabulous! Shrimp tempura roll is always my go-to and it was great. Wasn't extremely thrilled with the garlic tuna (tasted different) or spicy tuna roll (had zero flavor) or the one with scallops, it was good but not one that I was obsessing over. Definitely a goo sushi place in the area, everything was fresh.

This place is amazing!! From the carefree ambiance and amazing food to the impeccable service,  this restaurant is quite a gem. Ask the chef to suprise you with a special sushi roll. You won't be disappointed!

So, after seeing all of the great reviews this place had, we HAD to try it! And I'm SO glad we did! This has got to be my new FAVE Sushi spot in Las Vegas!
First off, service was great & it was fun! Very attentive & on top of their game. So major kudos to them.
Then, the food. This has to be one if the freshest tasting sushi I have had in a long time! Everything was great! Definitely you'll need to try from the cold menu & the traditional rolls. 
Seriously, everything was GREAT & everyone was AWESOME!

My hubby and I went to Vegas to celebrate our 13th wedding anniversary and his 43 birthday.  This wasn't our first trip to Vegas so we wanted more of an "off the Strip" experience this time around, especially for dining and entertainment.  

I found Soho House using yelp and google and I am so happy we decided to give them a try. The attention to detail, freshness of the fish, and amazing customer service, made this our best dining experience ever.  I have eaten in some of the best restaurants in the world, on nearly every continent, but have never had the combination of amazing food and service like I did at Soho house. Imagine my surprise when I found out that Nobu and Soho house have the same seafood purveyor! I'm really kicking myself for spending $$$$ at Nobu last year when we could have gone to Soho House instead.  Well, you don't know what you don't know.  Now, on to what I do know.

Sushi Chef Tai is brilliant!  Every dish we tried was so perfectly balanced. The only word I can think of to describe the flavors is: BRIGHT.  No one ingredient overpowered the next, but they all complemented each other so well.  I also appreciate his attention to texture.  I realized immediately after taking my first bite that the boring, overly soft rolls back at home are not going to cut it anymore.

The food alone is a good enough reason to visit Soho House but the level of service we received nearly left me in tears.  Gabriel went out of his way to make sure my husband had an amazing birthday dinner.  It was because of him that we decided to return two days later for a second meal. We had the pleasure of being helped by Sheila, who is the head server.  She is so sweet, warm and smart. She really upped the ante with her superior customer service and left an indelible impression on our hearts.  Thank you to everyone at Soho House for giving us one of the most memorable anniversary weekends ever!

This place never disappoints, the quality, service, sushi and everything I've had here is second to none.  We returned to Vegas last week and had to stop here for dinner on Thursday night and on Saturday for lunch.  Chef Chen is so fun, energetic, passionate and generous.  I love the care and attention he gives to all his culinary endeavours.  The staff here is awesome too, always polite and accommodating.  The place is now open again for lunch.  This is our favourite restaurant in Vegas and we come back year after year for the freshest and most innovative culinary experience.

came here with a friend for their happy hour on a weekday night. we decided to order the entire happy hour menu as every item was priced favorably. 
Over the course of the meal we ordered two Lychee Sake's ($4 ea.) to share and one beer $1.50 (for me).
We thoroughly enjoyed tuna tostadas and at $1 ea. who can beat that?! we also enjoyed the black cod $4 (YUM), Cajun Albacore Sashimi $5 (double YUM) and the baked mussels (a bit chewy for me but my PIC enjoyed them) :) 
not to mention the extremely attentive and friendly staff who were a pleasure to be around and never rushed us as we were there for hours!

We left with a split bill - both under $40 out-the-door. Left STUFFED; I loved this place... definitely recommend it and look forward to my return with the hubby next time. :)

This place has been very consistent. It's just so delicious! I know it's not cheap but we've been to other restaurants around town and we actually paid more but less satisfied. I think it's worth the money. We love every single food they have. Their uni and oysters are superb.

OMG! EXCELLENT food, ambiance and service!
They only serve dinner from 5-10PM and no more Happy Hour, first timer, finally made it here and doesn't disappoint.

We ordered Golden Ocean Trout, Garlic Soft Shell crab, Fire Cracker Roll, Rock shrimp tempura, and Tadas (octopus, tuna and salmon). There were modernistic, pallatable and heavenly. For dessert, we ordered the Green Tea Creme Brulee. I love how each plates were made with care and beautifully decorated.

Their local Sake and peach sake were pleasing.

The service was on par. They made sure you're doing fine. All young workers looks like they have great communication with each other and love what they do. 
We sat at the bar and noticed the lovely sashimi plates going out, each beautifully decorated with unique style. There were regular customers as well. The prices are not inexpensive. The bill was like $94 for 2 of us. We will be back.

Long time customer. All they do here is make you feel happy. The food is amazing. The sushi is always top notch.  I always order sushi. It's always fresh. Sheila (hostess or server) always explains any and everything I ask. She is very friendly and knowledgeable. She's the best. Chef Nae is amazing. No lie. All he does is try to make you comfortable and serve you great food. I'm in love with this place. No other place serves food this great for this great of prices. I love this place.
Literally the best happy hour in Las Vegas and it's from 3-7pm!!! Oh and the Lychee infused sake is AMAZING!

Soho is hands down the best sushi restaurant in Vegas ! The fish is always fresh, the wait is never too long, and it's reasonably priced ! I always order the same things when I come because it is amazing ! I do want to change it up a bit because I noticed they constantly add new menu items but I feel like I'm betraying my main dishes if I get new items. I ALWAYS get the Golden Ocean Trout. The golden ocean trout has pop rocks in it and it gives the fish a good taste ! If I'm feeling fancy, I get the premium sashimi because their uni is AMAZING ! Their uni is always so fresh and it tastes exactly what uni should taste like! The nutter pillar roll is also great! The macadamia nuts on top give it that great crunch that I never knew I needed from a sushi! I would highly recommend coming here because I think it is the best sushi restaurant in Vegas !
Love it! we had a wonderful meal ! We finished it up with Ice cream! Yum :-) now I'm happy to drive back to LA!

Everything was AMAZING here! Went here with friends on a Vegas trip and all of us left pretty satisfied. BEST SASHIMI I've ever had!!! The chef gave us a platter of free sashimi at the end of our meal, which was more icing on our heavily iced caked. The prices are also very reasonable. This is one of the few restaurants I'd probably order solely sashimi. Most places I'd usually more rolls since I'm hesitant of what the pure fish might taste like or how fresh the fish is (like in Texas). 

All the sashimi MELTS in your mouth. Maybe it's not authentic with my sashimi topped in pop rocks and swimming in ponzu sauce. I DON'T CARE. My fiancé says it's probably farm raised, so that's why it's so fatty and melts in our mouth, but I DON'T CARE. I'll eat the fatty sashimi and he will too. I'll definitely be back when I'm back in Vegas.

One of the BEST sushi places I have been to. The Spicy Tuna was great, however the Firecracker Roll was amazin, I love how they put sweet onion on top and the fact that it was actually spicy. Fusion House Sake was delicious and the waiter was on it and great. Food was surprisingly cheap during happy hour and I got so much food. I truly wish they had it in my hometown. I unfortunately did not take pictures I was too busy destroying the food. Yup have to try this place if you are in Vegas. DEFINITELY WILL COME BACK!!!

A new addition to SoHo's offerings:  an excellent "happy hour" menu served until 6 pm. Asahi Draft ($3), Coors Light ($1.50) and an array of great appetizers.  Even though we over-indulged, we still came back to our favorites: yellow tail and sunny salmon (see photos). The absolute best!

We decided we wanted sushi outside the strip so we YELPed it and found SoHo with 4-1/2 stars and $$. Good decision! 
We found all their ingredients fresh (in the sashimi plate) and could not find anything negative about their food. The ankimo (monk fish liver) had a house garnish/sauce. Really unique! We had king crab and rock shrimp tempura, sunny salmon, and tried many suggestions of our food server. It's good to go with a group in order to be able to sample more different dishes. Five star for me! Good enough to be featured in a hotel--but on the other hand, it's more affordable this way!

What an amazing find! Visiting my boyfriend's mom in Vegas and we were looking for sushi off the strip. After a 30 minute wait, well worth the wait, we were seated at the sushi bar in front of a staff with a great vibe. Everyone behind the counter loved what they were doing. The fish was fresh with amazing texture and flavor. So happy to not find fish swimming in mayo. We can't wait to go back and eat whatever they recommend. Thank you Soho for a most satisfying meal!

Soho is back for lunch! They're serving lunch from 12pm to 4pm. They have a lot more variety on the menu, including appetizers, some fried items, and plenty of rolls, along with the set bento-style options. I also get the feeling they'll serve you some of the dinner items as long as they have the items ready for it, but your mileage may vary.

Soho also has a new-ish happy hour menu from 4-7pm everyday (except Sundays since they're closed) with 24 items on it as well, with beer and sake as cheap as $3.  The drink prices are also available at lunch too, so you have ample opportunity to get a little buzz in the afternoon! :O

I was really happy to see Chef John Lee back behind the counter as well, working with kitchen staff and prepping some items for dinner. Service here remains excellent and I can't give enough glowing reviews to my favorite Japanese Restaurant in Vegas.

How does one start their Centennial revue? Which venue does one choose to mark the occasion? How many other factors can possible come together to make this the hardest revue of my Yelp career?

...and will I ever be able to regain my sanity?

I am told that a great work of art is never truly finished, that the work never ends. After just one visit to Soho Japanese Restaurant, I now understand what that means.

Clearly the great Yelpers of Las Vegas have collectively cried out the praises of this understated little gem in the southwest valley. Not only does it rank top among sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, it ranks tops among ALL restaurants in Las Vegas. That little tidbit has to be making some of this town's "legendary" chefs red in the face. Someone should tell those people at Michelin they are dinosaurs - no wait, never-mind, let them figure it out.

You see when it comes down to it, it's quite simple - if you do something great, people will notice. And it's clear, Soho does great better than anyone in Vegas.

The first thing you notice when you walk into Soho is that no world renowned restaurant decor consultancy group was brought in to "class the place up", like they do in most 5 star restaurants. Soho is a simple, friendly, comfortable and welcoming environment - a 5 star restaurant that won't make you feel like you're not good enough to be there (what a concept.)

The staff are regular people, just like you and me. But management is obviously treating these people with a little respect because it's quite clear they all love working there - it shows in absolutely everything they do. Imagine great service at a 5 star restaurant from friendly people who don't look down their nose at you (are you guys starting to see a trend here?)

But you really don't appreciate how good you have it until the food arrives. It's easy to get so comfortable here that you can forget you are about to partake in one amazing meal. All that changes once you take the first bite. For us it was the Uni Trio - just Wow! (Thank you sir, may I please have another.)

I know what you're thinking, what does a boy who grew up in Fargo, North Dakota know about sushi? Wouldn't he be dead last on the list of people you should trust on the subject? (Hey Buddy, you forgot to cook this!) 

Fair enough.

The truth is, you're just going to have to decide for yourself. No amount of banter from me is going to change your mind,so I'll leave that up to the marvelous people at Soho, they are better suited to the task. 

Whew! One hundred down, and ready for round two. Go Yelp!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(109/365) "From Social House to the Suburbs"

Chef John Chien Lee has set up shop on the Southwest side of town and is fast becoming a favorite spot among the Yelp Community and you can see by the rave reviews!

Our few visits have been during happy hour, and this is one of the best HH spots around town IMHO. On our first visit, we tried the Soho Maki, Tostadas(All 4 kinds), Beef Tataki, Albacore Sashimi, Firecracker Roll, Ika Geso,  Cod Lettuce Wraps, and all were delicious with the exception of the Soho Maki which is essentially annorexic spring rolls in a glass. That item as well as the Firecracker Roll was forgettable.

Our Second visit, we arrived just before HH which allowed us to try one of their lunch specials. If I had to suggest one, The Soho Moco where Chef Chien pays homage to the Hawaiian Loco Moco is pretty bangin'!  A nicely seasoned burger patty with rice, a perfectly fried egg, and Chien's version of a gravy comes with a side salad and miso soup...All that for $8.95? Stupid, right!?!? Oh, the components are presented seperately in a nice bento box style, but to totaly enjoy the Moco, dump out the rice and make little bed, on goes the burger, on the burger goes the egg, then smother the whole thing with the gravy. Cut in to that bad boy letting the yolk ooze all over, and KILL IT!...;9  We also redeemed ourselves during dessert as we finally got our hands on their popular Green Tea Tiramisu (They ran out during our first visit) That was a great ending to our meal.

The service here is some of the best as well. Servers are very personable, and are quick to offer recommendations of popular items as well as their personal favorites Chef Chien himself even stops by to each table to see how everyone's doing and even lets you know of upcoming events and menu additions which I thought were pretty cool. Soho is closed on Sundays so that Chef Chien and his employees have quality time with family...Awesome boss points right there! If you haven't already, come by and have yourself some Soho action!   ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/   5

Very good service, good quality fish and all at a pretty good price. 

It was our first time here. Wasn't sure how a sushi restaurant would be away from Chinatown but I'm impressed. The restaurant is very nicely decorated, loved the lighting and service was exceptional. 

Our waiter was super friendly and informative and our food came out so quickly. The menu consisted more of rolls and fusion Japanese food dishes. Just don't expect home style Japanese food here but for what it is, they did a good job. The fish was super fresh and presentation of the food was beautiful. My cousin and his friend ordered a couple of their sushi rolls and they were huge! It's always nice to get bigger portions than you expect at a sushi restaurant. Good Job Soho! This customer was a happy customer.

Not traditional sushi - fusion - the mix of flavors and textures was quite good and surprising.  Many of their rolls contain mayonnaise, cream cheese or cheese. Although light i wasn't sure if I would like it - but I did!.  We got there in time for Happy Hour ($5 rolls). When bill came my husband thought they made a mistake - very reasonable $ - and we even ordered a few things from regular menu.  My very favorite was the ika geso - like the traditional octopus grilled on stick, but with a very light and crispy batter. I thought the Diablo Loco was a winner!

A good sushi spot, but not deserving of many of the rave reviews here.  I suspect groupthink and good marketing are responsible.

Ambiance: Strip mall sushi spot.

Crowd: East Asian college students taking constant photos.

Menu: Americanized Japanese food.

Service: Unmemorable

Food Ordered: Sake nigiri, spicy tuna roll, and soft shell crab tempura roll.

Food Quality: The salmon was flavorless.  The spicy tuna roll was good, but unbalanced.  The soft shell crab tempura roll had no crab taste.  Overall, I was somewhat disappointed given the reviews.

Value: Exactly as expected.

I have one word to describe Soho and that word is phenomenal! I have been to many different sushi restaurants in town and Soho by far has the freshest cleanest tasting fish. We were going through the menu and saw Ocean Trout with Pop Rocks. I know we thought the same thing but we're feeling a little daring and it was so worth it. Ocean trout looks like salmon but tastes 10x better and danced with the tingly sweetness of the pop rock candy. The Garlic Shishto peppers were out of this world. We were lucky enough to be checked on by the chef who was amazing! He recommended we try a dish that was Jack Stripe fish with Uni and it was outstanding!!!! My wife is not the biggest fan of Uni but once she tasted Soho's Catalina Island Uni she was sold. We finished off the meal with the Green Tea Tiramuso refreshingly delicious!  We have already made plans to return. We definitely recommend you come and try Soho. You will love it just like we do!
Really awesome, super fresh fish. The Crispy Tuna Roll and sashimi sampler were amazing. Would definitely come back here soon.

We visited Soho after reading it's great reviews on Yelp and we weren't disappointed! This is not a large establishment or a fancy location, but the seafood was fresh & amazing.   We had the Philadelphia, Volcano & Rainbow Rolls-all great, but the Volcano roll was definitely the winner!  Waiter was attentive, & after finding out it was our first visit, brought us a complimentary sashimi plate-so kind!
Great experience and we would def visit again
Amazing experience!  The food was incredible and the server Darryl was top notch.  Service like that is truly rare and when coupled with great food is the best combination anyone could ask for.
Friendly people (good service)!! Great  Food . My tip is to get there by 5:00pm  when they open. The place gets full pretty fast  or you'll be waiting awhile.

Best Happy Hour!...Loved it. Really good food for the price. The seared albacore sashimi is one of my faves and the yellowtail kama, one of the best I've tried; very crispy on the outside and soft inside, super tasty!! I also liked the fried Calamari. Service is great as well! Drinks are also a fantastic deal on happy hour, I liked their lyche sake. The only con I can think is that rolls are so small that I barely tasted the fish in one of them, but still very good flavor.

I love eclectic Japanese food and creative rolls. And I absolutely love this restaurant! 

I don't know what else to say, just come eat and you will understand the 5 stars on almost every review.

Just perfect.... Wow! 
Just perfect in terms of delicacy, balance of taste, and freshness. In addition, what a great service! R u kidding me? Yes , I doooo recommend SOHO to everybody. Amazing food and pleasure experience.... Love love it!!!

The wife and I were looking for a sushi fix and we went to soho due to its great reviews and close location to us. We arrived with no reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes pretty good for a Friday night. The building isn't to large so if your looking to bring a big party it would be a little cramped depending on how many people are already inside, but the atmosphere is awesome and very romantuc. If your looking for alot of options you won't really get that as far as sushi goes I only saw one dedicated page and the amount of drink options was also low, but they do have the best miso soup I have ever had. Defenetly a place for a date but if you want alot of options there's better places out there.
Love this place always good customer service just wish the burritos were a little less pricy

This really is the best sushi I've had anywhere in this town. The fish is super fresh and flavors are unique. It's a hidden gem and everyone who loves sushi should try it. They have great lunch specials and happy hour, too. The grilled octopus is to die for. This is our new favorite spot for sushi and it never disappoints.

We decided to try Soho since it's near our new office and is highly recommended on Yelp and other sites. Gotta tell ya....this place is the bomb!  Our server, Sheila, was so friendly and gave us great recommendations. The sushi and sashimi were fresh, flavorful and visually appealing. The white peach infused sake was refreshing after a scorching day. The only downside to our new fave was the atmosphere was a bit rowdy. One table of 6 seemed a bit inebriated and made speaking across our table virtually impossible. Once they left, all was good. We will be back. Be sure to ask for Sheila if you're in the area and feel like having some amazing sushi.

I love Soho!  The staff is always polite and prompt.  We eat hear once a week for lunch or happy hour.  Lunch Bento Box is a great deal.  My favorite roll is the Flying Fish!  Dinner is a little pricey but so worth it!

Everytime I come here, I have something new and it's something I just feel the absolute NEED to review and give 5 stars to. 

This time around after a morning hike, BF and his roomies stopped in for lunch. My everlasting indecisiveness had me choosing between the Soho loco or the *off menu* salmon skin bowl that Chef previously made me. 
After the 4 boys made their lunch orders, to my shock, I ordered the sushi set lunch special...just because I never had it before. 

It came out, and I was pleased with the thick cuts of sashimi and tempura sushi. I was quite full when the hamachi kama (I forgot we ordered) came out. HOLY COW! Literally, it was a cow. Thick piece of yellowtail collar, basically the size of a T-bone steak. I was so impressed because I've only ever seen small size of collar. Truth be told, someone told me that's the size of real collar and the small ones are the frozen ones -- who knew?! 

I was soooo ridiculously full after that hamachi kama that kanak attack hit me and I was asleep for hours after I got home. Phew!

This place is DELICIOUS!!! Service, sashimi, sushi, owner, staff, and atmosphere is EXCELLENT. Everything I tried was beyond my expectations and tasted so fresh. John, the owner provided some sample dishes that was beyond my expectations. I had the best beef short rib I have ever ate and it was cooked to perfection. A must try!

There's tons of fancy, expensive, boujee restaurants in vegas but not enough places that are ACTUALLY good. Not only are all of their food fresh, but the hospitality that they offer here is just quite unreal.

Top notch hands down.

A little away from the strip but DEFINITELY worth the experience.

The best Japanese food I have eaten so far.  Chef John is a masterful craftsman in the kitchen.  All that he produces not only tastes great but are works of art.  Hamichi Kama was fantastic.   Lightly seasoned an cooked to perfection.   The tapas or mini tostadas erupt with flavor.  I tried the shrimp, tuna & yellowtale an they were all excellent.   Besides these I highly recommend the tempura rock shrimp, the sushi pizza and the yellow tale shashimi.  We tried several other dishes....see the pics with a bp after it...all were out of this world !!!!!  Thanks Chef John !!!
They have the best happy hour menu ever! great service!! love everything about this place. This will be my go to sushi place in vegas!

Our server Kelson was attentive to our needs. Atmosphere was pleasant.  The uni was very fresh and excellent in quality .  Happy hour menu was very reasonable with dollar items.  The lychee sake was delicious.  I will definitely be back for more.

THE COOLEST AND NOW MY FAVORITE PLACE TO BE!!!!

Being the outspoken and outgoing person that I am, I'm already glad that our server had a great sense of humor and definitely played along with my outspokenness. He was so accommodating and was more than happy to let us order off of the happy hour menu even a little after it was over. 

Now, the small trick to knowing if their service is "on point" is if they refill your water when it is empty without having to call for me to refill it. They most certainly refilled my water every time I took a sip out of glass of water, and refilled my glass every time I took my shot of lychee sake. Not only that, the Chef even came out to introduce himself, and offer a couple of complementary chef plates. It was DIVINE! I love their service here, and I can definitely see why they merit 5 stars.

Here are my faves:
HYDRO BIB BLACK COD - served in a leaf of lettuce (like a lettuce wrap). That nice butter texture with a slight smoke to it. So good I could even do without the lettuce.

STUFFED MUSHROOM - as any stuffed mushroom is. DIVINE! 

**FISH TOSTADAS - truly one of a kind and really the reason to come eat here. You'd want to buy 2 of each tostada during Happy Hour FOR SURE. It's fresh, and their tostada tastes like sweet panko crackers. Yum!

**UNI FROM THREE SEAS (thank you chef!) - AMAZING. Thank God this Uni was what I experienced my first Uni moment with. It comes from three seas. Santa Barbara, Catalina, and (if I am correct) Hokkaido, Japan. You start from SB and work your way towards Hokkaido (yes a journey right in front of your eyes). For a first time UNI-eater, I truly love the sweet taste to it.

After 1 soho maki, 8 fish tostadas, 1 fire cracker roll, 1 stuffed mushroom, 2 hyrdos, a sake and a creme brulee, my tab came out to around $50 for 2 people during happy hour. I'm pleased.

I love you servers and I love you Chef. You've got yourself a new fan!

The restaurant was very clean and the decor was nice. The ambiance was great and the service was good. I came because I saw all the amazing reviews here on yelp, but after eating here i was completly wow'ed.

When I looked at the menu it didn't have a large sushi selection and it had a small wine menu.  The wine I got was only okay and my husband's wine was way too sweet. 

The miso soup was really good, but the disappointing part was the sushi.  With all the amazing reviews thus place got I thought u would be having mind blowing sushi but it was just average.  Nothing to spectacular but also nothing bland.  It was just just okay.  

Dont get me wrong it is a great place for dinner but if you're in the mood for sushi there are better places to go.

I thought to give this place a try after reading all the good reviews. I was very disappointed with food and the service. It took a long time for the food to come. When the food finally came, the portions were small;food was over priced. The tempura was over fried. Rice did not come with it. It was not sushi rice...a little hard and dry. Sashimi was good but over priced. I've been to many Japanese restaurants, this one is definitely over rated on Yelp.

Seriously, as good as it gets. It's my Birthday and I was specifically looking for fresh sashimi. I don't just mean fresh. I mean so fresh I should be eating it wearing a snorkel and mask. I found it.

We made reservations for dinner which I would highly recommend. When we walked in four top was waiting for us and we were seated immediately. The staff recognized it was a birthday dinner and welcomed our first time visit.

Our server was Boris who is over the top with his service and demeanor. He walked us through the menu, made some great suggestions, he was attentive. A keeper.

I am writing this sated. Now to share the items we ordered.

We started off with the happy hour menu, which is a great value and then proceeded to the main menu

Infused Sake and Tyku Cucumber Sake
2 - Tempura Shrimp Rolls
2 - Shrimp Lollipops
1 - Baked Mussels
1 - Salmon Roll
1- Fire Cracker Roll
1 - Cajun Albacore sashimi
2 - Escolar Carpaccio
1 - Waygu platter
1 - Angus Sliders
2 - Salmon sashimi with avacado creme
1 - Golden Ocean Trout Sashimi - To die for
1 - Seared Garlic Tuna
1 - Amberjack Crudo
4 - Kumamoto Oysters
1 - Snapper with Uni and Roe (Not on the menu but you can ask for it)

All under $200 for 4 of us.

Everything was perfect and tasted so fresh. First time I tried Uni. Yay!

I have eaten at some of the most prestigious sushi restaurants on the strip. I have had Chef Nobu serve me personally. Chef John Chien Lee, formerly of Social House and the delicacies coming out of the kitchen was the best Japanese dining I have experienced in Las Vegas in 12 years. The bonus is not having to pay strip pricing for such a fine dining experience.

I don't normally leave Yelp reviews, but when I do it's for what I call Table Pounder food!!! 

We came here wanting to try something different than the normal AYCE places. 

The cold dishes were really the spotlight of the menu. We tried the Yellowtail Yuzu and Ume Scallop.  I fell in LOVE with sashimi scallop in Austin and have been on a hunt in Vegas ever since. This is the first restaurant I've found that had scallop and it was a table pounder!!! So fresh and delicious. I love the texture of scallop because it isn't like the normal fish that kind of melts in your mouth. It has this harder chewiness to it (best I can describe is Filipino pineapple jelly but a little softer)  For those who have never tried scallop, this is a must!  We wanted to try the entire cold menu but will come back for that. We also had some of the tostadas (shrimp and whitefish) which were also really good.  For dessert you cannot go wrong with the matcha tiramisu. The matcha flavor was good and it was super creamy just how I like it.

Best part of the night was having the chef come out to the table.  Chef John was very personable and you could feel the passion he had for his restaurant by the way he spoke of it. He also offered us a cold dish on the house of some special trout (can't remember the name) but it was similar to salmon and sooo good! 

We missed the specials because it was at the front of the restaurant and we couldn't see the sign. I mentioned it to him that the waiters didn't let us know and he said that he didn't want his patrons to feel like they were upselling us. I thought that was quite admirable but gave him a recommendation to move the specials where more people could see it because we probably would have ordered off of it. He said that he would take that into account and welcomed all recommendations. 

Not only was the food good but the chef really makes the place. It's only been opened for three months but seems to be doing well. I would definitely recommend this place. Not only for the food but the chef as well. He's the type of person that you hope has much success!!!

Our second visit. Fish was very fresh. Some confusion over which rolls we ordered, but they made it right and even brought us a complimentary starter. Very friendly and welcoming even when we showed up 10 mins before close. They have the usual rolls and some unique ones.  I like that they aren't the standard Vegas sushi joint with screaming O rolls, etc...a little classier than that. We'll be back.

This restaurant is recently opened on October 7th, by John Lee, former executive chef from Social House in Crystals at CityCenter. Went there for lunch, and it has excellent lunch specials for $8.95. It is not an "all-you-can-eat" sushi restaurant, but the quality of the food is outstanding; the sushi and sashimi are fresh, and the portion of the lunch boxes will not disappoint!!!
   In addition, this unique restaurant will have a live guitarist playing at the restaurant on Wednesday, Friday and Saturday nights starting at 6pm until 9pm!!! No other Japanese restaurant in town I've known does live music. Definitely will be going back there for dinner and enjoying the live music.
Probably the best sushi lunch I've had in a while.   I went a little overboard with the chu-toro but so tasty.  The gold flakes were a bit over the top but it's Vegas or at least Vegas area.

I use to come here often during my animal eating days but since my vegan diet, I've stopped coming until my beautiful vegan friend invited me to join her. She came recently & had such a good experience with the food & everything that she wanted to start coming back. 

They had great service as usual. They're always so nice here. We told them we had stopped coming because we went vegan & they accommodated vegan dishes for us. The veggie rolls were delicious! Everything we ate was really flavorful. Soho is so amazing! I can't stop thinking about how good everything tasted.

We were in Las Vegas both for business and pleasure.  We love sushi, especially sashimi. So...just to break away from the Las Vegas strip...we ventured away to find Soho, and it was the best find!!!  It is in a strip mall...but as soon as you walk in, you are welcomed with pleasant waitresses, and a calm and modern interior.  The menu is simple, not really crazy with all sorts of funky rolls, as we come to find out that it's known for fresh fish, sashimi!  We ordered their salmon tapas/tostadas and tuna tapas/tostadas, which was delicious, light and just melt in your mouth good!  Then, the sushi chef and owner, John Lee, came out and invited us to try the mixed sashimi special.  He asked us what type of raw fish we like...and of course, we didn't hold back to give our favorites!  Once the entree came out, we were floored with the generous portions and quality.  We had salmon, tuna, uni, saba, hamachi, scallop, trout, and aji.  But let me tell you, all of the bites of sashimi just melted into our mouths...and we knew we had to come back another time before we left town...which we did.  Highly recommend the treck off the strip to eat at this place.  We will be back again for more!!!
The uni is the best I've had. The sashimi lunch is an amazing deal. The staff is so friendly and accommodating.

Soho is amazing!  We came here on our way into Vegas because of all the stellar Yelp reviews.  We had the yellowtail sashimi with ponzu sauce and it was to die for.  Absolutely melted in our mouths.  Also tried the salmon avocado creme, completely delicious.  I had mango sake and it hit the spot.  Everything we tried was just perfect.  I could've lived without the kobe burgers but that was my fault for ordering a burger in a sushi joint.  Edamame was spot on too.  And the price tag was under a 100 bucks for a ton of food.  Go to Soho, you won't be disappointed!

Went here the other day for lunch!! Food was amazing, chef checked on us and made sure everything was perfect and also told us many options we could do in future. Staff was friendly, and could answer every question we had, waitress was very knowledgable about menu and Restraunt!!
