Best sushi I've tried in Vegas. We got a complimentary YellowTail sashimi plate from the chef himself! The staff was very friendly. We did wait about 30-40 to be seated but it was worth the wait. I recommend The firecracker roll; twin dragon roll; volcano roll and the tuna box.

I was born & raise in Las Vegas! I grew up on great customer service! I'm so happy to find it again! This is the place for great sushi & customer service! Sheila our server was extremely nice & the server that she relived! I'm a foodie & I promise if you go here you'll never go to a all you can eat sushi restaurant  again! If you're visiting Las Vegas and want too see what great customer service & food please go there & eat! The chefs & everyone that works there is extremely nice! It was my husband birthday and they treated him like he was a king!

Great Japanese-Fusion Restaurant with friendly staff. Good quality for fair prices in a safe and relaxed neighborhood. The Soho is definitely to place on the upper side of the fine dining Las Vegas list. The interior is rather family style design than fancy-chilly-cool&loud atmosphered.

This place is AMAZING! The fish is extremely fresh and the combination of flavors are incredible. We had the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, Snapper Lemongrass, sashimi mix plate special, Japanese Tai with uni in ponzu, hydro Bibb black cod, twin dragon roll and the chef gave us a complimentary uni sashimi which melted in our mouths like butter. Definitely coming back!

Best Japanese restaurant!  Everything was perfect!  Food, customer service, and everything was brought out in a timely manner.  And NO IMITATION CRAB served here!  Had the yellowtail yuzu, the black cod wraps, garlic tuna ponzu, hamachi Kama, and some kind of sashimi trout that had some kind of "pop rock" that popped in your mouth.  For dessert, The macha tirimisu was perfect.  Fresh fresh fresh fish!!!

I've been going here for 5 months and I will never ever go to another sushi place ever again. Chef Jon really built a sushi Jem in Las Vegas! Not only is the food amazing but the staff is incredible! Everything is reasonably priced and sooooo good. 

Try the crispy a Brussel Spouts and Sunny Salmon Roll.  I also enjoy being able to ask the chefs to surprise me with something creative. Chef Aaron and Chef Tae make the best damn rolls everrrrrrrr. But honestly the whole staff makes every thing so perfect. 

I almost don't want to write this review because I don't want my favorite spot to get busy! But they deserve every bit of business they get! 

Honestly though if you want quality sushi at a great price. Go here!!!

Wow, wow, wow! This place is AMAZE-balls! Can't believe I'm using this word!

We came here for happy hour on a weekday afternoon (M-Sat 4-6pm) and the restaurant was already pretty busy. Out waitress was super sweet, and immediately took our first round of orders. Our food came out really fast and the presentation was beautiful, see my photos! We pretty much ordered one of each of everything on the happy hour menu oink oink, which was very extensive and had many selection. We also got the lychee infused sake and that was delicious! 

The food was beautiful and super tasty, the pop rock fish dish was so fresh, so unique and so very interesting. Love it. The $1 tostadas were really good too, can't beat the price. Our waitress came back often to check up on us and refill our drinks without us ever asking, I call that excellent service! 

Highly recommend, my new favorite Japanese restaurant in town!

DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS! I had the lunch special sashimi, and it was really cheap for the quantity and quality you get. I loved their yellowtail the most. Super friendly and helpful staff as well! This place is going to be my go to spot whenever I crave sushi. 

PS: their oysters were good, but could be better.
Nice environment:  Laid back, while maintaining good, abrupt service. Clean tasting fish and knowledgeable wait staff. Keepv it up, Soho.
I love this place. Great atmosphere,  a bit pricey.  But good food n fast service w/a great happy hour.    Can't complain.

Me and my husband found this place on yelp since I was looking for a new Japanese restaurant to eat at during our anniversary week. We looked at some of the pictures on here too to see what we can expect. And I must say, they didn't let us down!
The fishes were all exceptional quality! The FLAVORS..??? To die for!!! And for the price, it was surprisingly reasonable considering the food was the same, if not better, quality than Andrea's at Encore hotel. The owner and the servers were really nice and friendly. The servers were very knowledgable as well when it comes to the components of the dishes. The owner was thoughtful enough to come to our table and ask us what we particularly liked in our food and recommended certain things to us that I absolutely loved!!! 
I definitely recommend ordering the yellowtail hamachi, seared beef hamachi, the ocean trout special, Japanese snapper with uni ponzu, fresh uni, shishito peppers, tuna poke tostada and miso black cod..

I highly recommend trying this place out and trust me you will be hooked! I know I am and my friends will be too soon after I take them there!
One of the best sushi restaurants!  Food and service was excellent! Was worth the drive from Aliante.

My daughter treated me to this wonderful gem for my birthday last Tuesday! She is a YELPER extraordinaire and a FOODIE so I always trust her to deliver and boy did she, because I am pretty squeamish about eating anything raw. The presentation and service was lovely, and they treated us extra special for the occasion. Sorry no photos as we were so in the moment of enjoying the meal.
The service here is excellent!!!  The yellowtail sashimi yuzu soy, and the salmon nigiri is the bomb !!

Amazing sushi! So fresh which is not what you expect in the middle of the desert but it's one of my favorite places in the across he nation.

I would say on par with Morimoto's in NY but no ridiculous price!  

When I'm in Los Angeles, I look forward to going to Vegas just for the sushi (specifically the toro) here!

1st time here and it was good. It's very reasonably priced and they have a nice special fish selection. Oysters were awesome and we enjoyed most of the cold dishes. Next time we'll try the live lobster and uni.

I love Soho! The sushi chefs are amazing ! Every plate looks gorgeous and tastes even better ! I'm so sad they are closed on sundays because I'm daydreaming about it now. The chefs go out of their way to make your experience special ! I went the day before Valentine's Day by myself and at the end of my meal I was given a piece of Matcha green tea cheese cake ! It was so delicious and made my night !
The food I've had here was pretty good...but the service is even better! Both times I've come here they've given me a complimentary dish! 5 stars to dat

Very busy the night we visited and I think they were short a staff member. Nonetheless,  very good sashimi and twin dragon roll. Octopus was very tender and the miso soup was very flavorful. The server was very kind and tried to make up for an order mishap by giving us a free sushi plate and some mochi balls. I really appreciate the gesture and that she earnestly tried to make things right.

Hands down the best sushi I've had off the strip.  They have an amazing happy hour from 5-7 with a bunch of stuff for everyone for only $5.  The fish is incredibly fresh, way better than Oyshi. This place is a hidden gem for sure!

SO good.  I didn't really know what to expect of a sushi restaurant with such high ratings on yelp (aside from "oh no, this may be horribly disappointing..") but I am VERY pleased to say that it lived up to all of the hype around it.

The fish here is SO FRESH.  Best fish I have had to date.  The chef orders fish fresh daily from the best places in the world, and oh my goodness it shows.

We got a large variety of appetizers + two rolls.  Their menu changes sometimes based on what they have in, so I'd highly recommend that you ask the server what's new.  She pretty much picked our entire order that day, and she did an amazing job.

The Happy Hour is Amazing! $5 items, drink specials starting at $3! Everything was delicious! Loved the fruity sakis! I don't even like fish or sushi, but I really enjoyed our food. Service was phenomenal! Will definitely be back again soon!

This has become one of my favorite spots to have a few rolls and some sake when I need a sushi fix. Usually I am a party of one, and they always make sure I feel welcome and are very attentive. The $5 app menu is AMAZING! I could make a meal of it alone. 1 or 2 items need to be had with each meal.

LAS VEGAS: Prepare to be treated like royalty when you come into this excellent sushi spot; the most yelped about in Las Vegas.  I read about it and came in, and was surprised to be treated non-pretentiously, comfortably, and with a very welcoming vibe.  The servers were having fun being here and were super nice to everyone.  Like I was stepping into the Cheers bar.  Thanks guys!

Yellowtail Yozu Soy (4stars/$12) Beautiful and delicious, mild soy and citrus with a spicy kick.

Cajun Albacore Sashimi (5 star/$5 HH menu): This beautiful dish packs a punch! Smooth fish with healthy spice, delicious sauce.

Tostadas ($4 for 4):
The Tuna tostada is 5 stars.  The other three (Tako, Salmon, Hamachi) are 3-4 stars each.

Hydro Bibb Black Cod (5 stars/$4 HH):  Awesome!  Warm marinated cod on crisp green lettuce.  A little tempura topping for additional texture.  Buy this.

Green Tea Tiramisu (4 stars/$7): Really smooth, really creamy, moist, firm cake.  Very light flavor.

How refreshing to dine in an establishment where the staff and owner cares so passionately about the quality and experience. We visited on a Thursday night started with the Kumamoto oysters and mix sashimi platter. The mix sashimi platter for 25$ is an amazing value, superb quality, and surprisingly voluminous assortment of yummy fish. The oysters, yellowtail, beef capriccio all 5 stars and with a delightfully pleasing presentation. The bone in short ribs - amazing!!!!!!!!!! The double dragon roll was well prepared and tasty. The green tea tiramisu was terrific.  This not an all-you-can-eat sushi joint - or a come-all sushi roll house with chicken teriyaki.  It's a high quality and adventurous sashimi house with a flare. If you have an adventurous palate, it is the place for you. The staff was overwhelming in friendliness, knowledge, and attentiveness. 

I forgot ..... They use real crab in their sushi rolls not the fake stuff found in 90% of the sushi houses in Las Vegas. I will be back !!!!!

The place is advertised as Strip quality without the price tag. I agree. This place has one of my favorite happy hours. Happy hour is from 4-6pm. The menu has a bunch of items like sushi rolls, mini tostadas, sashimi, and appetizers around the $1-7 range. Everything here is fresh. 

I especially like the firecracker roll. It has spicy tuna, cream cheese, and jalapeno lightly deep fried in tempura. I normally don't desire deep-fried rolls, but the tempura casing is more crunchy than breaded. 

Chef Lee is absolutely friendly and makes time to meet his diners. I've been on more than one occasion and he makes it a point to remember his diners. I really enjoy this personal touch.

The restaurant isn't big, but it's never been too busy to get seated. Try Soho during happy hour and if you like it, give the rest of Chef Lee's menu a shot.
Food was really great! The only thing that wasn't perfect was the green tea creme brûlée at the end. It tasted more milky than green tea to me :(
Everything we ordered was just phenomenal. The chef came out and went over different fish options we had. The service was amazing. I plan to eat here often.

WOW! I cannot tell you enough how much I love Soho!  

I have been searching for some new great spots on the southwest side of town and sadly, there aren't many. So naturally, when I read that former Executive chef of Social House (John Chien Lee) opened his own restaurant, I was thrilled!! 

I have always loved Social House but think their prices are outrageous for the portion sizes you get. The Sashimi Sampler at S.H. was my favorite but the fish was cut so thin and skimpy and was $28!  BUUUUUTTTT not at Soho! The Yellowtail Sashimi appetizer was only $10 and the yellowtail was cut THICK and was out-of-this-world delicious!!  DO NOT miss! I repeat: DO NOT MISS!! (I wanted to order 10!!!) We also ordered a simpl spicy tuna roll off the Happy Hour Menu and 6 Poke "Tostadas". All very very delicious and very inexpensive!!!!

The rolls were A-MAZING! We tried the Dragon Twin, Spicy Soft Shell Crab roll, the Sunny Salmon Roll and goodness.....the quality of the fish is SO FRESH! I have to admit, its been a long time since i've had such fresh fish in Las Vegas. Oyishi is usually my local hang, and though I love it... I feel as of late, the quality of fish has really gone downhill at points and its totally bummed me out! (That's why I've been on the search for a new spot!) 

One nice touch is that they also offer a hot brown rice Japanese tea and its complimentary, which is a nice alternative to the traditional green tea and its really really yummy!

To top off the whole experience, Chef Lee came out and asked us how our dinner was! He was so kind and actually mentioned that he takes the freshness of his seafood very seriously! To which I replied... "It's the first thing I noticed!" followed by... "I'm your biggest fan and telling everyone I know!!"

Without a doubt this is going to be my new spot. I want to eat here every night of the week! Ohhhhh, I'm drooling just thinking about it.....

Honestly I like that we always can get right in so hesitant to give it anymore stars (ha ha) but this place is great. Friendliest staff and amazing food. We just moved here 5 mos ago from LA and searched hard to find a place here like our one at home and this is it. We drive all the way from Lake Las Vegas every week or two we like it that much!!! Great local spot.

Our first meal at Soho we were a group of 11. We did our homework before hand and made sure to get there in time for the happy hour specials. Good thing we went early! There was plenty of room at 5pm but by 530 it was packed with a wait. It's a pretty small place.

Our server was outgoing, funny and very knowledgable about the menu. He had great recommendations on what to order and the best way to do it. 

The happy hour menu is great! Lots of good stuff at great prices. Every piece of fish was fresh and well prepared. We did order some regular menu items and were not disappointed. Prices are very reasonable and again, high quality. 

The only 2 things I didn't love were how cold it was in there (felt like AC was blowing) and they're a Pepsi place (personal preference- Coca Cola all the way :)

Go for happy hour and try it in for size!

I hardly have words for this one. Best. Sushi. Ever. For starters. One of the best meals I've had. Twice. Came here a year ago. Heartily came back. Hope to do so again soon! 

Just ask your server to bring you something good. You cant miss. Great service here. Have had two excellent servers, last time Sheila.

I've been waiting to post my first Yelp review to a very special place. 
Soho was amazing. Hands down!
We got there at 5:50 and put our names down... About a 15 minute wait. When they were ready to seat us, they apologized for the wait (unnecessary, but appreciated) and they offered to extend happy hour just for our first order (again, unnecessary because happy hour had ended at 6, but very much appreciated). 
We ordered several items from the happy hour and regular menu. My favorites were the Cajun Albacore, Firecracker roll, and the Sunny Salmon Roll. 
You HAVE TO TRY THE SUNNY SALMON ROLL. I can't even put words together to describe the delightful surprise of flavors that you taste, so you're just gonna have to take my word for it and try it yourself. 
We also had the cold peach saki which was delicious!
At the end of our dinner, the head chef came over to us, introduced himself, thanked us for our business, and later brought over a complementary sashimi dish of yellowtail, which was fantastic. 
Soho is a small place so there will most likely be a wait around happy hour, but it's definitely worth it. I'll definitely be coming here again very soon!

really fresh Hamachi, Uni and red snapper sashimi and other raw creations by chef John.  Matcha Tiramisu really hit the spot after some great Sushi.  Definitely will come back to try their happy hour and lunch menu.

Some restaurants try and fail to pull off Asian fusion. Soho does it flawlessly. I'd give 6 out of 5 stars if I could. 

My guy and I came by on a Saturday for Happy Hour -- offered Monday through Saturday from 3pm to 7pm. We arrived around 4:50pm and didn't have to wait. By the time 5:30pm rolled around, though, there were several groups of guests waiting for a table. Apparently, making a reservation is the way to go around here. 

Right away, we knew we'd have a great meal. We arrived famished and fell in love with the dozens of options on the Happy Hour menu. Rolls, carpaccios, appetizers, and drinks are all up for grabs. All of the food items are $5 each -- and great sizes! -- and most of the drinks are $5 or $6. 

A few things to keep in mind -- this is a place to go to if you genuinely like raw fish. A lot of the menu features raw items and creative garnishes, so this might not be the place to try something completely out of your element. Also, expect the sashimi slices in the carpaccios to be small and thin. Fresh, but skinny. 

Lastly -- I have to say Soho has the best sauces ever. Seriously. You won't find basic ponzu, eel sauce, and spicy mayo junk at Soho. Instead, you'll enjoy the likes of Yuzu mascarpone creme, creamy ponzu, avocado creme, and truffle oil. 

Here's what we ordered...

TROPICAL SAKE, PASSION FRUIT MANGO
- $6 for a small-sized carafe. 
- Sweet and fruity, just how I love it. No strong sake taste. 
- Cold, alcoholic drink.  
- Guava flavor is also available.

GINGER HAMACHI
- Yellowtail with slices of jalapeno and fried pork rinds. 
- Never had crispy pork rinds on raw fish, but I loved it. I've been missing out. 
- Not on the happy hour menu. 
- One of my favorites of the evening!

SALMON CARPACCIO
- Features Yuzu mascarpone creme, shallots, and diced tomatoes. 
- The flavor just works, and I was so weary of cheese and salmon. 
- Fresh, light taste. 
- So good, we got it twice. 
- Another favorite of the evening. 

ANGUS BEEF TATAKI
- Seared steak with shallots, chives, garlic, olive oil, and ponzu. 
- Tastes a lot like seared tuna tataki. Similar texture, too. 
- Compared to everything else, this was the least memorable. Everything else we ordered was just so much better. 

CAJUN ALBACORE SASHIMI
- Comes on a bed of daikon radish, soaked in sauce. 
- Creamy ponzu sauce is unlike anything I've ever had. So rich and flavorful. 

SALMON AVOCADO CREME
- Dressed up with avocado creme, pico de gallo, cilantro, and ponzu. 
- The avocado is subtle, but offers an excellent sweetness to each bite. 
- Cute take on ceviche. 

SALMON AVOCADO ROLL
- 8 good-sized pieces. 
- Basic item, but yummy and filling because of the rice. 
- Can't go wrong with a classic!

SPICY TUNA DIP
- Basically, a spicy tuna tartare with taro chips instead of wonton chips. 
- The spicy tuna is a legitimate tartare mix, not the average spicy tuna that goes in a roll. SO GOOD. 

INFUSED COLD SAKE, WHITE PEACH
- $5 for a small-sized carafe.
- Stronger sake taste, but still a nice fruity flavor. 
- Cold, alcoholic drink. 
- Lychee flavor is also available. 

BAKED MUSSELS
- 6 large pieces. 
- Yuzu dynamite sauce with ponzu, scallions, and tobiko. 
- Great, easy option to share. 

Overall, an excellent meal. My guy and I agree that this was the best Happy Hour experience we can remember. 

Bonus -- ample parking, as the restaurant is situated in a plaza. Also, the employees are great and helpful. There's a dozen people working in the open kitchen, busy creating masterpieces and shouting "Soho!" at incoming patrons. 

Whether you're a local or a tourist, come here!!
Love this place! Some of the best sushi and Japanese food in Vegas!! Locals favorite!!

This place used to to be really good they changed their menu and the food isn't the same. I used to love coming here and this place was always packed. Sorry to say but I don't think I'll be coming here anymore!!!!

If I can give this place 10 stars, I would! Good food,  good price & exceptional service. I've been here many times and was never disappointed.  Only once I said it was just "ok" and to my surprise the chef made me something special to make up for my dissatisfaction with my food.  The staff (especially Shiela) rocks!  Always going the extra mile to make sure customers are happy.  The price is amazing for what you get. I recommend this place to everyone!
This place was awesome! They have amazing happy hour menu. The server was very attentive and the service was top notch! I'll definitely be coming back for some fresh sashimi and sushi.
Went to Soho for my daughter's 21st birthday. We sat at the sushi bar and had a great time. The service was amazing as they were so attentive and the food was awesome. We'll definitely be back.

Some of the flavors repeat in dishes, but they have a good variety of selections to mix it up. The Toban soup was unique, a seafood soup served in a teapot and teacups.  After drinking, you eat the seafood out if the pot! Miso cod is deelish, beef tataki is fresh and zesty with ponzu. Garlic Soft shell crab was a bit cold n soggy, may have been a delay from counter to table?  I'm willing to give it another shot, of beer! They have Orion beer from Okinawa, I always like to have the obscure beers. Service is good as it should be for this type of venue and the staff are not noobs to the industry... 
SOHO, SOcial HOuse?  Hmmmmmm... And desert was awesome and I'm not a BIG desert guy, pastry puff w pistachio creme filling n blue/raspberry trim. Tantalizing to the tastebuds!!  
The southwest is starting to develop some really good venues!! 

Sake bomb!!!!!

In short... Most Amazing service.

This place gets 5 stars, not because of the food but also because the service was nothing less than stellar.

Shiela gave us free sake and free dish. She did this because it was my birthday and they didn't have a couple small items. Probably because everyone loves this place and doesn't have enough for everyone that comes. Very popular joint. I can't say anything bad about this place. If you end up waiting, it's worth the wait.
Holy moly!!! No joke this place wins in Vegas... Chef was so informative and nice, sat at bar, AMAZING experience. I let the waitress and chef guide my experience love this place!

Konnichiwa, I'd like to introduce my new Happy Hour friend.  Haul your cute little booties over to S. Jones & Warm Springs for one of the best hh deals around town Mon -Sat, 4-6pm. Soho emerges from the former Ambrosia Cafe occupancy.  While Soho is a perfectly good name, in my mind it just didn't fit for a Japanese restaurant, possibly why I kept forgetting about this place despite some of my fellow yelpers' high praise.  The name just seemed like some new, trendy little spot until I made the connection that Chef John Chien Lee is the former chef from Social House.  Therefore, depending on historical events, I'm guessing that the name 'Soho' can only mean 1 of 2 possible things, me love you long time or suck it b*tches.

We tried the many of their happy hour dishes with great success.  My favorite dish is the black cod lettuce wraps.  Other high points included the variety of sushi empanadas for $1 each,  cajun albacore sashimi, firecracker roll, and stuffed mushroom.  The only low point of the evening was the dry and overcooked ika geso, aka the fried calamari that came with a curry aioli dipping sauce.  During hh they offer $1.50 - 3 beers.  I enjoyed the Asahi @ $3 while he happily sipped the $1.50 Coors Light.

The atmosphere is nice but small, .  It looks exactly the same as it did when Ambrosia occupied the space; same layout and color schema.  Service is excellent!

Halfway through our meal owner/chef Lee came out to great us and treated us to a complimentary yellowtail special, which was absolutely delicious!  

My verdict = hit it, quit it, hit it again (and again).

Nice sushi restaurant on the southwest side of Las Vegas. They have a great happy hour menu. Food is very good and service is on point. 

It's a little dark inside for dinner so if you like to take someone to a nice romantic dinner, I suggest this place. Price is very reasonable and the set up in here is very modern.

The idea of having assembly line sushi is great. With that being said, the quality of the raw fish was nearly intolerable. The guacamole was even worse. I thought maybe if I tried something different, I'd enjoy it. I decided to get the crab and it wasn't quite as bad, but still pretty bad. The place is cheap and if you've ever eaten at a semi decent quality sushi restaurant you'll know how gross this fish is. I'm sorry, but I'm never going back.

$8.95 lunch specials makes Soho my new favorite lunch destination. Staff are incredibly friendly & efficient. Food is what you would typically expect from strip mall Japanese spot being that it's fresh & tastes good, but I wouldn't classify it as exceptional. 

I will be frequenting Soho for lunch, and maybe venture here for dinner at some point to try other menu options.

Words can not express the level of awesomeness this place has, but I shall try nonetheless.

#1. This place has some of the freshest sushi I have seen. Food is always consistently on point. Sushi places often struggle to keep their standards to a level. This place, without being over-pricey, keep a high level of quality while giving you good quantity. 

#2. The service here is great! Glass half full? Now it's full again. Bam, new prospective. But seriously, they make sure you are well catered too and even at times surprise you with unexpected sample dishes from the kitchen which is always a good hook. (ho ho ho...get it? Hook? Sushi restaurant? Ehhh...I should stop while I'm ahead)

#3. Place is clean. Even the bathroom. You can tell a lot about the hygiene level of the wait staff and kitchen crew of a restaurant by its restrooms. No lie. Go to a McDonald's bathroom then go to a great restaurant bathroom and you'll know what I mean. 

#4. Green Tea Tiramisu. Enough said.

I am put out. Love this place, but drove 30 minutes at lunch to get here to find out you are now closed at lunch. The other 10 people who waited patiently in their cars for your regular noon opening all walked up smiling and turned away disappointed and angry. It's not like you are centrally located. This is a destination - well it was.

I won't bore you of details that have been explained time and time again with Soho. Chef John Lee and staff are simply amazing and artist when it comes to food. Put this place on your bucket list if you haven't already done so, you surely won't be disappointed. A near perfect rating on yelp explains a lot about Soho, and I'm glad I found this little gem hidden around the corner of my house. 

I came in here for my girlfriends birthday, they were very accommodating and friendly even storing and plating some cupcakes I brought in from The Cupcakery. The service here is amazing and something you would expect dining on the strip paying top dollar. Chef John brought many practices from Social House but with a more relaxed vibe. He came out and introduced his self and got a feel for everyone and put together a epic tasting menu for the whole group.(If you have the chance choose this way to dine) I couldn't have set up a better menu in my wildest dreams. From the tender short ribs to the delicate hamachi and uni, everything amazing and leaving you wanting more and more. I have to say I never had the quality of uni Chef Lee serves and he prides himself in the quality of his foods. 

I am so satisfied with the quality of food and service with Soho that I will be back time and time again. You can't beat this place, he deserves all the recognition they can get for this gem! Thank you for the great experience!

We went here for a quick dinner after work. This place is an amazing neighborhood find! The food was great, literally everything that we ordered was perfect. We happened to stop by during happy hour and everything on that menu was perfect. We also ordered a few drinks while there. The infused Sake was perfect, as well as the house Sake. We will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone.

This place deserves five stars and more.  I was expecting another disappoint after the last two Asian Fusion restaurants I visited.  Luckily I may have just found my second home.

Originally I had been wanting to visit this place after seeing so many rave reviews on Yelp from my fellow Yelpers.  I came here for lunch and I base my reviews on service, quality, presentation, and lastly taste.

Service - We had seen two servers helping everyone throughout the restaurant and they were really on top of there game.  Food came out immediately despite how busy it was.  Refills happened without me having to ask.  I happened to spill the wasabi from my meal on my tie and the server noticed right away and brought water and napkins for me.  That's the real deal right there.  Kudos for the service!

Quality - Fusion food is a rather new concept that is slowly becoming an emerging market.  They didn't go cheap on any part of the meals we were served.  All freshest ingredients and healthy food!

Presentation - I couldn't believe how much food I was staring at for the incredible fairly priced items.  My braised short rib looked amazing and I was a little nervous about the wasabi, but shockingly it was AMAZING!  The presentation looked like something mom used to present for dinner when I was a kid.

Food - I think by now you get the jest of my overall review.  The braised short rib was cooked tender and to perfection.  It literally melted in my mouth and it was GOOD!  That wasabi sauce was not spicy at all and I definitely have now bookmarked this place to try more items.

For great service, amazing food, affordable meals and another place to call home, Soho is the place to go!

We love this place! Every meal is created with excellence and all the ingredients are always fresh! Service is fast and all the staff are very friendly! Overall experience is a 5 star! Cajun albacore is our favorite!

Some friends and I decided to try out SoHo while in Las Vegas because we wanted to get off the strip one evening. I will never regret that decision!

First, the food. Everything we had was amazing. The Yellowtail Yuzu Soy was outstanding. The nigiri and sashimi were so fresh they melted in the mouth. We split several rolls, all of which were absolutely fantastic.

Second, the service. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Our server gave great recommendations and was just so pleasant! And very attentive to our glasses of water as we plowed through several pints after a day walking in the Las Vegas summer heat!

All in all I wish I lived closer so that I could go back to SoHo! I'll definitely be returning the next time I'm in Vegas.

Although I don't EVER write reviews, I felt compelled to write a review from my experience here. Our group of 5 share in this bliss with me.

After a failed attempt to go to Bachi Burger (closed for maintenance the 1 day we wanted to go) we decided to Yelp another location. Randomly jumped back on Yelp as I started driving; light turned green, car started moving, executive decision whip a majorly illegal U-turn. Nonetheless we got there.

First thing we (at least the males of the group) noticed were the $4 drafts of Asahi Dry. Done and done.

Expecting this to be a normal sushi joint, we just order a few things to gauge the sushi quality. Our 2 friends decide to ask if they would do omakase, and the waiter said he'd ask the chef/owner if this was okay. Let me tell you, those 2 made the best decision of the trip.

Having heard that we wanted omakase, the chef/owner John decided to pay our table a visit (he visited almost every table while we were there dining). Asked what kind of dished the guys would like, but mainly we just left it up to him.

2 of our group shared the tostados and were amazed how good they were, so I decided to order all 6 that were on the menu. These little things were packed with so much flavor in various forms. No two were the same and they were just great.

For the rest of us that didn't get the omakase, here's how we ended up
Tostados 
Hamachi
Tako
Albacore
Philly Roll
Angus Beef Tataki


I love my philly roll for some reason, and right when I ate the first piece, I was confused. The fish quality and texture alone were completely different than anything I have ever had. Maybe I'm still a n00b to great sushi, but I have definitely not had that texture from DC, Cali, NYC, Boston or anywhere else I've ever eaten sushi.

The rest of the sashimi was just as good and at that point we knew we were in for a treat.

Tuna poke that was special reminded me of Hawaii. The flavors were nice and acidic with that mellow undertone of sesame oil.

Tuna, sliced beef, fish, oysters, uni, EVERYTHING we had was good. For some odd reason there is a beef short rib on the menu, and even that was good. The guys got that as part of their omakase and it is normally a $30 item at any "fine dining" place. They had about 6 or 7 courses in their tasting.. the grand total $40 for their omakase. Simply amazing.

By the end of the night we were wanting to throw money at the owner. Literally. They forgot to include the omakase in our bill at first, but we felt so compelled to pay them and told them to correct our bill. Sub $250 bill with beers, 2 omakases, a ton of other dishes for 5 people. Can't be beat.

Chef John even prepared a few special things not on menu for us to all try. Simply amazing. Seriously, if we didn't have a flight to catch, we were all in agreement we would've just stayed there and said, here's $100, do what you can. Having had tastings from some of the best chefs in the US, this one would surely be right up there with all of them.

Don't like the food, just fly back into Vegas, and I'll go again with you to taste it again. Chef John Lee, kudos to you sir. After 3 months and the reviews of this place are already pegging your restaurant as one to look out for.

I read all the positive yelp reviews of this place and decided to give it a try. I ordered 3 items for takeout - it took about 35-40 minutes (which is a long wait for takeout, but in fairness they were busy and the staff was very attentive, checking in on me frequently and letting me know my food was coming soon). I ordered three items: the angus gyoza which was delicious - the dipping sauce went perfectly with the dumplings. The Sunny Salmon Roll was also great - the lemon really adds a great twist of flavor to the roll. The tuna box sushi, however, I found bland. It wasn't bad but there wasn't much flavor to the roll and it was awkwardly shaped and difficult to eat. Everything tasted very fresh (which is always a good quality when serving raw fish). I will definitely come back again!
Really good happy hour and great service. The servers are always very happy and upbeat. Not much for ambience or decor but the food is very good. Great prices.

Really liked the sunny salmon roll and the Matcha Tiramisu dessert was what I liked the most. Sat at the bar because the place was really busy. Bar is really cramped for leg room and a television to look at would add to the atmosphere. I don't like fish, so not a great option of rolls to choose from. The lunch menu looked like more my taste. Loco Moco would have hit the spot, but not offered for dinner. The staff was really great and the chef came over and talked with us to see how we liked things. Will return, but most likely for lunch.
They don't open for Lunch anymore which is a bummer! Sushi is good and fresh, but sucks that they only open for dinner now.

Service was good. Food was anything but spectacular. A pricey menu that didn't live up to the high expectations. The place is clean but location is not classy as it is still next to a gasoline station. I do not recommend this place.
Aaron is so amazing and his smile and personality is fire!!!!!  You can NOT beat the $5.00 EVERYTHING menu. Sashimi and sushi and appetizers and drinks and beers.... so amaze!!!!

5 out of 5 stars? I thought there had to be something wrong about this place, but there wasn't! Every dish was presented beautifully and with every bite, you could tell it was fresh-definitely no "fishy" taste with their seafood. The staff is very knowledgeable and have great recommendations such as the sashimi platter, white peach sake, yellowtail yuzu soy and hydro Bibb black cod. If you don't like sashimi, try their grilled salmon or beef tadas. 

I will be coming back to try the rest of the things on the menu :)

Damn! I don't know how better to start off this review. Just had dinner there tonight for the first time after wanting to try a new place and reading the yelp reviews. I am so happy I went and tried this place. When I first walked in, we were greeted by the friendly staff. We sat at the bar and the gentleman asked us for our drink order. Being a big fan of beers my attention was quickly drawn to the cooler. I noticed they had some unique craft beers that I've never seen before (which is a surprise in a sushi restaurant anyways), but i was sold on a Japanese beer that I've never before (great beer by the way, forgot the name but has a white label, almost looks like a sake bottle) and a craft of lychee sake, which had to been some of the best I've had!  The the gentleman went on to explain some of the popular items on the menu, such as the sashimi, rolls, short rib,etc. 

  After we ordered a couple of recommendations we met the owner John as well as some of his other chefs. Do yourself a HUGE favor when you go, put the menu away when you look at it and let John and his crew hook you up!!! I can't describe how epic the dishes where they were creating for us. And don't worry, prices here are VERY reasonable!!! We ate a ton, majority off the menu with lots of booze and our bill was about $100. The short rib is an absolute must and hands down the best on the planet. They braise it for 8 hours and glaze it in a homemade veal  stock. The fish is so fresh, no cloudiness or weird texture. Just really amazing and everything is made in the restaurants from sauces to deserts. 

I can go on and on about Soho but you have to go. I went based on a yelp review and I'm so glad I did. Hopefully you'll have an opportunity to experience this culinary marvel as well!!!

Happy Eatings!!!

Man!! I love this restaurant! Great service and food! Chef gave us 1 complimentary dish cos he said we were so pretty :) (or maybe he says that to everyone) even the dragon roll made a difference in soho! We also ordered some tempura shrimps, yellowtail ponzu, and baked mussels??(so gooooood) I loved every dish we ordered and the service was great! Thumbs up to our server asian long hair dude!
Very fast and efficient for a quick lunch.  Very good and fresh sashima.   I just ordered simple today but next time I'll try the more exotic rolls with sexual enuendo names.
I can't get enough of SOHO! Having lunch right now & loving every bite! You gotta come to know what I mean!! ;)

Fantastic. Bravo. The compliments are piled on here and the adage that going off the strip in Vegas will lead you to some incredible restaurants wth great value certainly holds true here. The sushi is fresh and hand made in an open kitchen. The "one bite" appetizers (which I can remember but are basically a fish salad of some type on a chip) are delicious. The sushi is delicious - we loved every roll and they all my only had the quality of begin beg high quality, but try had the quality of quantity too - these rolls aren't skimpy!

The prices are very reasonable considering the quality and quantity you receive - I am so happy we ate here!

Excellent service and food. Make sure to have a reservation, the restaurant is not too big!

The Happy Hour menu is worth the trip. The $5 Escolar Carpaccio and Baked Mussels were amazing. The tasting menu is only $68 for 2 people which is a fraction of the price you would pay on the Strip!

Awesome place!!! Chef jon and his right and left hand men are by far the best sushi chefs and they're hospitality and grattitude and fun is outstanding! You all gotta check out soho sushi burritos on sahara and I-15 across palace station as well...thank you guys for the fun and conversations and OUTSTANDING service

This was the best service I have ever had. Best sushi ever also. The server was knowledgeable and very friendly. I drove here from the strip because the reviews were so good, they didn't disappoint. The green tea creme brûlée was delicious and I don't like green tea all that much. I have never seen 5 stars on yelp but they definitely deserve all of them. When I visit Vegas again I will be back. Great job!

This is the best restaurant in vegas!

Firstly, we were welcomed by the staff with just great smiles even thought it was like 4 in the evening when no one usually has lunch.

The sushi was out of the world! 

You need to have the green tea tisamisu! It's just amazing.

If your are in vegas, this place is a must go.

Soho was my first place I visited while visiting Las Vegas. I came here on the on set of happy hour and we ordered a variety of items including, the Cajun Albacore Sashimi, Salmon Roll, Black Cod Butter Lettuce Wraps, Spicy Tuna Roll, Fried Calamari, and Kurobuta Sausages wrapped in Bacon. All items were between $3 and $5 during happy house, not to mention the $4 ice cold draft of Sapporo. 

Both rolls, where great. The spicy tuna had a nice kick and tasted good, and the salmon roll's salmon was very good, rich in flavor and with a good amount of fat. The avocado pieces were perfectly ripe and creamy. The Albacore Sashimi was very good and the Cajun rub brought on some unique flavors. The Albacore was mild in flavor and the garnish of thinly sliced jalapenos went a long way. I liked the sauce underneath, but I wish they would serve it on the side, because it was a little heavy handed. 

The fried calamari was lightly breaded, thick, and tender. It also looked very appetizing with light honey color, but its sweet flavor was king and soft tenderness just right. The Kurobuta Sausages were bliss and were the perfect appetizer to eat with the cold Sapporo. The sausages were crispy, exploding with juice once bitten, and packed with a great meaty flavor. The crisp and chewy bacon just added to the goodness via its flavor and texture.

The Black Cod lettuce cups were pretty good. I expected a little more flavor from the cod, but it was good. The fish was light and flaky, but the cups needed some kind of sauce drizzled on top to moisten them up. 

Service was great and provided by a great young lady named Candice. We were lucky to have her with a enamoring personality and friendliness. No doubt, this was a great start to my Vegas visit.

The food was amazing, loved it! I am usually pretty weary of raw fish, but their sashimi completely changed my mind. They even gave us a complimentary yellowtail sashimi, which is their signature dish. Everything we had was top notch and pretty reasonably priced. Definitely recommended!!

Fresh sushi!  We went here for first time and definitely will not be the last time.  The prices are reasonable and the sushi are good.  We also order lychee sake and it tasted really good.  The restaurant is about 15 mins drive from the strip and the inside of the restaurant is clean.  The waitresses are friendly and they checked up on us a few times.

Great News!!!   This place is legit.  Service and sushi are both on point.  They do have happy hour specials although we didn't take advantage it's nice to know it's an option.  Would definitely recommend anyone on the SW side of town check it out.

Rolls are priced reasonably 
Place is clean and well maintained
Staff is very good and polite
Food is very good and fish is fresh
Some specialty rolls with beef seared and asparagus and other ingredients you won't find elsewhere
Best sushi in town. Their special sashimi are out of this world. In roll i recommend the spicy soft shelf crab. Delicious.

I absolutely love this place! Amazing food and the staff treats you great, very friendly and amazing customer service. I lived in Vegas for 20 years and been to the best restaurants but honestly Soho has the best sushi. I'm always happy when I leave. My favorite is yellow tail Yuzu. Love everything about this place.

The hype is real. I feel like I've been overrating other sushi restaurants. This one takes the cake and deserves all the stars I've been giving to every single sushi joint. 

Chefs, thank you so much for making my trip to vegas worth it! 

I've never liked sashimi before but my taste has changed after eating here. Had the white fish ponzu, salmon wasabi creme,  yellowtail yuzu, and the yellowtail soho tadas. Everything tastes sooooo fresh and the sauces were well-paired. Items were beautifully presented. Tadas are $2 each and the sashimi specialties I had were $11/$12. Worth every penny. 

Hot sake was served in a roundish bottle so the heat stayed in longer than the tall long ones usually served at other restaurants. 

My friends had the sushi lunch special with some spicy tuna rolls. They were happy with their choice as well. 

Desserts: also delicious we're matcha tiramisu and GREEN TEA CREME BRÛLÉE!!!! 


p.s. I couldn't even wait to get home to make a review.

I am only giving "one star" because i can't zero. Word of advise, when your sign says open until 10pm...the first thing the host SHOULDN'T SAY at 9:16pm is...."The kitchen is closing early"..pathetic....I'll never be back.

What can I say ? This place supercedes  any expectations  you may have from  a near pefect score on Yelp .   I'm   feom Los Angeles  and I've  had some  of the best in the world . Soho Sushi  is the Chef's   pride and joy  and it shows !

The fish is fresh, so kudos for that, and it's tasty,  where is the real wasabi? The chef and owner wasn't the sushi chef and it was noticable. However, it's worth coming here to taste what quality fish is meant to  taste like.
I can't even describe this place on yelp! I moved from Hawaii and had the most fresh fish even. This place is exceptionally fresh! Everything here is AMAZING!!

Take me to the place I love, take me all the way. 

Exceptional service and great food that will blow your mind, located on Southwest of Vegas. We came here on a Wednesday night after seeing some great reviews on Yelp and this restaurant had exceeded my expectation. 

Things we tried:

Golden ocean trout- Ordered based on server's recommendation off of appetizer and this was my most favorite dish out of everything I tried. It was ocean trout cut up sashimi style with ponzu and pop rocks drizzed on top. Yes, pop rocks. It added to an interesting sensation that kept me wanting a bite after another. Refreshing and interesting appetizer that I would highly recommend for everyone to try. 

Toro/otoro- It was off of their menu board by the entrance. You can order this in either nigiri or sashimi style. We ordered this in nigiri style and it came with gold flakes on top. Thick cut of toro/otoro with just enough rice. Simply delightful dish and easily one of my favorite. 

Tuna lover roll- One of their specialty rolls that comes with crispy kanikama, avocado, passion fruit soy and roasted spicy aioli. It was on the spicier side with their spicy aioli sauce that tasted like sriracha. It wasn't mind blowing but still was good and filling. Based on other reviews/photos on Yelp, seems like the firecracker roll is a popular choice for specialty roll. 

Crispy brussel sprouts- I'm not a fan of brussel sprouts in general but this was fried very crispy and cut up in small pieces which makes for a great appetizer to share in groups. Just a "ok" for me. 

Hydro bibb sea bass- miso-marinated sea bass served in lettuce cup. I'm usually not a fan of lettuce cup just because it's usually messy to eat but this was different. I ate it like it was a taco...haha. Sea bass is marinated and cooked well. One of my favorite dish. 

Great restaurant for quality Japanese food. First time here and I can see myself coming back here again and again.

I enjoyed it. The food was fresh and flavorful! Excellent job all around by the staff and the quality and effort they put in to making you feel welcome and full of fish! The staff is friendly and knows the menu by heart as well. Overall i am impressed ;)

I saw that Soho had a 5 star rating on yelp so I decided to give it a go. The location of the restaurant had me a little skeptical at first seeing that it's right next to Chevron but the overall experience won me over. The service was fantastic and our server Darrell was amazing! He was very attentive and answered all of our questions on the menu plus added some of his own recommendations which were all fantastic! We started off with the salmon, yellowtail, and trout sashimi appetizers and all were delicious! The miso cod was our favorite cooked just right with excellent marination. The head chef/owner came out to our table and introduced himself with such a friendly attitude. We ended with the green tea tiramisu and I highly recommend it if you're looking to end your meal right! Now I know why they're rated 5 stars and I look forward to coming back!

Is this the same Soho we're all writing about? Cause I'm confused.

I brought my parents and a friend visiting from New York here for dinner a few nights ago and we were not impressed. Had the restaurant not received raving reviews, I wouldn't have had such high expectations, but we were unfortunately disappointed from the moment we stepped inside. Here's why:

-Hostess did not greet us when we walked in- she said "one minute" which turned to five minutes before she asked how many were in our party.
-She said the wait was going to be about 15 minutes but it ended up being closer to 25.
-Food was less than stellar. The rice on the rolls were cold. Some of the rolls were EXTREMELY salty. And aren't all of the rolls typically supposed to come out and be served together? These came out one by one so we couldn't feast like we wanted to.

There were a few other gripes we had but I won't list them all out. I just needed to say my piece cause I don't think we got the value we paid for and we felt the Yelp reviews were pretty overrated after our experience here.
Amazing food - I loved the salmon and scallop sashimi and the beef rib entree. I could do that nearly every day.

We went for happy hour and ordered 17 dishes with 4 drinks. The amount came out to be $91 wih 5 people. The waitress Mika was very nice and the he'd came to say hello to us. Food was great quality and fresh .... And delicious! I would definitely recommend .

In search of a sushi place in Vegas that all of the locals go to rather than the more expensive offerings on the strip, Soho was definitely a good alternative. There is always a wait here but they do take reservations. Still on the more expensive side but good service and good sushi!

Do not come hear expecting traditional Japanese sushi, as you will be disappointed.  This is an Asian fusion type restaurant that specializes in sushi rolls and other Asian influenced dishes.  I had the braised short rib, poki tostadas (salmon and tuna) for $1 during happy hour, spicy tuna roll, and kumamoto oysters with uni which was the high dish of the evening.  I highly recommend the kumamoto oysters with uni, even though it cost $6/each, but definitely worth it.

*review based on happy hour experience* based on this, it was so good!!! Happy hour is available Monday-Friday 5-7. Super good small plates are offered on this menu!!! And it is all priced at $5. There is no AYCE at this location, but still worth the stop. Can't wait to come back and try it again!
Amazingly friendly place with excellent California fusion / sushi bar. We came in happy hour 4-6pm. Great prices and great food. Skip the buffet and come here instead. You won't be disappointed.

After spending a few days on the Strip, I was getting sick of the Strip's over the top, expensive food. I wanted something different - a local favorite. I decided to ask my Lyft/Uber (ops I forgot which one) for his food recommendation. He recommended Soho and their yellow tail appetizer. 

My significant other and I came to Soho on Memorial Day (yes, they are open). It is 15 minutes off the Strip. We ordered from the Lunch menu. They have pretty good deals for their lunch specials. I ordered sashimi lunch special and it came with soup, salad and good portion of sashimi for about $10 and the sashimi was fresh. The yellow tail appetizer was very good as well. 

I wished I had the stomach space to try more, but I guess it just mean another visit to Soho in the near future.

Soho. For me this name is synonymous with sushi burritos. Fortunately for me I went in here so skeptical because I'm so anti-sushi burrito I just didn't think I could enjoy myself. Sure enough though I give this place five stars. I came here on a Saturday evening after the gym with my cousin and we had the most delicious meal for like $40. How? Happy hour! They have a $5 happy hour menu and it is killing the happy hour game.

I just want to give a shout out to the staff here. From the chef sending us a dish on the house to the servers who were always around it was just a great experience.

I came in gym shorts and a sweaty shirt, but the establishment is far from that. I love the yelling when a patron enters, I love the glasses they use, I loved the warmth of the staff.

Our food was great. We had a couple rolls, but my favorite dish was the tostadas. They are served in a do it yourself style with a "poke" mixture, rice tostadas, and a wasabi cream sauce. We chose yellow tail and it was to die for! I haven't stopped raving about this place since I went a couple of weeks ago because the food was so good.

Amazing food that lives up to their star rating for sure.   Sheila, our server, took amazing care of us.  The calamari was the most unique flavor combination of dipping sauce and seasoning that I have ever encountered.   We tried all but 1 thing on the happy hour menu and our bill was about $60 and we were very full.  The only thing lacking here is ambiance.   Definitely not a romantic date night spot or anything.

Creative. Delicious. Reasonably priced.  
Soho lives up to its mission of "strip fare for locals." They offer an inventive menu of cold and hot appetizers, entrees, and actual sushi, in addition to a well-thought-out sake list. On the waitress' recommendation, we had a bottle of the cold g fifty sake to share and it was quite good. Then we just split several appetizers, and all were seriously excellent: baked mussels, Cajun albacore, the famous yellowtail, and the black cod lettuce wraps. $75 for a great meal and drinks is fair to me. Next time, we'll definitely hit up happy hour (4-6).

I was recommended to try this place from trusted friends.  We arrived right when they opened at 5 to a pretty chill restaurant and didn't know what to expect.  The place filled up in minutes and now I know why.  This place was awesome.  Our server, Gabriel, gave us great recommendations and the food was fantastic.  We will definitely be back and recommend others do so as well.

I bought my new house because it's next to Soho. True story. This is the best sushi in town. I have so many favorites.  I tend to focus on the starters.  I have dreams about that ocean trout, yellowtail yuzu soy and salmon creme fraiche.  Not to be overlooked, the sashimi and oysters are incredibly fresh.  Chef John has put a lot of thought into his menu.  You won't find a million choices like some joints but everything is prepared with great attention to detail and presentation.  I regularly get the Chef's sashimi platter if I am with a group.

My favorite roll is currently the Diabla Loca Roll ( a newer addition to the menu), but my "favorite" depends on the day of the week.  I am also a big fan of those Japanese pickles.  So salty and tasty.  A perfect compliment to the fresh fish.  I could go on and on about the quality of the food and the attention to detail that goes into the preparation, but I might run out of space to mention the great service.  All the servers are genuinely welcoming and provide excellent service.  Sheila is my favorite, but probably because she remembers us as the OG regulars when this place was not a rockstar on Yelp.  

Lastly, I was finally able to make it in for happy hour here and I must say, Chef John is getting robbed! Happy hour prices are an unbelievable deal, especially when considering the caliber of food you are getting.  Believe the hype surrounding this restaurant.  Soho deserves all the accolades.

When you walk into this place, your immediate reaction is that it's not going to be that amazing.  It looks like a pretty normal restaurant with not particularly good atmosphere.  

But the food here is excellent.  This is an excellent place to get high quality sushi/sashimi.  We ate at the sushi bar and talked w/ John, the sushi chef and owner.  He used to work at a high end restaurant on the strip and was able to maintain relations with the same fish source he used to work with.  The fish is all very fresh.  You can see in their sushi bar that they leave the fish in a block and only cut the fish as needed in preparing their dishes.  Though this seems like something all restaurants should do, I've found that other sushi restaurants around town don't necessarily do this.  Love, love, love the fish.  Also, the uni is excellent and also very well sourced.  This is one of the best sushi restaurants I've eaten at just short of when I lived in Tokyo.  

Creative dishes.  They are constantly trying new flavor combinations.  Prices here are amazing for the fish quality you get.  Definitely coming back.
Great customer service, our server Boris took the time to explain the menu and was really helpful unlike other places were they just walk up to the table and ask if you're ready to order.
Visiting from the East Bay San Francisco.  My husband and I really enjoyed our dinner so much that I want to come back before we head home.

This place has a ton of great reviews and there is a reason for it. This place is great.

I started off with a beer. I'm not a saki drinker. The beer I had ordered was no longer available, but instead of the waitress just coming back and delivering unfortunate news, she had actually brought out a different beer that was comparable to the one I had ordered. She told me the chef had suggested this Kagua Rouge Belgian Strong Dark Ale and I went ahead and got it. The beer was delicious, had the hit of an IPA but replace the bitterness with a nice flowery taste. 

The place is known for their tadas, which is basically for the lack of a better term, a toasted chip with your choice of tuna, shrimp etc. on top. These are delicious and cheap. There are a ton of other great dishes to sample. We tried the Cajun Albacore which had a bit of kick to it and the aioli was not too overpowering. They have some golden ocean trout and the kicker is that they include pop rocks on the bits of fish so it pops in your mouth. It was a bit of a novelty but still delicious and who is going to say no to pop rocks? We also had firecracker rolls and the volcano rolls and they were both delicious.

To top it all off, the waitress also brought us some of the yellow tail free of charge. I thought this was a nice compliment to the meal. She already had shown some great initiative with the beer compromise and now the place was offering us a free yellowtail.

I had heard that the chef really wanted everyone to be fully satisfied and you can see that mission throughout the restaurant. The service is swift and goes above and beyond. The food is delicious, presentation is excellent and the food menu is a bit innovative (pop rocks, tadas). This place is a definite must go.

Amazing customer service as soon as you walked in. Can't beat the $5 Happy hour menu pricing and drinks special. Sashimi and sushi dishes are fresh and tasty, nice decor and comfortable dining experience. The greeter is very welcoming, servers are on point and when u leave the restaurant u will hear a warm farewell from the chefs and staff... makes u want to come back for more... definitely coming back to try the other dishes. this is my new favorite sushi spot in town.

The sushi in Soho is really good especially if you want something special. The reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 is the quality of the fish. It's good but not like butter like in other restaurants. I guess for the price it makes sense. 
I would definitely go for the specialty rolls and the Tadas (so good!!) but not sashimi or nigiri. 
I love going at happy hour when you can get most of the regular rolls for cheap and tadas for only 1 dollar!! Just a great place.
Amazing service and AMAZING FOOD! A little on the pricey size but the quality is worth it.

Amazing service and amazing food! You can definitely taste the freshness of the seafood here. Uni here is excellent. Also, the seafood soup is great-it is served in a teapot and you pour it in a small shot glass looking bowl which helps the soup to stay warm throughout the meal. I can tell the chef really cares about the quality of the food and making the dining experience flawless. I loved it!

This is another great restaurant in the Southwest that hasn't received too much attention lately, judging from my Yelp friends. Fortunately, my IRL friend didn't forget.

One of her favorite local restaurants is Soho Japanese Restaurant, and I was honored that she invited me here on her farewell tour before her relocation to a new city. They're a great modern/fusion restaurant with a menu full of raw fish. If this sounds familiar, that's because there are definitely other local places doing something similar. But I still think this is one of the most affordable, as demonstrated with their happy hour menu, while not sacrificing quality.

I'd heard that they'd taken away the happy hour menu for a while, but they brought it back recently with a vengeance. Five drinks and eleven food items are available for $5 (with the sole exception of tyku sake at $10) starting at [UPDATE 9/12/17: 4pm, don't have to wait until 5pm now] and ending at 7pm every night. We mostly stuck to this menu, save for one ear-catching special of the night mentioned by the server.

Escolar Carpaccio (5 pc): EVOO, Italian seasoning, chives, white ponzu, truffle salt. The fish most commonly served elsewhere as "super white tuna" gets a full array of delicious complements here. If you're a fan of super white, you'll be a fan of this. I really liked the smoky charred seasoning on each bite. We ordered seconds of just this dish.

Cajun Albacore Sashimi (5 pc): serrano chili, red onion, spicy garlic, creamy ponzu, shredded daikon. In retrospect, I wish I'd ordered it again because that luscious albacore melted perfectly in my mouth. It's not too spicy overall either.

Crispy Brussel Sprouts (many pc.): citrus butter, roasted pine nuts, more shredded daikon. The sprouts weren't quite as crunchy as I'd hoped, but the pine nuts helped and the citrus butter is my newest addiction. The acidity is subtle, but the richness is front and center and needs to be in every bite. Just soak up that heavenly juice.

Tadas (5 pc): the tostadas may have lost a syllable, but they've kept all of the flavor. We tried the mixed fish order first, which had a huge array of fish and veggies, and then the salmon, which I'm pretty sure is the same old Japanese-influenced pico de gallo mixture. My only issue was the need to portion it out onto the fried wontons ourselves, for which they provide a serving spoon and a reasonable portion of yuzu avocado spread. I'd rather have it pre-portioned in roughly equal amounts as in the original version instead of having to do work and guess.

(Well, one more regret: I did write that I enjoyed the tuna tostadas the most in my first visit, but I forgot about them tonight. Until next time then...)

Amberjack salsa ($14, 6 pc): when the server described the special dishes available tonight, I _figuratively_ jumped out of my chair at the word "amberjack" and my friend seemingly did the same. What a fantastic fish. I could've eaten the delicious kanpachi alone here. Appropriately enough, all of the accompaniments were so subtle and indistinguishable to the taste (even the cherry tomatoes) that I may as well have been eating just the fish. It's ironic that, as a composed dish, this was the least impressive order. Perhaps it's one of their experiments that they're conducting for their seasonal menu change (which the server mentioned briefly).

After the removal and return of a revamped happy hour menu, Soho still stands as one of the great local restaurants that happens to be a tremendous value during happy hour. I'm gonna have to come back soon, so as a note to myself, the top of my "whoops, forgot about that" list are the tuna tadas and the hydro bibb sea bass. The rest will fall into place easily.

I love this place. When ever my wife and I want quality sushi, always consistent, and inventive entrees. The crispy rice is amazing with the perfect crunch to the rice. The Miso Cod is amazing and always fresh. They have their own signature tuna spice which is a mix of Cajun and some other great spices. The owner and chefs take great pride in the product they serve to their customers here. They do not serve any fish with a sheen or shininess to it. I never fear when I go hear that I may get sick. I feel great every time I leave Soho which is always a good sign when going to eat sushi. We are against going to all you can eat sushi because those places don't serve the best quality sushi. Another great sign is that they do not serve bay scallops which are super cheap. They serve the good sea scallops and they actually aren't crazy expensive for this my wife orders the umami scallop hand roll which is only $5 probably one of the cheapest items on the menu and most places charge $7-8 and they are most commonly bay scallops which are less expensive and have a fishy taste normally with more sand grit in them. The scallops they have here are silky smooth. I cannot stress enough this place again is some of the best sushi you will eat. I compare them to Nobu at half the price and possibly more creative with some of their menu items.

I am really into good food and this place is just AMAZING. 
I am from SF and was in Vegas for a business trip. Found this place on yelp and when we got there, we were skeptical in the beginning because of the neighborhood and the interior of the restaurant. But I am soooo glad that I found this place because their food is just the best!! The fishes are really fresh and the service is really good. We were told that the Chef/Owner here used to be a sous chef at Aria hotel in Vegas and he always uses fresh ingredients. We ended up going here 2 times within 5 days during our trip. Our favorite dish was special appetizer yellow tail sashimi with soy Yuzu sauce, Miso marinated black cod, Fire cracker roll. All the rolls are good and I can't recommend enough!!
Updated HH menu. A family favorite.. always fresh and the best sushi in town. Staff are friendly and attentive.

How do you describe the most decadent, delicious sushi you have ever had in your life?  I don't know what these guys are doing, but what they produce is amazing!  

Some of the highest quality fish I have ever had, incredibly creative rolls, and highly accommodating to restrictive diets (I am gluten-free).  First, our server Casey, was extremely observant in identifying that I had asked our drink person for gluten free soy sauce when we were seated and let me know he was more than happy to accommodate.  Then the chefs were great in meeting those needs!

For example, I ordered a roll that is normally deep fried but that does not work with a gluten free diet.  They were willing to skip the frying for me but warned me it probably wouldn't taste the same.  I was so surprised when they brought me the roll to find they had rolled it in gluten free rice cake instead since I couldn't have the tempura fry!  It was so creative and thoughtful to give me as much of the original flavor as possible.  I felt that I was truly valued as an individual!  

Soho, you have earned a customer for life.  And since I come to Vegas every year for a sports tournament, that will be for a long time.

Oh, and check out the pickled wasabi (REAL wasabi!).  Delicious!

I loveeeeee soho!!!!!! Aaron took care of us today! Great customer service, AMAZING FOOD!!!, the place is clean & the staff is super friendly!! I would recommend this place to everyone!! -- thank you guys for everything! Staciy & I had a great freaking time! :)

Love it!  From the moment we walked in we were greeted and seated by a very pleasant waitress from HI.  We got there early enough so we got some items for the happy hour prices.  Everything the waitress suggested was delicious.  We enjoyed the ume scallop, hamachi in a yuzu sauce, sashimi platter(mmmm, good), ika geso (ok), hamachi kama( a very generous portion, delicious), mussels (ono), kurobuta wrapped in bacon (yum), hydro bib black cod (a winner!!), fire cracker roll, spicy tuna roll, california roll and tempura roll.  The rolls were just ok...the next time I don't think we need to order any rolls.  We enjoyed the lychee sake (very reasonable at $5 happy hour price.  

Prices are very reasonable and the quality, superb.

Can't wait to go back the next time we visit Las Vegas.

Note: Read the yelp reviews before going and wasn't disappointed.
First Japanese cuisine experience in Vegas fish is so fresh great atmosphere and chef is really nice

Came here for HH (4pm-6pm) and the food was great! Fast, friendly service.

They have these little open face taco-like things ($1) and the tuna one was delicious.  

Salmon avocado roll ($4) was great. The salmon was so fresh and it melted in your mouth like butter!

Firecracker roll ($5) is made with spicy tuna and is deep fried. I normally don't get deep fried rolls because they're usually too heavy or filling for me. This was lightly fried and it was delicious.  

Overall, food was tasty, good prices for happy hour, and service was great.
Best sushi we have ever had, worth the trip to Vegas just to eat here! I would definitely recommend this place, happy hour gives you a good chance to taste a lot of the menu at a lower cost.
Among all the sushi places I have been to around the town, this is the BEST sushi place ever!! Every dish has it's own distinct taste !!  I been there more than 6 times already!
Amazing local Spot!!  Check out their new restaurant across the street!!! Best happy hour in vegas!!

Must tries: sashimi appetizer plates, rock shrimp tempura, black cod, and braised short ribs (especially good).

I tried this one their opening week, and made the comment that their braised short ribs were delicious, but needed something to cut the fat. Next week I came back and they added a little micro green salad and it was perfect.

It means a lot when you see a restaurant take your feedback and implement it so quickly.

I'm from the south so I didn't know what to expect from this place knowing that I'd be trying western style sushi. But I have to say, the food here is outstanding ! I love their happy hour menu which has items at $5 each. I ordered the salmon and mixed seafood tostadas, some kind of cod appetizer, the firecracker roll, and a basic salmon avocado roll. The fish here is so fresh and delicious ! The service is friendly but a little slow though. Still, definitely one of my favorite sushi places !

Just outstanding. The service, atmosphere, selection, and the food.  We weren't starving but we wound up eating more than we'd planned because it was so good. The green tea - to start and to finish - was exceptional because they put a bit of toasted brown rice in it which gives it a nice nutty flavor (and makes it brown so don't be surprised when your green tea isn't green). We had the poke tada (small plate) to start, then the spicy albacore tuna roll which was so well-presented and tasted great. The habanero sauce wasn't overpowering but you may want it on the side, like we did.

Hands down one of my most favorite places in all of LV! First thing you notice when you walk in is the amazing customer service. Everyone is super friendly, and not in a "I have to be" kind of way. The food is amazing. Not only esthetically pleasing, but great quality and delicious! Everything on the menu is what you would see at strip restaurants that charge twice the price. Lucky me, I eat here once a week.

My family wanted to try a new place with a 5 star rating from Yelp and we want sushi, so we ended up here in Soho.  We were seated right away. There were 3 of us in the party and we had the following entrees:
Yellowtail sashimi - the best that I've ever tasted. Even my daughter who is not a sashimi eater loved it.
Seared Tuna sashimi - very good taste.  
4 kinds of rolls spicy tuna, rainbow roll, twin dragon, and triple S - they are all good.  
We also ordered the 4 different tostadas that are very refreshing.
The Chef/owner came to say hi and he gave us a complimentary salmon sashimi that has an interesting ingredient: pop rocks
Grilled hamachi kama is very fresh and flavorful with soy sauce and lemon dipping sauce.
The price is a little bit more than the other sushi house off strip, but the freshness and taste of the food is worth the money.  The service staff are attentive.  We will be coming back and we will be bringing some friends to experience the Soho Sushi.
First timer here. I am excited the food looks and smells so good. This place is pretty busy they open up at noon I walked it 2 mins after and the place is busy. The prices r good also.

Best deal in town. Strip food and chefs, but not prices. Wonderful service too top it a off.  Actually better then a lot of strip restaurants, and better than a bunch of places who try to posh and tasty in the summerlin area. I'd like to say thanks to you guys. And hope that you continue to keep it real.
We have been to this place few times and thought it wasn't anything special. Even if it was a cheaper AYCE place, we probably wouldn't come back.

I could say so much about this place. So much goodness. They have always accommodated when we have come minutes before happy hour ends and their fish is always on point. I am soooo glad the chef from Social House came and opened up hi own restaurant. It beats having to go down to the strip when you can just head into the Southwest and enjoy some amazing sushi! Thanks for the warmth when we walk in. We can't wait to keep coming back and trying new menu items.

Sheila and Charles are the best servers :-) My green tea was always full. They are very attentive and fun. The food was pretty good too. Get the green tea creme Brulee. It is amazing!! next time I come it'll be dessert first.
SOHO has been our go-to Japanese restaurant for about 3 years now. Never disappoints and has some great sushi and rolls to choose from!
Great menu.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  Happy Hour $5 menu was phenomenal.   Wait staff was friendly and fast.  Green tea creme Brule hit it out of the park.

Thanks for the food poisoning Soho!  ..If you enjoy diarrhea and puke GO HERE! ... and that's just the start...

My friends and I (group of 13) went there for a birthday dinner and 5 of us ended up sick the next day.  Throwing up all night and having to miss work the next day.  Best part is we ordered different dishes... 

Yes I know large groups are harder to serve but other restaurants manage to do it just fine, so why not Soho?  To clarify, my group of friends and I are very nice individuals, that do not make large scenes, or loud obnoxious conversations that are sometimes associated with large groups of people getting together. 

We started the evening with a super grouchy waitress who really didn't like answering questions about the serving sizes of TWO MEALS!  Yes, I asked how big the salad and gyoza was.  She gave me an attitude, "Just order it you will be find out."   and left without taking our orders.  Upon return she went around the table asking if we were ready, if we were not, she didn't say anything and just rudely turned to another person or different table entirely.  This was sure fire way to a zero tip fast but with large groups we're forced to pay tip obviously, even if it was undeserved.  
Throughout the dinner she would avoid our area and wait on other tables.  We had to ask another waitress for water refills who was actually nice, sorry dear, you have a horrible co-worker to bring this atmosphere down.  
Back to the original waitress, she acted as if we were disrupting her time to flirt with the sushi chefs at the bar.  I could see her from my seat going from the cash register to the bar laughing and giggling then upon turning out to the restaurant she immediately made a disgusted face.  Enough ranting about the overweight rude waitress. 

Now to the food.  Yes presentation was GREAT!!  If there was a section on just presentation you guys got 4.5 out of 5.  
BUT TASTE.... OMG HORRIBLE.  And I mean truly horrible.  
The only thing that tasted "OK" was my cut up tomatoes, and the sauce poured under the sushi.  The Angus Gyoza which said Angus was actually sour tasting and could've been lamb maybe?  It had a distinct lamb flavor to it and I'm pretty sure the cows didn't eat any lamb before being slaughtered.  I could be wrong though...  But i'm pretty confident here.  Either way, one piece then the rest sat there waiting to be eaten by flies.

The fish was very bland and broke apart easily before being transported  from the plate to my mouth by my skilled chopstick skills.  I had one piece and left the rest to be thrown away.  I shouldn't smell a fish when i eat sushi, sorry that's just the #1 rule of good vs bad sushi.

Overall, i'm sitting here with diarrhea and puked twice this morning.  Texting my friends who have the same issues.  Five different dishes gave us this and using simple math because I personally didn't share any of my disgusting food can narrow this down to at least two different dishes that night caused our issues today.  

Avoiding this place from now on LIKE THE PLAGUE!

most of the time my friends and I would eat at all you can eat sushi spots, trying to maximize our bang for the buck, usually sacrificing quality for quantity and price. With that said, Soho Japanese Restaurant is one of the best sushi places i've ever had, not only in Las Vegas, but anywhere. Just to get other logistics out of the way, the staff is friendly, prompt, and the Sushi Chef was highly knowledgeable and very catering to our requests. 

The fish is unbelievably amazing. every cut, whether it be sushi or sashimi, was excellent in taste, texture, and "freshness"  We tried four different Cold Sashimi dishes, all which exceeded my expectations.
