As well, I am not usually a Uni fan, but after listening to the Chef's explanation of different kinds of Uni, and trying his specific Uni, i realized I never liked Uni because no one ever knew how to prepare it before. the uni at Soho is GREAT. 

The tostada chips are perfect in size, and great on taste. Highly recommend the Mackrel as well. Currently, there ivory salmon is in season. Chef hooked it up with a great  portion that I highly recommend. 

The pieces of sashimi you get for 5 dollars is outstanding. Definitely recommend getting that over sushi. For how good the fish is, I feel like I'm ripping chef off for only paying 5 bucks for each fish. 

Happy hour has great deals (only 1 dollar a taco, asahi draft for 3.) 

Overall, I just can't stop raving about the quality and taste of the food here. Easily my favorite sushi spot in vegas, maybe anywhere. If I could give this place 6 stars, I would. 

Favorites: salmon wasabi, ocean trout, tuna tostadas

Salute to you chef john

Great service and great food! The
Nigri sushi fish is delicious, and large portion. The tuna and beef tatakis were properly seasoned and made. Only thing had an issues about was the miso cod...tasted a little over cooked. Otherwise great restaurant, great service and definitely will come back. 

Oh also don't expect your American-type of sushi here, they have their own sushi menu and it's not all you can eat.

More like 3.5 stars...but we came back to give it another chance from our last visit. Happy hour it was again and there was much more variety on the menu. The Cajun albacore, black cod and mussels were all good. The rolls were nothing like blow me out of the water and I didn't care for the stuffed mushrooms. We ordered some uni and toro from the specials menu...verdict...uni sashimi was on par but the toro was yuck! At $10 a piece you would have thought that it would be some awesome toro but $20 bucks went down the drain (at Kabuto toro is $7 a piece).  It was firm and the texture was not the melt in your mouth toro. I know everyone loves it here but I feel their quality of fish is hit or miss. Obviously for me it's been miss. 

Service was great in the beginning but then we didn't see our server for a good 15-20 minutes after we got our food. Overall, I'm really disappointed about the toro. I don't cheap out when it comes to delicious food and I just feel a little bit let down. The wow factor just hasn't wowed me I guess. I'll be giving this place a break for now.

Ever feel like you're not quite ready to finish your vacation and head home? 

That is exactly how I ended up at Soho for happy hour and spending an extra day in Las Vegas! I was excited to finally check off another bookmark from my list of places to try off the Strip.

The wait for 2 on a Tuesday night was estimated to be about 30-40 minutes, but we probably ended up waiting about 20. Not too bad for such a popular place. When we were seated, the menus were pretty overwhelming, but we got to ordering right away to get in on those happy hour prices.

FOOD:
--------

HH Menu:
* Baked Mussels - Everyone raved about these in their reviews, but we honestly didn't see the hype. Maybe I just can't distinguish between different baked mussels because of all the creamy sauce.
* Cajan Albacore Sashimi - One of my favorite dishes of the night with just a tiny kick, nothing too spicy. Note: I'm a huge fan of Albacore so I usually fall hard for it.
* Yellowtail Tostada - Fresh chunks of fish with tasty chips. 

Starters:
* Crispy Brussels Sprouts - A little bit too crispy! They were overcooked in way too much oil, such that the Brussels sprouts were no longer in round form and all the leaves had fallen off. 
* Hydro Bibb Sea Bass - This miso Chilean sea bass served with lettuce cups is super flavorful! It made me crave the rest of the fish.

Rolls:
* Flying Fish Roll - Recommended by our server to be his favorite, this roll did not disappoint with its soft shell crab, tuna, salmon, yellowtail, cucumber, avocado, and creamy ponzu. Although a little too saucy for me, it was still really delicious.

Special:
* Bluefin Duo - When this dish was grandly presented to the next table over in a huge bowl and with something tall curiously sticking out of it, we couldn't help but eye it and request one for ourselves. The special came with one piece each of Akami & Toro, so we ordered 2.

Dessert:
* Green Tea Creme Brûlée - I've had this dessert at other Japanese restaurants and rather enjoyed it, but this version surpassed all the others due to the deeper, more intense green tea flavor. Mm mm mmmm!!!

SERVICE / AMBIANCE:
-----------------------
Our server was attentive and provided great recommendations. He didn't try to make us over-order, which would have been ridiculously easy, given how hungry we were. Instead he told us we'd ordered enough, and being the gluttons we were, we kept ordering. 

The place is relatively small, so get here early (or arrive later) to avoid the long wait. 

TIP: Get there on time for HH!

DATE TIP: You and your date better be ready to EAT because with how good the food is, you'll never want to stop!

Yeah, I love this place. The chefs never cease to surprise me with the love and care that they put into the food. The quality of taste and presentation is always on point. You cannot get the same items on the menu for this cheap versus any other high end restaurant off the strip. I was sad that they changed the hours of operation to 5 to 10 pm but it doesn't stop me from going! Plus you can't get the same consistent service anywhere else.

Chef Tae was amazing. We were here previously as well, but this time the experience was beyond fascinating. My sister and I made a reservation at Soho for her birthday dinner, and we were sat at the bar for Omakase. Chef Tae took a great care of our dinner. 

We had all their specials that were posted on the board, their unis and oysters were probably one of the freshest I have had in Vegas. They are totally worth whatever they charge you- even though we were charged only 1/3 of what we expected to be charged. They add black truffles and caviar to their sashimi dish, and other dish as well- which are probably the best quality and decoration you can find in any local area-and even strip. 

I love trying different places, but I have not yet seen a Japanese restaurant that satisfied me more than Soho. This is totally a place that everyone should give a try.

Was looking for a place like socal's Benihana... Benihana is wayyyy better than this place in everything; soup, salad, sushi... I couldn't eat the soup or salad(did not taste good to me; to my husband it was okay) but sushi was very fishy..
The food tasted amazing! We got the awesome mixed premium sashimi plater, tempura rolls, and the AMAZING stuff mushrooms! Everything was so damn good!! And great service!!!
One of those most fresh places I've ever been to! Would highly recommend the Sunny Salmon roll and the Volcano ! Our waitress Sheila was amazing. Will definitely be coming back

Totally deserving of 5 stars. One of the best sushi spots in Vegas. Fish was fresh and every bite was amazing. The menu is very interesting with the different pairings and concoctions they've come up with. The chefs were fun and made excellent recommendations. The servers were very friendly. Will most definitely be back!

I really like this place. Good food, great service, pretty impressive selection of sushis/rolls and desserts. This place is not AYCE, but the quality of food is way better compared to most AYCE sushi places. Will definitely be back.

Most people do not expect to find decent sushi in a landlocked city, especially one that is more renowned for things that are...well, not sushi. I was certainly part of that demographic, and was only drawn to Soho by their Happy Hour menu, which boasted over 30 small plates for $5 each, along with over a dozen drink specials.

With that many options, I also couldn't help wonder if it was one of those "quantity over quality" type of deals, but I had faith in the exceedingly positive Yelp reviews, which were absolutely on point!

A few Happy Hour dishes and infused sakes later, the other menu items started to look more and more enticing (who could resist the allure of Hokkaido uni?!). We ended up venturing beyond the HH menu, adding several nigiri sushi, Kumamoto oysters, and the Firefly Squid to our order. I'm all about trying new fish and got to try akamutsu (black sea perch) sushi for the first time!

Excellent food at reasonable prices, friendly and attentive service, plus a fantastic happy hour are all hallmarks of the Soho experience. I will definitely be returning on my next sojourn in Vegas.

TLDR: One of the best Happy Hours I've had, and the regular menu delivers some pretty solid sushi as well! Don't forget to make a reservation or be prepared to wait.

This place is fitting as my 200th REVIEW!

I had bookmarked this place after seeing it on a 100 top yelp restaurants across the country last year. Not just in Vegas, in the country. It lives up to being on that list. 

This place has a great vibe. Poppy music playing overhead. I loved the view of the kitchen and sushi bar. That view made me really appreciate the hustle and the amount of people working there. Excellent service all around. 

Here is what we tried: 
Tuna tadas- loved the blast of cilantro and the crunch. I feel like I could snack on those all day. 

The roll with the pop rocks- fun but I guess I like tuna sashimi with just a touch of ponzu or nothing at all.  Don't need to detract from a beautiful cut of fish. 

Firecracker-lots of heat. A warm "comfort" type of roll. 

Cajun albacore-was very "beef like" because it was seared. 

They brought ought a nice little sample, just buttery/melty piece of sashimi tuna. Wow, delicious and an awesome touch that puts this place above and beyond. 

Someone at a different table was having a birthday while there. They came out with a cake that the family brought and they even cut up and sang for them. Nice touch!

Came here on a Friday night and the place was slamming. Found out why after we saw the happy hour menu and how good the food was. Things we had that I would definitely recommend we're

Surf and turf roll
Salmon carpaccio 
Spicy tuna carpaccio 
Beef carpaccio 

They even hooked up my baby with fries and chicken katsu. 

Service was really good and quality of food even better. Definitely worth the trip if you're visiting and looking to get off the strip.

The flavor of the sushi rolls/sashimi doesn't hit you over the top and the ambience and atmosphere are 1 star. BUT this place is still a must go to for sushi lovers still. The quality is there and sushi is as fresh as ever at this local joint. Las Vegans enjoy "I love Sushi" but the quality stands out better here. Like I said, its a no frills environment. It feels your in a breakfast/lunch American café. lol

My wife and I visit Las Vegas 2-3 times a year and always look for and usually find, a new restaurant that we end up liking a fair amount. But this visit was different - we found Soho and fell in love.  Both of us felt it was the best overall Japanese meal we've ever had.

Each of the dishes we ordered - and I'd have to say there were really too many - were superb. The highlights - the salmon and the whitefish sashimi and the Twin Dragon Roll.  There are simply too many good things to say about each of the dishes but suffice to say, it was the best.

The service matched the food - terrifically casual, friendly and knowledgeable server with the willingness to let us know what she liked as well as what was popular.  We took her suggestions and were ecstatic!

I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant - get there soon before they move up and out because they definitely deserve to.

Ok. So now every time I come to Vegas I have to come to SOHO. The quality and imagination of dishes is comparable to the best sushi places on the strip. The atmosphere is friendly and service impeccable. I compare it to my favorite places in Los Angeles. I will always come here at least once every trip to Vegas. John.... I'll finance a Restraunt in Bev Hills if you want!!!!

Second visit just a wonderful as the first!  We lucked out on Friday night and were seated within a few minutes.  Score #1!  Our server skillfully navigated us through the menu.  We started with the Yellowtail Sashimi and the White Fish Special.  I cannot do justice to the freshness and quality of the sashimi - superb!  Next was the Hydro Bibb Black Cod -the crispy cod was delicious! The BF had two of the tostadas - one shrimp with mango and one salmon with pico de gallo - both of which were devoured with joy!  While he worked on the crispy tuna roll, I was having a Harry Met Sally moment with my Salmon Belly - OMG!  Creamy, buttery bliss!  As I was trying to make my moment last, the BF was having his own with the Vanilla Cream Brulee ( I am jello) made with vanilla beans! Everyone is so warm and genuine!  I love Soho!!!!!

Love this place, if you want quality hand made sushi with affordable price. This is the place to be. I'm part of the number #1 travel club in the world DreamTrips who we partnered up in our market and I was able to earn points to travel by eating in my favorite sushi spot in town. Hands down amazing! Thanks Chef John

OMG! I just got home from this place and I want to go back already! 5 star definitely for service, price and quality of food! Went for dinner with my family and we left very satisfied and planning when to come back. every single item we ordered was delicious.. food were nicely plated and dang all of it taste so good. I'm still dreaming about those Spicy Soft Shell Crab Rolls... looking forward to try every single item in their menu..

Wow. You know when you see a 5 star place with 10 reviews, and you're like...I wonder if those are legitimate? Well, with over 300 reviews and averaging 5 stars, you know this place is legit.

My girlfriend took me here for my birthday, and it only took literally a few minutes to see why this place was 5 stars. For me, what typically makes a 5 star restaurant is that the food is absolutely delicious, and the SERVICE goes above and beyond and offers true customer service. This place exceeded my service expectations the moment we walked in, and the food was incredible to boot!

Angelica was our waitress, and she was so nice and down to earth. We chatted with her for awhile, and some of the first things she asked were "is this your first time?" And "are you from around here?" Which in my opinion is great customer management and a VERY good indicator that they're looking to take care of their local regulars. 

We ordered off of the HH (4pm-6pm everyday) menu because it was just priced so damn well we couldn't help it. While waiting, numerous waiters came by asking if it was our first time, and they were genuinely excited for us to try different things on the menu. We felt like guests of honor even though we were 1 of maybe 7 tables. 

We also were a bit chilly because of the AC, so when I was in the bathroom my girlfriend ran to the car and got our sweatshirts. We put them on, and then I noticed our waitress and another waiter walking around the restaurant together. She came back a few minutes later, and said they were really sorry, they realize the AC wind was pretty strong and they turned the system down. Talk about the details!

Now for the food...

We had the gyoza, which I thought were delicious mostly because of the sauce they used. Their was a heavy lime taste to it,  and it was addicting! The stuffing inside was pretty good, and it was fried perfectly. 

For sushi, we got the spicy tuna, firecracker roll, salmon avocado, and shrimp tempura. Next time we will definitely do some sashimi as according to others that's his specialty.  All the rolls were very good and fresh, and the spicy tuna actually had a bit of a kick to it! Usually spicy tuna is barely spicy, but it was spicy enough my girlfriend didn't want more than one....more for me :)

We also got the tuna and salmon tostadas and they were DEVINE. I can't believe it's was 2 for a dollar in HH, REALLY!?

The chef even sent over their yuzu yellowtail special, and it was incredible!!! The tempura jalapeño, or whatever that spice crunch thing on there is, was unbelievable. Amazing spice to balance out the sweet sauce and butter like fish. Truly worth the trip for. 

They finished it off with adorable sushi and bento box key chains for my girlfriend and I, I have NEVER seen a restaurant do that. Key chains?! Now we both have them as a constant reminder of that awesome meal. Brilliant. 

We will be back again....many many times. It's just too good, too fresh, the service is too friendly and too considerate...I just can't NOT eat here regularly. This is how a restaurant should be run. 

Thank you again Angelica, you really made my birthday extra special!

The sushi and sashimi are as good as it gets, beautiful cuts and as fresh as any I've ever had.  On top of that the flavors on some of the specialty items are genius.  Even the broccoli was special--roasted until it almost dissolves in your mouth and flavored with a citrus sauce.   We will be back!  I only wish we lived here so we could go back more often!

I don't normally post reviews but they deserve it!! 
Incredible food everything we had was great.  We were in vegas for 5 days and this was the best food we had on the entire trip.  The service was awesome too.  I can't wait to return and eat here again.

Came here in march 2014 for bday dinner. Amazzzziiiing!!! Pricey, yes, but soooo worth it!! Owner came out and spoke with us (fiancé ordered a LOT of food) and gave us Uni "on the house". He also went around and spoke to each table. Small, basic set-up...very unassuming for quality of food! Sushi was so fresh!

They do have a happy hour, but its very very limited. there are like, 8 things...haha.. but still good to meet up with a friend and have some $1 select sushi half-rolls, and appetizers half price. they do have a sushi bar to sit at and tables, as well. have beer and liquor as well.

Daytime good for families and groups with kids, happy hour til 4, i think o_0 
Nighttime gets the younger crowd of "foodies" but its still great atmosphere. Great for a date, while a bit pricey.

My friend and I decided to try this Japanese restaurant after I found it on Yelp. It is a bit off from the Vegas strip area. A warning to those that do not have their own vehicle that it was a bit difficult to get a cab back. 

Despite any transportation issues, the meal was completely worth it. We went for lunch and sat at the sushi bar as all of the other tables were taken. We started with a couple basic rolls as well as salmon nigiri. Each piece was excellent. A fresh as promised. I took the advice of the either reviews and tried the tuna tostada. The single best thing I ate in Vegas. The tuna was expertly cut and just the right amount of sesame. We each had a salmon teriyaki bento box. The salmon is grilled and the sauce is served on the side to allow you to choose the amount of teriyaki. The bento box includes a slaw, salad with ginger dressing, steamed white rice, vinegar cucumber salad and miso soup. Each part of the meal was lovely.

The restaurant interior is very basic. The kitchen is open to the dining area and you can watch the sushi chef prepare orders. Despite how busy the restaurant was, our food came out quickly. Our server was polite and attentive. 

I wish Soho was closer to home!

This is my favorite place in Las Vegas. The first time I came here was because my boyfriend happened to be driving by and saw their sign. He thought it looked cool so we decided to check it out. At that time they just opened and barely had any reviews. Ever since then we make it a tradition to come here on special birthdays for our families and friends. I do notice they change their waiters, but the service is still always very good. The price is worth the quality they deliver, and the food is always innovative. I never know what to expect when coming here as they always change their menus!

Went for lunch today. Reasonably priced. The food was very good, fresh fish, properly prepared. Nice touch was the Chef sending over a complimentary fish plate, which was excellent. All in all a nice place but I still prefer Fish N Bowl which is right up the street.
Very good dining experience. Excellent quality and large servings for happy hour. Will certainly eat here again. Great service.

My daughter and I had the pleasure of dining at SoHo last week.  It was "Amazing"!  The food was fantastic and the customer service was truly impressive.  I wish we lived in the area as this wonderful restuarant would be a weekly stop for us!  If you are anywhere near SoHo do not miss the opportunity to eat very well and be "spoiled" by the wonderful serving team!  You too will be an instant fan!

I absolutely fell in love with this place. Our server Charles and Chef Lee were the sweetest!!!!! Came here for my birthday with a party of six, we sat by the door it was annoyingly cold couldn't move cause it was full house. But the service and food, made me forget I was cold every time the door opened. 

Started off with some beers and saki, then it was time to order. We didn't know what to order so Charles and the chef asked us if they could create a tasting menu for us. We trusted them and told them yes!!! OH DEAR!!!! It was incredible!!!!! The yellowtail was amazing!!!! I've never had uni and never thought I would like it until now! The chef brought out some pieces and after one bite, I could die happy. (I exaggerate a lot! Hehe!)

Chef John Lee came from Social House at Aria as a executive chef and decided to open SoHo for locals. This restaurant is a great place with good prices and wonderful service!! I will be coming back to try lunch :)

Came here from California and loved everything about this place food ,drinks , service , especially the fresh Sashimi and Uni. Also want to thank you for sponsoring our Conference CFC-FFL. I recommend this place to all my friends and families and I can't wait to come this way again.

This place was great! The staff is super friendly and after finding out it was our first time here the chef personally came out to make sure everything was going good and thanked us for coming in. Everything we had was delicious! I highly recommend this place!

Get the omakase! You pick your price point starting as low as $35. My buddy went for the $50 and got 10+ dishes. one of which was a 2 oz wagyu (which they sell for $25 already). Everything was very unique and very delicious. Definitely good bang for your buck and a wonderful experience! It will leave you stuffed!

YUMM! This place is fantastic! We found it on Yelp and we were not disappointed! Arrive between 5-7 pm Monday thru Saturday and order off the happy hour menu. Lots of rolls and a few sashimi dishes for $5 each. There were plenty of options to have dinner off the happy hour menu if you wanted . Dinner for 2 adults 2 teen boys and a tween for $100. AMAZING!!!! One of the best places for sushi in Vegas.

My wife and I started coming here over  a year ago and this place has become almost part of our family. We don't live in Vegas, we just travel frequently and we always incorporate dinner at Soho. The staff,right up to Chef John is first rate and is beyond reproach. Sometimes we travel to the Midwest and we plan stops both going and coming. We go to Vegas for some shows and we plan dinners around Soho, they are that good. Mixed sashimi platter,  uni trio, the mussels the wonderful happy hour everything is just fantastic.
They do everything right here and deserve all the success they have been getting, however, once sort of a secret now, it is much busier so plan accordingly.
Amazing service. Great quality food and very  flavorful. Came in and our waiter took us through all the good things they have.

This place is beyond what I previously expected from a sushi place. The owner is behind the sushi bar, which is a huge plus. We got a sashimi platter which comes with 15 BIG pieces of fresh sashimi for just $25. I honestly don't know how they can make a profit out of this because all their fish was imported straight from Japan. With the same quality of sashimi, I paid $150 in Chicago. The $15 twin dragon roll is super delicious and filling. The service here is awesome, too. The executive chef and servers are super friendly. I'll definitely come again!!!

We stopped in for dinner last week for the first time. Enjoyed some of the Happy Hour appetizer specials as well as a few of the other rolls. My wife replaced the rice with cucumber and really enjoyed it.

Ok so it's not as good as I Love Sushi, that being said, it is still fantastic. They have a great happy hour, half off selected rolls and such. Everything was fresh and the waitress was very sweet although a tad slow and forgetful. I would make a special trip there but if I found myself there, I would be very happy to stop in especially if it was happy hour! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

This palace became to one of my favorite place. The first impression was so nice welcome from the server girl name : Patty. She bring me to a table so fast with great smiling :D and i was order the sashimi lunch special set it came with soup and salad. It's so valuable cause their price was good reasonable with their potion. Anyway while i were eating my lunch, she served a Cajun Albacore for first coming and im very thankful for her and the restaurant great welcome. Coming back for sure. Love them!!!!! You must try this place. Im seriously!!!!

Such an amazing restaurant! Chef John is truly unique and creates a variety of surprising flavors in every dish especially his sashimi dishes! His prices are very reasonable for the quality of fish and the fresh ingredients he uses. The happy hour is awesome, one you don't want to miss! The service is 5 star and the restaurant is very clean which is always nice when raw fish is involved. Chef John is very personable with his guests so don't be surprised if he stops by your table to say hello or bring you something to try. The greatest thing about this place for us locals is that it's located off the strip @ 215 & jones so no strip traffic to fight, no walking through casinos and no paying casino prices. One of my new favorites!

They changed up the menu a bit since last time here but still amazing....sad to see the tadas go away but the ceviche is delicious. Don't leave without ordering the garlic tuna tataki. So amazing I ordered a second one. The California roll is delicious because they use real crab ....what a difference it makes and the sunny salmon roll also fantastic....I love this place I drive from Aria every time I am out here.....
I absolutely love this place. Clean, great service and the food is delish! If you haven't been you need to check it out.

Came in on a Wednesday night around 7:30 and the place was bustling. They only accept reservation for party of 6 or more and luckily there was a small high table vacant for our party of two shortly after we arrived so we got seated fairly quickly.

We weren't feeling very hungry so decided to order the grilled scallops, a chef salad with ponzu soy dressing, and premium sashimi (18-20 pcs) including an assortment of the usual such as tuna, salmon, snapper, uni (sea urchin), scallops, kanpachi, ikura (salmon roe) and hamachi (yellowtail) belly.

All were fresh and delicious. Service was fantastic. Would definitely return to try other menu items.
Our first time here was pretty good it's Yummy and delicious so come and try it out at Soho Japanese Restaurant

This wasn't just one of my favorite experiences in Vegas. This was one of the best meals I've ever had - anywhere. When I looked at all the five star reviews on Yelp, I thought, "there's no way...there's got to be a catch." Yes way and no catch. This is the real deal!

Driving there and driving up to the place didn't help. It's about 20 minutes to what seems like the middle of nowhere. It's in a nondescript strip mall. The place looks like (in a previous life) it might have been a Five Guys burger joint or Denny's with a new paint job. 

The people could not have been nicer or more cheerful. They highly recommended the sashimi specials so we went with the flow, tempted as we were to just stick to our sushi staples.

Wow! Just wow! The first garlic tuna was really good. Next, they brought us the yellowtail. One problem, we didn't order yellowtail. The waiter was like, "Dude, you gotta try this!" The verdict - more yellowtail and make it snappy! We ordered four things off the sashimi menu and when we were done, ordered four more. We could have said, "surprise us" and I'm 100% certain we would have been surprised and delighted. How many places can you say that about. And it was very reasonably priced (there's NO place on the strip you can say that about)

Of all the same old same old on the strip, there are two places in Vegas that just blow them all away - Soho and Raku. We'll be back!

HUGE star and mouth muscle straining smiley face!
Yummy... love their happy hours, great deals combined with excellent customer services

We've been there many times. Mostly for the happy hours Monday through Saturday from 4pm to 6pm. The albacore sashimi is one of our favorite. We like the house salad with sweet onion dressing (simple but always good to get some greens), the black cod lettuce wrap and also the shrimp tempura sushi rolls. We did try other items on the regular menu but happy hour is the way to go. Also I have to say friendly staff.

Chef Tae is amazing.  His creations are unique and one of a kind.
Kobe beef & sushi are half the price compared to the strip.  The quality is better. 
A must try when you are in Vegas. You won't be disappointed.

OMG!!! This place freaking AMAZING!!! We went around 5:30 pm, just in time for happy hour, which we didn't know they had. To begin with, we were acknowledged & seated right away. We were pleasantly surprised about the happy hour menu & started our order w/ the albacore tuna sashimi for $5 which was explained as the happy hr version of their signature dish of yellow tail sashimi. Unbelievable! After the first few pieces another was ordered immediately. We also had the crunchy shrimp tempura roll, amazing... We continued with an order of their signature yellow tempura sashimi, which was absolutely unbelievable delicious! Spicy Salmon roll, awesome! Beef tadas, so good & ended w/ the chefs specialty steelhead trout sashimi, special belly cut served w/ pop rocks, and I have to say, I am officially in love with Soho! The reviews say it all!!! Definitely the best find & now our fav sushi/Japanese place and best of all, we live just around the corner, luck us!!!! We will def be regulars, what an awesome find!!!

Super good. Nice servers. I was really craving sushi when I came in here. And when I say sushi... I mean 5 star 'katsuya Hollywood/ Sherman oaks' type sushi and sushimi. 

I'm not a huge lover of rolls, I always prefer sashimi. I ended up trying this place because any place I lived close to had terrible reviews and this didn't seem too far. 

I ended up driving about 15 minutes... It is pretty far from southern highlands. And I went solo. I had planned to get some work done... But it was pretty busy the week night I went and the hostess took about 10 minutes to acknowledge me, then another 10 to seat me. I'm not docking them for this... Because it was super busy and the wait sign was a bit confusing. 

I was sat at the sushi bar. My server came up quickly to take my order and I got yellow tail sashimi and a water. The sushi bar chef came right up and took over my order and experience. Extremely personable... Made what I was waiting for right there and gave me another 2$ appetizer which gives you about 6 fresh selections to come on a thin crispy wonton with avocado and fresh cilantro. I want to say I order a yellow tail or tuna and this was by far the best and most refreshing thing I ordered. In total I ordered this, yellowtail sashimi which gave like 6-7 BIG pieces and some tuna dish. 

The only area I could tell them to improve is the vibe between my sushi bar server and my actual waiter. Because I ended up tipping my server the standar 20% and tipping the sushi chef 20% in cash because I didn't know who received what. The sushi bar chefs were a lively bunch and handled everything from that point... And once my server let me sit when I was waiting to cash out... The sushi bar guy handled it. 

Portions. I am an athletic female who is tall, and I can eat at times. I came in extremely starving and could only eat 3 bites of the yellow tail, 2/6 bites of my tuna and one of the crudo wonton apps I ordered. I ended up giving the rest of my untouched meal to a lovely couple sitting next to me... Who no joke had about 8 dishes and hadn't even had their main dinner yet.. And they were smaller than me. True sushi fans who I briefly spoke to.. They had nothing but great things to say of the place... And the chef continued sending them other free items.. Something I just noticed. I really appreciated that they gladly accepted my left overs and dug right in!! (I have good taste... No all you can eat rolls here!). 

I am a rare sushi eater that craves higher end sashimis mixed with other fress ingredients. I'm not a huge fan of the all you can eat buffets of tired rolls that are all over town... So if this place serves something like that.. I am just unaware because I just prefer sashimi plates. 

Hope this helps. No place is EVER going to be perfect... But the food was good enough, the atmosphere good enough and my experience good enough to give them a 5 star review because I would highly recommend the place to all sushi lovers!!!!!

The lunch bento set are just great deal. Choices from sashimi to teriyaki with soup, salad and rice for only $8.50. The owner chef John spares no expense with rice. Instead of using Jasmine rich he actually uses Nishiki rice. You can for sure tell the differences between the 2. Dinner menu wasn't as extensive as I would like but the freshness of the fish and flavor are just superb. Two thumbs up!

My inlaws live right by this place so we decided to check it out.  There were 6 of us, so we were able to try a plethora of items off their lunch menu. Started off rocky with the server not being able to give us a sashimi menu and proceeded to tell us that two people were on a honeymoon. (From a consumer's standpoint, they don't care for excuses.). They should just say they don't have one available at the time.  Let's get to the menu!

Here's what we got to try out:

Garlic shishito pepper-  tasty and if you're lucky spicy
Salmon pico de gallo/ tuna poke sauce- comes on a fried wonton shell and served like a tostada $2 for one and was told $1 during happy hour.. Definitely worth it...happy hour it off and try one of each (there's a few more on the menu)
Big eye tuna poki- literally a poke salad (would have preferred big eye tuna sashimi)
Yellowtail Yuzu Soy-  delicious appetizers and served in thin sashimi pieces
Salmon Wasabi Creme-  served in thin sashimi pieces but the Creme was a little off.  Seemed like wasabi flavored Creme cheese.
Mix Sashimi 12 pcs- overall the sashimi is very fresh and beautifully presented (posted a pic of it)
California Roll-  only ordered this because it was served with real king crab
King Crab Salad- not worth it for $15 opt for the California roll instead

The owner and chef came over to introduce himself and even sent over complimentary uni (picture posted)- which was of course fresh and delectable!

This is probably going to be a new place for everyone to come back to.  We will be back for happy hour when we visit again!  After we had the food their hiccup in the beginning changed their review.  Hopefully they keep up with the quality of the food!

It's pretty rare I get excited about food. I'll eat it, I'll assess it, I'll write a Yelp review. But rare that I get an emotional reaction from it. This Saturday that all changed!

My girlfriends and I went here - one of whom had already been and was talking it up; she was right because It did NOT disappoint!

I was revealed that the atmosphere was chill, laid back, friendly, and welcoming. Not like the stuffy sushi places closer to the strip. Our server, Charles, was friendly, funny , and prompt with our orders. There was a lot of confusion and talk about what to order. He quickly stepped in and made the suggestion that the chef could present some cold and warm dishes at his recommendation until we were full. Sold!!!

Since I can't find the menu online, I'm going to recall the dishes as best I can:

Yellowtail Yuzu Soy - Texture like butter. So fresh, you wouldn't think it was fish. Love the tempura jalapeno on top. 

Gyoza - I HAVE to get gyoza at sushi time. Love this gyoza. Beef was fresh and moist. Not dried out and greasy. Very well done! 

Mussels: I can't believe more people that wrote reviews didn't try this dish. Don't be afraid people!!!! These were incredible

Live soft shell crab - not actually live, but very very fresh. Crab was fried served over a bed of fancy salad ("fancy" meaning it wasn't just crappy iceberg lettuce). The sauce that came on the dish with this was incredible. Spicy but not too spicy. This one had a perfectly balanced textures and flavors. 

Salmon Sashimi - It had pop rocks on it!!!!! So weird, but really amazing. 

I wish I could remember everything we ate. The servers were great. They kept checking on our appetite level. He wasn't pushy about desert or drinks, which was nice. The price for all of us was incredibly reasonable considering the quality of the food. We walked away paying about $45/person. I consider that a steal for this place.

I had such a great experience here. I have been blabbing about it to everyone. I CANNOT wait to come back and try some new things.

I eat here frequently and is my go to sushi spot in Vegas. All the dishes have such amazing flavors from their sushi, sashimi, and everything else on their menu.  One of my favorites is their Tuna Tostada!

Highly recommend this place!

I can only comment on their lunch bento menu and I would say that for the price and the quality, this is one of the best place in Southwest Las Vegas. 

Very nice and comfortable family place with very attentive staff. My waitress probably re-filled my green tea 10 times while I was there. Always smiling and most importantly, often overlook in many busier restaurants, there are plenty of staff to help you with your needs.

The soft-shell crab roll was pretty good and the sashimi was fresh. For lunch, the portion is just right. I can't wait to return to sample their dinner menu.

Some of the best tuna tostadas in town. I love the soho maki. Its like an egg roll but Japanese style. The happy hour is one of the best hidden gems. Come early or you will miss it. The place gets packed fast.

I adore Soho. My husband and I travel to Vegas on business twice a year for several weeks at a time, and lately I have found so much delight in the gems located off the strip rather than on. Soho was one of the best finds we stumbled upon. The quality of ingredients at this sushi restaurant are top-notch. While ALL sushi restaurants really need to ensure their food served is of the utmost quality and freshness, sadly this isn't the case. But no worries with Soho. 

We ordered several appetizers (including the rock shrimp with dipping sauces, omg!), seaweed salad, edamame, miso soup, sashimi and then a bunch of rolls for our dinner. While a "veggie roll" is not very exciting nor is it ever really worth mentioning - theirs was so good I nearly fell off my seat. The asparagus used inside the roll was SUPER crunchy and I honestly thought they executed this normally bland roll perfectly. Also, the crispy crab roll was one of the best I have ever had in my life.

I would also like to mention that the owner/chef was by far the nicest gentlemen I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. He came by our table several times to ensure we were having a good time -- he sent the sashimi compliments -- and he also came by and asked us if we wanted dessert on the house. We said no as he was already too generous, but what a great person and what an amazing experience!

It's a beautiful day in the neighborhood! The greatness is in full swing (freshest fish, excellent food, happy hour values & jumping service). We are back in love with Soho a celebration of all things delicious.

Hands down thee BEST sushi place I've ever been!!  I was in sushi heaven. There is a reason why they have all those awards on the wall. I've never in all my life had sushi that was this fresh, amazing in taste/flavor and quality as I did here. I've been to some four star restaurants that do not come close to this place. I literally day dream about coming back! Lol I would book a flight to vegas just to go back is how good it was. And to top it off the service was superb! A must try!!

No wonder they have very good reviews and stars. The restaurant from start to finish was wonderful. Their customer service started right at the door. 

Although they didn't have a table ready yet, they greeted us and asked us how many in the party. Momentarily, a table was cleaned and sat us down. 

We ordered the lunch special - beef teriyaki made from New York strips, twin dragon roll, various of sushi and the yellow tail soy appetizer. All in all, it was delicious. Waitress checked periodically if everything was alright. 

No complains. Good service. Good food. Good place to go. And it's not super duper expensive either. Win/win.

We went here for the first time last night.  We had an exceptional meal!  We thought the yellowtail app was outstanding!  The tempura Alaskan King Crab was amazing!  All their sushi was exceptionally fresh.  The service was attentive and very friendly which made it an overall wonderful experience.  We can't wait to return!

Great food! Excellent customer service...thank you Sheila and Michelle!

We are from the Bay Area and have been in search for great sushi and Japanese food. We found it.
Beautiful atmosphere, awesome staff, delicious food. I wish they were located more centrally so we can visit more often. Love!

Awesome service , nice atmosphere , and yummy food . The triple s rolls are amazing : scallops , spicy tuna , and shrimp in one special roll . The chef hooked us up with a special sashimi salmon with pico de gallo appetizer, which was a nice feature, too.

Come to this restaurant for some very outstanding Japanese cuisine. I especially enjoyed their famous yuzu yellowtail dish, which literally melted in my mouth. Also great were their stuffed mushroom and angus rib roast. Food is on the pricier and smallish sides though.

SOHO Japanese Restaurant located on Jones & Warm Spring (right by Chevron) I finally got to go on a sushi date with my Lola... And I have to say this place was fantastic! They just opened up about a month ago and I want nothing more than to see this business boom. I sat at the bar and the owner Jon gave me the best service! I had the BEST uni I have ever had and some of the freshest sashimi (yellowtail, salmon, scallops, hamachi, snapper, aji). LOVED the shishito peppers and the Hawaiian poke tostada. He even went as far as giving me one of their speciality sashimi dishes on the house and surprised me with another order of peppers as we left since he knew my mom called me asking for some to go! I'm really hoping the locals will come here! I look forward to trying their green tea tiramisu, short ribs, and their 8.50 lunch special!

Excellent!!
Must try!! The food is of the best quality and the price is really great for what you are getting! Great wait staff!!
Owner was very nice and hands on, I definately recommend this place and can't wait to come back again soon!!

Best sushi off the strip , and everyone that works there is so nice and helpful.  They have amazing uni and the fish is super fresh. They always have a special board with all sort of fun things. It has quickly become my go to sushi spot !
This place is the friken bomb!!!  Happy hour for any Asian place is the tops in Las Vegas....our server Darrel was the man..great service and atmosphere...

Fantastic sushi, great atmosphere, knowledgeable and accommodating staff.  

My wife is pregnant and can't eat raw sushi, so the waiter was very helpful in suggesting rolls she could eat, as well as pointing out substitutions he could have the chef prepare for some of the specialty rolls.

I would definitely recommend this place--the positive reviews are legitimate!

This was an awesome yelp find! Service was great! Our waitress was super friendly and did an awesome job helping us order. Everything we tried (all 14 dishes) were yummy and nothing disappointed. Fav is the garlic softshell crab. Hands down best softshell crab I've had and I'm from HI and eat a lot of sushi. Catalina uni was another fav. It's worth it to get it! Their homemade lychee sake was really good. Tasted like lychee and doesn't bite like some house sakes. One thing I really liked about the place was that the rolls we got that were California roll-like all had king crab in it. Will definitely put this on my list of must-eats when I'm in Vegas.

Can a restaurant be THAT good? i saw a bunch of reviews on yelp about how great the chefs and sushi were so I decided to try it out...all the while, staying a bit skeptical that a restaurant can be THAT amazing. 

Well, let me tell you. I was MIND BLOWN . I have never had a better experience eating sushi. We sat at the bar and met Chef Tae and NuNu.  They were both incredibly down to earth and funny...but most importantly (when you're hungry for some DARN GOOD sushi/fish), Chef Tae and NuNu were incredibly skilled at making delicious, mouth watering, impeccably  presented sushi rolls and sashimi dishes!!! Ahhh Im getting hungry just thinking about the food at Soho.

Conclusion: FRESH fish + AMAZING TASTING combinations of sushi rolls (very unique) + SUPER COOL chefs = i will recommend everyone to come here! You MUST TRY Soho! Come early because it gets packed!

OMG, this place is divine. This restaurant food is delicious and a must go to eatery when visiting Vegas but maybe I shouldn't share a great kept secret. While located in a strip mall, the ambience and chi of the restaurant was awesome.  The food was just as good and scrumptiously delicious as my favorite CA sushi restaurant.  This caucasian girl gives it a five star - service was stellar!.  Highly recommend if you want exceptional service, fresh sushi with balanced sauces and quality grade fish, and an overall great experience.

Really Really Good!!
Yellowtail jalepeno.... excellent!
Bone in short rib...... excellent!
Sashimi is super fresh... amazing!
We will be back very soon!!!

This restaurant has such great sashimi plates. Yellowtail Yuzu is my favorite. I  order 2 at a time. I also really enjoy the twin dragon roll.  I've had the deluxe sashimi a couple of times and its plenty for one person as a a meal. The scallop sashimi is the best, it tastes so sweet. If I'm not feeling sushi or sashimi. I'll order a hamachi Kama, it always so meaty and flavorful.

Service is very friendly. Also they have happy hour from 5-7.
We loved everything! the triple S roll, sushi tostadas, and steel head trout sashimi with pop rocks were our favorite! And the service was exceptional!

Came here specifically on our trip to Vegas from California based on an article I read on MSN saying it was the best sushi restaurant in Vegas and this place didn't disappoint! Food was so so good. Fresh, presentable and full of flavor.  Staff is very friendly and our waiter , Gabriel was excellent. Very friendly,  was so nice to explain the menu to us and let us know what was popular. Highly recommend!

This place is awesome.  The sashimi platter is the best in the city (for the following reasons:  price, variety of fish and presentation).  The service is great.  Chef John always takes the time to  walk around the restaurant and talk with customers.  When I get the craving for fish and sushi I always think Soho first.

The bad part:
I tried calling ahead for a reservation, and was put on hold for 10 minutes at which point, I hung up. I thought we'd just show up and wait for a table since I wasn't super hungry, and I knew the food would be worth the wait. When I arrived, I stood at the door for another 10 minutes before someone even greeted me. I wasn't pretending I was already waiting for a table (aka off to the side, staring at my phone), I was standing in the middle of the entrance, eyeing any and all of the staff, hoping someone actually look at me, and maybe even come over and greet me. I decided not to give them my business and went down the road and had a much better experience and the food was just as good.

The good part:
Food here really is good. The waitstaff service also use to be excellent when I was frequenting this restaurant more regularly last year.

I feel as if their service has suffered from their success. I'm not likely to return any time soon, sadly.
So happy this place is close to home. Their tuna tadas are full of flavor and their butterfish melts in your mouth. Reasonably priced too :)
This place is outrageous! You must try the..I think it's called the White Peach Sake and try the Lychee Sake. Change my life.

Amazing food and service. This is quality fusion sushi at affordable prices. Very comfortable establishment, super friendly staff. The owner chef John is such a nice guy and is a sushi genius. Sat at the sushi bar and had a great time. 

We started with the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy cold appetizer which was a beautiful and succulent yellowtail sashimi. Melts in your mouth. This was hands down my favorite menu item of the evening. I *LOVE* yellowtail.   

We also tried four different kinds of soho tostadas, salmon, shrimp, hamachi and tuna. SO GOOD. It is very unique and flavorful, you have to try it. It's only $2 each for a two-bite taste, delicious. 

The seared tuna tartare was delicious, as was hamachi poke salad and albacore. The last item we tried was the philadelphia roll, which tasted much different than regular philly rolls because it is made with smoked salmon. Every bite was awesome. 

See my pictures - words cannot alone describe the beautiful presentations. 

Overall, the quality of the food and the presentation is what makes this a 5-star review. No AYCE menu, they don't need it - this is again about quality, not quantity. The service is excellent and everyone is just so nice, and they even have conversations with you unlike some other sushi establishments. I saw the chef go out to the tables and introduce himself which is so cool. Too bad we were so full, I really wanted to have some dessert as I read in other reviews how good they are. 

Will DEFINITELY be back and am telling everyone about this hidden gem!

wow amazing food and service!!! the best sushi burrito i have ever ate and ive tried many places!! fresh and tasty. alfred did a great job on customer service made sure we had it our way :) i will be back for more!

This is hands down the best sushi restaurant I have ever been to! I went for the first time during happy hour just to check it out.  The place was extremely clean and the smell of raw fish was kept to a minimum, while some sushi places have that fried fish smell, this one didn't.  The staff was so friendly and inviting offering food off of their menu with such respect to the chef.  We ordered 3 sushi rolls, Shrimp Tempura, Firecracker and Salmon Avocado, which are some basic rolls to try.  I was shocked at how fresh and flavorful the rolls were! yum! A gentleman came over to our table and introduced himself as the chef! He was beyond nice! He then sent over 2 Sashimi plates and some Jalapeno poppers! Free of charge! I am not into sashimi so i thought I would give it a try.  My mind was blown! If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would! Best sushi place ever.

Came here for happy hour. It was busy, which was expected but the servers who saw us offered beers while we waited. Once we were seated we were greeted by our waiter Louie who took our order promptly. Food was SOHO delicious (pun intended), service was above our expectations and we had a great night. Our waiter was very personable and made us feel at home. All in all we left extremely happy and will be coming back for more.

This is quite possibly the best Japanese restaurant I've ever experienced. The chef/owner used to be the executive chef at Social House in Treasure Island and I'm assuming he kept all his connections because the fish quality is on par with the world class sushi joints on The Strip, but you're paying normal prices. 

A few things are worth highlighting as to why this place deserves nothing less than 5-stars:

First, Chef Lee is incredibly passionate about the experience. If he has the bandwidth, he'll personally visit every table in the place just to find out how you're enjoying the food. I've never seen another chef do this as frequently or with as much enthusiasm. Also, he'll take note of commonalities amongst your orders and make recommendations for other dishes he thinks you will like. His recommendations to us have all been things we've never heard of, like engawa and sawagani, but have been soooo good and worth ordering again. 

Second, in case you glossed over it above, the quality of his fish is on par with the best restaurants in town. Further, he designed the menu to include unique dishes you won't find anywhere else, such as the tostadas. Ask him about his specials if you want to get your hands on the one-off buys that he doesn't list on the menu.

Finally, SoHo won't break the bank. If you go all out for dinner, you may spend $50 per person (not including alcohol), but we usually end up around $35 per person. If you go there for lunch, you can get an entire meal for $8.50. Pretty awesome.

If you're a fan of Japanese food or just like trying new places, you would be out of your mind not to give SoHo a try.
I so love this place! The food was amazing. Their Happy hour menu is a GREAT deal and the owner is so nice!
Great place to eat, real fresh fish makes a big difference.  There customer service was excellent, my tea was constantly filled up.
Las Vegas Strip quality and presentation ...actually better! For local pricing. Great staff and make sure to try the grill!

Do yourself a favor, don't bother with the sushi rolls.  They are pretty bland and are not very interesting.  The Firecracker roll was surprisingly bland given its jalapeno content and the other couple rolls we tried were just meh and we get way better sushi rolls at our regular place.  For that reason, this restaurant does not deserve to be the #1 restaurant on Yelp.  

Everything else - WOW!  The quality and cuts of fish are excellent - you cannot go wrong with the sashimi.  The tostadas are a good little value at only $1 each during Happy Hour - the Salmon and Hamachi are the best ones and they taste awesome!  The mussels were very good and used uzo so they had a great citrus punch.  Don't skip dessert - we loved the matcha tiramasu because it was the perfect little size after we stuffed ourselves with sushi.

Even during Happy Hour, you will end up spending quite a bit of money.  The service also was only 3/5 on the night we went but they were quite busy and the people were pleasant just scattered about and not that attentive.  I enjoyed eating here but it did not blow my mind like Kabuto and it is also not as convenient and cheap as my regular place down the street from me.  Maybe if they rotate the selections on their Happy Hour menu I would go back, but probably not for any other reason.  We spent $60 per person and for a little more money I can go to Kabuto.

From experience, when it comes to Vegas, my expectations around food are lower. Thus, Soho Japanese Restaurant stands out among the rest. If I were being ultra picky, yes, I could probably figure one menu item I'm not crazy about or that this other thing could have used a little more dressing.. that goes with every restaurant, practically.

This place IS THE BEST restaurant in Vegas, hands down. 

The food is incredible, tasty, and fresh.

I just went back recently and everything - I mean EVERYTHING I had was DELICIOUS - OK??!!!

I'm a fan of the original NOBU in NY and this rivals it at a tiny fraction of the price.

Anyone who states this food here is (4) star or less, either is a hater or never eats less than 5 star food in their silver-spoon fed life.

The servers are diligent and the chef is a sweetheart, but I am basing my review solely on the FOOD. The atmosphere and staff are just a ++++++++++
I like Soho still. They used to have lunch and happy hours but no more now. The food quality is not as good as last year. Wish they can do better like before.

If I could give this spot 6 stars I would!
Great specials and awesome service!
Take the trip off the strip for sure!

Food was excellent. Service was excellent. Seaweed salad was good. Gyoza was the bomb. Braised short ribs were tender and tasty. Poke was tasty. Salmon taco thingy was bomb. I don't know the exact name but they are $2 each. Oysters were bomb. Black rice tea was bomb. Salmon and yellow tail nigiri was bomb. Definitely will go back.

Nice atmosphere nice decor. Very busy tonight (Friday)  which is a good thing.  Fresh fish and the tips are very creative and original which you can't find at 80% of any other  sushi resteraunt in Vegas.  Taste, texture, and amount of fish was on point. Device was very attentive and where detailed with every step of service.  Had a great dinner.  Thanks yall!

This was the happiest surprise gem of a restaurant! The rich, deep, hearty miso soup was the best I've had. The thin, crisp, succulent tempura is good enough to knock your socks off. Twice. California rolls were dainty and appetizing. Even the soy sauce was served in soy pots, and the ginger had a nuance I've never tasted before. Here's where it gets interesting: the triple S roll was delicious with a little kick. I thought it would be my favorite, but things only got better from there. Chef brought out their specialty yellowtail dish, which was beautifully cut, topped with a subtle-tasting micro cilantro, and thinly sliced tempura Serrano. The light dressing had a clean taste, and this will no doubt be a favorite of mine when the heat strikes in summer. Chef also brought garlic tuna tetake, which was perfectly seasoned and had a delightful crunchy garnish. It all was so good, my mom and husband, who don't eat much fish, liked it. My dad ordered a rainbow roll for dessert (also excellent). The real dessert menu was refreshing for a Japanese restaurant. We shared a chocolate mousse cake, and that was a mistake; sharing, that is. This caliber of food is something you'd find in a Michelin star restaurant. However, the prices are affordable. The atmosphere is welcoming and pleasant, not too fussy. The staff and chef made the whole experience all the more enjoyable. They were very accommodating with our two small children and offered to rearrange the chairs to ensure our comfort. A winning combination of high quality food, fair price, great service, cleanliness (they wiped our tables before dessert), I could go on, but will spare you for now. Go see for yourself, you won't regret it.

More like a 3.5.

Very, very limited sushi menu. I'm a fan of anything and everything that's spicy, so I tried two of the "spicy" rolls listed. Plus side- sushi chefs were super fast, which is never the case no matter where I go. Unfortunately, neither one of the rolls I ordered were close to being spicy. I might come back in the future, but I won't order the sushi next time.

I wanted to check out this place after I saw the great reviews about it. The sushi is truly fresh and very tasty. I didn't go during happy hour, but I heard they have really good pricing. They have a good selection of sushi rolls which are very unique. I personally enjoyed the yellow tail sashimi and the fried fish roll. The service and the atmosphere were also agreeable. I usually go for all you can eat sushi, but this is definitely a good alternative for those days when you just want a quick and small bite!

Yelp 100 Challenge 15' * 13/100

One of my friends raved about SoHo and suggested we meet here to catch up. If you must know, I've been keeping a close eye on restaurant hygiene after a few unpleasant creepy-crawly incidents in Chinatown over the summer which allowed me to notice that the place was spotless, simple and minimally decorated. The last time we went, they seemed to be short on staffed so we did not really mind them taking a while on the orders. 

What they lacked for in their service that day, they made up for in their food. I ordered the seared tuna salad, a little pricey for greens at first glance but you would soon understand why. It is served as a bundle of microgreens with a special citrusy dressing, tuna sashimi seared perfectly to crispiness on its sides and sprinkled with deep fried onion pieces. I was in salad heaven! For such a healthy serving of vegetables, it does not fail to impress and I just had to go back again earlier this afternoon to order the exact same thing!

On the other hand, my friend ordered the tonkatsu curry - my usual bento favorite - from the lunch specials and she had great things to say. It came with miso soup, a small bowl of vegetables and rice. (For options such as salmon teriyaki, an order also comes with edamame and a delicious garlic sauce).They closely rival the bento boxes at RA on the Strip in portion size and price but SoHo clearly has a larger pool of options for lunch which makes it a more attractive spot. Can't go wrong with all these 4-5 star reviews!

John- please come and check on dinner service at Soho. I miss lunch there and still don't understand why you changed to dinner only. Your lunch regulars would gladly have paid 2-3 more for that excellent lunch box. As for dinner last night, I was disappointed in the presentation. The trout is now presented on a dark clay plate which made me realize how much you taste with your eyes. It just wasn't as appealing. My favorite uni came out on this weird giant plate of ice and by the time I got towards the end it had become orange goo. One bright spot was the brussel sprouts which were excellent.  The food tasted pretty good, but the lower standard of presentation was disappointing. I miss the beautifully prepared plates and attention to detail. I am sad to have to post this review. Soho was something I was looking forward to when in town.

A little inside scoop - the owner, Chef John and the Sous Chef used to work at the Social House, but John decided to open up his own sushi restaurant and use the same vendors from the Social House. Though they're not conveniently located on the strip and the ambiance isn't as swanky, the prices are much lower and the portions are bigger.

I chose to have an omakase here on my birthday. The wait was a bit long. They have a fusion take on sushi, with many of the dishes infused with ponzu sauce and other non-traditional accompaniments. The price was very reasonable. Significantly less than my last omakase in San Franacisco. Better yet, you could to get an omakase a requested price. We skipped the cooked dishes and requested sushi only. The chefs were very accommodating and polite. Let them know what you're favorites are! There was some waiting time each dish, as the chefs were fulfilling orders and juggling our customized dishes. Understandable.
 
The place has a great local vibe..none of those pretentious people.

My boyfriend took me to this place and I must say I was very impressed with the food.  The salmon avocado creme was SUPER yummy!! And the bronze broccoli was orgasmic! I wish I knew how to make that!! The yellowtail yuzu soy had such a smooth texture and it melted in my mouth.  The service was also above and beyond.  Our waitress, Sheila, helped me decide on what to try based on what I told her I like.  Excellent decision!  She was spot on and I was very happy.  I will definitely come back to eat here and tell my family and friends to check it out :) *Happy Tummy!

Eating here (and doing nothing else in Las Vegas) was literally my ideal Las Vegas experience. We came for Happy Hour, and enjoyed $3 Sake, $1 Tostadas, and $3-5 rolls and other dishes. Terrific service, delicious sushi etc, etc etc. 

The lychee-infused sake was very yummy. Well, everything was very yummy.

I've come here a few times now and have had a great experience each time!

Let's talk the important stuff...Happy Hour! 3pm-7pm! Mon-Sat.... $5 dishes and everything I've ordered so far has been fresh.

Lunch menu is small. Dinner menu is quite a bit more extensive. The restaurant is not very big - several 2 and 4 seater tables and sushi bar seating. With that, know it'll be busy with a wait at dinner time.

This is not AYCE sushi which is fine by me given the quality of the food that you get. Service has been consistently friendly and attentive.
This is probably my favorite place for happy hour in all of Vegas! The lychee sake is so delicious and the rock shrimp is addicting AF!!!

Services: Upon entry, they are very kind and welcoming, with everyone yelling "welcome" including the sushi chefs behind the counter. The wait times, with a reservation, were within 5 minutes. They sat us down this is where they began to lose a bit of their steam. They asked us for drink upon sitting down and brought them, however we didn't hear from a server for a while. They came and asked for our order which by then are water cups were half way empty for most of us and they never came back to fill them, until after we began to get our food. The food times were decent, but servers wouldn't come by often to refill drinks or checkup. 

Judgment of service: A bit slow
 
   Food Quality: Most of the sushi tasted amazingly, some of the sashimi wasn't amazing, but almost all the food had a nice taste. All the fish was fresh and was prepared amazingly. Plus, the food times were great. We never had to wait long for anything we ordered, always had something to eat while enjoying our conversation. The presentation above all was the best part of the meal. The chefs worked quickly and gave attention to detail with all plates. Making the food look more delicious than it already seemed.  

Judgment of food: Amazing
 
   Cost: The cost seemed quite fair for the quality and presentation of the food. They take the time on each order and it shows. However much the services may lack, the food easily recovers for them. You are for the most part looking at about twenty-five to thirty-five per person for a decent meal.
Judgment: Average
 
   Atmosphere: The restaurant was very small, not giving much room between tables. Which took away from the food. It made you feel enclosed and didn't offer the privacy and comfort you would have expected with the quality of the food. However, the atmosphere was light and opening. The noise level was a bit above average voice, but you could still easily talk to your friends or date. This seems most of a party environment than a date because of the slightly more open and louder environment.  

   Judgment: Average

Over all it was a nice place with amazing food. The price is quite respectable for the food they are giving. I wouldn't recommend for a date night, but a great place for a small group of people. The service is a bit slow, however, everyone was very nice.

Finally I understand what my wife has been preaching about for the past three years. 
Incredible quality, creative sushi, amazing value.
Plus, the best happy hour specials. Ever.

My wife travels to Vegas one a year for a conference and this year, I decided to join her. She insisted that we leave the strip for one night and go to Soho. She's been talking about her previous visits for the past three years, and has compared all other Sushi restaurants to Soho since her first visit and now I totally understand why. We sat at the sushi bar so we could watch the chefs create their magic. I'm amazed at how quickly they worked, and how much fun everyone was having. You know it's a great business with great employees because everyone was laughing and cracking jokes all night long. When everyone behind the counter works at the same level and in perfect harmony, that quality is reflected in the end product. After about 4-5 happy hour appetizers, we ordered a few entree rolls. The standout or all of the standouts was the Double Dragon roll. The perfect balance of hot/cold and well as texture, this might be the "perfect roll". 

Most of these guys cut their teeth at high-end sushi joints on the strip. Here they can be as creative as they wish. Fortunately for them they have access to the best fish in the world. 
Soho is proof that some of the best sushi comes from strip malls. 
World class quality at non-strip, local-friendly prices.

We we're out-of-towners looking for some good sushi. We figured if it had that many good ratings and wasnt on the strip, it might be one of those locally kept gems... I'm not sure if that's what it is, but damn, it was amazing! Our server was very friendly and gave us their signature sashimi on the house, which was also amazing! It'll be awhile before I have sushi that good again.

Great local sushi joint with high end items like toro.  Service was excellent and food very reasonable for the quality.  We had the tasting special $125 for two and it was delicious.  Worth the Uber off strip.

This place a is absolutely the best all around. Been here several times and the quality and freshness is superior. Happy Hour is always happy for us. The prices are very reasonable along with a good selection. Chef John has always made a point to come out and say hello. I tell everyone about this place.

I have become a regular at SoHo now. This place has an amazing happy hour with some really good prices. Try the lychee infused cold sake for $5, $1 tostadas, and way more. This place does it right. Friendly staff. Fresh food. And Chef John always comes to talk to us everytime we come back. This places sets the standards of how a restaurant should be run.

We planned need a special event at the Bellagio and had Soho provide an on site chef who made rolls to order.  Quality was excellent, staff was great from organizing to finished product.  It was the hit of the party.  Many thanks to those involved!

Hardly give 5 stars, but this is a place where I look forward to going to when in Vegas. All the great taste and creativity with the non STRIP prices. The funny part is, this place is in a little strip with other local food businesses. I don't remember how I found this place, but I'm glad I did. So why is it 5 stars!

- food and quality is ridiculous
- the price is ridiculous
- the service is on point
- it's just a pleasure to eat there

This is one of those places I say you must try if you go to Vegas and don't wanna pay an astronomical amount of money but still get the same service and food quality. The only difference is the decor. I'm sure if you want a fancier place, then you might be underwhelmed. As for me, I'm all about the food and this place knocks it out of the park for me

Everything we had today was just absolutely delicious!! Very good quality. All of the fish just melts in your mouth! 

Seaweed salad
Volcano roll
The macadamia nut roll (forgot what it's called)
Cajun albacore sashimi (best I've ever had!)
Yellowtail yuzu soy sashimi
Deluxe platter sashimi

Not to mention, our server Sheila was the best! Overall great customer service! She made sure everything was up to par every time and made great recommendations. Will definitely be returning!
Tong Dak and Sondubu Tufo Seafood are my favorite order in this place Kalbi whenever I'm craving for good Beef BBQ pair it with Soju.
FRESH. Better than sushi joints on the strip. Everything is good but the must haves are Yellowtail Yuzu, sunny salmon roll, & Kumamoto Oysters.

Noted for its high quality ingredients, innovative cuisine and excellent service, it was with much anticipation that we entered the restaurant at around 8PM on a recent Thursday evening.  We started off with a pair of shrimp tostadas which were made from taro.   For entrees we shared orders of sansho butter salmon with mixed root vegetables and free range chicken with garlic butter soy, pea greens and pickled vegetables. Each dish was nicely plated and portioned. The meal was closed out with a matcha (green tea) tiramisu which did little to enhance our otherwise exceptional dining experience.

A couple friends and I met up for Happy Hour yesterday and were very pleased with the food and amazing hospitality!

We focused on the Happy Hour menu which was simple since there were so many wonderful items on it! The prices made it even sweeter (everything ranged from $1-5). 

I'm a big fan of fruit-flavored cold sake, so I was immediately drawn to their Soho Infused Sake with Lychee and White Peach options. A small carafe was just $4 (reg. $8) and enough for 6-7 shots. I was floored by the amazing deal and it is delicious. You could tell that it was made in-house with a natural flavor and light sweetness. We tried both flavors and White Peach was chosen as the favorite.

We tried a couple sushi rolls: Firecracker Roll ($8, H/H $5) which has spicy tuna, jalapeño, cream cheese, sweet onion, then deep fried; Shrimp Tempura Roll ($6; H/H $4) with avocado and cucumber; and Salmon Avocado Roll (H/H $4). I didn't really care for the Firecracker Roll, but I also didn't realize it was fried (I'm not a fan of deep fried rolls or cream cheese in my sushi - fail on my part for not checking descriptions). The other two were fine, but really nothing special.

Other appetizers: Ika Geso (H/H $4) and Cajun Albacore Sashimi ($11, H/H $5) served with Serrano chili, red onion, ponzu aioli, and spicy garlic ponzu on a bed of julienned radish. Both delicious!

"SOHO Tadas" (Tostadas) are $2/each (except the Beef Tostadas) and during Happy Hour, the Salmon, Tuna, Hamachi, and Tako are just $1/each. A thin "tostada" crisp is topped with avocado creme and micro cilantro before being packed with delicious raw seafood. The Salmon is served with pico de gallo, the Tuna is made with Hawaiian poke sauce, the Hamachi is tossed in a salsa verde, and the Tako is served "kimchee" style (tossed in chojujang). All of them were delicious and refreshing. I love the variations of flavors and I think it is an amazing value for the amount of quality seafood! These are a must for your meal. I can't wait to try the beef, white fish, and shrimp ones!

Mr. Lee (owner and former executive chef of Social House at The Crystals) was so kind to welcome us (since it was all our first time), chat for a bit, and offer us a complimentary tasting of their signature dish! The Yellowtail Sashimi ($12) served with Tempura Serrano, micro cilantro, garlic oil, ponzu, and garlic dust was absolutely delicious. 

The whole night pretty much went like that. Amazing service from several servers in the form of constant water refills, attentiveness, and just all-around kindness. I asked the server for a pen when I realized the one I keep in my purse had died and instead of just allowing me to borrow one, I was given a SOHO-branded pen! Then, as we were preparing to leave, the same server presented a plate of adorable sushi key rings and phone charms!! What restaurant gives keyrings to their patrons?! Just, wow. Everyone was so, so nice to us! We couldn't stop talking about it even as we exited the restaurant!

The food was quite good. The lunch special I ordered was gigantic, a true steal! Plus the happy hour pricing and quality were top notch. Service was more than acceptable, in a typical casual Japanese sense.

So showed up to a wait. We're told 20-30 minutes. An hour later nothing. Then was given a high top, we requested a non high top but a "reservation" was coming in. The place is trying so hard to be high end, maybe for Vegas it is but it's not. Definitely not SOHO level. Food is VERY mediocre with low grade fish. Service is quick but extremely unfriendly. Will never be back. Spent over 100 dollars on a meal that I could get a bento box place for 20! Go somewhere else.

It was a while since we were here for dinner. I still remember the first time we came to SOHO, and the chef sent a complimentary plate of Yellowtail sashimi to us and said "welcome to SOHO" ... 
That Yellowtail was the best tasting Yellowtail sashimi I ever had before! Thank you Chef!

Ever since, we returned many times and the quality of food never changed.

It was a timeframe when the restaurant was open for dinner only, and I didn't like it.
Now, I am very happy SOHO is open for lunch again! Also Happy Hour is back, too!

Last time we were here, we tried the Lunch Prix Fixe ( available from Monday to Saturday, Noon-4pm), either for $8.95 or $10.95 ...
I choose the Teriyaki Salmon with white rice. It was including a Miso soup and a mixed greens salad ($10.95).
The portion was very sensible but satisfying.
Dessert was available to add for additional $2.- and I choose the Mochi Ice cream, 2 pieces (one green tea and one mango flavor) ... Very yummy!
Also ordered a glass of Sangria ($3) and a glass of Iced green tea ($3) ... 

Noticed that the restaurant got very comfortable, new chairs! I really like the way it looks!
Happy to return and enjoy our neighborhood restaurant!

How is it possible that Las Vegas has the best sushi I've ever eaten? I don't know. But it's true. You MUST visit SoHo when you're in LV. Yes, it's a little out of the way, but it's a nice break from the craziness of the strip.

While I don't remember the specific name of what we ate (it was a special) the fish was fresh and melted in your mouth like butter. In fact, we did not need to chew any portion of our meal except for the sushi (barely!). We were seated right away with reservations, and the staff was so pleasant.

We ordered the Mio sparkling sake which went great with the seafood options. Everything including the fish and sake were affordably priced.

It's almost been a year and I still think about SoHo!

Sorry this place is NOT 5 stars!!!  Thought I give it a try for lunch because of the 5 star rating.  Had the lunch special that came with a salad, side of cucumbers, steamed rice, 4 piece of spicy tuna roll (by the way the roll dimension was the size of a quarter. Not exaggerating)

There was nothing spectacular about any part of my lunch at all.  

Service was terrible.  Walked in, waited at the front, not sure if I was supposed to seat myself.  Waited for anyone to even make eye contact but all the staff seemed too busy to even notice. Finally walked up to one of the servers and she sat me at the bar.  Took a while for a server to come take my order.  Once I ordered it.  Took a while to get my food.  They dropped off my food and not a single server stopped by to see how I was doing.  No One!  

I ate everything, because I was starving.  Was up for 5 hours running errands and didn't have anything to eat.  Everything was below average.  Fish did not seem fresh to me. Salad and cucumber was tasteless, miso soup tasted  like all soy sauce based.  The steam rice was good. But I wish I had ordered the Chicken Katsu lunch instead.  Was still hungry, but  I can't eat just steam rice plain.   Why would you serve a bowl of steam rice with sushi anyways?
