To sum it up...this place is FAR from 5 stars.  It's lacking in every department.  Oh and I their credit card machine was down so the server told me that she had to write down my credit card number and enter it later.  Geez. 

There isn't any reason I could think of to bring me back here.

Goyemon is and has always been my favorite.  I just wanted to see what all this 5 star rating hype was all about.  And I'm sorry but this is a completely misleading...5 star?  More like 5 NOs!!!!

My husband and I have been coming here since they opened. We have NEVER been disappointed. John and his staff are amazing. The king crab tempura, yellowtail, beef tataki and tuna (can't remember specific name) are an absolute must order when ever we come in. Always satisfying. I've even ordered to go after a long day... Best sushi I've ever had!!!

Amazing atmosphere, really great food!  Love seating at the bar and enjoying the unique sushi and sashimi plates.  This is my new favorite place to come and eat sushi.   Highly recommend it.  Oscar and Agustin Sushi chefs are great at preparing it.
I ate here few times now and chef Aaron & John are excellent.  I love sashimi so chef sets me up with delicious fish.  Service is excellent and food is awesome.  Some day I will try the happy hour.

This is by far my favorite Japanese Restaurant!! Foods are tasty, phenomenal, fresh seafood, amazing and friendly staff, the Chef's are amazing..special mention to the superb and talented Chef Tae..shout out to Sheila, Dominic, Louie, Israel, Augustin, Anthony and Janae!! This place is a MUST! Very worth it to come here if you love far or your first time! Chef Tae is the MASTER of EVERYTHING...ask him for some specialty sushi, sashimi, soup or just about ANYTHING! Sit by the Chef Bar!! This place is HIGH RECOMMENDED!!!!

The soup is a specialty soup with an amazing homemade fish soup...the salmon is in a specialty sauce with pop rocks...amazing combo..simply the BEST!!! Please come here!!!
BETTER THAN SEX!!!!!

Soho Japanese Restaurant is always a stop for us when we go to Vegas! Well, it is if we have a car! I'll ask to rent a car even if we don't really need one, just so I know we can get to Soho! I'm upgrading my review, not so much on the food, as the food is always delicious! And I rarely give 5 stars because I think you can always improve. But the service here is super attentive, yet not invasive! I have enjoyed every meal I've had here! And appreciated the service each and every time!!!! Our server this time in, had a tattoo of diamond head on her arm, so I assumed she had Hawaii ties. She was fantastic! We enjoyed every minute. And although they did not have any more of the braised short ribs that I wanted so badly, my meal was nonetheless delicious! I had the miso sea bass. Yummy and huge portion (in comparison to the butterfish they used to serve). My wife, son, and daughter had the hamachi. My kids also had  the smaller deluxe sushi assortment, which was huge and FANCY! I have to say it was my best meal this trip! Oh wait, it is usually always my best meal!!! We also hit the last few minutes of happy hour so we got brussels sprouts, spicy ahi roll and avocado roll! And a few bottles of yummy Sake, peach and lychee! So ono!!!!!!!! Thank you Soho, for never failing to please!

I am always up for a new sushi spot, especially when the chef/owner happens to be the ex-chef from a strip hot spot, Social House. So what better night to try SoHo than anniversary night? Based on its fabulous reviews from fellow yelpers, I wasn't worried and certainly was not disappointed! 

From entry to exit it was an excellent dining experience! One of the best I've had in a long time. From the food to the service, everything was rockin'! Our waiter was on point, friendly and funny, attentive but not pushy....perfect! 

Food....delish!!!! We ordered so many things I don't know where to begin. It's almost like Japanese tapas being as the servings are so small. We had the yellowtail sashimi appetizer- I've had this citrusy yellowtail and jalapeño creation many times and at many different restaurants and its by far my favorite thing to order, but it was also by far my favorite here at SoHo!!! They made it different by frying the jalapeño in a tempura batter I believe which gave the dish a slight crunch and made it different than other establishments! Well played SoHo, well played! Onward.....tostada's, think we had 10! Tuna, shrimp and hamachi all delish. Angus gyoza, cod lettuce wraps, and crispy tuna all phenomenal. 

Nice touch...the chef came to our table and spoke with us, even brought us a special dish. Hawaiian tuna poke, which was so light and delectable I wanted a second order but was too stuffed to go there! 

This may very well be my favorite new sushi spot. We will know the next few times I go, but from first glance it's a winner.

We where visiting from out of town and just really not finding any good sushi restaurants on the strip that didn't cost an arm and a leg. We also have quite a few gluten free eaters in our group making the food hunt a little harder. I stumbled upon this place and the hostess confirmed over the phone they had gluten free options. Little did I know how accommodating they would be for us! Unbelievable service and so sensitive to our dietary needs. They made every item (even tempura) in a gluten free option for us and where so knowledgeable. Our waiter, Charles, was sooo kind! He gave the best recommendations. I swear- you won't regret eating here. Hands down the best sushi I've had in a long time- and I'm from San Francisco and total foodie!! I don't recommended places lightly!! 

I'll be dreaming of this mean for weeks! Thanks Charles!
Love this place! Whoever came up with sushi burritos is genius! And it was very smart putting one on UNLV campus

absolutely the freshest, most delicious sushi/food and amazingly impeccable service every single visit!  everything is sooooo good!  i highly highly highly recommend soho-my fave sushi/japanese restaurant on this planet!!!

I just ate here tonight for the very first time and I can't believe it took me this long to discover this place. By far the greatest Japanese sushi I've ever had in Vegas. Sat at the sushi bar with some friends and the guy who made our sushi was awesome. I'm definitely referring this place to everybody I know that likes Japanese food. And can't wait to go back in the near future.

I looooove this place! I live in the northwest area and I don't mind driving down to the south side just to eat here.

This place is not all you can eat. The seafood is such good quality! It's very fresh! I've been here two times and I really loved the cold dishes. I've had the Seared Garlic Tuna, Salmon Avocado Créme, and Tuna Tataki with truffle oil (Which they took off the menu! Please bring it back!!!). Each dish has it's own unique flavor so I can't really say which one tastes better because they're that good!

The second time I went a friend and I ordered the Premium Sashimi plate which came with 20 pieces. Like I said.. the fish is very fresh! I used to dislike Uni.. I've had it had other sushi restaurants, but after trying it here, it's safe to say that I love it now!

Also shout it to Charlei our server! She was so friendly and always on point. Even gave me a sushi pen because she found out it was my birthday!

I don't like to give out five stars.  I need to be wowed in order to do so.  I have been wowed every time I've been to SoHo.  No doubt this is the very best sushi in Las Vegas.   Our server Charles did an awesome job with suggestions.   Chef John came to our table.  He was very gracious and humble, it's was a joy to meet him

SoHo is hereby my sushi place.  I don't say this lightly, considering a friend of mine owns a sushi restaurant.

Went for happy hour last week with a couple of friends that said we had to try this place...5 star, etc, etc, etc.  We arrived at 5pm and the place was about half full.  We were greeted immediately, and sat very quickly.  The server took time to explain the menu and all of the dishes we had questions on.  Service AWESOME!  After perrussing the menu, my wife and I decided to order the happy hour menu (yes, the whole menu.)  We love sushi, fish, and generally food itself.  Our friends looked at us surprised, and then we knew, they were not the same sushi people we were (nor the eaters like us.)  Nevertheless, the menu arrived (along with a couple of chef comps.)  We enjoyed everything on the menu, but did not consider it to be a 5 star level.  Although the food was clean and presented very well, we have had better tasting sushi elsewhere.  That is not to say that we would not come back (because we would if we are on that side of town again.)  There was a $25 sashimi platter that looked very, very good, but we did not order it on that visit.  We would recommend the happy hour for very reasonable prices, and if you are having a nice cocktail while eating.  We will definitely see you again Soho.

One of the best sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Easily can go up against any on the strip. We come here all the time and it's always good. Happy hour from 5-7 is awesome with many items for 5 bucks. My favs are the salmon avocado roll and the shrimp tempura roll. We get the roasted Brussel sprouts every time too. They only make so many sprouts so get them early!

We love the golden ocean trout, with pop rocks, it's a go to these days. Never had anything that wasn't fresh and delicious.  

Service is always great. We always ask for Sheila and she is the best. The food comes quick and they are even quicker to clear the plates. The drinks never get empty and water is always full. 

The chefs are friendly, often visiting the table to check on our experience. We are regulars and the chefs will often send over a little treat. It's always appreciated and never expected. It's the little touches like that that have made this our favorite sushi spot.  Great place!

Their happy hour is ridiculous!!! $5 plates and $1 bites. $5 infused sake. Seriously!!! I couldn't help it and ordered almost everything. It was a ridiculous amount of food and such a great deal! We also had several of the Sashimi platters. Wow!! Flavor packed and delicious. The jalapeño poppers were awesome and the sushi rolls  were all excellent. Get off the strip and come here for awesome sushi. The sashimi that we had here was less than half the price and much much more flavorful!

Saw all the 5 star reviews on Yelp and decided to swing by the other night for dinner. It was a surprisingly mediocre experience.

There was a ~30 minute wait at 6:30 pm (Maybe folks were still finishing up from Happy Hour 4 - 6 pm?!?)

Restaurant seems like an Asian Fusion restaurant.

Miso Soup
- Bland and it seemed like it came from a powder

Wok-Fried Broccoli
- Broccoli wasn't fresh...there were yellow spots?!?
- ...Broccoli had this odd lemon taste to it?!?

Twin Dragon Roll
- Decent Roll with 4 pieces of tempura.
- ...there was a little bit of real crab squeezed between some fake crab?!?

Black Cod Entree
- Portion was generous and pricing was decent.
- Fish was fresh. ...but wasn't mind-blowing...

Noticed that other tables got complimentary dishes from the chef?!?

~$50/person after tax and tip for dinner.`

Simply the best. Fresh. Clean. Kind service.  Thoughtful.  Kelson (our server) was so genuine, knowledgeable and generous (we were celebrating our anniversary and he recognized that in kind).  Sheila was also hilarious and sweet.  

And seriously- the sushi was awesome and on point.  A sashimi platter with baby yellowtail, scallops and red snapper - WHAT???  A Uni duo from Santa Barbara and Catalina that melts like butter with the ocean breeze. Pop rocks and snapper - elevating your sensual experience of sushi.  Come on - this place is so good / so phenomenal.

Thank you thank you thank you for a fantastic meal and service.

When I came here I want much of a sushi fan.  Still a beginner ordering phili rolls.  Came out with a customer and boy oh boy was my mind made up.  We tried just about everything on the menu and everything that everyone suggested.  You really can't go wrong with anything.  Even things I would never eat, I tried and LOVED.  3 days later, I'm still craving more as well as ranting and raving to friends. After ordering about 20 rolls for the handful of us, we proceeded on to the dessert which we had no room for but I sure am happy I took advantage of this experience.  Beyond amazing and I suggest everyone go.  

Not only is the food great, but service was outstanding as well.
Not your typical sushi place! Chefs take so much pride in their food. The fish is fresh and there are specials everyday. I love the spicy garlic edemame and the volcano roll. Great service as well!

This is my favorite go to sushi restaurant in town and I swear it gets better every time I go because I try something new on the menu!

Although SoHo isn't AYCE, they do have lunch specials and an amazing happy hour with items that start at $5. That can't be beat! :)

The ambiance is amazing. It is nicely decorated and the staff is amazingly welcoming, efficient and fun!

I do not think that I have tried anything that I do not like but my top choice are:
1.) Flying Fish Roll
2.) Yellow in Yuzu Ponzu Sauce
3.) Salmon Kama

The quality of the fish is way better than the other AYCE restaurants that I have tried so I do not mind paying a little extra but not too much extra like Nobu prices. Haha

This place can get very busy and wait times can go til over an hour so if you're trying to make it for happy hour I highly recommend that you call and make a reservation before showing up.

I love their premium sashimi platter!most of the items are pretty good here... their happy hour menu is just ok. I like their old happy hour menu better since it's more selection. I would suggest them to add back the tostadas. Those were good. I don't go there as often since I was not impressed with their new happy hour menu.

This place lives up to its reviews and stars on yelp! Me and the hubby checked this place out - sashimi platter: to die for ! Uni was bomb- wrapped with salmon and topped with egg, butter at tits finest! We will be back to try more high quality items at this gem!

Overall great experience here last night. The happy hour menu is insane, we got to try so many different things on there for a fair price. The mango sake is good- my fiancé said it's not very strong in his opinion but I'm ok with that. The shrimp tempura roll was my favorite (I'm basic). The server let us switch to a more comfortable table. The only thing this place could improve on is the bathrooms. They were dark and in need of some updates but not a big deal. We'll definitely be back!

WOW, just amazing!!!!

Great Service and especially the food!!!!! 

During 12pm-4pm, is their Lunch Special time. $8-10 bento set!!! (Recommend)

4pm-6pm, they have Happy hour. Discounted appetizers and drinks!!! (recommend)

I usually come in around 3:30ish to order lunch special, and afterwards, get some from the happy hour. So I get a little bit of both world. (Highly Recommend)

Staff are always there to help for the first timer, and the owner always shows up to your table to check up on you, if its not too busy. 


Food is always fresh!!!! Quality you can trust!!!! 

I always order Teriyaki Beef from the lunch special. Cajun Albacore from the happy hour. But you are not me, so order whatever you want....you wont be disappointed!!!!
Sat at the sushi bar. Super good rolls and a really fun staff. Gave us custom sashimi on the house.
This is the best sushi place in Vegas! Service was fantastic, fish was fresh, sake was tasty and overall it was a fun experience.

To me, this is the BEST Sushi place in town and the price is sooooooooo reasonable. The place is very clean and the owners are wonderful. I have tried eating here many times and every single time, I walked out happy and satisfied because of how consistently good and fresh their food really is. In the past, I preferred those AYCE place, but this place has changed my mind. Unless something changes about Soho, I will definitely go here for sushi. =)
Food is fresh and delicious and service is kind. A bit of pricey judging from the decoration and ambience of the restaurant.

This is a MUST stop every time we are in Vegas. We have been going to Soho ever since they opened and it has never disappointed us. We're from Los Angeles and this is better than most places there. Make sure to go during happy hour  (4-7) when everything on the happy hour menu is $5.

BEST SASHIMI PLACE I'VE BEEN TO SO FAR!! I love it so much! The price isn't bad for the quality, almost all the sashimi is great (I can't say all since I still haven't tried a lot of them)! And the waitress there is always so sweet! She even remembered our first time being there! I always recommend this place to everyone going to Vegas! Everything is so fresh and the sauces compliment each sashimi they make. Don't be fooled with the small plates they bring out. It'll definitely fill you up and give you some space for their yummy dessert! Try their mochi ice cream! Or their tiramisu!

The best off strip sushi restaurant I've been too. Fresh fish and well prepared. Full of flavor and sushi melts in your mouth. 

Must try their flying fish and for desert a must have is green tea creme brulee. Will definitely come back.

Staff is very friendly and quick on their service.

There was a 45 min wait at an all you can eat sushi place nearby so I immediately went to yelp. This place had the highest ratings out of all the other places so we immediately headed there.

Three words, order ALL the tadas. We couldn't decide which was our favorite since all 6 tasted phenomenal. We also ordered the Cajun albacore cold plate, soft shell crab appetizer and twin dragon roll...all were AWESOME!

Our server recommended the green tea tiramisu and it did not disappoint. You definitely need to save stomach room for this. 

I don't think we can go back to the other sushi place. The quality of the fish was far better and the service was 10 times better...I know it's not really comparable since the other place is a high churn AYCE restaurant but since they are equidistant from our house, we will definitely keep coming to Soho from now on.

So we went in hungry and craving a variety of sushi rolls. Except we came in at 3:30pm and from 12-4pm they have a very limited lunch menu (which we didn't know about). So we were seriously on the verge of leaving, not because we were mad but because we just REALLY wanted sushi and didn't want to trouble them. But our waitress Sheila convinced us to stay and told us that she will request the Sushi chef to start the dinner menu early. We ended up getting the full dinner menu released to us about 30 minutes earlier, the service was great, and hands down the best Japanese dishes I've ever had. We ended up just getting one Specialty roll, but tried a variety of other things like: short rib plate, tuna tostada, sweet shrimp, oysters, and baked green mussels. Then the chef gave us a complimentary salmon dish with some kind of ponzu sauce and pop rocks.... soooo good! Sheila said the chef sent it out because we were being patient with them even though I felt like it was the other way around since they changed up their whole service routine for us. Needless to say, we'll be back... and we live in Henderson.

Finally got to try this place.  Unfortunately, I wasn't as crazy about this place as other reviewers.  I agree that the fish was good quality, a definite must for a sushi place.  

My biggest disappointment was the rice. Nice and sticky as rice should be, but it wasn't sushi rice.  Sushi rice should have a touch of vinegar, they just used plain white rice.  Guess this place would be a good place to have sashimi.

My wife and I went to SOHO for the first time to celebrate our anniversary and we arrived and got seated by 6:55pm Tuesday night (9/26/2017). The waitress (Patty) handed us the menu and mentioned it's still happy hours. After a minute looking at the happy hours menu,  we decided to ask the young sushi chef (Aaron) what he would recommend because we didn't really know the menu but want to take advantage of the happy hours (which we didn't know or expected from a highly rated restaurant). Aaron asked if we like sushi or sashimi more and we said Sashimi. He recommended a few and we ordered as recommended. Aaron said not to worry about the happy hours cut-off and take our time. His attitude was very cool and made us feel very welcoming. Aaron  prepared some awesome dishes for us and they were very good.

We invited Aaron to drink Sake with us and eventually got John & Oscar plus Patty to join us... it was like celebrating our anniversary with a bunch of close friends and we had such a fantastic time with them.

The bill came out to be much less than expected and I honestly thought they miscalculated because a sashimi dinner like what we just had and the many bottles of Sake we drank,  I was expecting 2x or 3x the amount.

Now the food: EXCELLENT QUALITY, INCREDIBLY TASTETY, AND BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED.

Hands down the best sushi experience we have ever had.

Thanks SOHO!

Tracy & James

Very good sushi!
4-7 is happy hour and sushi is $5 a roll. The service is very good too!!

No more Happy Hour. But that's okay, I still love it here. I haven't tried everything on the menu yet but I love everything I have tried.

I particularly like:
The yuzu yellowtail
Cajun albacore
Hyrdo bibb sea bass
White peach sake

The hydro bibb used to be black cod but honestly the sea bass tastes the same to me. (Though in my case I only eat here maybe twice a year while visiting.)

Other notes:
Small restaurant,  expect to wait during peak hours
Try the green tea tira misu when they have it in stock
Ladies room has two stalls, which is a nice surprise lol

Though Soho seems to be more of a $$$ restaurant than a $$ restaurant,  it's actually quite affordable for the quality of the sashimi you get. Ordering a roll will help fill you up. I think the white peach sake is a great deal, you are getting a small bottle of a strong yet sweet sake for only $9, which would normally get you one watered-down cocktail somewhere else.
Best sushi in town!!! Yellowtail sashimi was the best and other dishes. i ordered 2 greentea creme brule because it taste so goodd! The service was excellent, very quick. Five star for suree :)

The food is incredible, the fish is fresh, and the owner takes a lot of pride in the presentation and flavors of the food!  I recommend this place to everyone who likes sushi and Japanese dining.   However, the only challenge the restaurant had was splitting checks.  We had a party of 20, and their check splitting was very inefficient and confusing.  They had split the alcohol on a separate check and all additional orders made later on through the night on another check.  Needless to say it was frustrating. When taking a large party, have everyone bring cash.  This was the only complaint of the evening.   Otherwise, food, services, and atmosphere was excellent!

Delicious! We went for happy hour and there was so much to choose from! We ordered a bunch of different plates and shared it family style and it was more than enough for us! You can't beat the $5 happy hour. My only complaint was with the hostess. She was completely rude when we asked for a high chair for our child and she acted like it inconvenienced her.

OMG! I hate to write a review of this place because it's so good that I don't to ever have to wait for a table. It's rare that you see a 5 star rating  on yelp with a LOT of reviews, so we had to try this place and I'm proud to say they deserve it. The food is fabulous. What I love is that everything had it's own distinctive flavor. So often you go to a sushi place and they use the same sauce on everything. We went during happy hour and ordered just about everything on the happy hour menu. Needless to say we couldn't finish everything but we came close and it was under $50 for both of us. The service was the best I've ever experienced in any asian restaurant, you know how bad it can get. I will definitely go back next time i'm in vegas.

I had some dinner with my local friends and we decide to go on Japan restaurant we stop by the time happy hours the food is was excellent and great service compare between price and quality of food

Local: not far from the strip like 15-20min
Food: fresh and good taste 
Price: $$ reasonable
Reservation: Yes  (good for party)
Service: very friendly 
Parking: easy to parking

If you stop by in Las Vegas and looking for  Japanese food I would recommend you to come have it  and if I have to to come back I will totally stop have it again

* *if u plan to come on happy hours time line will be wait 15-30 min**  

T Saengsuwan

Love the menu, decor, service, food, and drinks. Compliments of the chef was a trout dish topped with pop rocks, such a fun combination, and delicious. Twin dragon specialty roll was also delicious, as was the lychee sake. Angelica made our first time incredible. I love when servers are engaging and describe each dish they place on the table. Thank you!

Impeccable food and service.   I was curious....5 Solid Star Rating for this place with 247 reviews?  I have never seen this before.  The sushi is really fresh, delicate pieces of Salmon, Yellowtail, Tuna and Shrimp that nearly melted in my mouth.  I read the review from a fellow yelper that recommended some Sashimi plates and I tried them all and it was incredible.  Wasabi creme Salmon, Seared Tuna, Ocean Trout and Yellowtail with Crispy Jalapeno slices.  All fantastic!  The Black Cod appetizer was the perfect start to this meal.  Perfect for kids too- they offer chicken with rice.   The service was quick and attentive the food outstanding.

This place is not on the Strip and though if you're in Vegas it's where you want to be, but with this kind of rating I had to check this place out.  It is amazing and worth the drive away from the crowds on the strip.  This place will be my go to spot next time in Vegas- without a doubt. 

Parking is easy- they have their own private lot.

My son said this place should be Michelin 3 star.i said I concur.  Loved all the foods, the specials, the sashimi platter was beautiful, happy hour dishes were amazing.  My reply, definitely. Food, presentation, service was all star worthy.  They just gotta up the decor of the restrooms n change the hand soap

Quality food!!! I relied on owners' recommendations with satisfying taste. I got my favorite 16 oz Asahi Dry with these tasty foods, and guess what?!  Oh...Oh...so good~ Have fun there!!! Best Japanese food not necessary comes only from Japanese.

One of the best places to go for sushi in my opinion. This place specializes in flavorful sashimi platters($11-13 per plate), which is something you must get if you're trying this place out! My friend and I got the salmon wasabi cream that had wasabi creme fraiche, roe, crispy shallots, and a yuzu soy dressing; the quality of the ingredients was wonderful and the salmon seemed to melt in your mouth. Then we also split a tuna box roll (which was delicious and unique) and a spicy tuna roll. However, the BEST PART of this entire experience was that our waitress came to us to ask if we wanted any dessert and when we said no, she gave us a complimentary green tea tiramisu anyways! It was so so so amazingly yummy! As some of these other reviews have stated, complimentary food giving is fairly common at this restaurant and I think that absolutely wonderful. It gives incentive for customers to go back frequently for that, the food, and the service.

4.5!!!!

I had been wanting to try Soho forever since the reviews look great but never really got around to it.. So when my gfffffff told me I definitely should try it out because she loved it, I dragged my mom there to grab an early dinner.. We actually came during Happy Hour so that was an added bonus! 

There was a about a 10 minute wait because a large party had just left so the tables had to be broken down..no biggie! But when we were sat it was almost like we were forgotten.. Our server ended up being Sheila who was just fantastic! She was so sweet and informative. Definitely suggest sitting in her section!

-HH Cold lychee sake - served in a nice sake glass.. Not too sweet and went down smooth.. I really liked how Sheila would refill my sake cup since that is not something that is practiced at all neighborhood sushi joints..
-HH Tostadas- the yellowtail, salmon and tuna ones were so good and fresh! The kimchi Tako one was a little on the salty side.
-HH Firecracker- I usually don't like deep fried rolls but this one was good and not oily!
-HH spicy tuna roll & salmon avocado roll.. Fish was fresh but the rice was a bit too sweet
-HH hydro bib black cod- 2 in one order.. My mom loved these.. Don't know if you're supposed to eat it like a lettuce wrap but that's what she did lol
-Ume scallop- so fresh and delicious with a little bit of yuzu, tobiko and salt... mmmmmM the cilantro goes perfect with it as well
-Yuzu Soy Yellowtail- at the end of the meal Sheila brought out this dish on the house since it was our first time and this is their signature dish (they did this for my gfffff too). The fish was good but it was way too cold almost like it was just defrosted.. I really appreciate them bringing out this dish for us and it says lots about their customer service! 

I will definitely be back! HH is awesome and their lunch specials look good too!

HOT TIP: if they don't give you a cool sushi pen at the end of your meal.. Ask for one!

This is my 4th time here and as much as I love the place,  this will be my first review of it.   I love their happy hour menu.   It's from 4pm to 6pm.  There is nothing that I have tried that I didn't like. ..i mean love.   And to top it off, service is excellent. They really know how to keep customers coming.   If there is anything I hope they do is to expand.  In other words,  i hope they open more locations. Keep up the excellent work SOHO!!!!

My first time here and I'm in love! We didn't know that happy hour went til 7 so it was a very pleasant surprise. We ordered 4 items off the happy hour menu: spicy tuna roll, salmon and avocado roll, a shrimp tempura roll and albacore sashimi. While these items all sound basic, they were anything but. They tasted so fresh and full of flavor. I actually loved the simplicity of the rolls because I am so sick of the typical sauce-drenched rolls masking their mediocrity behind pools of spicy mayo and dollops of eel sauce. In stark contrast, you could taste the fresh fish of each of these rolls, along with whatever crisp or tender veggie it was rolled with, and perfectly cooked rice served at just the right temperature as needed to taste the balance of the subtle rice vinegar. 

We sat at the sushi bar and watched the chefs create all of their masterpieces. It was mesmerizing. Even while there were extremely busy, they were always friendly and helpful and found time to check on us. The chef saw my friend give me a birthday card and they sent out some Mochi with a birthday candle and the whole restaurant sang happy birthday. It was the nicest thing ever! The food and the service were both amazing and this is now my new favorite spot. To top it off, because we made it for happy hour, our bill was unbelievably low.

1st time. One look at the diners at their tables upon entry gave it away - almost 80% Asian. Gotta be good, right? Well, yes, it is. Exceptional service - very friendly and helpful with ordering their specials. Dining with 3 others of divergent tastes, I observed a range of dishes suitable for any meal. My choices are tried & true - hamachi sashimi, something toro (tuna) and something tempura - along with edamame and sunumono. A real treat was the diaginjo sake - cool and smooth in 350ml bottles. Next time, green tea brulee for dessert. Carry on!
frickin awesome place.  Quality food.  Great service.  My faves: dragon roll, beef teriyaki, tuna "roll"...

I love this place..specially cause they have great happy hour selection even on Saturdays.  We had  spicy tuna rolls and spider rolls off their HH menu and did a sashimi platter and boy it was delicious. The service is always great cause we were confused with the selection of sashimi and thought they were all the same but the waiter was kind enough to explain and even gave us a complimentary tuna prepared and sliced differently that what was served to fully understand that they did not bamboozled us lol ..always a great time at this sushi place :)

After at least 5 visits in as many months, I decided now was the time to write an updated review.  The good news, is that this place is still deserving of a +++ 5 star rating.

a.  You have to really enjoy real Japanese food, seafood, and the infusion of subtle flavors in order to really reap the full benefits of this restaurant.  

b. The only other restaurant now that I would say is close to this would be Yonaka over on the west side.

c.  Here is what I have found to be extremely consistent:

- Value - The place is an amazing value for the quality of food and the uniqueness as well!  Previous to Soho and Yonaka, I would get my fill of really unique Japanese from Nobu. I would easily pay 150.00 plus per person and while having a very good meal, I would feel like I did not get any great value.  Here at Yonaka, the value is amazing. From Uni to Hamachi Kama to Hydro Bibb, the prices, value and the quality of food is spectacular!.  You can pay for four people about 150.00 including tip if there is no alcohol or dessert.

- Chef - Chef John Chien is absolutely creative, welcoming and passionate about his craft. He is extremely consistent, very adventurous and is involved in all aspects of his restaurant.  He will wave at you and make you feel at home. Who doesn't love going home.  There is no place like home!

- Food - Everyone has already posted all the different menu items, the choices, menu and etc.  All I can add is that I am always excited to come here.  I am looking forward to ordering the same things, new things and what is on special.  The same things seem to always be unique and better tasting than the last time.  The new things are always such a wonderful delight and the specials are always so darn creative.

d.  Groundhog Day - Do you remember this Bill Murray movie where he lives the same day over and over again?  My favorite quote from this movie is "I was in the Virgin Islands once. I met a girl. We ate lobster, drank pina coladas. At sunset, we made love like sea otters. That was a pretty good day. Why couldn't I get that day over and over and over."  If I had to live a day over, it would be dining at Soho every day.  It just gets better and better.

e. Quick hints - Always busy, off hours are going to be best, but still busy. 

GK says, go for it.

this is probably the best Japanese restaurant in town,,,we tried almost all their happy hours offerings and amazingly everything are excellent, everything is so fresh and the presentation is great, service is good too...we have the salmon & tuna tacos, cajun abacore sashimi, shrimp tempera roll, spicy tuna roll, miso marinated black cod..

I went with friends for Happy Hour. The menu has a lot to choose from including rolls, angus sliders, tempura green beans and cajun albacore for $5 each. Everything tasted great but the best thing on the menu were the roasted brussel sprouts. AMAZING! Great service, friendly staff, overall a great experience.

Arigat?

Stopped in on lunch to to feed my sushi craving. The ambiance is pretty nice on the inside and it was pretty packed (which is a good sign of great food) I ordered the Philadelphia Roll and can't quite remember the second roll however they were both extremely tiny and just okay nothing too spectacular. Don't think I'll be back considering the endless sushi options (not to mention I didn't even finish the second roll pictured...) but I guess it was worth it!

Eleventy bajillion stars, but Yelp only allows me to give a mere 5. To put this review in perspective, I was at Nobu (the flagship) last week. I spent an obscene amount of money there and had a fabulous meal. Soho is better - period. 

First - you will be welcomed genuinely. I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef chatted me up through the meal, as did the peeps next to me. This is a locals place in the best way. 

Second - value. From 5-7 M-F they have a great happy hour. Beer, sake, apps, some Sashimi plates are just $5. The regular prices are a BARGAIN people - I live in MKE and let me tell you, it's not a high roller sushi town (big surprise right?) but I would expect to pay at least 50% more. On the Strip? For this quality, you should pay triple! The sushi chef said they get people bitching about their prices and I have to be honest - what????? This is some top quality shit (aka Nobu) and amazing preparations.

Third - sashimi. Yes, please - all day. The chef specializes in it, and the cold sashimi dishes are where it's at. Started with Cajun albacore ($5 HH) which was wonderfully peppery, then salmon wasabi ($11) - a ton of lovely fish. After that - yellowtail (comp'd) - fucking amazing, then ocean cod w/pop rocks ($12) - must have, so creative! Finally - escolar carpaccio ($5 hh), and raw fish Italian style followed by one bite tuna tartare with gold leaf. Does that sound like a lot of raw fish? Too bad!! Don't judge me - I've been dreaming about a return to Soho for 2 years. Let me have my moment. My bill? For all this perfect fish + 2 sakes???? $46 - what?????????? I can't even - that is crazy. 

How this place doesn't have a line out the door and around the block, I don't know. I do know that many of the local chefs from the Strip get their sushi on here and you should too!

Delicious food, prompt, friendly, knowledgeable service. One of my new favorite spots! 

Good job elevating our local food scene.

Good quality & good taste!

Pros:
$5 happy hour menus that are pretty good quality
Happy hour alcohol menu too!
Sashimi was DELICIOUS. Very fresh and tasty for the price! So worth it!

Cons: 
It gets full during eating hours so reserve ahead
The tempura was a bit too oily

Overall taste was excellent 
Customer service is great too! 
Left pretty satisfied!

Quality of the fish and everything tasted just as good. But this time the service wasn't up to standard. Although the servers were nice, we've waited about 7 minutes for someone to come and take our drinks, had no refills throughout our meal while the restaurant wasn't even busy.

4 stars for the food but deduct 1 star for interior decor. I was hoping for a intimate setting.  Their oysters are excellent.  Fish was fresh but didn't wow me.  Shrimp tempura roll was BAD.  All I tasted was rice & avocado.  Most likely won't go back again since taxi ride from hotel was another $60 R/T.

Wow! This place has the very best customer service. Sheila was our sever and did an outstanding job. She convinced us to try the yellow tail shashimi, which is the best we've ever had. The fish is of the highest quality. Everything we had was delicious. This place far exceeded our expectations. The food and customer service are well worth the wait!

With all these five star reviews for Soho, I had to visit.  We went for lunch the very first time and let's just say I was not too thrilled about the whole experience.  It wasn't even worth writing a review in my opinion because lunch was boring.  I honestly had no intention of returning, but Soho's reviews just kept getting better and better.  This time, we made a point of coming for dinner because that's where all the unique offerings happened.  (Since our first visit, I think they do offer more of their exciting menu items during lunch time.)

The Lunch Experience:

The Husband got the Loco Moco Lunch Seto "Soho Blend Seasoned Hamburger Patty" ($8.50).  

* Sashimi Lunch Seto "Chef's Choice" ($8.50)

The lunch menus offered were disappointing and they didn't look that special either.  I went to check it out during its first month when all the rave reviews were happening. I was very disappointed, especially when only up the street is an awesome Japanese bento lunch special that I truly love.  

A few months go by and Soho is still blowing up, so we decide to give it a try and make sure that we make it over for dinner. The whole experience was a complete 180.  The dinner menu cannot compare to the lunch menu at all!  Lunch is a 2-3 experience and dinner is a 4-5 experience.

The Dinner Experience: 
We ordered mostly from the Special Cold Dishes and what a treat they were.  Yum  yum.  

The owner was about to come to our table during our first visit, but a bunch of his former colleagues all walked in and he never had a chance to return.  This time he chatted with us and sent over a comped dish and just made the effort on building a more personal experience and customer base.  I really appreciate the effort.

I think their lunch offerings have since changed and they are allowing you to order other things besides their basic lunch menu.  Thank goodness.  Would hate for people to judge this place based on their original lunch menu. Bleh.

These are the yummy dishes we ordered: 
* Salmon Wasabi Creme ($11)
* Yellowtail Yuzu Soy ($12)
* Ume Scallop ($12)
* Miso Marinated Black Cod ($18)
* Sea Urchin Sashimi ($9)
* Spicy Salmon Handroll ($4)
* White Fish Shiso Pesto Tostada ($2)
* Wild Saba
* Hamachi Salsa Verde Tostada ($2)
and two other specials that I can't remember the name of but it looked and tasted awesome.

Presentation is definitely something to write home about and everything tasted fresh.  It was just a really great experience coming for dinner. We definitely plan on going there again during dinner time!

I took my 9 year old daughter to Soho last month and had an excellent time.  She had never eaten sushi and  wanted to try it so we went there because it is close and had good reviews on Yelp.  The staff greeted us immediately and were very friendly.  Our waiter was great at helping us make our selections and the Chef came out to visit with my daughter personally.  They brought her up to the counter and let her watch as he made a special roll just for her.  The food was excellent but the staff, environment and Chef provided an experience my daughter and I will never forget.  I will definitely be back.

Each year in January, it's become a tradition with a group of about ten of us, to eat Omakase at Soho. This is now the third year and it's always been the best meal I eat all year! The dishes the chefs prepare are never dishes I'd select if the choice was up to me and I'm always amazed at how delicious each one is.

We always go in with a budget of around $50 each and there's always food left over at the end of the numerous courses brought out. I documented each course this year with a photo, because hey, the camera eats first! 

I'll be sure to post the images shortly to the restaurant photos, if you're interested in seeing them. I'm from the Dallas/Fort Worth area and travel quite a bit. Omakase at Soho in Vegas is the best Sushi I've ever had, bar none. I salute you Soho, keep up the awesome!

Very disappointing, it was not bad, just not very good.
Had lot's off dishes non where exceptional. This does not deserve a 5 star, more like a 3.5 to 4 stars at the most.

This place is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant ever!! The sushi chefs are all so nice and make it seem like cheers when you enter. I'm always trying new dishes per their recommendations. Happy hour is always a good time to go but I love the dinner menu too! Thank you Soho for being awesome!!!!
Delicious, good service and great presentation. We were shocked and didn't expect that. Fresh sashimi and oysters!

I'm not a huge sushi fan but I do enjoy sushi from time to time. This place was pretty great. The fish was really fresh and the sauces were light and not overpowering. The chef visited our table and even sent some complimentary dishes. I'd recommend soho sushi.

Wanted some sushi while in vegas so we decided to try this place since it has such good reviews. Was not dissapointed.

-The food is fresh, incredibly tasty, and reasonably priced.

-Staff is friendly, funny and very attentive.

10/10 definitely go here!

Two words: Pop Rocks! What an overall EXCELLENT and DELICIOUS experience! Best sushi in Vegas, HANDS DOWN!! The service and food were BOTH top notch! Hats off to the Chef and team!! AMAZING ambiance, service and food. I cannot stop raving about this place!

Soho has phenomenal food and service is never lacking.

Get these dishes:
Yellowtail Yuzu with soy
Ocean Trout with pop rock
Seabass with miso glaze
Ahi Tuna Tostada ---- Get this!!! $1 during Happy Hour
Too many amazing dishes to list here.

Try SOHO out, you won't be disappointed.

Where do I begin....its hard to find a starting point when everything was delicious and soothing. When we first got here, we expected great things from this place. It has over a thousand reviews and almost a perfect five star rating. Boy!!!!the food lived up to the expectation. 

We gathered here for our new friends December birthdays. Yes, it was plural. the group was pretty much the size of the entire restaurant. It is always great when you walk into a restaurant and people great you with a smile and open arms. Now, was this the staff or the new friends? 

The menu for the specialties are different but great!!!There was soooo much food on the table that it was hard to pick a favorite. Just go into the restaurant blindly and pick and point in the section of specialties and say...that one. You cannot go wrong with any. Plus, the portions are well portioned enough to feed at least two people. Everything you eat almost just melts in your mouth. It has that soothing feeling..."broke da mouth" type of feeling. Its like I need a cast after one bite. 

I would honestly come back over and over again to try almost everything on the menu.

Don't ask me how I found this place. It's in a residential place of Las Vegas. 

Randomly say down with some friends of mine that had been recommended this place and we came and sat at the sushi bar. The owner?? (Chef John) served us and we started with the sampler platter and worked our way down the menu. We had uni, Tuna Takaki salad, cucumber salad and just about everything else and ended with fresh mochi and a green tea Cree brûlée. Right??  

I'll just make a long story short. After driving 8 hours, being 9:00 at night it was the perfect way to end a great day. 

Find your way here and you won't regret it...and ask for Chef John if you really want VIP service. If you speak Taiwanese  you might even get a break on dessert :)

I have to agree with the other reviews and say, great place for a fusion take on sushi, but def not as cheap as you'd think. 

For instance, the HH menu seems reasonable bc everything is 3-6$, but for what you get, a bit pricey. 

I.e., 
-Sashimi tostadas are a dollar, each. the hamachi salsa verde tostada was delightful, interesting flavors, freshness of fish was average. 
- Black cod lettuce cups are 4, for two cups, which are basically a bite each with a piece of cod the size of an eraser.  I'm used to tender, buttery whitefish at home (chiliean sea bass, cod, etc), so I wasn't super impressed. Tasted for the most part-- salty. 

I'd def go for the cold sashimi plates, the waitress said it was their specialty.  The cajun albacore was fresh and tasty, not super pricey, but not a great value either $12. (see pic) 

** I have yet to try the typical sashimi fishes, so I can't comment on the freshness of fish** 

Can't vouch for any rolls except their spicy tuna roll ($4), and was pretty disappointed, flavorless and super mushy.  

Uni was tasty. not super well versed, but it was 12$ for 4 pieces of the Santa Barbara Uni Sashimi. (cheapest type)


The service was super, you could ask anything there to help you out, and they were laid back and not in your face.  

Overall, interesting flavors, not a super great value, decently fresh fish, but perhaps not for the sushi purist.

An absolute pleasure; the food quality , the service , the value  and the atmosphere !!! This place is a must for any sushi lover. $35 for Mixed Sashimi; 8 different sushi delights!!! The yellowtail collar is massive for $15!!! Kelson was an amazing sever, very knowledgeable, patient and kind. Thanks for your great service and hospitality and unforgettable experience!!! Shelia we loved your positivity, passion and energy. This place is a true reflection of excellence and pursuit of  perfection!!!

This week was all about reconnecting with friends. Tonight a few of us decided to take a drive and visit Soho as we've heard some amazing things! So good, I noticed they had an average of 5 stars with over 250 reviews! WOW! That's amazing. I'm always up for new places, especially ones with amazing reputations. What I didn't realize was how amazing this place was going to be!

This restaurant is located on the Southwest side Las Vegas in an up and coming area. New homes and business are opening every single month. Soho is located in a strip mall a couple of blocks south of the 215. Once you enter, you'll notice a very small location. A few tables in the main dining room and a sushi bar around the corner. The prominent color in this joint is red, but not an obnoxious shade, more of a warmer color. From the chopsticks to the seats, to the service, this place really takes the time to focus on their customers. Our server tonight was Sheila. She was definitely on point. Super personable, super accommodating and very efficient. By the time we were finished with our meals, I felt like I was hanging out with a friend. I really enjoyed her as a server! This place truly takes pride in their service as well as their food. Here's what we had tonight and here's what I thought:

Yellowtail Yuzu Soy for $12: Sheila said this was their signature dish so we just had to try it! Sliced Yellowtail sashimi topped with tempura serrano peppers, garlic dust and micro cilantro over a bed of Ponzu sauce and garlic oil. WHAT AN AMAZING DISH! The sashimi was super fresh, the serrano, dust and cilantro brought a  clean crisp taste and texture to the raw fish and the oil and sauce enhanced the overall flavor. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this dish!

Mixed Sashimi (15 pc.) Special for $25: One of my friends tonight recommended this  dish to share. I'm so glad she did! This huge dish came with various cuts of sashimi: Tuna, salmon, 2 kinds of snapper, yellowtail and scallops. Each cut was super fresh and not accompanied with a super fishy smell. The garnish made the plate super easy on the eye, but the food solidified it's beauty. Definitely a must try!

Tuna Box Sushi for $12: This was a cool roll! Tuna, Spicy Mayo, avocado, shrimp and rice crackers all formed into a box shape. The flavor was insane! First, I'm going to keep reiterating the fact that the proteins are so fresh! What I really liked was the crunch from the rice cracker balls. The crunchiness really brought a nice texture to the overall roll.  You have got to try this one!

Spicy Salmon roll for $6: So good, we ordered 6 of them! Spicy salmon, avocado, cucumber in a roll. What stood out was that there was a lot of salmon in this roll! Definitely worth the price and the salmon had a really good flavor to it. I loved it!

Man, I'm so glad I was able to try this place. It's become such a huge favorite spot within the Yelp community and I can definitely see why! Our party was really treated with the most respect and I truly appreciated it. Reviewing a place involves your opinion in multiple areas including, but certainly not limited to, the atmosphere, the service and the food. In other words, the entire experience and let me tell you, Soho has exceeded my experience expectations. Thanks so much, Sheila and the rest of the gang at Soho!

Yes, my family, friends and I are regulars here. The service is stellar, the food is amazing and if it isn't on the menu, just ask and they will accommodate your high maintenance needs with a smile. See you at Soho!

My favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas. From their rolls, to sashimi, to sake, to angus gyoza, to their cute sushi nigiri pens!

They're located super close to my house in the SW next to scoop boba&ice cream.

The service here is always on point. They never forget my order and bring out my food in a timely manner. Servers are always attentive and fun! The restaurant is very clean and modern/upscale. I always want to dress up to eat here because it's so pretty in here!

Their prices are super reasonable for ala kart. My favorite is their appetizers and sashimi. Their cuts of fish are sooooooo fresh it's unbelievable. 

Thanks SOHO for keeping my stomach full and my wallet happy!

Sushi is unbelievably fresh and presented so beautifully!   The price is a steal for the quality and quantity of the seafood.  The chefs and wait staff are beyond friendly and helpful.  I cannot recommend Soho enough.  This restaurant is one of the best I've been to.  Get your ass down here!

Best deal in Vegas. The price, the food, excellent experience with the waiters and got to meet the chef personally!

My boyfriend wanted to get sushi as we had a huge dinner the other night at Sushisamba (review upcoming). I start looking for sushi restaurants in LV and Soho comes up. My boyfriend checks it out and says "nah this doesn't look like sushi, look at the pictures". The pictures were showing a lot of rolls and I had already decided that I wanted the rib (somehow I was pretty hungry even after the big meal) as it had great reviews. Also, the pictures could be deceiving as they have changed their menu slightly, so the pictures of the menu here are outdated. We decided not to go there as he wasn't that hungry. To be honest, even though I love rolls, I prefer sashimi or sushi, way less filling and delicious. Previously we had gone to an AYCE sushi place where we learned that they didn't serve sashimi and they complained when we left some rice. 

Anyways, he was not that hungry to try another AYCE given that they never offered sashimi and we waited. I was starving so eventually he felt sorry for me and we drove to Soho. As soon as we were parking we noticed the amazing lunch deal: $8.50!!! We had to check that out. 

We went inside, were seated and the waiter asked us how we found the place. I said Yelp and he said "well the food reviews are always on point, the service has been up and down but we'll try the best". I liked his honesty. We were given the lunch menus and one dinner menu. We both ordered the sashimi lunch which was 7 pieces of nigiri plus a bowl of rice, salad and miso soup. I ordered the ribs ($19) from the dinner menu (the one that is here is outdated) and waited.

The lunch boxes came first. I really have to say that this is the best sashimi lunch I have eaten EVER. First, the price was only $8.50, second, the pieces were big. And I mean big, I was pleasantly surprised. Many people think that you can not get full from sashimi lunches because it is only fish but trust me, you can.

As for the rib, it was delicious as well. It fell off the bone, the sauce was good, the potatoes great, everything awesome. 

As soon as we were done with the food, the chef approached our table and introduced himself saying how pleased he was that we ordered the sashimi and the rib. He then asked us if we were full. We said yes (because we were). He then asked again that if he were to send us something, we would eat it. Of course we said YES!. A couple minutes later, the waitress brought us a plate from the chef. He sent us a couple pieces of Yellowtail Yuzu Soy which she said was their #1 dish. The pieces were delicious. 

As for the service, it was great. The waiter that seated us said he had to go and pointed us to the girl who would be taking care of us from then on. 

Really great and surprisingly affordable lunch!

I went here with my family for lunch after my dad's friend recommended this place and I can see why. The staff here are extremely friendly and welcoming. The chef even came by our table to welcome us and thank us for coming =) 

A few things we ordered were the soft shell crab roll, shrimp tempura roll, california roll, short ribs and the seared tuna and they were all AMAZING. The sushi here is so fresh and hand made by the chef himself. The short ribs were extremely tender and mouth watering. You didn't need a knife to cut them because it was easy to tear apart.

Aside from what we ordered, the chef actually gave us yellowtail sashimi on the house!!! It was such a nice gesture and it tasted fantastic!

The only downside to our visit was the main chef was not there because he was on vacation so we were not given the whole menu, BUT that's okay because I'm sure my family and I will come back again :D

How does some place like this have a 5 star AVERAGE? I came in thinking that it definitely inflated as there isn't really anything else like in in the area. I left feeling pleasant after a good meal so while it may be inflated, I am a believer that the food is good.

We were in the neighborhood and decided to come by for lunch. 

The fiance and I share a few plates - 

Beef teriyaki set lunch - I like that they use sliced steak for this and not thin shaved meat. It's much better quality than most offer. It comes with a mix green salad (not just iceburg), miso, pickled cucumbers and rice which were standard, but solid. 

Spicy tuna roll - just wanted something simple and this filled the request. It was cut and made well. 

Soho -tadas get a lot of buzz so we both got a yellowtail one. This was yummy, I enjoyed the avocado cream on it. 

Compliments of the chef we got yellowtail yuzu which was great quality fish and I enjoyed the texture of the fried jalapenos and use of coarse finishing salt on it. 

So based on the food, they are an above average Japanese food spot, but what really stood out for me was the service! Our drinks were topped off in such a intuitively quick manner which was appreciated on this hot summer afternoon. Both guys checking on our table were friendly to boot and was personable cracking jokes with us. The chef/owner came out to check on everyone which I always feel is a nice touch  and he seemed genuinely humble. 

On a second visit it was raining and our server (guy with longish hair and glasses) took his apron off and covered customers and walked them to their car. That is a absolute gentleman going above and I really respect that. 

I am enamored with the friendly staff and enjoyed my lunch both occassions that I most definitely will be back when I'm in the area to see more of what this place has to offer.

Superb! Excellent food and service everytime!

Been going here quite a few times even before they had the happy hour menu. Every visit so far was great. Food is always on point! 

During happy hour I normally order my favs which are, salmon carpaccio, beef tataki, angus sliders and truffle fries. 

Never a disappointment with each visit, that's how it should be. I only leave reviews after I've eaten to a restaurant quite a few times and SOHO is definitely one of those fav restaurant.

Their fish taste fresh as fresh! Lol amongst all though, I love the salmon carpaccio and amberjack with apple. 

Tip:
When you sit by the bar they give you little treats or surprises for you to try. Well at least when we sat by the bar for the 1st time, one of the chefs let us try 2 complimentary dishes! Wonderful!

Thanks guys! Keep it up!

Great place. Very friendly staff, great prices, the sashimi and nigiri tasted fresh and delicious. We got the sashimi bento and was blown away by the portion. Only weird thing was the way they prepare hand rolls, but everything else more than made up for it.

First timers.  Excellent food, service and price!  I would have given 5 stars but the rice on the rolls was a bit soggy.  I'm hoping the owner reads this and fixes the consistency of the rice because it was a bit mushy.  All the other components, flavors and creativity were spot on.

The Soho is legit!   If we lived in Las Vegas, we would definitely come here monthly if not weekly.

Definitely got to go with the Volcano and Nutter Pillar.
Try the cod. Wow. It is amazing delicious and prepared incredibly healthy.  Everything was wonderful.  Service prompt

Their happy hour which lasts until 7 is amazing! I usually work until 6 so a late happy hour that is also delicious is hard to find. Their escolar carpaccio, cajun albacore sashimi and brussel sprouts are to die for!  Quality is good and consistent. Their servers are so nice and attentive. Everything on the menu is great!
This is my favorite sushi burrito place. Food is fresh and staff is friendly. I like the soy paper wrap. They have a good selection of toppings to add in as well.

As many stars that this restaurant in such a short time. Do I really need to write a review? I mean. I would rather keep this restaurant in my secret company of secret restaurant that I only frequented right? Wrong. They deserved every exposure they get. Why??

Because they are worth it. Superb service, great chef/ owner. Great Happy Hour. But most of all great food. To have a great restaurant, you have a great food. And this restaurant is a true epitome of a restaurant that knows what they are doing. Me and my wife try all their happy hour menu and absolutely adore their miso black cod.

Nobu have one of the best Miso black cod in the city but for the price they are asking, I rather hit SOHO. I shall see you again soon SOHO!!!

If I was blindfolded, I would swear that I was eating at Nobu. Let me tell you something, Soho isn't just better. It is the BEST. Foreal foreal. 

One thing you should know about me is that I absolutely love miso marinated black cod! Soho does an excellent version of this and you cannot beat the price! ($18)

Some of my faves: 
-Miso marinated black cod
-Yellowtail yuzu 
-Salmon w/ cream something
-Tuna tadas 
-Salmon tadas

These are just OK:
-Twin dragon roll - Alaskan crab, shrimp tempura. Sounds exciting. It wasn't all that jazz. I'm not really a "roll" type. ($15)
-Rock shrimp tempura - Comes with three sauces. Two of which are useless. Go with the banana sauce. Trust me. ($9)
-Nigerian prawn - This one of the specials. It was just a single, but large prawn. Hard to eat. Knife and fork style. Flavors weren't mind blowing either. Next!

Pinch me, I must be dreaming, maybe I am considering that I am writing this at 4 in the morning, but...there is happy hour from 4-6 PM? Where was my invite? *Ahem* $1 tadas? Dolla dolla bill y'all. I'm there. 

Hands down, best non-AYCE sushi spot! It's all about quality, quality, quality and decent pricing. Love it!

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 20/100***

FINALLY I get to cross off Soho from my bookmarked places. Got off work early on Friday and with no solid dinner plans, I told my husband I wanted to try Soho's HH. It lived up to the hype, the service and quality of food was top notch. Our server Julie was very knowledgeable, giving us the background of the place, its specialties and dishes and Chef John. Although I've read here on Yelp most of the info that she's given, it was very much appreciated that she took the time to go above and beyond. 

The dishes that we tried were deliciously satisfying and melt in your mouth goodness, it's nice to know you can go to a place and have 5 star quality without the price. We ordered all the tadas and of which I liked the tuna and octopus the most. The firecracker roll was a favorite as well but the star was definitely the yellow tail sashimi with yuzu soy that Chef John sent for us to try, it was so fresh and flavorful and melted like butter. I wanted to order more but I was stuffed and wanted to save room for dessert. We got the green tea tiramisu and green tea crème brulee, both heavenly but the crème brulee stole my heart. No doubt we will be back to try everything else on their menu. Kudos to Chef John and staff for doing such a great job!

I came here from out of town on a whim and a 5 star rec from yelp.  It delivered! No joke some of the best fish and creative dishes I've ever had. And dont skip the dessert either.  I never write reviews but I want this place to stay in business so  I can come back again and again. Its worth the $25 cab ride from the strip.  The owner john was also very humble and nice. He personally checked on our table more than once.

I came here during Happy Hour. Ingredients were fresh and everything was well made.  I've tried just about everything on the Happy Hour Menu. The dishes that stood out to me were the yellowtail in yuzu sauce, soho egg rolls, and the tostadas. The staff was friendly and attentive. I'd definitely come back.

Japanese restaurant, Chinese chef.  Vegas style.  

Imagine Nobu Matsuhisa in a food truck.  Less refined, pseudo Argentinean Japanese that taste great at a great price.

Small selection of relatively fresh, everyday seafood.  The sushi, AYCE quality (this is not an AYCE restaurant).  Average quality seasoned rice wrapped unevenly around massive amounts of filing or compacted to a brick in a mold and topped with this or that then heavily sauced.  Far from what a sushi master would make but the flavors are good.

Two standout "raw" fish dishes, the yellowtail and the white fish.  The first drowned in a yuzu soy, drizzled with garlic oil and topped with jalapeños and micro cilantro; the second drowned in a wasabi shiso vinaigrette and dusted with dry red miso powder.  Both rapidly cook in the acid and take on a ceviche texture but the flavors are solid.

Also noteworthy, the assortment of taro tostadas  Hamachi with salsa verde, salmon with pico de gallo, and Hawaiian style poke (no there are no pineapples in this) all crowned by an avocado cream and cilantro.  A great bite.

Nobuesque tempura (rock shrimp, king crab, assorted veg and shrimp), all not oily but over battered, masking the flavor what's inside but all work with the non traditional dipping sauces ie miso, yuzu aioli..

Finally the soy braised short rib with wasabi.  Well braised and glazed.  The wasabi cream compliments the earthy soy and cuts the richness of the dish.  Excellent.

Friendly, off Strip service.  Casual decor.  UNBELIEVABLE VALUE at around $20pp.

It's not authentic but it's all Vegas baby.

Great food, the Kobe beef special was some of the best I have ever had. The sushi was very good, and a adequate amount of wine, saki, and beers. They don't take reservations for parties less than 6, even though Yelp says 4. Waited over 30 mins in a small cramped space. If was a Saturday night, but the food made it worth it.

This is the best sushi I've eaten off the strip!!!!!!

I've been there a couple of times and they never cease to amaze me!!
The way they season the fresh fish is incredible and with the diversity of savory flavors, it's enough to make my mouth water.

I love going during happy hour and trying there extensive menu.
It's cheaper that way for me because I like to try everything. 

The staff provide great customer service!!
The chef/owner greets the customers and makes sure we are having a pleasant experience. Very reasonable prices.

Highly recommend!!

If I could give it no star I would. This place is called Soho Japanese Restaurant but it should really be called HELLLLLL TO THE NOHO!

First off the host never greeted us she told us she'll be with us in 5 minutes. She took about 30 minuets to seat us and seated people that came much later than us first. 

I rarely write reviews but I don't think this place deserve 4.5 stars. Either people around the area never had real sushi or they just don't know what good quality or fresh fish is suppose to taste like! 

The food was overpriced for the quality. Even the services couldn't make up for the horrible food. My friend took her family and myself out for dinner when I came to visit and we order a lot of food and they would first take forever to bring out the food and bring it out one at a time. By the time we were ready to leave they were still bring out our food. The only highlight of this experience was the sushi pen when your signing the bill.

The food was OK nothing memorable IMO. We ordered almost all the rolls except the veggie roll... there was this bento box type thing that was a good deal bc it came with soup, salad, and a meat, sashimi, or chicken depending on what you ordered but nothing great. I'd maybe come back if my friends wanted to but I probably wouldn't crave this place.

2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge 81/100

Went on a Thursday at 4pm, for Happy Hour, it was not busy at all. Fantastic hour hour specials! $1 Tadas. $5 menu - sushi rolls, sake, & more. My fave was the Firecracker roll, Fried mushrooms, Cajun Albacore Sashimi. All great for sharing! We almost got everything on the happy hour menu. Great service too. Not a fan of some of the tadas. Will be back to try the dinner menu!

Fantastic! I've been here twice now with different people. One large party and then again with my dad. Everyone I've been with were first timers and we all loved it. The quality, creativity and service were superb! The hand rolls and cut rolls were awesome and the hamachi was larger than normal and delicious!

Friendly, knowledgeable service. Food came out very quickly, and they also gave us a really delicious sample of yellowtail in ponzu sauce. Came for the happy hour which was an awesome deal. Tried salmon ceviche, mixed ceviche, Angus tataki, escolar , Cajun albacore sashimi, salmon and avocado roll, and a spicy tuna roll. They were ALL delicious. You seriously cannot go wrong here with the sushi items!

Sorry Soho. When I came here again, I faced disappointment, which really sucked because my husband and I loved this place. We came the second time and sadly will not be reuturning. We ordered the more expensive sashimi platter, and somehow we got less fish than the last time whe we ordered the less expensive platter. Not only the quantity of the fish, but the quality of the fish went down too even though we paid more this time. We got albacore on the more expensive sashimi platter, and honestly albacore is definitely not my favorite fish and I usually see albacore on standard combinations not special ones. Last time we ordered, we got salmon belly and ocean trout! How come with the more expensive one we got even less premium fishes? We had also ordered the salmon ceviche which tasted just okay even though last time I came the ceviche was my favorite part of the meal! And this is not the biggest deal, but I asked what the market price was for the sweet shrimp, and the server didn't know and gave me a random number, but it ended up being more expensive than he said and he never came to let us know he gave us incorrect information. The reason for the downfall in this updated review is mostly due to the disappointment of the sashimi platter, the food just tasting average, and the time I felt was not used wisely since I had such a high expectation. I will not be back. I am sorry.

Hands down, one of the best sushi joints off strip to eat a la carte!!! The owner, John, is very friendly and personable. The uni is so fresh, it taste like the sweet ocean! The yellowtail Yuzu is also a must try. The crunchiness of the fried jalapeños goes so well with the ponzu and yellowtail itself. The tostadas are also delicious! Everything I've tried are amazing. Nothing was disappointing!!

Loved this place.  Gets busy in a hurry but is worth the wait.  Staff was great.  We really like everything about this place.  We had to wait about 45 min and they were bringing us appetizers for waiting.

Excellent lunch value!

I went with the Sashimi ($8.50 Lunch): which includes rice, miso and house salad. Fresh fish and good value during lunch!  There were about 8 pieces here, with great QUALITY fish to boot.

Eva tried the Salmon Teriyaki ($8.50 Lunch): Includes rice, miso and house salad. Good flavor and good value here!

The house salad was good!  Comes with the lunch specials, and I think a yuzu dressing if I remember correctly...ate up every bite!  The miso soup was just ok.

We supplemented our lunch with the Yellowtail Sashimi ($10): Tempura Jalapeno, Micro Cilantro, Garlic Oil & Yuzu Soy. This was very good, fresh, and tasted great with the slight citrus flavor from the yuzu. Recommended!

Also tried the Ocean Trout....outstanding! Had micro pop rocks for a fun consistency, and the yuzu soy really works well with this fatty / buttery fish. Highly recommended!!  I'd come back JUST for this dish!

Go during lunch for some very reasonable prices on some of the better quality sushi I've had in town :)

I rarely give 5 star reviews but soho sushi deserves it from their customer service and the chefs attention to detail to accentuate the flavor of the fish he's preparing. I was
Blown away by the customer service and quality of the fish and food. We were here for my girlfriends bday. We ordered the cold plates...tuna tataki and yellow tail even the fried broccoli. It was so good that we ordered multiple servings. The waitress Sheila recommend great dishes and we devoured them. We saw that they served uni and we asked to order one to try it. We were torn between the Catalina uni and the Japanese uni. We were told that they had different flavor notes. We ended up with the Catalina uni and they even threw in the Japanese uni on the house for us to try. Amazing! The chef also walked us out sea trout sashimi on the house for us since we were celebrating a birthday. And even threw in peach sake. My experience here was unforgettable! I will be recommending this place to everyone and will be looking forward to coming back. Oh and they use real Alaskan crab in their sushi. Not that imitation crap....best sushi I've ever had. PERIOD!

Julie was our waitress and she was stellar! Her suggestions for what we should order did not disappoint. We loved all the dishes that we ordered in the first round so much so that we ended up ordering three rounds of dishes!! If our stomachs could fit anymore food we probably would have ended up ordering at least one of everything on the menu.

What we loved about the food at Soho was that it was prepared well, not overly done with sauce and garnishes, and the most important part was that all the ingredients were fresh! 

Another reason why we liked this restaurant was because it's super low key and relaxed but the food is something you would expect on the Strip in a fancy overpriced restaurant! The restaurant itself is not super fancy either, it's located in a stripmall next to an ice cream/boba place (which is also really good too). The restaurant is nice and clean. We came during lunch, midweek so we were able to get a table without any wait. We even enjoyed their selection of music playing in the background, stuff you'd listen to while hanging with your friends on a weekend. 

All the staff was very nice and well versed in their menu. 

Here's what we enjoyed: *All sashimi was super fresh!
-Golden Ocean Trout sashimi: suggested by Julie, it was our first time trying this, which is pretty crazy because I love sashimi and feel like I've tried it all. This was awesome!
-The Hamachi appetizer: I'm usually not a big fan of Yuzu but it definitely was not overpowering in the sauce
-Fresh Scallops dish
-Crispy Broccoli: One of our favorite dishes, so simple but executed well. We had to order this twice because it didn't stand a chance the first time
-Miso bass: wish the portion was a bit larger because it was so good. We asked Julie beforehand and she let us know what to expect, that's why we ordered another dish. The fish was so tender and the miso was not overly sweet like some places can prepare it.
-Short Rib: also super tender, the meat came right off of the bone. 
-Dozen Fresh oysters: also prepared well, shucked nicely with a complimentary light drizzle of sauce on top

If we lived in the area we would definitely frequent this restaurant for sure. I had to give this place 5 stars because of it's overall value and quality. 

Restrooms: Separate restrooms for men and women. Clean and stocked.

Absolutely amazing. Salmon tostadas, Tuna tostadas and Black Cod are fantastic. Food is fresh, flavorful and carefully presented. The owner is a real gentleman and true craftsman. We dine here several time a week. What a find!

While on a business trip to Vegas, some of my coworkers told me about this place and asked me to join them.  They had been once and loved it so much, they were going back again!  I have to say, I visited SoHo three times while on my trip!   It was that good!

Each time we went, we did enjoy their 'happy hour' sushi specials.  Each of us ordered three specials as well as some saki and we were able to be full and happy for under $25!   

The Decor is modern asian and really was nice.  It was clean and the staff looked happy to be there.  Once seated, our server explained the specials and we all ordered from that menu.  The items started coming out only after a few min.  They all don't come at the same time which was fine since we started to run out of space on the table!  

Everything was fresh and tasted great!  The presentation of each dish was also great.  It has to be one of the best sushi place I have ever been too.  I don't say that lightly either.  My fellow co workers also felt the same way.  

The server was so nice and asked who we were and our what were our names.  When we were done and walking out the door, the entire staff behind the sushi bar said good bye and thanked us for coming in!  The next two times we came back in, they greeted us by our names!  The service was the best.  

Atmosphere = 9

Service = 10

Food = 10

When you combine great food with wonderful service, you get a top notch place to come back to over and over again.  I only wish they had one in Orlando!  Enjoy!!!
Excellent establishment. Quality and care go into every dish. Creativity is high. Fresh fish great prices. The lunch special is the best in town. Highly recommended.

Sushi at Soho's is geared to attract a crowd of hungry sushi lovers. I stopped in and found the place was packed with fish lovers like me. The place was illuminated by flame-less candles, while some of my favorite hit songs played above my table.  

I got the Dynamite Roll which was Deep-fried roll filled with chopped smoked salmon & shrimp, jalapeno slices, cream cheese, and sriracha sauce. Topped with eel sauce and spicy mayo. If you like hot and spicy food, this be it!! My nose started running from the heat! 

The Angry Dragon Roll had Shrimp tempura and cucumber inside, eel, avocado, spicy mayonnaise and eel sauce on top. Another prefect amount of flavors and spice. 

For dessert, I had Mochi ice cream. If you do not know what that is, it is a small, round dessert ball consisting of a soft, pounded sticky rice cake on the outside and an ice cream filling on the inside.

Popular flavors are green tea, peach strawberry, so I got all of those!

Please check out this restaurant if you love sushi. The reviews aren't lying. It has amazing food

After stopping by this place three times, I think it is a fair time to write a review and I have one thing to say: Everything here is consistently delicious! The food here is always fresh and beautifully prepared. Chef John is amazing and makes wonderful sushi/sashimi, not to mention that he is super nice.
