He ended up giving us platter of free salmon sashimi after finding out that I am a big fan of salmon! The servers here are also friendly despite being such a busy restaurant. Definitely my favorite sushi restaurant from here on out. 

I highly recommend everyone to try their sashimi; I have never tasted more fresh and delicious sashimi in town. So far I have tried the Salmon Wasabi, Yellowtail Yuzu, and Garlic Seared White Fish --- all wonderful. I'm now making my way to try every sashimi offered on the menu (and special menu)!

All I'm going to say is this was a top ten experience in my life...I appreciate the fact that the owner is very passionate about his quality of food..ive never said this in a review but thank you for the awesome and memorable experience..and thank you for being walking distance from where I live
This is my favorite sushi restaurant in town. Quality of the food is superb and service is excellent. It's not AYCE but it's worth it. Definitely the best non AYCE sushi restaurant in town.
Visiting from LA and WoW incredible... I own a restaurant and recommend this place for your next visit. Owner came out and introduced himself... Awesome awesome awesome...

One of my top happy hour spots in Vegas hands down! The service was great the servers and chefs are nice! Everything we ordered was very tasty and fresh. The drinks were cheap too! Great place for happy hour I would highly recommend it. Happy hour is from 5-7pm and all the items are only 5 bucks each and the portions are fair.
Amazing! ! Deserves every star! The food is truly delicious. Every single recommendation was fabulous.

We were not disappointed by Soho House. We went for dinner one night, and take-out for lunch a couple of days later. The seared Wagyu beef was awesome. The Kumamoto oysters were very fairly priced ($3 each!) and yummy as they should be. The service was great - attentive but not overbearing.  And that braised short rib... definitely drool-worthy.  Really really good.

For take-out, we ordered 4 of their lunch specials: salmon teriyaki, steak teriyaki, Soho loco and tonkatsu (each lunch special was under $9!). The steak teriyaki was definitely one of the best. Typically, the meat most restaurants use for the steak teriyaki tend to be tough/chewy/stringy, but Soho's was great. Could have cut through it with a spoon. My husband had the tonkatsu, which came with a curry sauce and he ate it, even though he's not normally a fan of curry. The Soho loco was.. different. Instead of brown gravy, it came with a unique sauce. But the meat, like the steak teriyaki, was very good. Soho House will definitely remain a place-to-go when we're in Vegas.

This place delivers.  My mom, the most picky sushi eater was impressed, which is hard to do since she's from Japan.  She even liked it better than Nobu.  Everything was great, unpretentious atmosphere, attentive staff.  Great dining experience.
First time trying this place. Amazing and fresh sushi and you can't beat their happy hour menu! Nothing bad to say! Make sure to try their Black Garlic Trout/Salmon/yellowtail with Truffle Oil

Our family really loves this place.  The price is fair; everything we have tried has been exceptional; the staff is very friendly and service very good.  No complaints.  We have gone back time and time again.

I have been here at least 10 times and the food is always top notch.  I have tried the lunch specials and happy hour and I have always been pleased.  The sashimi and rolls are out of this world.  This is my go-to spot for Japanese cuisine!

This place is amazing! I love everything about it. The food here is so delicious. The flavors are incredible. They also have some very unique dishes here that you can't find at other places. Pop rocks on sushi!? Who would have thought! It is also plated beautifully. The service is fast too. Yum.
Pretty restaurant. The foods are delicacy. We went there at happy hour. 5 dollars per plate and they also have special plates. Good restaurant.

Soho Japanese Restaurant has amazing lunch specials that worked for every member of my family. We had the teriyaki salmon, teriyaki chicken and the sashimi lunch specials. Everything was fresh and delicious. We also had a delicious yellow tail appetizer. We will be back when we are in Las Vegas again.

I've had a lot of strip mall sushi in Vegas and most of it has been bad to mediocre - fishy tasting, tons of mayo, fake crab in everything. EW. I was skeptical of this place, but we were blown away by how yummy and affordable it was!

A lot of the dishes are very similar to Nobu, but at this price point I was thrilled to see them ! $2 for sashimi tacos that go for $15+ at Nobu? Yes please! I adore Ocean trout and was pleased to see this as a sashimi offering (with pop rocks, which were really fun). I also loved the black cod lettuce wraps for only $8 (wow). 

The only slight let down was the twin dragon roll - it was large and lacked the refinement the rest of the food we ate had (the crunchy tuna roll on the other hand was a pleasant surprise!). 

Service was friendly and gave us a free sashimi platter to welcome us to the restaurant. I'll be back every time I come to Vegas !

I'm trying the happy hour tonight, which is served from 4pm- 6pm (I really like places that extend their happy hour to 7pm). I ordered one of each of the $1 tostadas (Salmon, Tako, Tuna and Hamachi), $5 Bacon wrapped Kurobuta Sausage, and $5 dollar order of baked. The owner came around and introduced himself, I had met him before, he is super friendly. It always nice to see this, shows he cares. Oddly enough, the credit card machine wasn't working, the waiter said they would run the amount later if that was ok. I was ok with that especially when they have my 20% off the total bill.
Yet another great expense.  Food is amazing.  People are amazing. Keep up the good work.  I had sashimi salad and spicy crab roll

Excellent sushi restaurant in Vegas. The reviews and ratings speak for themselves. My grandparents and I decided to try a new sushi restaurant: Soho exceeded all of our expectations. The food was exquisite and the prices are reasonable. The experience would not have been as unparalleled had it not been for the service. Indeed we were lucky enough to have Charles guide us through the evening as he introduced us to the restaurants' best dishes. His professionalism and sincere warmth is definitely the determining factor in wanting to return one more time before we leave Vegas.
Outstanding food and service in an out of the way location. Super fresh and innovative sashimi dishes. Go with 6 or more and try as many things as you can.

This was a very pleasant dinner. The owner even came over and greeted us. The chef kept sending complimentary dishes to make sure we were having a great dinner. I spoke to one of the waitresses about my garlic tuna Nigiri about being a bit fishy and she took it off the bill with no fight and brought me other delicious things to make up for the lack of quality with the tuna! This was so awesome! I highly recommend them.
Best Sushi Joint in Las Vegas! Five Star service, quality, and atmosphere. Will definitely be back.
I absolutely love it here (I go here at least once a week)! The entire staff especially the chefs are personable and kind. Such a positive atmosphere with beyond amazing food and at a great price!
Really good, fresh sushi. Cool vibe, great prices. Will definitely be back for Happy Hour.

Hands down one of my favorite local restaurant. They have the best prices and the best quality Sushi. 

Strip quality for local neighborhood price tag. We've never had a bad meal here. We go at least 2-3 times a month. 

The staff, decor and food are on point.

The food is delicious and affordable. I didnt know what to order so I just randomly ordered by staff's recommendation. I did not regret about it. The place is comfortable, warm, and welcome; staffs are nice
Still 5 stars!!!! Perfect sushi restaurant with amazing chefs and service! Thank you SOHO staff!

Don't believe the hype!  I had a business lunch here and  was not that impressed.  Usually when I have a free meal, it makes everything taste better...until now.  

Yu- Yu, barMASA, and the in-room menu at Nobu Hotel have superior sushi!

AMAZING!

Decided to check this place out for their happy hour which was an awesome deal esp the pricing! Went for date night - pretty casual place but very busy! We went around 6:45pm so we caught the HH just in time and opted to sit at the bar. There were so many options to choose from for a HH menu so we were quite surprised. I don't remember all of the things we got but the pics can do the talking! The yellowtail sashimi w/the gold edible flakes was the most memorable and prettiest dish there! There was an older couple next to us who ordered the omakase (sp?) and we thought the gold flakes on some of the nigiri pieces looked so pretty with how they presented the dish! I don't remember the name of the chef at the bar but he was the one who hooked us up with the yellowtail sashimi dish for us since we were first timers - thanks!!! Overall everything we ordered was pretty good, wished we had room for dessert but we'll deff try the next time we decide to go!

Thank you to our server Jenny for her lovely customer service and recommending superb items from the menu. Fantastic quality Japanese food for a descent price. The sashimi setto on the lunch menu was delicious. It came with salad, seasoned edamame, miso soup and rice. The Philadelphia tempura roll was also delicious. Using smoke salmon made my mouth water.  I will be back again.

So happy to have this restaurant close to home! I've been there 3 times this week alone and it never disappoints! Food is delicious & fresh, and service is never spotty. It's great for a date night or a casual lunch where I can bring my 8 month old! I seriously can't get enough of this place!

My family and I came here for my grandfather's birthday and the reviews were spot on. The staff was incredibly friendly and provided superior service to my family. Our server Louie was amazing very polite and attentive.

The food was fantastic! The quality of the meats and fish were superb. Better then a lot of sushi restaurants I've been to. Chef John was also gracious enough to give my grandparents his signature dish on the house.

Overall the experience and food was just a cut above the rest. We will definately be coming by the restaraunt every time we come back! It's a must try.

I heard the chef here used to work at Social House and practically recreated all of the dishes but with neighborhood prices. That's cool with me! I've been here three times and have had a different experience each visit. 

First time: excellent service with gratuitous additions of sashimi to sample. 

Second time: overall fine, but we had that questionable experience where one sashimi dish is super cold and the other is warm. It makes you hope the fish wasn't cooled to mask poor flavors/quality. 

Third time: good food, but horrible location. The tiny bistro table near the front door is 1) too small to enjoy food and 2) too close to the door when there is inclement weather - and such was our night.

In the end, the sashimi here is delicious and the combinations of flavors are impressive. I could eat "yellowtail yuzu" for the rest of my life; ponzu and cilantro are brilliant together. Another favorite: the "salmon wasabi creme fraiche."
Friendly fast service, nice decor, but most of all yummy fresh sushi.  Loved the ponzu yellowtail and Hokkaido uni!
Other favorable reviews hit the nail on the head.  This place has it all... great service (seriously), awesome food, very reasonable prices.  You should go.

I was recently in Las Vegas for a company conference and after a week of eating conference food, my coworker and I were craving some sushi.

We were extremely disappointed with the sushi offerings on the strip - small, overpriced portions with questions on how fresh the fish was.  We had settled on this place in the Hotel/Casino we were staying at when I decided to check yelp one last time and found Soho Japanese Restaurant. Needless to say we walked out of the place and I'm happy we did.

Having the opportunity to travel the country due to work, I have had sushi in various major metro cities and SoHo Japanese Restaurant ranks in the Top 10!  I can't commend them enough on how good everything was. The service was fantastic, and the sushi was even better.  I can't remember the last time I had sushi and sashimi this fresh!

The portions and prices were right inline if not just awesome considering the quality, freshness, and presentation of everything.  Highly recommend the Yellow-tail Sashimi and the Twin Dragon Roll.

During our visit they had asked to re-seat us to accommodate a larger party.  Since the service up until then had been been great and we aren't jerks, we obliged to help them out.  Needless to say, we weren't expecting anything in return at all.  Not only did they bring out a nice bottle of Saki for us, they also gave us an additional Sashimi dish, both on the house.

Stand-up establishment!  Again, best service I've had in a long time.  Next time I am in Las Vegas and I spare time, I will definitely be back!

The owner and/or Chef should feel good about the great team of employees working here.

Love the lunch specials.  The fish is very fresh for Vegas!  The chef/owner is cool and does a great job getting you in and out in a hurry if need be.  
Would be five stars but the decor is exactly the same as the previous joint...

SoHo is an superb Japanese fusion restaurant with great service in affordable price. All the cold platters are delicious, especially snapper, scallop and beef. Draft sapporo and sake are highly recommended with the meal. The servers and owner are very friendly, different from other Japanese restaurant with Chinese owner. 5 stars for SoHo.
Great sushi! I brought a group of people here for an outing, the service and the food was outstanding.

Seriously if you're lucky enough to be in the area-- order the $25 sashimi platter!  Extremely fresh, and decorated in a way to rival a $30+ platter at another establishment.  We actually ordered two (for a party of 3) among other dishes because the sashimi was THAT good.  It included tuna, salmon, yellowtail, squid,  and another I cannot recollect.  

Anyways, a breakdown of what we ordered (spending upwards $200 at the end of the night):

* Sashimi Platters - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#lRndlLck8p7kFRYKUOGLpg As previously mentioned.  BEST DEAL HERE.  Highly recommend.  Oh, and I forgot to mention, but the second time around the chef included salmon from Japan.  And yes the freshness and clarity of the fish was palpable.  

* Uni Trio - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#A-cEeA7g_oBrHePLhVYqHw  the BEST uni I've had in my life.  Tasted uni from Santa Barbara (my favorite, most creamy), Hokkaido (lighter in taste), and Santa Cruz.  Obsessed with uni now.  Highly recommend to order here.

* Black Miso Cod - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#mkLPaL6yBH25O4j9LBU_fA  Having been spoiled with the black miso cod at Nobu (OMG) this cod was still good but not the same, obviously.  This one was sweeter -- less flaky, but still delicious, nonetheless.  I'd order it again.  Good price as well.

* Tuna Box Sushi - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#B8cYzwavrjey4z4lYijV6g cripsy rice on the bottom, ebi on top, with tuna, avocado and cucumber in the center.  Delicious!  Love that cripsy rice.

*Angus Beef Gyoza - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#K4BF-OMDtLNtSE8AZDEBxg Came paired with a tangy orange fusion gyoza sauce; the meat tasted like pork and wasn't flavored enough.  Crispy gyoza skin however

* Edamame - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#jiZ3cajCe4KnyS-UNwLpUg For $3 this is a steal; though it is painfully typical the edamames were hot, fresh, crunchy, and perfectly salted.  Came paired with a dipping sauce as well

* Yellow Tail Tartare - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#TGhWeKEhDZEV_0anzOoK2Q BURSTING with flavor, it didn't even need wasabi.  Beautifully presented as well.  Craving it right now

* Tuna Tartare - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#VytauQePvWEGvPbMcLQ-wA  strong tuna taste with no negative connotation.  Spices blended well with the fish

* Blueberry Cheesecake with peanut butter brittle - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#5aTrN0Hc64-0aSaLG7UukA Unfortunately tasted like something you'd purchase at Costco (supersized, in that case).  I'd pass.

* Tiramisu - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/soho-japanese-restaurant-las-vegas?userid=4MHFQcFfHzVe4ISx3lvHlw#lJRio-aBk1Yhl5uH9fkVKQ so delicious; light, fluffy, fragrant, and strong chocolate tones that taste authentic and not chalky

Service is excellent, seating are is on the smaller side but you can always sit at the bar (which is what we did).  Definitely coming back!  A RARE 5-star review on my end!

I feel like I just started dating someone and I KNOW he's going to be my husband.. It's one thing to have great sushi. It's another to have great sushi down the street from your home... but it's another to have great sushi, down the street from your home, AND behind a Chevron gas station. Think Lotus of Siam in proximity to the Green Door.

I read the reviews of my trusted yelpers so yes, I was pretty confident I was going to have a great meal with great service. I didn't, however, expect to have my tastebuds orgasm from my first bite to the last sliver of dessert. I love great sushi but I've become lazy in my years. It's easier to train my palate to accept good AYCE sushi then train my wallet for the $$$ and gas to drive 10 miles for top quality cuts of fish. So after just one amazing dinner at Soho, I'm beyond thrilled that Strip Sushi at Local prices now truly exists.

I started out with the Yellowtail sashimi - with tempura jalapeno, micro cilantros, garlic oil, and yuzu soy - I was told this was a chef signature dish.
WOW really sums it up. I would have paid at leasst 20 dollars for that plate but it was only 10. Next up was a salmon tostada, rock shrimp tempura, and the tuna box sushi roll. The tostada was delicious... at 3 bucks a pop - I know that I could order like 5 of those things and be deliriously happy with myself. The taro tostada was light (be careful it may break) but just perfect and the avocado cream and cilantro sauce mixed with the freshest salmon I've had in a long while --- all of this adds up to Ahhhhh-mazing. The box sushi was just the cutest. Oh, and it had the perfect combination of textures and flavors.  The little crunchy rice cracker balls on the bottom combined with just the right amount of rice, tuna sushi, avocado and topped with a layer of shrimp. It's mouthwatering just to write about again.

Do you have a non-fish eating loved one in your life like I do? Well, the jidori chicken is "the best chicken dish I've ever had" says my non-fish eating husband. He is going to try the spare ribs next -- I'm so glad that the non-sushi items are just as good because that is the dealmaker in this household.

Soho's service is top notch. The chef owner John Chien Lee is just a delight to talk to. His visit to our table really added a nice touch to one of my most memorable meals.

If you love sushi, if you love strip sushi, if you love all you can eat sushi, if you love sushi but haven't been able to afford Kabuto, Nobu, Kumi, Koi, Okada, Yonaka, or Sushi Roku ----- whatever part of town you are in --- put this on your list of MUST-TRYs.... You won't be disappointed. You will have a great experience that you'll tell your family, friends, coworkers, fellow yelpers, and just anyone who will listen.

If I wasn't married,  or if you actually could marry a sushi restaurant, I would be married to Soho with children by now...it's that good.

I've been here a couple of times and it was all during their happy hour except for the one time, we had it during lunch. You know what that means?! This review is solely based on those times! Happy hour is everyday from 4-6 pm and for lunch, they have pretty good specials available. 

First and foremost, I do suggest sitting at the bar. I normally prefer sitting at tables but the bar at Soho is amazingly spacious. It was perfect. I'm not elbow to elbow with some random ass creeping stranger :P! 

I've had their salmon avocado roll, firecracker roll, some appetizers, and their tadas. Their tadas are quite interesting cause it's a fusion mix of flavors on top of crispy rice and they're $1 each during happy hour so you can potentially try them all. The fish on those aren't particularly that great. Sometimes, they're actually mushy ...So they're nothing really all that special tbh but fun to try.

They put a good amount of salmon in their salmon avocado roll, which surprises me. It's so simple yet so delicious. I mean, for like $4, I'll take it! The firecracker roll has a really nice blend of flavors ranging from a little sweet, a little creamy, and a little spicy. One of the most memorable moments was when we ordered one of the rolls and we requested it to be spicy, the chef gave us some of his house made ghost chili sauce. I LOVE spicy foods and boy did this sauce hit the spot. Just a tiny dab with the chopstick is all I need to set my tongue on fire....it burns so good and so delicious. Try it if you dare ;) I swear...ghost chili is sweet. 

Another favorite is their black miso cod in lettuce. It's pretty good except sometimes, I feel that their cod gets a little overcooked...still good nonetheless. 

Oh and don't forget the lychee infused sake. It completes your happy hour night for sure!

Happy hour is the bomb!

We pretty much ordered every thing in the happy hour menu which was wide-ranging and had an enormous choice of beverages and food items. The cost is amazing! Each food item was truly remarkable and extremely delicious. We loved everything we purchased. The demo was delightful although each dish not only tasted amazing. The service was likewise outstanding: our waiter came often check on us to see if we were doing fine and to refill our drinks. The chef also came out to talk to all of the patrons.

Highly recommend!! My new favourite Japanese restaurant in town!

This is not an all you can eat Sushi place and it may be why it's great. 
 The seafood was fresh. I had yellowtail sushi and fish was absolutely buttery and delicious.
     We ordered the Flying Fish, Double Dragon, Rainbow  Rolls and we liked them all.  We also had their Tostadas (wonton, avocado cream and ceviche yellowtail) so good. Their Miso soup is undeniably the best Miso soup I have had in town.
      Service was awesome and I hear their happy hour is great as well, will have to make it to that soon. 
     Outside of the strip it can be a hit or miss to find quality sushi. This one is definitely a good find and their prices are reasonable.

**Summary**
       - Specialty - Their specialty is sashimi with different sauces on top. Each plate is around 10 dollars and has 6 slice of fish. They are a bit more inventive than your normal sashimi dishes.
       - Decor - The outside is in a strip mall that's not too great to look at. Inside however, it looks like a trendy hot spot, much like the soho part of it's name suggests.
       - Price - The price will set you back a bit and the portions are tiny, but this place is more for the experience and tasting new things.
**Ordered**
       - $18 Miso Marinated Black Cod - Easily the best piece of cooked fish I've ever had. It was cooked to perfection with the perfect amount of miso sweetness.
       - $12 Chicken Salad - Chicken was grilled pretty well. Moist inside with a grilled outside.
       - $10 Yellowtail Sashimi - I love their twist of making the jalapenos tempura style. 
       - $11 Seared Tuna Special - The ponzu sauce was complimented very well with the slight sweetness of the onion & the sweet green sauce.
       - $11 Ocean Trout - By far my favorite. It tasted like really fresh salmon. When you put it in your mouth, the pop rocks, yes, pop rocks start popping and it's a very different experience. The sweetness of the candy works with the freshness of the fish to produce a very different and delicious experience.
       - Uni - A couple flakes of sea salt on these uni slices really brought out the flavor. Fresh and good.
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a fancy sashimi place on date night.

So excited to find this place. The positive reviews are spot on; thank you Yelpers.

Top quality, fresh fish with sashimi platters to rival the best. Looking for the classic Nobu style dishes (like yellowtail  jalapeño, miso cod, etc.) for literally less than half the price as well as dishes with a unique twist. The trout sashimi with all sorts of goodness including a sprinkling of poprocks was fantastic.

The Chef-Owner made the rounds chatting with folks. When he came to our table he spoke with such passion it's no wonder the food is so amazing. We even learned something new from him. He shared that mackerel (Saba) mate in the summer, so by nature their fat and nutrients are stored and used for biological purposes. Which by default makes them  less flavorful. He indicated he will be bringing in Japanese Saba come fall when mating season is over. Who knew?


Decor wise expect your typical trip mall restaurant, but the friendly, attentive staff and amazing food make this spot worth visiting on a regular basis. We will be back; likely once a week.

We ate and drank like kings (including alcohol) for ~$70 for two people.

The taste of Tao but half the price!!! If you have ever eaten at Tao at the Venetian, not the nightclub but the restaurant side, and ordered their omakase wishing you could get the same quality for half the price, I bring you SoHo!!!! As a sushi guru, I worship fish, not just the taste but the presentation and experience. Upon trying SoHo I was nothing but surprised and astounded by the quality, friendliness and overall satisfaction. The fish is the freshest I've tasted short of the finest on the strip and selection is to die for. This place will rival and destroy any sushi restaurant you know. Also a cool tip, the owner gets his fish shipped from Japan so I've heard. So don't think this is your average sushi joint, it's honestly a diamond amount the competition.

WOW. Soho is my new favorite Japanese restaurant. Everything that I've tried there is amazing! Also, they have a great lunch special menu which ends at 4pm. Whatever you decide to choose, it comes with rice, soup, and salad. The portions are perfect. You can still order off of the dinner menu during lunch, but all in all, the quality and taste of the food is satisfying. For dessert, I recommend trying the green tea tiramisu. It is to die for!!!! Just some quick tips, if you're a sashimi lover, you will just taste the freshness and high quality of the fish. If you're a California roll lover, they use real crab instead of imitation crab.

The whole staff is awesome. The owner, John, is super friendly and welcoming. Every time that I've gone to Soho, he comes up to the table to ask how everything is. You can tell he's very passionate with what he does and wants to make sure that you're having a good experience.

The food is great so it's the cooks or the line that prepares the food, it's a bit pricey but I we will continue to come here, the only thing was that the tables were dirty and very sticky and some trash on floor. Besides that I would've given them a 5
Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent.  Server did excellent job too.

Soho has amazing food and great service

I love their location as well

I can see why everyone speaks so highly of them
FREAKING BOMB!! Everyone needs to have a sushi burrito or 3! I always go here when I come into town and bring my friends! It's so delicious and the staff is always friendly!

Great experience here. Happy hour was a great deal.  The fish tasted fresh and had amazing flavor. We got the rolls on happy hour and one speciality roll. It was one of the best sushi rolls I've ever had. We will be coming back, I want to try all of their speciality rolls!!!!

Came here in a busy Friday night and waited to be seated for 25 mins. Ambiance is not that great but we came there to chow so we didn't care about it much. Food was excellent, service was great and we didn't wait long for our food to be served. We ordered shishito peppers, angus beef tataki, spicy soft shell crab roll, some white wine, matcha tiramisu and green tea cream brûlée. Everything tastes sooo good except for the cream brûlée which tasted "milky"... But overall, it was a very good experience and will recommend them to everyone
This is by far my favorite place to go to. Amazing service you are receiving quality service and product. I love the Sushi rolls and the sashimi. Great HH spot to go to as well.

I would actually give this review 4 1/2 stars. What gives this such a stellar review is, to begin with, the excellent service that we received when we went in. The tables were full and we were given the option to order drinks while waiting. When the table was ready, we were served quickly and the staff is very friendly.
The last time that I came here, quite a while back, I was somewhat disappointed with what we ordered. At that time, the sushi that was being ordered was not that impressive to me. I can say that that has completely changed. We started out with the yellowtail sashimi appetizer, in ponzu sauce, that was delicious. The Shishito peppers were good but quite spicy. We ordered the Seabass appetizer in lettuce wraps which was absolutely delicious and we also ordered the vegetable tempura platter. This, without a doubt, is the best tempura I have ever had. It was perfect without being overly greasy. We then ordered the rainbow roll which was delicious and I would recommend it any day. We also ordered a twin dragon roll that looked interesting on paper, having shrimp tempura with spicy tuna and a combination of a California roll all in one. I asked the waitress about it and she said it was the most popular roll ordered. This is why I did not give this review five stars. I found the role to be quite distasteful and it was not pleasant at all. My friend agreed. I would not recommend this role to anyone. How it is the most popular role is beyond me.
For dessert, we tried the green tea crème brûlée which was interesting.
The lychee sake was amazing! This is an absolute must for anyone that likes lychee.
The ambience of the restaurant is very nice. I would not hesitate to go back but, likely next time, I most certainly will not be ordering the twin dragon roll or the Shishito peppers which I found way too spicy.

Favorite spot in town for a while now. Amazing staff service, food, chefs, atmosphere everything!! We come here at least once a week and continuously get treated like queens. Love my SoHo family!!! 

Ps. Get the Cajun Albacore. You're welcome

My new sushi delight. A must try for any sushi and sashimi lover.

Must try the sashimi plate!!!

This is quality over quantity. 

Quick and energetic staff. Delicious high quality food. Knowledgeable service. Decent pricing. Excellent atmosphere. Good environment. 

Super friendly!

Would highly recommend to beginners and veterans of sushi
A must-eat restaurant for sushi lovers. The yellowtail sashimi is, by far, the best I have had. Do your mouth a favor and eat here.

This place used to be 5 stars but it dropped to 4.5 and I have no idea why. This place is 5 stars all around. We came in close to closing time and they welcomed us in without acting like we were going to be keeping them. A family came in even later than us and they received the same warm greeting. Right away we got a good vibe because the servers didn't act like us being late was a problem. 
 Now the food. Man everything was perfect. We had tempura king crab, firecracker roll, and the bone in short rib. Everything was delicious. We were not even hungry but we demolished everything. If you don't get anything else get the short rib. That's a winner right there. Id wait in line (but there isn't one) for an hour for that. 
Service 5 stars. Food 5 stars. Atmosphere/cleanliness 5 stars.

This restaurant has good food, but very bad service. We called to make a reservation for 4 people they said they don't take reservation for less than six people. When we arrived we waited for 20 minutes then they said we can either sit by the bar or we have to wait for 20 more minutes for empty table ( we have two children with us). So as we were going to sit by the bar we saw empty table for 4 we asked if we can sit there they said no it's reserved!!!! They had the family of 5 coming after us (big size family) sit there. That was very unprofessional and I don't trust going to this restaurant again. They lied to us and they are biased to certain customers. Please watch out and don't go there.

WOW! I actually signed up for yelp to specifically give this restaurant a shout out! We are from the Boston area and were in Vegas for a quick lay over and sought out sushi for the 1 night in town. Based on Yelp reviews we ventured out of the strip area and sat at the sushi bar at Soho. It was by far the BEST experience and sushi we have had in a very longtime. We were immediately greeted by many of the sushi chefs behind the bar. Their welcoming and obvious banter and laughs while they were working hard to keep up with the demand of the full house was infectious. Obviously the owner treats his staff with respect and it shows in the love they have in what they do, working right beside him.   We ordered a couple of rolls and Toro sushi which all blew us away. While chatting with one of the chefs he inquired what we were particularly fond of and moments after informing him that we both like spicy/jalepeno, raw fish type entrees and rolls we were presented with the most delicious complimentary hamachi that had been soaked in a garlic, with what tasted like a hot spicy sesame oil...delicious.
We will definitely make it a point to go back anytime we are passing through Vegas and HIGHLY recommend you do the same.
This was straight up the best part of our recent trip to Vegas.  We went 2 of 3 nights - it was that good.  Delicious food, great service. Worth the trek from the strip.

Came here strictly based on Yelp reviews, and we were NOT disappointed!  This place is sooooooooooo good!  Our favorites were the shorts ribs (bone in, moist, soft, delish), the hamachi in yozu soy (the head chief/owner was nice enough to give it to us complimentary just for stopping by!!), and spicy tuna on crunchy rice sushi (so tasty).  Notable were the tosadas.  The ahi one especially.  These folks do fresh fish right!  It's not chewy or tastless like some AYCE places.  The wait staff are also very observant and friendly.  We will definitely be back!!

I don't have more much to say than what I've said the other 10 times we've been here... However, the added value this time was our servers they were friendly, attentive, knowledgeable and just plain excellent! We had lots of happy hour plates, beers on tap and the 18 piece premium sashimi platter, hamachi collar and much much more.

Amazing!! First time to Vegas and heard about this place from a friend. Reviews do not lie. It is delicious!! Great flavors, fresh fish, nice atmosphere and delicious saki. Chef John is awesome and so is all the staff!! If you don't know what you want just ask them. My meal was amazing and over half of it I didn't directly order, just said what should I have? Will definitley come back anytime I'm in Vegas!!
Delicious. . Delicious !!!! Fresh , melts in your mouth sushi.  The staff is very friendly ,  personable,  and also knowledgeable of their dishes.  Impressive

The crispy brussel sprouts are a must. You can tell they use quality ingredients. The food was amazing; fresh fish and flavors. Will definitely be back for sashimi. I really wish I could remember our server's name. My friend had dropped something on her shirt, and he must have noticed us talking about it and brought over soda water to get the stain out. That's service! We really enjoyed our dinner.

my family and I just got done celebrating my mother and fiances birthday dinner. the food was delicious and came out very promptly. even though the food was great,the service is what made our night. one waiter in particular went out of his way to go above and beyond to accommodate us. We didn't get his name but he has an arm tattoo.. would definitely recommend him. Will be coming back whenever we're in vegas!

I love the whole Soho Franchise! On my last trip to Las Vegas I tried Soho Sushi Burrito and it was pretty awesome so naturally I wanted to try their sushi restaurant.

I had made reservations for my fiancé and I earlier in the day, which was a good idea because this place gets packed fast. We were seated right away upon arriving, and the vibes were friendly and casual.

Service was a bit slow but good. Our server was nice and checked on us often. He took our drink orders right away and gave us a lot of time to look at the menu.

We ordered the following: Carpaccio; Golden Ocean Trout and Salmon with Avocado Creme, Premium Sashimi Platter, Kumamoto Oysters with Uni and Ikura (not on the menu), Multiple Nigiri Pieces, Braised Short Ribs, and Hamachi Kama (not on the menu).

The Golden Ocean Trout was the best Carpaccio style sashimi I have ever had in my life. The way they prepared it was just incredible. The flavors and mouthfeel was out of this world, this is a must order! The Salmon with Avocado Creme was good too, very fresh. 

The nigiri pieces and sashimi here were generously portioned and very fresh. A few of my Maguro were a little chewy but other then that everything was good.

The Kama was excellent. Buttery, tender and juicy. It was just cooked and flavored so well, some of the best we've ever had. We were so excited to eat it we didn't even take a picture! The Kumamoto oysters with Uni was good, not the best I've ever had but definitely delicious still. The short ribs had good flavor but were quite dry.

Overall we had a great time here. The service was a little slow but they always made sure we had what we needed and they were very nice. One of the managers or owners came by to talk to us (probably because of all the food we ordered). The food was awesome, we will definitely be back!!
Came here of yelp reviews when visiting Vegas and was not disappointed.  The sashimi plates are awesome and not to be overlooked.  Rolls were wonderful too!

As a big sushi lover, I decided to take my first trip to Soho Japanese Restaurant based on all the positive yelp reviews.  Believe the hype! This restaurant is 5 stars all the way around.  The staff was overly friendly. Great customer service as well as great suggestions on house specials. I never had to wait for a refill on my drinks. The servers were very attentive to guests needs.

The owner who is also a chef really went out of his way to ensure we had the best experience possible. He was very friendly and personable touching all the tables to see how everything was going. After letting him know it was our first time there he made us a special sampler on the house comprised of Ocean Trout & Scallops which was way better than I expected it to be. (I had a bad experience with scallops at another restaurant) 

Being it was our first time we tried a bit of everything and I cant say anything negative about any of the dishes. I will list what we had below.

Starters:
Miso Soup
Seaweed Salad
Yellowtail Sashimi appetizer 
Spicy Tuna Handroll
Sashimi Sampler of Ocean Trout & Scallops (a gift from the owner/chef)


Speciality Rolls:
Twin Dragon Roll
Spicy Softshell Crab Roll
Firecracker Roll 

The price was very reasonable compared to alot of other places in Vegas. Ended our meal with some really cool sushi key chains. 

Overall this place gets 5 stars and is my new favorite spot for sushi.

So my friends and I wanted to go to a good sushi place in Vegas and this place lives up to it.

Great service, great sushi. The portions are kind of small for my taste but it's good quality.

We have not ever had a bad experience here in the past 2 years of coming to this place. Recently ordered food to go which was just as amazing as dining in. Angus tataki, miso cod, all ceviche. Always fresh with a happy staff.

I came in today with my family, and this was our second time. We really came for the happy hour to try out the specials and Soho really delivered. 

Quick and easygoing service, great happy hour prices (Mon-Sat 4-6pm) and great food. We had the Soho Maki, Salmon Avocado Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Firecracker Roll, and the Baked Mussels. Everything was perfect. 

The Soho Maki is like a long and thin eggroll, $3 for 3 of them. They also come with a very delicious sweet chili sauce. 

The Salmon Avocado Roll was pretty good, also goes great with the sweet chili sauce from the Soho Maki, but I personally think there was a bit too much avocado in it and it made it just a bit greasier than it should be, but it was still great. 

The Spicy Tuna Roll was good, really no complaints, I love how spicy it was, not too spicy, but just right.

Now, the Firecracker Roll. What can I say, amazing presentation and the flavors just explode in your mouth. I loved it and it was definately worth the Happy Hour price (not that the others aren't worth it). 

Finally, the Baked Mussels. I hadn't had mussles in at least 9 years, and Soho really delivered. They were delicious and cooked perfectly. 

Also, the owner came up to us during the meal and introduced himself, and at the end of the meal we got a free dessert (I dont know what it's called, like icecream wrapped in dough, delicious). And he also gave my little brother (6) a chop-sticks helper thingy. Very friendly owner, and he is an excellent chef.

All in all, everything was great, final bill came to ~$22.00 for everything. I live a block away and it's a great neighborhood place. Must check out if you live in SW Las Vegas.

This sushi restaurant is great especially for the price! The chef was very nice and he came and greeted us to find out how we were enjoying the food. My fiancé works in one of the restaurants on the strip and he is very hard to please when it comes to food but he enjoyed most of the things we ordered..

What a great hidden gem in our neighborhood! My fiancé and I went here this afternoon at the end of happy hour and let's just say this restaurant gained 2 new regulars! 5 star service and the chef even stopped by our table to introduce himself! He's so genuine and friendly... The entire staff was actually! A couple of dishes that notably stood out to us was the hamachi kama, uni (Catalina Island our server insisted I tried and was probably the best uni I've had in Vegas thus far), and the macki are key items to try! Thank you Soho for an amazing experience.. We will be back!

Decided to come for happy hour and we were not disappointed! Chef John came from Social House, but left the Social House prices behind.  The happy hour items are $1-5, pretty much a steal for the quality of food you are receiving.  They have $1 salmon, hamachi, tuna, and tako tostadas.  The only one I didn't try was the tako, the other three were delicious in flavor and the fish was extremely fresh.  The hydro bib black cod is essentially miso black cod lettuce wraps.  The miso cod is buttery smooth in texture and the flavoring is a good salty sweet combination.  The stuffed mushrooms are fried little balls of delight with an aioli dipping sauce.  I could have eaten 3 orders of these little mushrooms.  All the rolls and the baked mussels are your normal fare at most sushi restaurants, so if you want something different I would order the other items on the HH menu.  I did like that the spicy tuna roll, since it had more of a spicy kick to it, rather than being overwhelmed with mayonnaise.  Another favorite was the cajun albacore sashimi, incredibly fresh fish and quite a large portion given the price.  We also tried the ika geso, which is essentially squid karaage with a great aioli dipping sauce.  We also ordered the sashimi platter which was a generous portion for $25 and all of the items were extremely fresh.  The chef did pop over to see if it was our first time and even sent out a complimentary dish of yellowtail yuzu and a fresh uni portion.  The place and location is unassuming, tucked into a small plaza with some random stores.  The decor is simple and minimalistic.  The best part is that the HH is Monday-Saturday 4-6pm!  I'd come earlier to make sure you get a table!

I was here at 11:30 only to find out they don't open until noon. No big deal, as I found the boba tea sitting right next to it actually served very good boba tea. ;)
Prbly because we were the first customers on that day, we got complimentary yellowtail sashimi, which is absolutely excellent. My friend was never a fan of sashimi, but was shocked to find out how good it is. 
We got a crispy tuna roll, very unique and I luv it. The garlic soft shell crab is also cooked perfectly.
This is the fourth time I'm in Vegas, I'd say this is prbly the best dining experience in town

Oh, forgot to mention, Most importantly, the price is very reasonable.

Hands down this is one of the best sushi places I have been in town! The menu puts a unique twist on sushi. They have an amazing happy hour with a ton of items for only $5.00. The service is world class. Every staff member is extremely attentive even during their rush hours!

Me and my girlfriend come here all the time and I would highly recommend!!!!
Love, love, love this place! Service was on point & food was delicious! Everything was fresh & light yet full of flavor. Must try the Matcha Tiramisu! So good! Will be back again & again!
Wow wow wow love this place great place for drinks and fun and delicious food don't hesitate to come here you'll thank me l ;)

I love this place!
I've been here a few times and each time it has been great.
The staff are amazingly attentive, constantly checking up on you to make sure everything is good, no matter how busy they may be. The fish is good quality and the tostas are a must try. They also have a great lunch menu!

This is my fav japanese restaurant in las vegas!!!! Chef here are so talented and they are so nice...been here twice and never got disappointed....i was amazed by their skill...i did omakase...and it was different!!! Fusion between korean, peruvian, japanese and others make a wonderful dish...

This place was fantastic! The service was incredibly personable and the staff worked together very well to provide an excellent experience. We had several rolls and all of them were exceptional - the sunny salmon roll was unique and refreshing. Definitely a great way to spend a meal off the strip.
Amazing firecracker roll and soft shell crab so delicious all he sauces amazing love this place will be back

4.572989027792333 stars

When you combine the quality of ingredients, service and tremendous value, Soho is a place worth coming back to again and again.  Dinner for 4 came out to around $60 before tip and we got to try a nice variety of dishes.

It was easy to see and taste the high grade fish they used right off the bat in the "Seared Tuna Special" which included crispy shallots, sweet onion, micro greens and chili oil combined with super fresh nigiri cuts of maguro.  This was a terrific mix of flavors.  $11!  That's about 50% off the strip price.  I almost wished I didn't have to share it.  

I couldn't turn my back on the $3 (!!) Soho Tostadas and went with the tuna with Hawaiian poke sauce.  The tostada itself was made of taro and there were some delicious chunks of tuna on top mixed with cilantro and avocado cream.  Another great starter for sure.  The rock shrimp done tempura style was also nice portion for $7 and came with 3 unique sauces that I fail to remember the details of since my wife was seriously sweating the end of the Seahawks/Rams Monday night game due to some sports bets she had.  It was nice they had one TV up.

Hydro Bibb Black Cod for $5 was a total freakin tease that ensured I'll get a full order of miso marinated black cod the next time.  Even the smaller portioned cod were cooked really well and the combo of cool lettuce, crispy wontons and fish was kind of like a deluxe protein taco.  

Those all were excellent opening acts for what I was personally here for which was the short rib dish.  Ever since I saw that one picture of all those short ribs being grilled, I knew it was destiny!  It totally delivered.  The one rib was like something out of the The Flintstones and tasted as good as it looked.  It was juicy and so tender that you could've just picked at it with chopsticks sans fork and knife.  

The chef and owner of Soho, John Chien Lee, stopped by our table to ask how things were and gave us a breakdown on the business.  We were still open to one more dish so I asked him for a recommendation.  He asked what we liked and we said salmon.  He asked if we wanted something cooked or raw and we said raw.  He said he'd make something special for us off the menu (YES!) and 10 minutes later brought over this delectable dish with 8 pieces of scallop wrapped with salmon topped with a little green, lemon and some other stuff I can't remember.  John whipped up this dish thinking it would be a great finish to the meal after the heaviness of the short rib and MAN was he right.  Then he told us it was on the house!  Thanks, John!!  I suck for not taking photos of anything.  

Las Vegas strip quality for locals!  Check it out.

I think I found my favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas! Fresh fish, stunning presentation, and friendly staff!  Chef John and all his crew sure knows how to treat their customer by giving the top notch dining experience!  We will definitely be back!

Amazing and delicious sushi. Service is impeccable; sushi and sashimi is the freshest we have ever had. Such a  terrific experience! Everyone working here has worked at top sushi restaurants from the strip, and they all take pride in what they do. And it shows.  The rolls are FANTASTIC, but the highlight is the fresh fish. For example, even the most basic California Roll is created with real crab. It's Nobu quality without the pretentiousness or the price.  :)

I'm in trouble now, My previous favorite local Japanese restaurant that always seems to have a line is Goyamon on Decatur which is a mere 3 miles from home. Unfortunately Soho is around the corner from where I live and the first time I went there was when I was exhausted from working 12-hours straight. They were also almost closed as it was late. 

I was so tired that I just told my waitress Mika to give me anything. I received a cooked Hamachi shoulder part I believe for a mere under $20. Oh Boy! the taste and flavor was out of this world and I just realized I have not even tried any sushi yet.

Next trip I came in during happy hour on a weekday and though it's not even 5pm yet. Had to wait 10-minutes and decided to just eat by the counter. My big mistake was I didn't eat breakfast, nor lunch today as I was over working again. We ordered everything on the happy hour menu and not a single one disappointed. I asked the sushi chef what was good and affordable. He made us a sashimi platter to die for but unfortunately I was too hungry that I forgot to take a picture!

I have to be fair and do another review and take pictures to be able to describe each item we consume and talk about the uniqueness of the dishes.

Amazing service, killer sushi, excellent presentation. I'll be making a pit stop here every time i'm in town from now on. Strongly suggest yellowtail sashimi, high roller roll, sunny salmon roll. Happy hour was legit. $5 dolla make you holla.

This place was really good. I love it. I created my own burrito and all of the ingredients were really good quality and delicious. We got the taro chips on the side and they were good too. I do think they could use a bigger building with more seating because it was really packed. Highly recommend this place though.

We had the twin dragon roll, super white tuna and yellowtail sashimi & hanger steak. Everything was delicious! Our waitress Sheela was excellent. Great customer service and she knew the menu very well. Nice presentation. First timer but we will definitely be back:)

I had checked into this place a few time before this review because I wanted to give it a fair shot. 

The first times, they screwed up the soup.  Had to send it back it was extremely salty.  Second try, the hamachi was under cooked. Rice was undercooked on my third try.  

After third visit, I finally concluded, I don't like the rice.  If it says SOHO Asian restaurant, I would not expect sushi rice to be served.  

I find the rice undercook during all visit for my taste, then I found out from the server that they don't use Japanese rice at all.  

If you are someone who is looking for the authentic Japanese home made food, I would choose Kyara (215/jones exit) or Izagaya Go (spring mt/valley view) instead.  

I ended up turning to Tonkatsu Kiyoshi on my fourth attempt.
Amazing atmosphere ! Great service ever, food wonderful! Loui and group just unbelievable ))) Julia just great! Thank u defiantly will b back and recommend that place!!!

By far one of my absolute favorite Japanese restaurants here on the Southwest side. Their happy hour menu is great!  From the kalbi ribs to their Cajun albacore sashimi, everything was so addicting. Can't get enough of their food!  Not to mention their fresh oysters, yuzu yellowtail is just so amazing!  This place never disappoints. I will definitely keep coming back!

This restaurant looks so nice inside. It has a casual contemporary setting. What's even better is their food! Definitely try the sashimi options (yellowtail, salmon, and scallop were delicious!). Be sure to also look at their daily specials menu to the left when walking through the front door. I tried their poke from the specials menu and it was AMAZING! Staff is very friendly and the chef even came to greet us at our table! I'm a fan of AYCE sushi but find myself often craving the sashimi from this spot ;D

Holy shit! I had high expectations since the reviews on here are spectacular...  and i was very impressed.  The food was quick, fresh and OH MY GOD ! The salmon sushi i was given melted in my mouth. The servers, were so friendly, and the chef came to us to see how everything was.

Love the premium sashimi platter which is $45 for 18 pieces. Big pieces and you get to choose uni or ama ebi.  Also the beef tataki is delicious too, small but many pieces. Sheila is always our server and she's great and super nice ! Ask for her to be your server. Soho is only open for dinner.
Honestly this is for the fast service and tasty food! Wow that Mt. Fuji roll was unexpectedly very tasty!! Recommend this spot and their other sushi burrito spots. Great place to eat.
Stopped by before leaving Vegas. Sit at the sushi bar and look for Tae or Aaron. They will take good care of you!

Although I didn't have the chance to sample many different dishes here, the ones I tried were delicious and interesting. I ordered two sashimi dishes: the yellowtail yuzu soy and the salmon creme. I love citrus so when I saw the word "yuzu" I knew I had to try them, and I was not disappointed! Both dishes were amazing because the freshness and cut of the fish were of exceptional quality. For sashimi like this, it was reasonably priced as well. 

Along with this, I pretty much mooched off of my other 2 family members who ordered a sashimi and nigiri lunch setto. These came with a bowl of rice, salad, miso soup, and pickled cucumbers. They both agreed that the fish was fresh and the sides were great. We ordered a twin dragon roll as well, and though it was good, it didn't really blow me away compared to other "special" sushi rolls I've tried in the past. 

This was lunch time, but I know the dinner menu has even more to offer so I'd like to go back for dinner some time. Overall, great quality fish and service.

I've been on a roll lately, finding all these great restaurants in Las Vegas. My husband and I came here before when this place first opened, but we weren't hungry and ordered 2 rolls, enjoyed it, and left. Recently though, my girlfriend and I came back, starving, after UFC, and we sat and the bar and took the time to really enjoy the food. The chef, I think his name is Nunu, was actually transported there after he left a fancy place called Social House at Crystals. Actually, we learned that day after chatting with the chefs that they all came from fancy strip-sushi restaurants. Their preparation was amazing, and their foods were delicious! We tried a lot of good things that night but their 3 kinds Uni was amazing! Its the best thing I've had ever. And to think I didn't like uni before.. Probably because it wasn't as fresh as this!

This place is one of my top favs. I highly suggest you give them a try but make reservations they can get very busy. The sashimi platter is awesome and just the freshest seafood like uni, oysters, shrimp, crab and much more. They do not disappoint. 

One of my favorite happy hour dishes is the truffle fries and wagyu sliders. I know right, ordering that in a Japanese restaurant...It's simply addicting!

We take all our friends and family there and they say the same thing, "wow"! When are we coming back!

Definitely the best sushi burrito restaurant in town. Unlike other sushirrito places I've visited, Soho is quick and efficient. They also have a delicious menu and have pretty amazing and unique specials/dailies. My absolute favorite is the Twin Dragon with soy paper - a must try!!
The servers were super nice! There miso soup was really salty, but overall everything tasted really great.

It was delicious,  just like the reviews say.  It's worth the drive off the strip. 

Comparable to other fine dining sushi houses down the strip especially with the prices.  It's like I am still in Orange County, Ca.

In town for the weekend and decided to head out of the strip and try this place. I'm glad I did because it's one of the best sushi restaurants I've ever been to. It's only about 15 minutes outside of the strip so make sure you visit this place the next time you're in Vegas!

We loved our selections from the extensive happy hour menu.  My husband loved the tostada selections but I prefer the sashimi choices.   All are  unique in their presentations-YUM!  A big shout out to John whose  skill and knowledge was the highlight of the meal!
Place going down hill as if late,  especially the service.  Food also has been inconsistent , using my last three visits as my indicator to many other choices fair well soho!

Went here on Thursday, 4/24/14, with my sister's bf Tom T. (He's practically just another sibling to me.)

We missed happy hour by 55 minutes. Agh! The HH and lunch specials looked decent and I may come back to try them but this review is for dinner only.

We were stuck in the back corner by the register. Waitress told us about the menu, how we should order something from each page rather than just order rolls so that we don't end up hungry after an hour. I thought that was super bizarre to mention that their rolls aren't adequate for a meal. 

Tom ordered a bowl of Miso ($2) and gyoza ($5) and we picked three rolls: Spicy Tuna ($6), Spicy Salmon ($6) and Soft Shelled Crab ($9). Our waitress told us that we should really order the spicy soft shelled crab ($14) instead beacuse it was her favorite and the rolls that we ordered we could "get anywhere." Again, I found this really off putting and we decided against getting the spicy crab as it was a $5 difference than the roll we ordered.

Miso came out, then gyoza. Do not waste your time on the gyoza. $5 for 5 potstickers that have zero flavor. They might as well be from Costco (but Costco's do have some flavor.) Serious waste of money.

Spicy Salmon and Spicy Tuna were not spicy and without the eel sauce that Tom asked for, were bland. The sushi rice was devoid of any flavor which I also found odd. The soft shelled crab roll was great and I'm glad we tried that one. 

While we were eating, other staff were trying to tidy up around us which was uncomfortable. I don't want people straightening menus at the table I'm seated at while I'm in the middle of eating or sweeping.

Between the two of us, we threw down $15 a piece before tip. Meh, it wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. I'd skip dinner and just check out the lunch in the future.

Came here spontaneously (seriously, we just apparated...didn't even drive) for lunch! I've seen many good reviews and enticing photos on yelp regarding their lunch setos (only $8.50!!!!) so decided to finally try it out. SO WORTH IT.

Service was friendly and casual with smiles from the attentive employees all around. Atmosphere/decor was modern and casual with a lot of open space. Very clean. The kitchen area is half open for customers to see and from what I could tell, there were so many employees. Maybe they're preparing for when it hopefully gets busier in the near future!

Now let me tell you about the food. It looked exactly like all the yelp pictures I had perused, which is quite a testament to how consistent they are, especially for a newer establishment. My boyfriend got the chicken katsu seto and I got the sashimi seto. The side salad had fresh greens and the perfect amount of dressing. The miso was standard and always a welcome addition. There was a side of thinly sliced cucumber in some vinegar-type sauce as well, which I definitely enjoyed. 

My favorite of course, was the sashimi itself. It came with 7 thick slices - two salmon, two tuna, two yellowtail, and one snapper. All were succulent and so so fresh, probably one of the freshest I've had in Vegas.

They provided my boyfriend with this house hot sauce which was so good and addicting. I alternated dipping my sashimi between that and the soy sauce! The little itty bitty mug of green tea was adorable and perfect for my tiny hands - normal mugs are way too large. I appreciated this detail immensely.

The icing on top of the cake was that the owner/chef himself came to check up on us and offered us a complimentary dish - this popular yellowtail sashimi with micro cilantro, fried jalapeno, and some kind of ponzu sauce. It melted in my mouth, not gonna lie. We later found out that the dish amounted to $12.

So why give this place 4/5 instead of 5/5? Am I just being a hardass? The only reason I loved this place was because of the lunch set value and quality and the comped dish, which I'm pretty sure doesn't happen all the time. Looking through the menu items, they seem to be quite pricey, so I want to come back and try them before really deciding that it's worth it.

Yay! I'm a fan.
We came here for happy hour and enjoyed everything on the hh menu. We order runs and Salmon crisps, egg rolls and sea bass deliciousness! Stop here when you are in the area!

I would give this place 10
Stars if i could. came here on a Wednesday Evening, We Ordered 4 rolls off The Happy Hour Menu which is from 4p-7p Monday-Saturday for $20... What? Awesome right?! I'll be back on the weekend. Service excellent as well.

After a long day at the Wet Republic, a group of us decided we needed to refuel with some good, quality sushi. I am a bit wary of sushi in Vegas, so I used Yelp to find a place and this happened to be just around the corner from my friend's apartment. 

Decor inside was very modern. There was a decent amount of seating, but not really that great for large parties. We were a group of 5 and it took about 10 minutes  for them to figure out how to accommodate us despite having a half empty restaurant. 

What I got to try: 

Sunny salmon roll - delicious!
Garlic edamame - very flavorful, and slightly spicy 
Ceviche - soooo freaking good... The Mexican-Asian fusion was on point for this dish 
Volcano roll - I didn't realize this was going to be deep fried. I'm not a big fan of deep fried sushi but it wasn't bad. 

Service was friendly but food came out pretty haphazardly. My food took the longest, but it was worth the wait.

Absolutely awesome sushi place. All their plates are fresh, original and affordable. On top of that, you can make reservations on yelp, which is really convenient. The chef is really nice and offered us some special sushis to try. I had two ceviches and a couple of sushis. If you like urchin, definitely go for the uni sushi! It was worth going away from the strip!

This place is a gem!  

Had chef tasting (omakase) twice here and amazed at the quality and value.  Service is fantastic and food is as good as anything you will get in the strip.

Such a hidden gem....across the street from my house. I LOVE this place. I love to sit at the bar - the chefs like to chat and educate. Once they know your tastes, they surprise you with unique things to try that aren't on the menu. Tonight we got a Big Eye Tuna sashimi plate - such a nice surprise. We also got my standard favorites: Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, Miso Marinated Black Cod, Cajun Albacore with Serrano Chili and Ponzu Aioli, Ika Geso (Fried octopus) 2 orders, all the Tadas, and the Bone-in Angus Short Rib. And it was happy hour, and I drank the white peach infused Sake, and I left full and happy. And I can't wait to go back.

The staff were great and very friendly. The owner even walked around making sure everyone was enjoying their meal and gave us an Uni sampler for free to try! We'll definitely be back the food is delish and fresh and they have great service.

The reviews were definitely what brought me into Soho as I'm always looking for some high rated new sushi places in town. This place definitely is NOT a "sushi" restaurant, though they have some sushi offerings. That being said, no all you can eat either. The service was quite slow and inattentive which made things go by agonizingly slow. We had to make some requests for changes on our rolls (for a shellfish allergy) and they were less than accommodating, even bringing out one item which was entirely crab. Other requests for additions or changes were all around generally ignored and you will probably have to walk outside to the gas station next door to get your water refilled before a server happens to drop by and top you off. Definitely a cool "hang out" place for some, but it's social not satiable.

This is my first attempt at writing a yelp review so please bear with me! 

I don't have an explanation as to why I haven't been to SoHo sooner, being that I only live about 10 minutes away and have had multiple friends say with conviction that they won't hang out with me until I do. I'm also a huge sushi/sashimi/Japanese cuisine fanatic so I'm almost glad there was an hour and a half wait at Goyemon (my go-to AYCE sushi restaurant), which factored in my decision to try out SoHo instead. When we arrived on a Saturday evening around 6:30PM, they told us the wait would be about 45 minutes but 30 minutes later, we were able to sit at the sushi bar, which is where I prefer to sit anyway. So, "Yay!" for the actual wait time being shorter than the anticipated wait time. 

When you first pull up to SoHo, hidden by a gas station, you might think that you're just pulling up to an average sushi joint but they prove that looks can be deceiving. The venue isn't too large, but I think that's a positive for local, off-the-strip sushi restaurants. So don't judge this book by its cover!

After being seated at the bar, we were greeted by a very enthusiastic, outgoing server. After telling him my drink of choice is either good beer or whiskey, he recommended a light, sparkling cold sake. I was surprisingly happy with this suggestion since it wasn't too sweet and was very, VERY easy-drinking. Chef John, the executive chef and owner was behind the bar and that was a huge plus. You can tell he truly cares about his restaurant and his passion for this Japanese artwork is present throughout your dining experience. I heard that he used to be the Executive Chef of Social House at Crystals so I'm guessing that may have inspired the name, "SoHo". I could be wrong though so feel free to tell me if I am. 

If you're looking for AYCE, this isn't your spot, but worth the extra bucks for a la carte sushi. SoHo features fresh specialty fish like Striped jack with a mild flavor, but firmer, amazing texture, similar to amberjack or yellowtail. And they had the freshest uni I've seen in Vegas. I've tried uni (Sea Urchin) before and wasn't very fond but I'm assuming that's because I've never had properly prepared/fresh uni. When I had it at SoHo, I found a new must-have! If the uni looks like a firm tongue, that's when you know you've gotta try it! When you bite into it, it reminds me of biting into raw liver, as far as texture goes. Maybe, it's a "Hawaii" thing, but I LOVED it. Chef John also brought out the exceptional Hokkaido uni straight from Japan. It was life-changing and the presentation was strip-worthy. It made me kind of wish I was on a date rather than a friendly lunch with a girlfriend (Sorry Tiff :P). We also tried their Kumamoto oysters - real Kumamoto oysters. The shells were about the size of a dollar coin (random, but the only thing I could compare the size to) and were pretty deep with a nice, plump oyster. The texture was perfect and partnered with their light house-made mignonette, forcing the sweet flavor of the oyster to come out and say, "Hi!". Other must-haves are the yellowtail yuzu soy (I'm a yuzu-whore) and the truffle white fish (I'm also a truffle-whore). In total, our bill was about $100 for the two of us, which is awesome! They also included a complimentary little green tea latte hard candy for each of us, which is always a nice gesture, especially for whoo-girls or yay-girls (if you have one of these as your girlfriend, you know what I'm talking about). 

Stay classy Las Vegas & thanks for stopping by.

Erica with a C gave us the vip treatment and is a seaweed laying master! I really appreciate the great service. She even came to the table to ensure that we enjoyed our meal! Thank you, Erica with a C

Dude, it's a good thing they don't have AYCE sushi because otherwise they would always run out of fresh fish. They get shipments here and there, as long as they come on time, and they're pretty solid thus far. 

The owner will come around and engage with his guests usually. He'll recommend stuff and he made us a complimentary raw scallop dish. Everything tastes so fresh and nice :D. 

Try the uni with red snapper (forego the ponzu sauce). The salmon avocado roll is a personal favorite for me. ^^v Yums. 

The tostadas are $1 during happy hour so it's a good value. Speaking of which, 4-6pm is happy hour. I also liked the firecracker roll but beware non-spice-peeps, it's spicy! Flaming for me. :0b

Overall I enjoyed my experience and I'll be back to try it again soon ;0).

I thought this was a good place. It's rather small, so  there will be a wait. I wanted to  check this place out because it was on a list for best  sushi  happy hour. The happy  hour menu  had some good options. I ordered a tempura roll, crispy  brussels sprouts, and baked mussels. Each  item was $5 on  happy  hour menu  and yummy. The regular menu  itself isn't that  expansive, which was kin of a let down because most other places have rolls on rolls on rolls. The tiny restaurant was also  very  warm like they  didn't have the a/c on. It was a tad bit uncomfortable. Overall, service was good and the happy  hour offerings were good. If you're looking for a sushi  spot though I think others in the area are better...e.g. Goyemon or Oyshi.
Two years after my first visit and the food is as awesome as the first time I ate it!  This one is a keeper!  Off the strip, reasonable pricing and honestly the best sushi ever.  I will be back.

Best to go on weekdays. Weekends can be super crowded around dinner time. That said, the owner remembers us and our 3-year-old! I was very impressed by that. 

The sushi is always delicious and overly expensive. Quick service. Decor is clean, though can be a bit dark in the evenings. They just got new chairs, too, IIRC. 

Oh, and I have to say, their happy hour menu is the best I've encountered in Southwest Vegas. Simple rolls, cold and hot sake, and even creme brulee on it!!!

So I've been off work randomly on the same day SOHO has been closed for the past month and finally this afternoon I got to enjoy the place. 

Every single thing I've read and head is true. He place is just superb. The staff is super attentive and probably the happiest, most friendly staff at a restaurant I have ever come across. I ordered just about 4 dishes at the sushi bar. The first thing was the uni sampler of 2 different types (mind you I've never thought of uni as being something I'd like because of the texture and I use to step on those bastards when surfing in hawaii) both were very fresh, smooth, and tasty like I'd never expect by looking at it. The second was the Cajun albacore on happy hour that the server, who was very friendly and sweet, suggested and was very good, not too spicy, not over seasoned. Third I got the sashimi sampler of about 8-10 pieces and wow, the presentation was great, the fish was super fresh and he cuts were huge compared to other places. Third I ordered was dessert and my god the green tea tiramisu was recommended and highly appreciated! I was so full and yet I stayed to eat every last bite of what was obviously prepared with love and skill. 

Best sushi I've very had and best deal. I grew up in hawaii and have had the best of the best from my Japanese heritage, yet this place gave me 5 diamond service with super good attitudes and great service for an amazing deal. Love it!
My new fav japanese place. Soho moco plate is awesome. Service is top notch. Sushi fresh. Love the matcha tiramisu.

It's hard to argue the reviews. Been going since opening and Chef John is actually getting better as time passes. Depending on your timing you may have to wait, it's really popular with locals and tourists follow so try to get in early, especially when going as a group. 

One tip, if you're going for lunch, you can ask for the dinner menu to order the more interesting dishes. 

If I had to make a criticism, the ambiance needs help as it took over a restaurant and inherited the questionable decor. Also the arrangement of seating on the space can be improved, like the useless reception area could be replaced with a 4-top. BUT you forget all of this after enjoying the very consistent, great food. 

Don't hesitate to go people, Chef John is one of Vegas' local superstars. Go now, it's brilliant.
My absolute favor place. I love the ambiance, the staff is caring and personable. The prices are great and the food is always pleasing to my palette. I eat here at least twice a month!!!!! LOVE SoHo

Love coming here. 

Been here for lunch and dinner a handful of times and tried various things off the menu. My favorite japanese go to in the neighborhood.

Sit at the bar! Staff is super friendly.

Thank you SOHO for my tuna box! So happy I still can enjoy one of my favorites that is no longer on the menu.

If you're in the area or looking for a place in the SW area, SOHO got my vote. 
Parking lot. Casual dining. Good vibes. Friendly service.
Awesome service and the sushi was very fresh- the owner/chef John was so hospitable and took his time to talk with us.  We definitely plan to come back!

If you're looking for a HH for a sushi place this one might just be the most bang for your buck with the quality of fish they have to offer. So HH items are $5 and the menu is ye long. And wait for it wait for it.......... they do HH for lunch and dinner!! Whhhhhat daaaaa rice! Decent size parking lot so don't worry bout no parking spot to snatch during HH. Try their fun playful dish like pop rocks trout and if your are truffle fetish then get yourself some of that black truffle garlic trout!! Me like it!

This is my go to sushi place. It's where I take family and friends when they visit. And my family from Japan knows sushi, even they agree this place is awesome.  

They brought back the happy hour from 5-7 and added new things to the menu.  I have never had a dish that wasn't great. The atmosphere and service is always outstanding. Overall a fantastic dining experience.

The food is as fresh as you can get here.  Love the way the sashimi that I ordered sort of melt in the mouth and combining the hint of aroma lightly and elegantly dressed plate and light up all of the senses.  It's like waking up fresh in theornong in every bite.  I actually could not resist cleaning the plate without leaving anything behind.

The atmosphere spells warmth and welcoming. Calm and yet spicy enough to illicit you to explore what the place got to offer.  The kind of surprised that one anticipate exploring the breezy forest morning.

All in all it's very good place to take your date and your family to.  You'll leave with such satisfaction that you won't get from most restaurants.   It's got the food that comforts both the mouth and the mood.  Sooth the soul if you know what I mean.

The place is okay, I don't know why it has 5 stars. 

Chicken Katsu was alright, but it was served with Teriyaki sauce, which the sauce was really tangy. Miso soup was salty. 

California roll was the same as anywhere else.

Philadelphia roll was good, but the tuna was a bit too sweet.

Almost forgot... When we first walked in the staff saw us and completely avoided us & about 2 mins later they walked over and greeted us as if we just walked in.

Also, they forgot the wasabi and ginger when they brought our sushi out.

Super fresh sushi. This place made us quit ayce sushi. It's so good. Cheap happy hour, great service, awesome specials. Fatty tuna and sea urchin - some of the best seafood I've ever had. Always bring family and friends here and it never fails to impress. From traditional family, to foodies, to business owners, to even my picky eater son - no one just likes it - everyone loves it.

The sashimi dishes are delicious and they offer enough slices to get u full than most other restaurants that you pay an arm and a leg for, and give only a couple pieces. The service is great, and so is happy hour. Best prices for the quality u get here. $10 for a lemon bowl of uni! Sooo good!! Must try for sashimi and seafood lovers.
Strongly recommend the ocean trout. What fun to have the pop rocks blend with the taste.

My wife and I came here based on Yelp. We certainly did not expect it to exceed our expectations. It did. We tried the yellow tail with yuuzu (sp?), the seas trout, the wasabi creme salmon, the sea trout, the double Dragon roll, the soft shell crab roll, and the in house made gyoza, and the matcha (sp?) tiramisu. The sea trout was a gift from the chef/owner, John, who came by to talk to us. Everything was fantastic!!
