As well, our server, Sheila, explained that the restaurant was based on providing Strip quality and service to a local audience. Well, they have exceeded at their goal.

This place is better than 5 stars it's a 10 for sure! I love sushi and this place has the freshest fish & offers a great happy hour. I can't wait to go back again. Our server was absolutely amazing!!! ( I don't remember  his name but he had glasses and dark hair with a great sense of humor - sorry )
Food is fresh and awesome! Owner John is super awesome, gave us a ride back to the hotel after we waited over an hour for taxi.

How can a place have 200+ reviews and defy the law of Yelp averages and have FIVE STARS??? 

I see why now.

I came for lunch on a Saturday. The place is very unassuming and doesn't try to be hip or cool. There was no wait at 3PM, and it definitely doesn't feel like you're in Vegas, which is fine with me. The quality, presentation, and flavors of the food were quite another thing. The lunch boxes are a STEAL, and even the specialty rolls and sashimi are competitively priced, especially for what you are getting. We ordered the standard recommendations from other reviews and loved everything. The cherry on top is that Chef John is SUPER NICE. He literally does come to all the tables, say hi to everyone, and then offered you specials on the house after asking about your food preferences. I don't think the Tai and Uni he brought out for us was even on the menu, he just made it because Tai was fresh for the day, and we said we liked sashimi and uni. Wow. 

To get: Tadas, lunch sashimi, Scallop ume, Sunrise roll, anything that comes out of that kitchen really

Before we left, the Chef brought us another complimentary dish (we felt beyond special at this point), this time beef tartar. It was a thick cut of beef unlike any beef tartar I've tried, and it was expertly sauced and oh so yummy.

I (and my table of 6) am beyond impressed, and we would highly recommend all you weekend warriors (new word I learned!) from LA to drive your asses off strip and check out this place. 1000000x better than a buffet. You won't regret it.

I'M GOING TO WRITE THIS IN ALL CAPS BECAUSE THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST SUSHI RESTAURANTS I'VE VISITED. I REALLY WISH THEY HAD A SPOT IN LOS ANGELES BC THEN IT WOULD BE MY GO TO FOR SUSHI. 

Okay, let me start by saying not only is the food awesome but so are the employees. They check up on you, chit chat with you, giving some info of the fish, their fave on the menu, etc.. Much love, so I love it!

Now their food.... So damn good and so freakin fresh that Whole Foods can't even touch it! And the creativity of Chef John's dishes is a delight that it makes you want to try everything on the menu! 

Go. Stop reading and go!

My faves: yellowtail sashimi (so good we ordered it twice).

Good portion lunch dish. Sashimi is thick and fresh. This is my new lunch spot.

Just stopped here for dinner.  Probably the best sushi dinner I have ever had for a long while, with a very decent price tag.

Sashimi is super fresh, octopus was just amazing. Salmon, hamachi.. I cannot complain at all.

This restaurant was highly recommended by friends so we decided to check it out.  We didn't have to wait long to be seated and our server, Sheila, was great!

We had the Yellowtail Yuzu Soy, Hamachi Kama, 15 piece sushi set (Maguro, Sake, Hamachi, Scallops, Trout...), Hamachi Kama, Ikura, Uni, and Sake nigiri.  I was hesitant to order the Uni at first because I've been disappointed every time I've eaten it other than in Japan...but our server highly recommended it and assured me that it was fresh.  I have to say that the Uni was good!  In fact everything we had tasted fresh!

I also thought the prices were reasonable.  I would definitely dine here when I'm in Vegas again!

Fresh, fried, fun and fabulous! We made a reservation for a friend's birthday. They were more then generous with their service.

The food in particular was great. I'm picky about sashimi freshness and they delivered, especially the Uni trio special. Would definitely come back next time we are here in LV.

I think. Individual store is a beautiful dish. The quality of the fish is also good, and is the best employee of the smile of sushi field. And is chef of smile standing in the middle of the sushi field is particularly the best. Hospitality is also polite. Why not also try everyone.

Unlike other Sushi or Asian restaurants, Soho is trendy in red-accent decor. 
The service is definitely one crucial factor which made its great reputation. 
Our server, Sheila, is attentive and knowledgeable on the food items and gave great suggestions. 

- UNI DUO: Santa Barbara uni is way sweeter and tastes better than Catalina Uni. Great Santa Barbara uni is a must order to me.

- SHORT RIB: This popular item doesn't make a wow for me and my Asian guests. We didn't finish it. It is good, but for Asians, it's not new flavor. 

- HAMACHI KAMA: Juicy, tender to melt in the mouth, and with sophisticated presentation. Will come back for it.

- COD: This popular item is a little too sweet for me. But my guests loved it.

- UME SCALLOPS: It was fishy and the color doesn't look pleasant. I myself and my scallop-lover friend were hesitated to finish it. Sheila reflected to the Chef and removed it from our charges even we insisted there is no need to do so.

- STUFFED MUSHROOMS: Very thick mushrooms and generous stuffing. 3 pieces per order.

- SALMON AVOCADO ROLL: Very creamy and mellow to slide into your stomach.  

- SAKE: I preferred lychee sake and my guest liked the peach sake. Both came in elegant and transparent tear-drop shape kettle. Beautiful and interesting.
 
Will have to come back for more other items.

One of my favorite sushi happy hours in Vegas. This restaurant does not offer all you can eat. However the sushi is fresh and delicious. Make sure and try the Yuzu Yellowtail! 

Every dish is a work or art and is very reasonably priced! A must try especially if you live in the southwest area.

I had an amazing experience here. Charles was the best server. He did a pre set menu for us of because we are unsure what to get.

The yellowtail sashimi was the best I ever had. 

The chef was the sweetest man. He came out to great us and he gave us several free bottles and a plate is salmon sashimi with pop rocks that was amazing.

I thought I knew good sushi and then I came here!  Wow!  Just WOW!!  This place is incredible!!  The collar bone fish, the pop rocks fish, the little tacos...I'm having a hard time finishing this review because I want to run to the car and get to Soho as quickly as possible!  It get's very busy and there is a very good reason for that!  Service is great and it feels like they are one big family!

About our 5th time going I took 6 others for a birthday lunch celebration. We were treated like royalty! The vibe is amazing, the service is the best, and the food is TOTALLY DELICIOUS!!! Make a reservation if you're going for dinner bcs it does get busy. And the sake... wow! My fave roll is the Sunny Salmon. Other family faves are Firecracker and Twin Dragon rolls. The mushroom soup is delicious. And the tostadas are worth any amount of waiting if you don't reserve before you go! 
We take all out of town visitors here. It's definitely our favorite sushi place in Vegas!!!

Amazing bone in short rib. Tender, fall off the bone, melt in your mouth meat. Absolute must try! 
Service was great too! Can't wait to come back again!

I come here regularly for their Happy Hour from 4-6p. Prices are $5 or less. They have these $1 sashimi tadas that were fresh & flavorful. They have shrimp tadas that are not on the HH menu which is $2. You have to try their Hydro Bib. Delicious! Its like miniature fish/lettuce wrap. Everything on the menu was very good! The customer service was quick and attentive. Its a really nice quaint restaurant with great HH prices.

Gotta say,
Been coming here for a while.  Here is what I will say.  The portions are MUCH smaller now.  Rock shrimp use to be pile high.  A5 is half the portion.  Way less food for the same price always tells me a place is struggling.  Air conditioner out for about the forth time.  Too bad it's like this.  Hope things turn around ... I won't be back anytime soon...

Taste: 5
Creativity/Authenticity: 3.5
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 5
Bang for your buck: 5

I rarely give five star rating especially on sushi category since its very rare that there are really good sushi restaurants and to top that off in the dessert hundreds of miles away from the ocean. Now im rating this on sushi, that means nigiri and sashimi not rolls. Lets begin to start this place is way out there in henderson i think but still worth the drive. The atmosphere is nothing special which worried me especially when my friends told me this is one of the best sushi spots in vegas?! The service here is spot on, as good as it can get, water topped off, knowledgable waiter and very friendly staff, mirror of a 5 star restaurant. Now to the good part the food

Starter
-Salmon and tuna tostada [MUST HAVE]
-baked muscles [TRY]
-cucumber salad [TRY]
-hydro black cod [TRY]

main course
-yellowtail sashimi [MUST HAVE]
-seared tuna special [TRY]
-snapper uni special [MUST HAVE]
-sweet shrimp nigiri [MUST HAVE]
-red snapper nigiri [MUST HAVE]
-santa barbara uni [MUST HAVE]

drinks
Echigo Koshihikari [This beer is best with sushi because it doesn't mask or overpower the flavor of sushi]

I don't know what else to say; wait for the best part all that food and more plus drinks $100 this place is a definite must try when in vegas, if you looking or craving sushi and want 5 star quality sushi at insanely cheap prices SOHO japanese restaurant is your one stop shop cant beat that and for that I will be back again and again

Great happy hour prices. Quality food is great. I highly recommend Cajun albacore sashimi and the there tad as in happy hour menu.. I also recommend their UNI which is the freshest I've taste in town.. Two thumbs up for sure..

Mucho expensive because everything is sold a la cart and they don't have children friendly foods or a kid's menu or bento boxes.  

Wait was also SUPER long on a late Tuesday evening-about 45 minutes long. 

Upside: 

Hostess and waitress were both super and attentive and helpful and friendly and refilling my green iced tea and making convo so that was nice.

Food was good and fresh, just slow. Long wait for everything. After waiting so long to be seated and then waiting so much more for each course/roll order, it was just a very long dinner experience. 

We tried their most popular rolls-see pics and the sashimi. We also had the shrimp and veggie tempura, the edamame and the miso soup and that was all very standard/average.

The one thing I didn't like: we told the waitress we were celebrating a birthday and she didn't do anything for us but the table next to us had singing and the works. Kinda bummed me out at the end. But overall, it was good and we enjoyed it. Just mega pricy.

My boyfriend and I have been going to SoHo for majority of our date nights and every time we're impressed. Last night they went above and beyond. The customer service was great, our waitress (can't remember her name ) was very engaged and personable. The chef would send out free rolls and new entrees for us to try, very nice and SO delicious. We can't wait to come back!

Outstanding value. I recently spent a week in Tokyo and returned with a taste for sushi. We took advantage of Happy Hour to get about 8 different rolls for a very reasonable price and the quality, presentation, service and taste were all excellent. Would definitely come back.
BOOOOOOOOOOOMB!!!! Service great. Food great. 5 star quality at a very very Great price!

This is by far one of my favorite places to dine for light affair with amazing flavor!! Strip quality ingredients and style at an affordable price. Try their ocean trout with pop rocks and ask if they have o-toro available, at $7 a piece it's unbeatable!!

I am such a lover of Soho! If you love sashimi, this is the place for you. I have been 5 times in three weeks. There lunch specials are excellent, but happy hour menu is a steal! The chef and his crew makes some of the most tasteful bites of Japanese cuisine that my palette has ever experienced.  

A tip is to try everything on the happy hour menu! It's affordable, so pace yourself over several trips. I would have given 5 stars, but there rolls are a distant second to the rest of the lunch and dinner menus. A true sushi restaurant should master rolls, sashimi, and nigiri. I feel that feedback is love, and I would love for the chef at Soho to read this so that he challenges himself to create rolls as excellent as the rest of his menu.

I was last here over 2 years ago when I wrote a review that Soho was somewhat mediocre and that there was nothing special that would urge me to come back. Well we did come back; and I'm really glad I did. The service was good as before, but the menu and the food was way way better. This is my first updated review cause they really deserve a re-rating. 

We ordered several kinds of carpaccio, sashimi, and rolls (diablo was delish). All were excellent and reasonably priced. The salmon kama was especially surprising, perfectly grilled, mouth watering, with a slightly sweet tangy glaze. The Pork belly was disapointingly small (2 skewers)and under-seasoned. But everything else was on point. 

Glad we gave them a second look and glad they have really stepped up their game.

Let me start by saying I had high expectations going here, seeing that this restaurant has five out of five stars. I can now see why people love this place. It lives up to the hype. First off, service was great, it seems that every server there was helping us out. Very friendly staff, and so was the owner. Waited a little long to be seated but, the place was packed and everyone was busy. So it was understandable. 

I had the Spicy Soft Shell Crab roll, Fire Cracker roll, Yellowtail Sashimi (which had deep friend jalapeños on top!), and Garlic Tuna Tataki. All of the fish was very fresh. But I think my favorite of all the dishes I tried were the tostadas, salmon, hamachi, and tuna. My favorite being the tuna but all bursting with flavor! To top it off, got to wash all this down with Yuzu sake. All food totally worth the price. I need to come back for happy hour for sure. Keep up the great work!

WOW. All I can say is WOW!

My coworker brought me here and I didn't think it would be that amazing, but it was! To the friendly atmosphere, to the food, the glassware, and the presentation, it was awesomeeeeee. I really liked the sashimi plates and the rolls were to die for. You could literally taste every part of the roll and the fish was super fresh! It is a little more on the pricier side, and not all you can eat, but I believe it's definitely worth it. Super delicious and a must try if you're in the area. I'm sure the wait gets pretty long because it's a very small place.

Best sushi I've had in a long time! I wish I've known about this place sooner! The sashimi is so fresh and the waitresses, hostess and chef are amazing. We went during happy hour and ordered almost everything from that menu plus more off the regular menu. The yuzu soy yellowtail is so fresh and flavorful. The beef short rib was so tender that we could use chopsticks to eat it. AMAZING! Definitely try the green tea creme brûlée. I love this place and will go back here again!!!!!!!! :)

I've been here multiple times. The first was over a year ago for a dinner yelp event and the fish was the cleanest I've tasted in Vegas(at the time). I'm from Alaska so I'm just a liiiiiiiiiittle snobby about seafood. The experience and food was great. The fusion take on dishes were creative and well executed. I became a fan and so I returned. My second experience was just as good and Chef John even went the extra mile and introduced me to uni for the first time--on the house mind you!  It was soft buttery and sweet as people always had told me uni was supposed to be.  And then it went downhill from there. Couple more times I've tried to come back and either the wait was long or the host was extremely unorganized. Sometimes both. It's not good if both I and the employees are flustered. But the food had never wavered. My boyfriend insisted on trying this place with me since I had always talked so highly of it. We came for dinner, calling ahead, and trusted Chef John with omakase. I'll give credit for presentation, but unfortunately, both mine and my boyfriend's palette wasn't agreeing with any of the selection. It wasn't anyone's fault but I was really hopeful. There was an array from mackerel, scallops to tuna, but we weren't digging any of the flavors. With a couple bottles of hot sake the bill came to around $140. I don't mind coming back, but it's just not high on my radar anymore. Sorry Soho.

It's good but not five stars and not quite as inexpensive as most people imply.

Really good things on the happy hour menu were the tosdadas, black cod, and albacore sashimi.  The mussels and sausage wrapped in bacon would be a pass if I ate there again.  

Also I would pass on the yellowail yuzo soy if I went back.  The one roll I had was good but can't remember the name and there is no good online menu.  Even with ordering mostly happy hour food it was about 75 dollars for two with no alcohol so not exactly cheap.

Ammmazing! Our waiter told us to "trust him" and he'll bring us out the most delicious dishes based on our likes. Now I'm a foodie so I never trust anyone to make a meal choice for me for fear of disappointment... however this time I decided to give up control and let the waiter decide on our dishes. MAN.... this was honestly one of the best sushi meals I've ever had! Everything he brought us was amazing and it flowed perfectly into the next dish that he brought out. It was such a delicious meal that was perfectly prepared. He kept us around $60 for 2 people and we were very satisfied and happy with our meal and service. We'll definitely will be coming back here!

Their sashimi bento is really amazing. Seriously. Large thick chunks of fish that will actually fill up your belly, along with (a tad too salty) miso soup and simple salad. It also comes along with a bowl of rice, which I was totally NOT impressed with...Dried and cakey on top, i couldn't really dig my chopsticks into it so I just ended up leaving it be. It looked like something had been sitting on top of it and squashed it down. Blech.

The rolls are really tasty though, like the Spicy SSC (yummm!). The sashimi plates are also all great and very unique, such as the one with uni. Our group had quite a bit so I can't remember all of them, but do check my pictures :) 

Lastly, we actually stayed til Happy Hour to try their popular items, and if you like black cod, then you will definitely like the Happy Hour black cod lettuce cup thing. Melts in your mouth and has great flavor! The TADAS!!! (Love that name) were my favorites though--my group favored the hamachi one the most.

Needless to say, amidst all the popular AYCE restaurants in the area, Soho can definitely hold their ground!

This WAS one of my favorite happy hours spots. However, I went there around 4pm on 10-24-2015  and they were CLOSED. Their hours are now 5pm to 10pm (Dinner Only) Monday through Saturday. Apparently they are focusing on fast food like place they opened up on West Sahara.

This is my 5th time in soho, I feel that my review will be fair and accurate, today I had a business lunch with and the restaurant was filled to capacity.  I was nervous that our hour and a half we allocated for lunch would not be snuff to enjoy our meal. I have never been here for lunch before, I order the soho moco and to my surprise it was served in less that 15 min as well as all the other plates on out table. We ate and the tables was cleared almost instantly.
The amazing part was we where never rushed out we had our meeting and no one offered us the check it made me feel as if was ok to stay. 

The food was incredible the service God sent.

The ceilings are red and they help to remind you that your not in a culinary dream as you find your self looking up to thank god for the great flavors your experiencing. 

Chef John offers the food experience of the strip in a constable eating environment that allows you to be dressed up or casual at less than half the cost of the strip.
 
I have now tried 3 deserts and can pick one, my intent is to try them all.

This will be my default lunch spot.
There is good sushi, there is great sushi... This is exception sushi created by great chefs! I have never had anything that I would not order again.

Three of us went here a few days ago because of the Yelp 5 star reviews.  Wow what amazing sushi!

We sat at the sushi bar and were given the option to order from the menu or leave it up to the chef.  Was a little reluctant after leaving it to the Sushi Chef in Vancouver once which turned out to be a bad and expensive experience but I did it anyways.  We had several courses of amazing shashimi with sauces, cooksed fish, rolls, and then even amazing desserts.  I would have to say this was the best sushi I have had and the price was very good for this amazing meal.  Significantly lower than the strip.  The chef/owner was very nice and appreciative of our business.

Can't wait to go back.

Jeff

I can't say enough about this place. The service is 5 star amazing and the Sushi is phenomenal! We come in for their happy hour specials from 4-6pm which are all fabulous. The salmon and tuna tadas and the Cajun albacore sashimi are my favorite. I also ordered the free range chicken my first time here because I wasn't a sushi expert. It was special and had a huge portion. In fact all the portions are big and the fish is so fresh. Soho is our only place for sushi now!

Having heard so many of my friends raving about this place, I had to check our Soho for myself. I was worried the meal wouldn't live up to the high expectations I had, but it certainly did.

I came in for Happy Hour and we tried an assortment of their offerings. Everything we tried was solid, but the standouts from our meal were the salmon tostada, yellowtail, miso cod and the stuffed mushrooms. 

We had wanted to order more, but the portions were generous and we filled up quickly for a minimal price. The quality was great for the price and because they offer Happy Hour Mondays through Saturday 4-6, I will be able to go back again during the weekend when it's more convenient for me. 

Service was impeccable and no fewer than four different servers checked on us during our meal to make sure we had everything we needed.

I look forward to trying the rest of the menu and even coming in for their lunch specials and dinner menu.

Absolutely a 5 and oh boy are we lucky to have this world-class sushi place right down the street from us and at neighborhood prices. The Happy Hour menu is by far the best I have seen in Las Vegas. Great sushi rolls and sashimi dishes for just $5. Sapporo draft beer for only $3. Outstanding dishes we tried were the Cajun Albacore Sashimi, Salmon Carpaccio, Salmon Avocado Creme, Fire Cracker Rool, and Seafood Dynamite Roll. The counter service was super friendly and it was fun to watch the guys do their craft. We should have tried this place much sooner. Can't wait to go back for dinner service. If you are visiting from out of town get off the strip and run to this place.

Very friendly staff and the food was good. I know CA rolls are not real sushi, however, I was super impressed with their Salmon avocado rolls, which by the way is on their happy hour menu. Wow, they used some very fatty and good salmon in their rolls!!! It was also a smaller bite lol, on purpose or not, I think was actually the perfect size. It was so good, I went for another plate (not in photo). Oh, happy hour starts at 3pm and the menu for it was very extensive and got some good items to choose from. We also got the yellowtail tostado - good. The uni - fresh, scallop- fresh but too tiny.  Overall, even though not an ayce place, the quality of the food and the happy hour menu makes up for it. Would come again!

Soho is one of the best Japanese sushi restaurants we have ever eaten at and that includes Tokyo, Yokota, and Okinawa.  Food prep, quality and service are superior and prices are reasonable.   On this trip to LV we dined 3 times and enjoyed every meal.
We discovered this place when it first opened and have been fans ever since on subsequent trips.  MAJ Mike, Vietnam Veteran
Fresh, high quality fish. Creative and thoughtful execution. So happy this restaurant opened near my house. Looking forward to going back soon.

For me this is the best Japanese restaurant here in Las Vegas. They have a first-rate kind of food that you will not smack from the other Jap. Resto. The very important thing is that, they're not open on Sundays! Why? Because there's no fresh deliveries of seafood on sundays.

Well, back here again for my semi annual visit to my favorite Sushi restaurant in the US. What probably was the most wonderful was seeing Chef John and Michelle again, and of course their entire team. I've been coming here for about two years now, every 6-8 months or so, and every time I'm greeted like family. What makes this place great, aside from the amazing food the Chef Tae puts out, is the warm and friendly service and how happy everyone seems to be when working there.

On to the food. Ask for live sweet shrimp! It's a little pricey ($9.00 per order) but they literally kill it in front of you (or at the sushi bar if you order at the table). How much fresher can you get? It's also my girlfriend's favorite, which was way more worth than the more expensive, less delicious versions they sell on the Strip. But for me, what stood out the most this time around was some type of salmon dish with pop rocks. It gave a very interesting texture and experience that you don't find in many restaurants. The fatty salmon sashimi was beyond delicious and my stay would not have been complete without my regular Macadamia Nut Dragon Roll and (recently added) Truffle Tempura Beans. Come for happy hour and order them, it's a super good deal and really nice to munch on in between raw dishes.

If you want a drunk, get the MIO Sparkling Sake, it's Michelle's favorite and goes really well with their specialty drinks. A special thank you to Sheila for always being wonderful and I'm so glad to meet Julie as well.

My only regret is not coming back hungrier as I did not have room to enjoy the Santa Barbara Uni or Oysters that I got last time. Well, I'll be back in a few short months, and I will not make that mistake again!

Not to be confused with Soyo, the korean restaurant, Soho has excellent sushi and other dishes and, during happy hour (4-6 weekdays+sat), great prices.

Everything is good, but favorites include the firecracker roll (it's fiery!) and the ika geso (it's kind of like calamari, but Asian). The amaebi sushi/sashimi is excellent and comes with the heads. 

As a spoiled Californian, I am continually amazed by the high quality and amazing flavors of the sushi here in Vegas, and Soho is no exception. 

This is an excellent restaurant both for a classy date night or for a casual group of friends. Best to come with a large group if you can to sample more items!

This place is incredible. The chef is very talented. The food is Japanese inspired but definitely fusion. Fish quality is top of the line, and you can get fish here that you'll never sniff at most of the sushi bars in town. It was our little neighborhood secret but not any longer.

Phenomenal sushi place! Not only is food fantastic, but the service is also great. The best, hands down. And feet down. Fabulous food, friendly and quick service and decent and reasonable price. The only bad thing: sometimes their food looks too pretty to eat. I usually dont leave a review, but I had no choice, long story short, such an outstanding place that you MUST check out.

more around a 3.5. 

Service was prompt and friendly.  I had no wait on a weeknight. This restaurant is more fusiony, but I would recommend you stick with sashimi or rolls. 

We ordered with our eyes rather than our stomachs and couldn't finish. 

The Alaskan King Crab tempura was too greasy and had too much batter. The batter was just so overwhelming, I couldn't taste the crab! I had one piece and let my friend eat the rest. 

We ordered a sashimi appetizer of snapper topped w/ uni. Extremely fresh and very tasty. 
Also ordered the 12 pc sashimi and everything was fresh. 

I was a fan of the spicy tuna w/ crispy rice roll, but my friend said he found it to be too dry. My only quip with it was that it's hard to eat and falls apart immediately, boo! 

We had 2 rolls that I can't recall.. but they were just ok.

The hamachi kama was also just ok. I felt it could've been grilled a bit longer, and I didn't like the dipping sauce. Normally, the sauce that comes on the side is just ponzu  but theirs tasted like something is added to it. 

We got the matcha tiramisu and I honestly felt we could've done without that too.

We came here during happy hour on a Wednesday so we didn't expect it to be too busy. The service was a little slow and the food took quite some time to come but it's understandable because they had several big parties. From the happy hour menu, I highly recommend the tostadas, very tasty! Fish was very fresh and yummy

I can't say enough good things about this place and anything I would say negative would be overridden by the slammin jammin sushi offerings at this sashimi paradise.  I was told of this gem by another friend who's taste in food is to be well trusted in my experience.  This time though I felt like she'd really gifted me something.  It was busy when we came and I wasn't thrilled about the certain lack of organization when it came to seating but when I finally sat, the goodness was delivered to my belly in short order.  I loved that they gave me a little sushi pen at the end of my meal for a souvenir.  At least I hope I was supposed to take it.....

First time eating at this place today and the experience was great. Of course I went for happy hour which is from 4pm-6pm Monday through Saturday. 

The service was great and the waitress was very attentive. I like how she was able to have an input on our order. It really made the experience so much better. 

We got the tuna, salmon, & yellow tail toastadas which was yummy. 

The firecracker roll. I did not like the gingery top of it, but once I eliminated it the taste was better. 

The jalapeño poppers were just the right size and not overwhelming

The hydro Bibb black cod was okay. The cod was small and the lettuce took over the taste but from what I had tasted it seemed to taste good. 

Last the waitress suggested us to try the creme bruleé. This dish is hard to perfect as it's my favorite and I've tried this dessert at many sushi places before!
